reviews.title: Sooo close to a great product
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 28, 2022
reviews.text: This was so close to the perfect bra. Having front close hooks AND adjustable size hooks in the back is genius. This is great for those with mobility or health issues that require a front closure which typically lacks adjustability in band size. Women aren't plastic mannequins. We can vary in size day by day due to our cycles, what we eat, etc. What I didn't like: the unlined cups gave me a very odd scooped but sort of smooshed to the sides shape. Odd cup shapes has long been a problem for me with this brand. Perhaps some light sewn in lining would rather than the stretchy fabric cup would help this issue. I also found the band to be too tight compared to other brands in this size. If you don't care about shape and are going for comfort with easy on and off, this bra may be for you.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2019
reviews.text: These Easton pants are great for kids. They are pretty durable and hold up to baseball activities. My boys wore them until they outgrew them despite playing (and sliding) and after repeated washes they stayed nice looking. One of the pants got a rip in the top layer by the knee but had a lower layer reinforcement so my boys skin wasn't exposed. Other than that my two sons have worn several pairs of these pants over the past few years and they look great with their back pockets and belt loops and elastic bottoms and can be worn low or as knicker style. Most of my boy's team wears these pants now due to their economical price, look and quality. PS: XS is good for about a 30-45lb kid.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2021
reviews.text: This bralette is basically just a halter top bra, not really a racerback like it is marketed. There's nothing majorly wrong with this, I just don't personally care for halter tops as they hurt my neck and can be uncomfortable. The bra is very cute and fits great. I wear a 34C/36B and got a medium. Soft, comfy, and the straps aren't too long or stretchy so it gives decent support. However, the elastic bit tacked on to the back is not adjustable (like in the photos) and isn't short/strong enough to do anything, so the pressure of the straps is all on my neck. It seems like they had a halter bra that they just converted to a 'racerback' without actually adjusting the design. Doesn't totally work for me. Because I like the fit, though, I am ordering another Shekini bralette that is very similar and has crossed straps in the back. I will compare and see which one I like better. Hopefully it will be a winner!

reviews.title: Smart phone friendly front pockets
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020
reviews.text: These are great pants with deep front pockets that will fit almost any smart phone, and they are secure due to the angle of the pocket opening. I own these in multiple colors. If you are between sizes, you should consider sizing down. If you have a flat bum, these will fit baggier in the back upper thigh. The fabric does relax a bit as you wear the pants, and while there is a fair amount of stretch and recovery, they do not completely recover to the "just washed" fit after you have worn them for an hour or so. I would say the "slim" fit is appropriate, as the legs are tapered but not skinny. The fit is work-appropriate, and I haven't noticed issues with show-through. The fabric for most of the colors is a stretch twill, but the navy houndstooth is a sateen print. Due to the print, the black of the houndstooth is not as dark as it could be, although I like the print. The sateen has better recovery than the twill (doesn't get as baggy with wearing), and I have noticed some variation in fit between the gray and breen colored versions I have, with the breen color fitting looser. I am unsure whether this is due to variation in the stretch of the fabric for each color, or variations in cutting/sewing. This is the only thing I would remove one star for -- it would be great if the fit were more consistent. The twill fabric is not truly wrinkle free, but I have not hat a problem with significant wrinkles after line drying and wearing them. If you wanted a front crease or sharper look, I'm sure you could press them. Given the very affordable price, I have not noticed significant flaws in the fabrication of any of my 4 pairs. There is no topstitching, and the pants are hemmed with a blind hem stitch. When I first bought these pants, I thought the twill fabric was a bit more casual than I would like. Now that I am mostly working from home, I am very happy that I have these as my work pants. Even though you usually can't see people's pants on conference calls (insert joke here..), I really find it helpful to maintain the routine of getting ready for work in the morning, and these pants help me do that.

reviews.stars: 3.0 out of 5 stars 3.0 out of 5 stars

reviews.text: I am just shy of 5‚Äô6‚Äù, 166 lbs, 40-33-39, ordered a size 10 and they fit quite well. These pants are okay. They are very flattering gon my bum, which I like. I really like the fit, until my lower leg. These pants kind of flare out from the calf down - unfortunately this is pretty common with my larger thighs, but I don‚Äôt like that the look more flared than slim. I feel like the pant is a bit long - well below my ankle bone - and doesn‚Äôt look quite as long in the picture, which I don‚Äôt love. They are ever so slightly tight around my waist, but that‚Äôs pretty common for me and I‚Äôd rather them be a bit snug since I‚Äôm consistently losing weight. If it matters to anyone (doesn‚Äôt to me), they don‚Äôt have belt loops. I ordered the colour ‚ÄúCosmic,‚Äù which is noticeably a deep blue/navy in the picture. However, they are so extremely dark in person (in any lighting, not just the crappy mirror lighting in the pics) that they look black. I like a dark navy, but not so dark that I can‚Äôt even tell that it‚Äôs supposed to be blue. Overall, not a bad pant at all - I‚Äôm just not sure they‚Äôre for me. I may try reordering a 10 short in a different colour to see if the shorter length and more noticeable colour change my mind, or I may just suck it up and keep them because I start a new job in a few days and need some pants.

reviews.title: Works, but not my favorite.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2016
reviews.text: Well, the pro is the fabric is a little thicker than my last generic pair of black gloves. I started off annoyed because I was shipped the wrong glove (flap instead of no flap), however I suppose that's not a fault in the product. It's lucky I didn't want flaps though because the flap itself is secured with a long thread that weaves in and out of the glove, and it is snapped to the button by way of another single stitch made of a couple threads. Well that button securing thread was broke on the right glove so it would not snap to the button out of the package. Floppy flap syndrome. :-( I was going to cut the flaps off anyway because it would have been more hassle to return it than just take them off. If the single stitch that secures the whole flap to the glove itself is severed it is easily pulled all all across the glove. So basically, if either single stitch to secure the flap to the glove or the one to lock the flap to the button is (easily) broken, your flap is history real quick. That's a bummer if you actually wanted the flaps there. Not a big deal for me though since I didn't want the flaps anyway. So flaps and buttons are now gone. The stitching around the fingers looked like the stitching I put in when I made my own pair with my sewing machine. Honestly it's already frayed out of the package and will probably start to fall out after 3 weeks. I'll try to reinforce it a little when that happens. I wouldn't mind as much if they were like half the price but $10 to me is about the price where I expect them to have somewhat better stitching for something so small and simple. Overall I was hoping for more of a closed knit design at the fingers, not cutoff gloves with a stitch to keep them from unraveling. I really could have done that myself with 99c store gloves. But... in the end, they are keeping my hands warm at this very moment while allowing me to type. So I guess they are doing what they're supposed to do. Even if they aren't the best. Will I buy again? I don't know, I might try to find some wool ones with a high thread count next time so that the fingers wont fall out eventually even if it costs me 25 bucks.

reviews.title: Solid pair of gloves with flaps.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
reviews.text: These are decent gloves.I bought a pair last year, and I'm still wearing the same pair. I ordered my husband a pair once the cold weather hit, per his request. They're pretty warm as long as it's not bitterly cold- I wish there were thumb flaps on the thumbs, but I knew what I was getting when I ordered. One star off because the pair this year- when ordered off of the same exact listing- is a different material. It has slightly less give to it and isn't as soft. I assume this will improve with time, but my gloves were perfectly soft out of the package. All in all a good pair of gloves, but if it's particularly windy or bitterly cold (under 15F) they probably won't do much if you're outside for extended periods of time. However these are very good for your usual house-to-car-to-other building type of being outside. Also driving. They definitely keep your hands warm until your car warms up. The button to secure the flap is not sewn on very securely- it will come loose, as will the little loop on the mitten flap to keep the flap secure. I don't bother securing them anymore, honestly it's easier since I put the flaps on and off several times while I'm out. No stars deducted for the flap not being able to be secure- just making everyone aware to not expect the flap to stay secured for extended periods of time.

reviews.title: I like these a lot
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2014
reviews.text: I like these a lot. I live in a condo and have to take my dog out whenever he needs to go out and I live right on Lake Erie. So very cold and windy in the winter. They are not thick so might have to use heavier pair of gloves or mittens in the bitter cold, but these are great so far. Makes my life so much easier as a dog walker. I can handle the leash and the flashlight easily and even the "poop collection" is easy cause I can flip the mitten flaps off and have my fingers to do the work. My thumbs get cold, but that is just the nature of the critter, so to speak.

reviews.title: Keeps your hands warm even w/ the flap flipped back.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2015
reviews.text: I use these when I walk the dog and have to have access to a "pick up bag". Before I had to remove my gloves b/c I couldn't handle the thin plastic of the bags. Now I just flip the flap back, do what needs to be done, flip the flap over the fingers again and my hands stay warm. Even w/ the flap off (flipped back) the fingers are mostly covered so you stay warm. THey come to just over the distal knuckle so almost the entire finger except the tip stays warm and covered. I'd really like to give them 4.5 stars because the button loop which you can use to keep the flap tacked back, came detached. But since I don't want to keep it permanently flapped back, it's not a big deal

reviews.title: Probably More Flattering On Curvier People
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020
reviews.text: I needed some basic sleeveless tops to wear around the house and for that purpose, these work well enough. However, I wouldn't wear them out and about because they are just not flattering on me. The sides spread out under the arms as shown in the first picture. The neckline in the back sags down into a little shelf, as shown in the second picture. I am very slender and small-chested (32B, 25‚Äù waist for reference) and these seem to be shaped for someone with more curves on top. I am 5‚Äô8‚Äùand they hit me at just above the crotch, so they could be tucked in if you wanted to. I wouldn't wear them as an undershirt because they are just too boxy and would add too much bulk. I ordered the smallest size and I still feel like I am swimming in them. The material is like a comfy t-shirt with a little bit of stretch, but not much. The stitching and quality of the fabric seems fine. They should last me for quite a while. I have washed them twice now and they haven't faded or shrunk.

reviews.title: Definitely order at least a size smaller than usual.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021
reviews.text: I‚Äôm 5‚Äô7‚Äù and 130-135 lbs. I typically buy small or medium shirts, depending on whether I want something to be fitted or baggy. According to the reviews, I ordered an XS as I didn‚Äôt want these to be at all baggy. They ended up fitting me like a medium, so fairly baggy. Which wouldn‚Äôt be a problem, but that makes the arm holes so loose that I‚Äôm not comfortable wearing these (especially to church) without a jacket or sweater over them. I was hoping they would shrink some in the first wash/dry but I can‚Äôt tell that they did. On a positive note, the neckline is a very comfortable size! Not tight on me but not showing too much. And I love the length! It‚Äôs a perfect length and doesn‚Äôt ride up at all. They are very soft shirts and the green especially is a beautiful shade!

reviews.title: Wearable Even In Phoenix!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
reviews.text: I live in Phoenix, AZ. The average high temperature this summer has been 107.9 degrees, and we must plan for most days to be in the high 90s/low 100s at least until Halloween. Why the weather report? Because the heat here means that for at least six months of the year, the only clothes I wear are shorts and tank tops, I _know_ tank tops, and I demand a lot from them. These tanks measure up. They have deep armscyes and scoop necklines, allowing decent air-flow; they hang straight without miserable, heat-trapping cling; they are 100% cotton so they are both absorbent and breathable; they are very well-made; and they launder beautifully, without shrinking, even in hot water. I recommend them unequivocally. Are they "flattering"? (What does that even mean?) Let me just say that, when my hair is plastered to my skull with sweat, my face is boiled-lobster-red, and I have chosen to accessorize my ensemb with bags of ice or frozen veggies at my neck and armpits to try to avoid heat exhaustion... I don't worry for one moment about how "flattering" my tank top is...

reviews.title: Loose and casual tanks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2021
reviews.text: I agree with other reviewers that these tanks run a bit big. I normally wear a large or xl and the large was pretty roomy but not huge. I was a little disappointed by the feel of these tanks. They are heavier and stiffer than they appeared in the pictures. Hoping a few washes will loosen them up. Out of the first wash, the are pretty stiff and don‚Äôt have the soft drape shown in the photos. That said, they do seem like good quality- nice seams, not super thin, no loose threads, etc. I was hoping to wear them to work under a cardigan or collared shirt, but they are a little more casual looking in person than in the photos.

reviews.text: I was looking for cotton sleeveless tops to wear at home during the summer and stumbled across these. While I do like the quality of the fabric, the sizing is a little off. Like many have suggested, go down a size if purchasing. Also, yes the arm holes! They‚Äôre pretty large. I feel if they had to adjust the arm holes, the fit around the chest would be perfect. That‚Äôs why I gave it four stars. That said, after washing them once they did shrink slightly and fabric feels like it softened a bit, so I‚Äôm still happy to wear them. Just wasn‚Äôt getting what I expected.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
reviews.text: I ordered these tanks for the sole purpose of wearing them around the house as I work from home now. They're nice cool cotton, definitely run big. I am a size 10 and range between a medium and large, and I'm glad I went with medium because it fits more like a large. Other reviews said they run big in the armholes and that's definitely true. It's definitely not your tailored going-out top (not that anyone is doing that these days anyway) but it's a great everyday tank top if you're just trying to be comfy. I haven't washed them yet so maybe they'll shrink down a little - just be aware to size down if you're between sizes.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2022
reviews.text: I didn‚Äôt find the fabric to be a flowy as I expected based on the picture. They are comfortable though and cute. Also the color is a little more yellow in real life. They fit basically as expected perhaps leaning a little big but I didn‚Äôt mind. The length was perfect for me.

reviews.title: Nice but Not as they appear
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2021
reviews.text: In some reviews people say the material is soft, others report it is not. I ordered a black pair Xl (I am a size 12.). These are little baggier than I expected and the material is soft but the texture does not flow or drape like a tshirt material would, as it appears they do in the photo. (This draped look is the look I wanted). This Material is thick and feels more like a very thick starched dress shirt would, which means the very wide leg opening holds its round shape and does not lay against your leg as you move. Since I have thinner legs, the wide leg almost looks like it has wire ring holding in its round shape. As I move my hips, the shorts stay stiff and don‚Äôt not move with me. Not at all happy about that. If you are more pear shaped, this may not be an issue. They will be a very cozy short to wear around the house so will keep them. I am wondering if the different colors may come in textures (as light and dark denim are always different too). The pics of the lighter colors show a very textured material that has a weave that is allowing the material to drape and flow. I may try ordering a different lighter color just to see. If your looking for for that draped look in the photo, don‚Äôt order the black, try a different color thats texture is very visible in the pics. I did wash and dry, not much shrinkage at all(the one time I was hoping there would be lol). They look o.k. Without ironing even though the material is thick but they do wrinkle a lot in front as you sit so ironing wouldn‚Äôt matter anyway. Being that I have black, it does not show to bad but if the lighter colors are the same way, it would be very obvious. I gave them a 4 because they are good quality. Just not what I wanted for my body type.

reviews.title: It has unforseen flaws. Not the worst however.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2022
reviews.text: I liked it from the pictures but IRL its not as good. The button close is insufficient. It requires a zipper closure that goes all around the wallet. The bottom does not close the wallet properly. If it was going to be button close it needs to buttons on the sides as well as the one in the middle and they need to be closer to the edge. The button in this wallet is too far in and thus the wallet does not fully close. It kinda hangs open like a gaping mouth. It stores a lot hut when you put anything in the slots the wallet bulges out more than I expected. I shall keep this wallet because it is very cute otherwise. But I am displeased. I expected better quality and make. It has slight fraying and I dont like how the slots were sewn. A much thinner fabric could have been used for the slots also so its a much thinner and slimmer wallet over all. The lip of the card holders is also fat. Not a preference of mine. I thought a bigger wallet would be great. But I‚Äôm not so sure now. Whenever I use this wallet kr take it with me I may have tk rubber band it closed on the sides or place it in a pouch of its own so that it may stay closed and not bulge out like it is currently. I havent even stuffed the wallet full. I barely have any cards or photos in my wallet. And all the zipper pouch barely has anything in it currently. I cant imagine putting too many coins or anything of substance in there. The make isnt too bad but it is a little flawed and I am not smiling ear to ear over this purchase like I hoped I would.

description: From the manufacturer A Fit Like No Other ECCO designs footwear to meet your needs, whether you're taking the stairs, walking around the city all day, or scrambling over rocky slopes; ECCO delivers superior fit, durability, support and flexibility. Our advanced construction techniques and continuous exploration in materials science add up to comfort you can count on. You'll notice the difference immediately - and at the end of an intense hike or after walking a dozen blocks uptown, you'll continue to appreciate the difference of ECCO. Read more The ECCO Freedom Fit Conventional shoes fit across your feet at the toes, restricting the way your toes spread as you walk. ECCO's Freedom Fit is different; it offers a roomy toe box and fits more narrowly from heel to instep, suitable for most widths. Toes spread naturally to support your weight and foster a more comfortable walking experience. Feet of nearly all widths feel good in ECCO, comfort straight from the box. Read more ECCO Leather ECCO is one of the very few manufacturers to have its own tanneries where it processes its own hides and leathers. This ensures that ECCO has the highest quality control from raw materials to finished shoe. The various highly advanced processes and treatments, to which the hides are subjected, always reflect the look and specific function of the product. This ensures a perfect match of form and function. ECCO Comfort Fibre System This exclusive inlay sole is designed with a vegetable-tanned leather surface. Underneath is a soft layer of unique, moisture-absorbent foam; treated with AGION for long-lasting and effective control. The pumping effect of the foam is activated as you walk- pushing air through tiny holes in the lining to create comfortable air circulation around the foot. Polyurethane Soles Polyurethane (or PU) is a manufactured material that can take the place of rubber. PU is the longest lasting material for outsoles; often lasting 2-3 times longer than traditional materials. In an ECCO shoe, PU is made to be flexible and shock absorbing; requiring little to no break-in period and allowing the wearer to be comfortable longer. PU also retains is shape or 'Memory' longer, allowing the wearer the same support from the first day to the last in their ECCO shoes. These ECCO shoes have a nylon or TPU shank allowing the wearer to breeze through some security checkpoints without removing their shoes. Direct Injection Process Direct inject Production or DIP is a highly specialized process in which ECCO is a world leader. This discipline represents the core competence of ECCO sole technology- and one of the secrets behind the special and famous 'instant fit' of an ECCO shoe. It‚Äôs a process where the upper is placed into the mould, and liquid polyurethane (PU) is injected to shape the and anatomically correct midsole and / or outsole. Robot precision ensures a consistent quality regardless of the production location. Read more

reviews.title: Good Shoes, Danish shoes fit different than American.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.text: Ecco shoes fit differently. As the shoe salesman explained it to me on my first pair, they fit to the ball of your foot, and the toe box is more open. Your toes never cramp at the end of the shoe, they are free to wiggle. It feels a little funny at first, but after a short period, I prefer this type of fit by far. These Fusion 2 Tie Oxford are a little stiff in the cuff around the ankle. Not enough to cause blisters or abrasion, just I can feel them rubbing. They seem to be breaking in well and I think in a couple of days I will not notice it anymore.

reviews.text: My husband loves this shoe! he has a smaller foot but wide and very high arch. Also, being a diabetic good footwear is important. This one fits amazing and looks very stylish. He's always been a fan of ECCOs and I am glad they are stepping up their design.

reviews.title: Comfortable for my foot with broken toe.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2019
reviews.text: I need shoes with a fairly wide toe box that allows the laces to tighten each foot differently - as one foot has a metatarsal to my big toe that protrudes outward. ECCO makes several shoes that work for me. I am also flat-footed and use an arch support which consumes volume in the shoe, so I need them to run on the wide side. I am happy with this shoe as it adjusts to both feet and is fine for extensive walking. I also own the Black version of this shoe in a smooth leather that takes a kind shine. I like the black shoe better as it retains a better finish and appearance than the "suede-like" finish of the leather on this shoe. I would give the black shoe Five Stars and would do the same for this shoe if it stood up a little better in the looks department. But hey, one can't wear black all the time. So I would recommend this shoe if you want the color and finish.

reviews.title: Perfect Travel Shoes.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2018
reviews.text: I bought these primarily as travel shoes. I needed something comfortable enough to wear for 20+ hours at a time during international flights but dressy enough to wear with khakis for a day or so when the airline decides to delay my baggage. These turned out to be perfect. They were broken in after a few hours, extremely comfortable, and extremely well made. They would have been great if I'd been able to take long walks on the trip. (Winter in Korea took that option off the table). They're more on the casual than dress size. I always think it's silly when people say an item "fit great" or "didn't fit" in online reviews since everyone's body is different. I will say that I normally use a D or E width, and the medium version of these were fine. I'm a 10.5 in American shoes and the 44 was perfect. (I own several brands of European motorcycle boots and know that sometimes their sizes don't align precisely with American sizes, but Ecco's do). One final thing: I expected these shoes to be made in China but was pleased to see that they're from Portugual.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 6, 2022
reviews.text: For reference I am 5'0, 103lbs, 32DD breasts, size 4-6.. This fits perfectly except for the length which I expected to be too long. It even holds my heavy dagger! The belt and gauntlets are a thinner material, so I will see how they hold up. I think they will. To me it's worth the price as I will wear it to the Renaissance festival also. Also I have to hem everything, so that's not an issue with me. Itll be fine for taller women. The belt around the waist is a little long for me, but still hooks. I love that it shows a little skin, but not too much. Love the leg slits. I am wearing a costume necklace that covers some cleavage, it's not part of the outfit. Great outfit. 5 stars!

reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Pretty Flattering and gives the intended look
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 9, 2021
reviews.text: This made me look and feel the way I hoped. I ended up feeling like Megara from Hercules. I like the fabric, which is crepey. And the color, which is maybe bluer than it seemed online for me but is still somewhere between blue and teal. The accessories are ok; I liked the headband a lot. It is revealing but also covers a lot of the abdomen area. It was a good balance for me and let me feel like I could reveal some midriff without being rolly. The bust was moderate on support. I think most folks could get away without a bra and feel pretty good about it. I did adjust a fair amount, but I was also on camera while wearing it so I was hyper aware of how it was fitting and looking. (I adjusted off camera) Main issues: * The width of the fabric on the bust. For me it cut into my underarms fiercely. I'll be looking for some sort of alteration that might help with this. I don't think I could wear it more than 3 hours because of it. * Length. It's very long. I'm 5'6" and would have had to wear spike platforms to not walk on this. I ended up gathering it up like a wedding dress whenever I walked around. Made stairs particularly treacherous. * Minor, but the slits didn't show my legs the way I hoped when standing and moving around. This might be because of my own anatomy though, I have some belly and so maybe it was hanging too far away from my hips to do this effectively while standing. I was able to arrange it well to show off while sitting/laying though.

reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars

reviews.text: This a a beautiful dress that stretches and breaths. It‚Äôs not too sheer but love how thin the fabric is! Though the straps are fake pleather and uncomfortable over all it was a hit at Comicon!

reviews.title: Decent but with the caveat that you need to put some work into it
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 1, 2019
reviews.text: Pros: - can look really cute with some tweaking (I recommend you only get this if you have some small ability to sew/modify it to fit your body type better and/or to fix some of the shoddy work done in the factory to make this thing.) - nice color (initially... see cons below about washing) - comes with its own accessories (gauntlets are good, belt thing was garbage, headband was cool) - light, flowy, and very breathable fabric for hot summer days (feels like you're naked - also see cons below) - can be made to fit in different periods/styles Cons: - odd proportions (the breast strap things were super narrow but the band and elastic around the torso was crazy huge, such that my breasts wouldn't stay covered but my torso was way too small, so it hung off of me weirdly until I resewed the top) - skirt is really really really long. I'm an average height (5'4") and I literally had to cut off almost two feet from the front just so I could walk without tripping. - fabric is very thin and definitely feels and looks that way. Don't wear dark underwear or everyone on the planet will see it. Also don't stand in the sun or people can see through it. Also don't sweat or get rained on. Basically don't exist as a normal human in this outfit for long periods of time, lol. - color fades a lot even the first time you wash it. I very carefully washed it by hand in cold water with gentle detergent and it immediately lost about a third of its dye. That cute emerald/turquoise color turned into a sad almost gray/green dark pastel looking color. Overall I wasn't exactly disappointed by this purchase because for the price I wasn't expecting a lot and I really just needed a one day costume for Ren Faire. I did quite a bit of resewing on it to make it fit and lay a lot better, and that helped tremendously, even to the point where I got a lot of compliments on it and people asking where I got it. So I'd say that it worked out but that you should set your expectations for this reasonably.

reviews.title: My feet are so much happier now
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 6, 2020
reviews.text: My friend and I walk at least 3 miles 6 times a week to start our day. We are walking around 16.5 minute mile right now but trying to improve that. Both in our 40s and both with some pounds to lose. I have weird feet and my right foot has a more pronounced bunion than my left and foot pain was becoming a thing that made me want to avoid walking. My last pair was some Go Walk Sketchers but I had worn them to point where bottom was smooth. I was having pain on outside of my foot and decided to go ahead and invest in better shoes. My oldest daughter ran cross country a few years back and swore by her Brooks. So I knew she would gladly take this pair if I ordered them and hated them since her foot size is same as mine. I went with this pair because it sounded like it would have the support I want and because it would come quickly. I got black with purpe and hte purple is pretty bright so it might clash a bit if I was back on work and wearing it on a jeans day with our school colors (blue and gold.) However my foot pain meant I wanted delivery speed and we are all remote now anyway. As soon as I put them on I noticed an immediate difference. Sorry kid, mama is keeping these shoes. I wore them for errands (prior to going into lockdown mode) and I barely noticed the foot pain that had me hobbling when barefoot. Did 3.5 miles in under an hour today in them and they are a million times better than what I was wearing. I did order the 8.5 because I am sometimes as 8 and sometimes an 8,5 depending on shoe. I have just the width of my thumb between my toe and end of shoe so I would say the fit is good. Might have been okay in an 8 but then again feet swell a bit with exercise so they have felt a little small if I had done that.

reviews.title: Holy Cow! Who Knew There Was A Perfect Shoe!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 13, 2022
reviews.text: Brooks are hands down the best shoes on the market. Straight from the box, they are magic on the feet. No rubbing. No sore spots. No blisters. No pinching. No fatigue. I always thought shoes needed to be broken in. That belief is just plain wrong. Shoes do not need to broken in. That's a lie. Shoes should be perfect right out of the box. I compare all types I buy now to the experience I have with Brooks. Shoes must be perfect from day 1.

reviews.title: so far so good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 13, 2020
reviews.text: I go these all black brooks because that's the only color I'm allowed to wear at work. The gray part on the toe keeps making me thing something is on my foot when I catch it out of the corner of my eye. I may take a black sharpie to it to cover that up. I only tried this shoe today for one 10 hour shift. I can tell it has added support in the heals, ankles, and arches. I think its lacking in support in the toes. If thats what you need find another style. But I needed the support in my heals. These did not rub my ankles at all. They also didnt eat my socks like some shoe do. The shoe laces are not filled or are made of a different material than most common shoe laces but I think this helps them stay tied. I only had to tie them when I put them on and they stairs tied all day. I wear a size 7.5 in Nike and that is the brand I have been wearing for the last 10 years. I wanted something with the extra support in the heals and my mother recommended Brooks to me. I just guessed at the 7.5 size and they fit almost exactly the same. The only difference I noticed was that my big toe touches the top of the inside of the shoe. I dont know it thats just me of if this style is slightly slimmer than other shoes I typically purchase, but it was not enough to return them. I will update if they wear a hole in the shoe. Otherwise, I recommend these shoes.

reviews.title: Great shoes, great price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 9, 2021
reviews.text: I wear nothing but Brooks Adrenaline and love the fit, comfort, and support they provide for my severe pronation issues. I walk 5 miles approximately 5-6 days a week so I need a really superior running shoe. Buying the latest model (GTS 21) will cost $125-130 so finding the previous model, the GTS 20, at such a good price is a real bonus for me as I go through 3-4 pairs of Brooks every year. In most other shoes I wear a size 8 but in my Brooks Adrenaline I wear a 9. Amazon ordering is easy and shipping is fast, so that‚Äôs a plus. Highly recommend in particular if you wear Brooks shoes and know from experience that the Adrenaline is the shoe for you. If you have never worn Brooks shoes before I recommend getting fitted/evaluated for the right shoes for you at an independent running shoe store so that you can be sure Brooks are a fit for your feet and your exercise needs. Then you can feel confident making all future purchases from Amazon without needing to try them on.

reviews.title: Clueless about shoes but these are great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 5, 2021
reviews.text: I've recently started working out which has been awesome but my knees were really starting to ache. I realized I needed to purchase new shoes with better support instead of my typical Van's. I bought a cheap pair of running shoes for $25 on Amazon which provided no relief. A post came up in my workout group asking about shoe recommendations and somebody suggested the Brooks Adrenaline shoe, and after doing more research I decided to try them out. Wow! The day these arrived on my porch, my knees were aching while just standing and cooking dinner. I put these on right away and I am not kidding when I say that I felt relief almost instantly. I seriously thought it would've taken a day or two. I am someone who has never owned a proper running shoe in my life. I've never liked the look of them. After feeling how supportive and comfortable these shoes are, I couldn't care less what they look like! (Although, the black shoe with the purple accents really isn't so bad!) I'm going to resume working out tomorrow, I will update again about whether or not it truly helps my knees.

reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Fantastic costume corset!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2022
reviews.text: Great costume corset for my Renaissance festival outfit. Really cute just with jeans too. It is a costume corset, not steel boned, don't expect major waist reduction, so keep that in mind. Notes about fit/size: Take your waist measurement and subtract the number of inches you want to have space for on the lacings. So, for me, my waist is about 33-34" relaxed, but I know that I like a good 4-6" of adjustment space for the back lacing, so I always order for a 28-29" corset waist. Medium was perfect for me, but if you're wanting to lace it all the way closed, you'd want go up a size or two. The modesty panel in the back is pretty generous, though, and with corsets it's always better to go a size smaller than a size too big. Once it's fully tightened in the back, it doesn't go tighter. Better to leave at least a couple inches for the laces. If it's slightly too tight, replacing the laces is super easy and inexpensive. If it's too big, there's not really anything you can do unless you have some serious skill with sewing and corset making. The lacing in the front is adjustable too, which is great because, while my breasts aren't that large comparitively at 34DD, I tend to have issues with things that fit my chest being too loose at the waist, or vise versa. Being able to adjust the bust area separate from the waist/overall corset is super useful for getting a great fit. Also very supportive once tightened, even without a bra on underneath. You do have to redo the laces yourself if you want them laced properly in the middle for easy tightening. If you have any other corsets, you can model off of those, or you can easily find instructions online about how to lace a corset. Personally, I'm planning to replace the laces on mine because I prefer slightly longer laces on my corsets to make getting them on and off by myself easier. Besides that, fantastic product, very well made. Note about seller: AXIYA Lovely Fashion was fantastic. When my order initially came in, it was missing the detachable garters. I sent them a message, and after confirming what I'd ordered and confirming my contact info, they sent me a whole new corset set within a week of the original arriving, and only a few days after my original message to them about the missing garters was sent. Highly recommend them! They went above and beyond to make sure I was happy with my order.

They were a bit big for my arms, and kind of slid down my shoulders. I fixed this by pulling down further than needed, then tightening the straps so it would hold a bit better, still not perfect though. reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Comfortable but be prepared to adjust the fit!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2022
reviews.text: I am 5‚Äô5‚Äù and 205 lbs, 38 DDD. I normally wear a XL in shirts, I ordered this corset in a 3x based on manufacturing suggestions. This was the perfect size for me! This is a very well made, and comfortable, but I will make a couple of suggestions for a perfect fit, as it was very awkward out of the box. I‚Äôm a traveling vendor for Ren faires, so I wear steel boned and leather corsets a lot. I was looking for a cheaper, lighter weight option for smaller events during the summer months. This one definitely fit the bill! This corset has light weight plastic boning and made from a fabric inner lining and a soft, thin pleather outer lining. It‚Äôs not made to hold its shape rigidly, and won‚Äôt support the girls if you are on the bustier side like me, so you‚Äôll still need an under support (bra) to save your back and fill out the top if you desire. There is a lot of extra room under the arms and straps. So it is very accommodating for curvy gals, but you‚Äôll need to take those straps in with pins or sewing if you can‚Äôt fill out the top, they WILL slip down off your shoulders. Or be prepared to tighten the front and back laces tighter than shown in product images to take in that extra room. In order to get a good fit and a curvy profile, I went ahead and threaded the back like a traditional corset. Just skip the criss cross for the holes closest to the top of your rib cage under your gals, and thread into the hole above it, then continue criss cross. Tie the loose threads together in a knot near the end of the strings. I added a picture of my lacing pattern. Zip the front, but don‚Äôt lace the front. Pull the thumb loops until comfortable, pulling the hip lace or chest lace tighter as needed from the thumb loops. Tie these loops in a simple double knot, will look like a bow. Then just pull the gals up, and lace the front. Doing it this way will mean in the future you only have to undo the front to put on and off, keep a curvy shape, better support, and also makes minor adjustments of the fit easy on the fly. Hope this helps anyone looking! Would definitely buy again. Was exactly what I was expecting based on other reviews and manufacturers suggestions.

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Odd feel
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2022
reviews.text: Honestly, I love the brand. I love their willingness to still put quality materials into their shoes. I purchased these knowing that they didn‚Äôt look as well manufactured as some of their other styles. Typically they have a brushed leather bottom and wood sole, this is completely rubber. I wear dress shoes daily and can see myself burning a hole in these like I do in all the other rubber soled shoes I have tried. The shoes are beautiful, I get tons of compliments. They are definitely eye catching and not over the top. The fit: I wear 10.5 or 11, I purchased 11 and without laces, my foot required a tighter fit. Toe doesn‚Äôt pinch or crush the toes. In the arch of my foot, the shoe feels like I‚Äôm walking on something foreign. The shoe curves to my arch completely on the inside of the show. I have not figured out if I love this or not, but I have never had anything like it. The main issue is what it looks like when I pick up my foot, the material squished in an odd fashion in my dim picture. I know that all shoes bend on top, it just looked a bit cheap when it happened. I like them, I wear them often. The arch support is odd, the top bends weird, and the rubber sole is less than ideal; but I like them for the short period of time that I have had them.

reviews.title: Sensible & secure configuration, excellent quality and construction, simple design and non-flashy appearance. Highly recommend!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2018
reviews.text: Bought this for my wonderful husband last Christmas and he loves it! We're not big gift-givers as we are happy with the simple things in life. My husband had a black leather wallet that was of the exact (or nearly) same configuration as this wallet, but not quite as high-quality. He carried that wallet for years, and a few of the pocket edges had worn quite thin. When he brought it to my attention that his wallet was wearing out, he expressed to me that two of his favorite features of his old wallet were that 1.) He could show his driver's license without removing it from his wallet or exposing his cash and credit cards and 2.) The "flap" or fold-over section flipped over the bill section, helping to prevent bills from falling out and also keeping his cash out of public view (not that he carries a huge wad or anything, but it's always best to be discreet with cash). We were not yet Amazon Prime members, and I proceeded to shop at a few stores for a replacement wallet. I found a few wallets that were similar, but the flap section didn't flip over the bill section, it flipped over the credit card pockets only, leaving the bills exposed, so those were a no-go. I'm not a big (in-store) shopper, and by the time I finally did find this beautiful wallet on Amazon, one of his old wallet pockets had broken and he was in real need of this item. I can't remember his old wallet now, but with this Tumi wallet, there are two card pockets that are exposed when he shows his license and four card pockets that remain hidden. He keeps his library card and membership cards in the exposed pockets and his credit cards in the hidden pockets. What he loves about this wallet: The configuration, which keeps his cash and cards secure and out of view. The size and slim profile of this wallet, which is comfortable in his pocket. The quality of construction. The simple profile and non-flashy logo. What I love about this wallet: The guy who carries it! It's been over a year, and we are very happy with this purchase. If you are considering this wallet, I hope you buy it and that you enjoy it as much as we have!

reviews.title: Good wallet and design.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2016
reviews.text: Well-made wallet with an RFID area to protect your credit card information to be pickpocketed by electronic devices. Craftsmanship and leather quality is very good quality. This type of trifold wallet is hard to find. The set up is very easy to use and it's not bulky.

reviews.title: Best wallet you could get...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2014
reviews.text: Love this wallet and its L-Fold design... I had a Coach wallet before with the same L-Fold design and it lasted 10 years. Several occasions I looked for another L-Fold wallet as my wallet got older, but could not find one until I found the Tumi L-Fold wallet. Let me just say the photos don't do it justice. The ballistic nylon liner gives the wallet an extra feel of durability and quality. The leather is supple, but not flimsy, the stitching is perfect and the "TUMI" logo is small, black and subtle. I don't usually carry to many cards, but this will hold my license, plus seven cards in easy access slots. It also has two additional pockets to hold a few more cards if needed, but I hate bulky wallets so those are always empty. I like this wallet so much I gave a few away as Christmas presents this year and may do so again for birthdays this coming year...

reviews.text: Just as ordered. I've been using these wallets for 20 years now. The wallet folds up perfectly so that no credit cards can accidentally fall out. They usually last about 5 to 6 years before they start to wear out.

reviews.title: If you aspire to be George Costanza, this is the wallet for you!

reviews.text: this now makes my 3rd tumi L-Fold wallet, this btw over a 30-year span. so, why the so-so rating you ask!? well 1st of all, this is not the previous one's lovely, supple leather, which i could live with, were it not for the fact that this thing is massive, not quite george costanza sized, but exceedingly chunky nonetheless. i'll live with it, but i certainly regret buying it.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021

It has extra compartments to put cards I don't use very often but need to carry around. So I give this wallet TWO THUMBS up or .. 5 stars!

reviews.title: Not your average sock liner
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on July 22, 2019
reviews.text: I am really picky about my no show sock liners. Comfort, non slip,cut just right. These are the best I have tried so far. Most sock liners are cut in a typical oval shape. These are cut differently. At first glance you might think the top will show in your shoes. They do not. They have a padded toe which I love and they are absorbent and slightly thicker than other brands which I like when working out. They are soft and comfortable. There is a generous clear no slip patch on the back and it works. I love these and eight pairs for the price is a steal. I highly recommend these.

reviews.title: Awesome socks!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on September 1, 2020
reviews.text: I decided to order these because i got a pair of canvas Keds sneakers for the summer, and needed some little socks to wear with them. I chose these ones based on the reviews, price, and cute colours. When they arrived, ill admit I was a bit disappointed at first. Right out of the package, they appeared to be way too thin, and the inside felt almost rough to the touch. HOWEVER... after the first wash, they came out beautifully! The fabric became totally soft and fluffy. Ive now had them about a month, theyve been worn and washed many times, and theyre holding up really well. Theyre just the perfect thickness for spring/summer/fall - thick and cushy enough to be comfy, but not hot or sweaty at all. The silicone grip at the back is genius, ive been wearing them daily with all different kinds of shoes and have never had a sock slip down. They stay exactly in the right spot on your foot all day, and you cant even feel the silicone patch against your skin. Theyre extremely comfy. I wear a wize 9.5 wide or extra wide shoe, and these socks fit my feet nicely. I would 100% recommend these socks to anyone, and ill definitely be buying more for myself.

reviews.title: Never have your socks fall down again!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on July 18, 2019
reviews.text: I really like these no-show socks! They have a durable, quality feel to them. The back of the socks have a rubber strip which helps the socks stay up, because them falling down is something annoying that happens with most no-show socks. Because they're a little on the thicker side, they might be too warm for summer weather, but overall, I'm really happy with these. I got them at a really good price too.

reviews.title: Non-slip heel didn't work for me
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on March 30, 2021
reviews.text: The socks on their own are a comfortable fit, well made, cute and feel good. Unfortunately my main goal in getting this style was having the no-show cut stay put while wearing sneakers and runners, which these didn't live up to. :( Despite the non-slip heel lining that's built into the sock - sort of a silicone/rubbery thin bit on the inside of the sock near the back ankle interior - they slid down during my first and second wears, leading to nasty blisters from a very easygoing neighborhood walk. It also kind of seems like the silicone part made things worse... I got blisters from the shoe rub with no sock protection, and blisters further down on my heel where the silicone had slid. Definitely a bummer.

reviews.text: So pretty! Light, airy, breathable, feminine, beautiful embroidery - a perfect summer top! Except they really took the pattern for a toddlers dress and widened it to fit adult torsos. And that's exactly what it looks like when you put it on. I ordered my usual size, but I dont think even sizing up would save me here. For those ladies that have a large chest, just face the music and move on. If your less fortified in the chest area, then this may be just perfect for you. The fact of the matter is, there is not enough length in the torso to actually cover your boobs and the peplum to reach your waist line. It hangs there like an awful bedskirt, ruffled around the largest circumference of your chest. Even if you size up, the torso length won't change significantly enough to make a difference. Super tight in chest, shoulder, and sleeves. Looks like a bedskirt.

reviews.title: excellent shirt, your size to order depends upon the look you want
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 23, 2022
reviews.text: The material is lightweight with a smooth natural feel. The 5% spandex gives it a very comfortable level of stretch so it never feels binding. Overall a very comfortable shirt with good quality. This would be a great shirt at $85, let alone the $25 price I paid. To give you insight into the fit, I am 5'8", 145lbs with an athletic physique. I'm a size 40.5" chest, 31" waist (wear size 29" in levi 501s), and 14.25" bicep. I would normally buy a medium when getting a slim fit. However, I've been burned a few times when ordering on Amazon and the fit is not as describe, so I will look at the reviews, especially those with photos. There was a review/picture from a guy who is 5'71/2", 150lbs, 31" waist and describes himself as having broad shoulders. He bought a small, but In the picture it seem to be a loose fit. So then I saw a guy who is 5'11", 176lbs, 42" chest and 34" waist and 14" biceps. He bought a small and in the photo he looked similar to the model but not write as snug. This convinced me to buy a small. When I put it on, I looked similar to the model, though perhaps even a little tighter in the upper body. It was an extremely flattering fit. If I were in my 20's I would kept because you are expected to be 'showy' at that age. I, however, and 60 and I looked like an old guy trying to hard to impress. So I exchanged it for a medium. It still has a flattering sung fit in the upper body, but more age appropriate, though I would prefer it to be a bit slimmer in the waist for a more fitted look. Hope this helps. update: I just received a long-sleeved version. I tired it on and fit exactly like it appears on the model. I thought maybe they sent me a small by mistake so took it off and check the label, but it is a medium. It is not quite as snug as the short-sleeved small, so it is borderline 'age appropriate', so I decided to keep it. Anyway, I hope this helps you decide what size to order.

reviews.title: Not as wide as hoped, but better than most!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 22, 2022
reviews.text: I've had the WORST time finding actually-wide "wide" shoes after foot surgery. My only successes so far have been a couple (expensive) Merrells and (no-support, cheaply made) "XW" Easy Spirits. These have been the first tennis shoes I've been able to get my post-surgical foot into other than a pair of Merrell Moab Flights! They're just a hair too narrow for full comfort, but being that I got them for about half the price of the Merrells and my foot is still healing a bit, I'm going to keep them and they should fit better in another month or two. If you've been disappointed by way-too-narrow "wide" shoes like Asics, New Balance, or Columbia, these would be worth a try. If you need really wide shoes, try the tennis-shoe height Merrels like Moab Flight or Moab 2. Those are wider than these in the same size, but the mid-height Merrells seem to run a little more narrow. Other benefits: they look well made, have nice padding around the ankle, they're super lightweight, and they have a very supportive sole (can't be bent in half over the arch like cheaper shoes). There is a little arch support built in, but I'm replacing the insoles with orthotics for a little more support just with my foot structure. Recommended!

reviews.title: Two years on the hunt for Asics that work - finally hit gold
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 15, 2018
reviews.text: Jury is still out BUT, I have bought and returned 3 or 4 pairs of running sneakers from Amazon over the past 2 years and I will be keeping these. I have been wearing Asics for probably 20 years but recently have noticed that the sizing is off and the support not as good for moderately priced (under $80) sneakers. I used to be a 7.5 in Asics and could always buy that size and know they'd be fine. My last pair were bought almost 2 years ago and they were an 8.5, which I know I am NOT. But the 7.5 and 8s, my toes were hitting the front. I even recently tried a pair of Adidas, but returned them too (they didn't feel substantial enough, I can't really explain it - but they were the PureBoost Xpose). So given that it's been a 2 year journey for a sneaker that fits and feels comfortable, I am finally content. I am a walker, not a runner, but these will be fine. My only concern is that because the upper material feels like cotton, I worry that they will wear out faster. We'll see

reviews.title: Extremely comfortable!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 23, 2019
reviews.text: I've worn Asics for a couple of years now, although I always went for Gel-venture 6s. I decided to change it up and order this model instead. For context, these are not for running but I do spend most of my work shifts (8+ hours) on my feet. If you're familiar with Nike Tanjuns they would kind of remind you of these but they feel sturdier and they're a bit heavier. This model has a narrower toebox than my gel-ventures (which I actually prefer) and they truly fit like a glove. Some people have written that they orderd down a size... as for me, I've always worn a 7.5 in Asics and these fit true to my size in that regard. Would definitely recommend checking these out!

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 17, 2020
reviews.text: This is one of my favorite shoes to work out in. This is my second pair of them. They are light weight, dry fast, and protect your foot well. The reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because when I received them they look like they base of the shoe was glued to the fabric of the shoe. You can see the white glue like material. The last pair I had lasted until the tread was gone this pair I don't even think will make it that long.

reviews.title: These shoes are very light weight and extremely comfortable. I purchased "soft sole" inserts to go in ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 7, 2018
reviews.text: I am a nurse who works 12 hour shifts and walks anywhere from 3-5 miles per night during my shift. These shoes are very light weight and extremely comfortable. I purchased "soft sole" inserts to go in them (I replace all inserts with soft sole....they are the best and very worth it). With the combination of the shoes and the inserts, my feet don't hurt at all after working a very long shift. The inserts may not be needed if these are strict gym or running shoes, but being on your feet for long hours, the inserts are very much needed. I love how the tops of the shoe are fabric, thus allowing your toes and feet to move freely. I would totally buy another pair of these for my gym shoes. Great shoe for the price!!!!

reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe but Runs Large & Not Good for Supinators
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 16, 2019
reviews.text: I always wear an 8.5 in sneakers, but in this shoe I think an 8 would've fit better. Good style with enough arch support and cushioning for true comfort and not feeling every speck of gravel you might step on. Very good price for a shoe of this comfort level. However, this shoe didn't provide enough support along the outer edge for my problem with supination that resulted from a broken ankle and surgery a few years ago. I don't think this would be a good shoe for supinators in general. The Brooks Glycerin offers much better support for this issue, but it also costs a lot more. I would've loved the Asics Torrance otherwise.

reviews.title: Most comfortable ASIC yet!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 19, 2019
reviews.text: I bought these shoes for work, and wear them over 8 hours a day (cashiering) with no problems at all, for my feet, my hips, or my knees. I love that there are no seams across the top to rub on my feet/toes, as I have previously had surgery on my feet for bunions, and they can be sensitive after a long day of work. I will be buying an additional pair of these (in a different color) for the gym as I also do Zumba, kickboxing, and other classes and prefer the feel of this style of ASIC while attending those kind of classes. I have always been an avid ASIC wearer, but will be sticking with this style for the long haul!!

reviews.title: Perfect Loungewear
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2022
reviews.text: I have twenty of these long tee shirts in four colors and have worn them exclusively since the pandemic. I wear leggings under them and an insulated waffle-weave long-sleeve shirt over them when it's cooler, and it almost looks like a little skirt. I sleep in them and wear them during the day around the house, as I work from home. With so many, I can change them as often as I'd like. Alone, the long tee shirt is not a flattering cut, but it can't be beaten for comfort. If you don't need to look sultry, this is the shirt for you. It is roomy.

reviews.title: For the price, a great buy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2022
reviews.text: I bought 3 of these. And I already had 3 similar ones. I don't shower until the afternoon, so if I have nowhere to go, I do housework in these little dresses. But, after doing housework in them, I pitch them in the hamper and use a clean one that night. I don't even mind answering the door with these on, as they don't look particularly like pj's. They are very comfortable and not restrictive. I guess that would depend on your size, of course. These say they are one size fits all but I think they run large. If you are a size 10 or under, they will swallow you! Use laundry soften when you wash them because they are a little rough. I am sure a few more washings will take care of that. Surprisingly, the red one didn't run in the wash.

reviews.title: Nice heavy fabric, very Straight - no flare at hem, tight neck...
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on February 4, 2020
reviews.text: This is difficult, and I will update once washed...size is equivalent to my WASHED AND DRIED 2X-3X from Walmart or Superstore, but the material is thicker, and there is no annoying picture/logo on it. At the shoulder, width is about 23 inches (59 cm) from sleeve seam to sleeve seam; hem width is about 26 inches (65cm) across - very little flare to accommodate hips; length is 40 inches (100 cm) measure from back collar to hem. As mentioned by others, this is VERY close fitting at the throat. I really want to like this, but I really don't like tight fitting, and it lacks the flare (an extra 6 inches width at the hem with the others in my drawer...) I would prefer. Update Oct 2020: after warm water washing and tumble drying it lost a minor bit in length (less than an inch) but gained it in width, lessening the tight feel. This has vastly improved the feel and fit - although the neck is still a bit on the snug side. Material is quite heavy for this sort of shirt, at least double the thickness of normal Walmart T-shirt style night shirt. I have upgraded from three to four stars based on softening, widening, and wear - it still looks new.

reviews.title: Comfy and long
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on May 16, 2019
reviews.text: I'm obsessed with this shirt, to be honest. I'm 5'6" and about 215-220lbs, and this fits very comfortably - it's big, but doesn't feel way too huge, and it is long enough that I'm comfortable lounging in it. It hits just above the knee for me. The material isn't the softest at first touch, but it seems to soften with wear. I'm already planning to buy another one because it's the perfect fit and it's affordable.

reviews.title: Great quality, great price!
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on September 13, 2020
reviews.text: I wanted to buy some 100% cotton men's hospital nightgowns for a loved one that does not tolerate polyester. All I found was either 100% polyester (so uncomfortable) or polyester/cotton (not much better) gowns that were very expensive. None were 100% cotton to my discouragement, until I discovered these Hanes women's nightshirts at a super price! From the comments, I saw that the size was very large and some of the colors ok for men. Since I needed a men's LARGE size, I took a chance and ordered 3 in denim blue. They arrived quickly, great color, perfect size, great quality 100% cotton, and hardly shrunk when washed! I adapted them by cutting them down the back, trimmed them with bias tape and some Velcro at the neck and was so happy with the result that I ordered 6 more!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
reviews.text: Went with a size small since other reviews said it has good stretch and I am happy I did. I looked at Amazon's size chart rather than the one listed in the description, though they're not too different. The pink color is more of a warm-toned pastel/baby pink whereas I feel the posted pictures looked like it might be a bit darker or cooler-toned. Overall the material feels good, but it is a little see-through (but easily fixed as long as you don't wear anything dark underneath). The sleeves were also a bit long, but I'm petite so I'm not surprised. I plan to cut the sleeves in the future to make it sleeveless though, so it doesn't matter much to me.

reviews.title: Easy to Adjust Wrist Band
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2022
reviews.text: This is a cute little casual watch that I love wearing. I am so pleased that I was able to adjust the wrist band on my own. It's just a matter of using a very small Allen wrench or a thin metal tool that you insert into the opening of the clasp where the arrow is located. Lift up and slide the clasp to your suiting. Then press very hard to close up the clasp. I didn't figure this out on my own, I went to You Tube to teach me! So if you need to see a video lesson then go to You Tube and search "How to adjust a Casio side clasp" and the video by The Watch Hut will come up. The video is short and sweet and easy to understand even for someone like me who is not mechanically minded. Also I went to You Tube to learn how to set the time and calendar. You can find this video by searching for "How to set time Casio LA670W" by Yzmael Official. Again, for someone like me who gets easily frustrated with this sort of thing, the instructions were clear enough for me and it wasn't even in the English language!

title: Leggings Depot High Waisted Leggings for Women Buttery Soft 3‚Äù Waistband Women's Leggings Solid Yoga - Reg, Plus, 1X3X, 3X5X

reviews.title: They're my favorite! I order whenever there's a sale!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2022
reviews.text: This is my second or third round of buying leggings from Leggings Depot! I love them so much every time. I'm a size 12 and the one size-plus fits perfect. I'm going to list all the reasons these are emy favorite to date: 1) they are long but don't bunch up at the ankle like other leggings on short legs. I had so many issues finding leggings that would fit but would not bunch at the ankle because I'm on the shorter side so I could wear them under shoes/boots. These are long so there is enough fabric to stay under the boot but also the fabric is thin enough that there is no bunching. These are perfect for the knee high or ankle boot look. 2) They are soft, stretchy, and the band is not abrasive. Im very sensitive to material feeling. These are so soft and delicate feeling. They are quite thin which may be a downside for some but it lets you layer them in the winter easily. I wear them under long shirts, sweaters, dresses and other pants/skirts so it's not much of an issue for me. I never see my skin through darker colors but you may want to be aware of the thiness just in case you intend on bending a lot and don't have booty coverage. The band (especially the wider style band) doesn't cut into your stomach like others might. The wider band style especially doesn't leave me feeling like a sausage link. It doesn't provide a lot of support but for me, this is a plus as it doesn't trigger sensitivity issues I have in the abdominal region. Also they somehow managed to make a product with enough stretch that it can perfectly hug every curve in the leg without it looking too stretched out in the thigh. This is a rare delight. 3) They are so affordable. It's so hard to find clothes that check all the boxes. But I always come back here when I need leggings. I buy them a few at a time. And just replaced my last ones that were wearing out after a couple years when they were on sale recently. These are a staple in my wardrobe and I will definitely be back for more when I can!

reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: JUST WHAT I WANTED -- EXCELLENT PRICE, LOOKS AND FEELS GREAT, BUT SHEER **4.5 stars**
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2021
reviews.text: My Height: 5' 5" My Weight: 110 lbs Size: Small Style/Color: Yoga Capri White Leggings are a staple item in my wardrobe -- worn alone with t-shirts or under dresses, sweaters, long tops, flirty shorts and rompers, etc. I can't survive without them, and white or ivory are staple colors in summer. I've been looking for 2 years for a replacement pair, and because of Covid restrictions, and long quarantine here in L.A., I haven't been to a mall since December 2019. Ugh. My favorite legging store has been just out of reach, and you all know how hard it is to order online, let alone deal with sizing. None of the leggings offerings on Amazon were what I was looking for, until I spotted these ... There are workout/yoga/running leggings for "sport" which are thicker and very different than fashion leggings. It's hard to tell online sometimes which is being offered. I've been fooled several times in the past, but not this time. The leggings I chose in YOGA CAPRI WHITE is EXACTLY what I was looking for. They're thin, soft and supple, but all the leggings on this site are not the same style/material/cut. The one I got is buttery smooth and soft, and too sheer to wear with or without panties. You might as well be naked if you try. These leggings are great for wearing something over them that covers the lower torso, whether it's a top, sweater, hoodie, dress, skirt, etc. I noticed the photo of one reviewer wearing her leggings without panties and you could see RIGHT THROUGH THE LEGGINGS from behind. EVERYTHING. If we could still comment on reviews, I would have warned her to take it down. Perhaps you can see what I mean in my photo with my hand underneath the legging. Most thin, American leggings are made of nylon and a little spandex, while these leggings are POLYESTER and a little spandex. The weave is smoother and tighter, very buttery soft (not quite as breathable as the nylon) and about as stretchy. There's a wide but thin tummy control band at the top, which I prefer to gathered elastic waistband of the other legging style in this offering. The stitching is mostly great (French seams where needed), even though the hem at the bottom of the legs took a shortcut on the side seam. It's just cut material, but can't be seen from the outside. These leggings fit me great. They look exactly like I wanted them to look, and like they appeared online. No complaints about the thin, smooth, soft material either. I don't know how durable they'll be as the laundering instructions recommend hand washing. That's okay with me. Hang dry doesn't take long, and the price -- on sale when I ordered them -- is even better. I can't speak for any other style or color, but this one was EXACTLY what I was looking for. FYI: If you buy a smaller size than you actually need, the thin leggings will look even more sheer. 5 stars for being the look I wanted, but only 4 stars for some reservations about long-term stretch of the polyester material and durability.

reviews.title: Must-have for Anyone with Under-Arm Sweat!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2017
reviews.text: This is a great undershirt for anyone who wants to avoid sweatmarks! Note that I have worn this shirt twice, and washed it--as per the care instructions--in my washer/dryer in between. Accordingly, I can't speak to longevity over a period of months, but can discuss the effect of a wash. The highlights: Pros: 1. Truly sweatproof. I recently wore this under my suit to a cocktail-attire event that seemed to lack air conditioning. Everyone complained about how hot it was. I could feel myself sweating and--even though I had this shirt on--was worried that it would show. Not at all! I even double checked when I got home: no sweatmarks, no damp feeling, and (courtesy of a good ol' fashioned sniff test) no smell. 2. The deep V collar keeps it truly hidden. When not wearing a tie, I typically like to keep the top two buttons on my button-ups unbottoned. Even with V-neck undershirts, the undershirt can sometime make an unwanted appearance. This shirt does not have that problem and stays hidden. 3. Similar to #2, the streamlined fit means that even with a tailored- or slim-fit dress shirt, this undershirt doesn't create any added bulk. At the same time, the elastic material used in the shirt is not constrictingly form fitting. 4. Seems to hold up after washing. I waited to write a review until I had used the shirt again after washing. Following the care instructions, the wash did not seem to have a negative impact on the shirt. Cons (sort of...): 1. If wearing this with a white dress shirt, there is a chance that the outline will be visible under your shirt (this depends on how thin the dress shirt is). This is the case with one of my white dress shirts, but it is very minor and--especially when wearing a jacket--I don't think others tend to notice. 2. The material in the under-arms has a weird feeling when first wearing the shirt that you have to get used to. It feels a little bulky in that area, but this seems to be a doubly-thick material to make sure that sweat doesn't soak through. And (see #1 in the Pros above) it does it's job. Once you get fully dressed and start going about your day, it really isn't too noticeable. Overall, for someone who sweats a lot--particularly under arms, this shirt is a lifesaver for dress events!

reviews.title: Sweat krypronite
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2022
reviews.text: As someone who has hyperhydrosis and works in sales this shirt is a miracle. Typically 1 hour into my day I have giant visual sweat rings. This has left me to party much black and white dress shirts only. I can feel comfortable wearing a pink dress shirt for an 8 hr day in this shirt. This is no joke the best thing I‚Äôve ever bought. Highly recommend‚Ä¶ just don‚Äôt buy them all on me! P.s. size down. I wear a large typically and the medium fits me perfect. I‚Äôm 6ft and 195lbs.

reviews.title: Life changing product for me
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2019
reviews.text: One of the best products I've ever discovered. I sweat excessively, and for years I worried about sweating through shirts at the office or when giving presentations and relegated myself to dark shirts on weekends that wouldn't show underarm wetness. I was always self conscious about raising my arms, and I ruined many nice shirts with anti-antiperspirant buildup. Coffee, hot days, social situations etc. were not my friends... After discovering Ejis a few years ago, my life really changed for the better. Now, I simply wear a regular v-neck during the week and a deep v-neck on the weekend, and my shirts and underarms stay completely dry and clean. I actually stopped wearing antiperspirant and switched to just deodorant because antiperspirant is unnecessary. I've never once sweated through the Ejis shirts. At first I was a little unsure of the modal fabric, but I've grown to appreciate its cool silky feel and stretchy fit. These shirts are fairly expensive, but it's a small price to pay to never have to worry about underarm wetness and stains again. Plus, it's probably saved me money as I don't have to replace my shirts as often, and I get to wear my favorite shirts more frequently without worrying about ruining them. I'm really happy this product exists, and I hope it works as well for other excessive sweaters as it has for me. The shirts have really improved my life.

reviews.title: BEST PURCHAS OF MY LIFE!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2019
reviews.text: This product is simply amazing! Sweating through my shirts has always been a problem but when I started giving presentations at work it really got in the way. Not only does this shirt solve the problem of looking ridicules when you're covered in sweat in the middle of December, it also saves a a lot of money by making your dress shirts last a lot longer. I had tried other brands that make similar products but was never happy with how bulky they looked. The Ejis shirt fits like a compression shirt and is so stretchy that it wont effect mobility. The underarm pads took a minute to get use to but I very quickly forgot they were even there. If the price is an issue I would remind you to consider how many nice shirts you have thrown away because of armpit stains! This product eliminates that problem completely. I would strongly recommend buying at least two because they do need to be washed often.
