I also love how deep the v is, so I can unbutton the top two and it still won‚Äôt show.... I also sweat during important meetings $, and could tell I was sweating and not one spot.... I‚Äôm getting a couple more. They are REALLY comfortable and breath too/not too hot. Now I can wear light blue button ups without the blazer and fee confident I won‚Äôt have wet marks under pits.. and won‚Äôt ruin white shirts Wity yellow stains :)

reviews.title: Years of only wearing dark colours wasted
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 6, 2020
reviews.text: I wish I had found these years ago. Years of only wearing dark colours wasted. No sweat patches in baby blue shirts, no sweat patches in interviews, no sweat patches on dates. I can wear any colour of shirt without having that anxiety of sweating through it. The boost in confidence is worth the cost. And honestly it's not much more than what you'd spend on a regular t shirt or shirt. Plus it will protect your expensive shirts, making them last longer. Do buy a size down as other people have said. If you want to wear short sleeve shirts, it's harder to hide but doable with relaxed sleeves. The seems of the absorbent material can be seen when you stretch and your shirt goes tight but it's not a big deal for me. A little less underarm material and it would get 5 stars.

No wet feeling, no stains on clothes, no embarrassment. Finally, I wear all my shirts and I just feel fine. Even my suit jacket was stained before this. Now nothing and no cold or wet feeling. RECOMMENDED.

reviews.title: I ordered them too big per reviews that they ran small.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 27, 2014
reviews.text: I read through all of the reviews before purchasing these tap shoes. Many people noted that the shoes ran very small and to go up 1 to 2 sizes. People even noted that going up 1.5 sizes were a perfect fit, with no room to grow. I printed off a shoe size measuring foot from Amazon and measured my 3 year old daughter and then went up 2 sizes since my daughter actually will not be taking a tap class until summer, but she wanted a pair of tap shoes to practice/play in now. She was an 8.5 per my measurement. I ordered a 10.5 medium. These are waaay too big for her. You can see the cracks of her toes and her toes almost look like they are going to come out the top of the shoe. I worry about her twisting her ankle in the shoes since they are too big and tap shoes can be slippery, especially on our ceramic tile floor. It is also very difficult for her to tap in them because she cannot bend her foot since they are so large. She wants to wear them, so I really have to tighten the Velcro strap down. She will grow into them eventually, but I am going to purchase another pair 1 size smaller (which is 1 size up from her measured foot size), which I anticipate will still be a little big according to how big this pair is, but with some room to grow. She is petite and does not have "thick" feet, so I went with the medium and they seem fine width wise. I normally do not like to buy shoes online because it is so hard to get the fit right the first time. I did order these online for a couple of reasons: 1. They were so much cheaper than ordering directly from Capezio ($42) 2. Our closest dance store is approx. 30 minutes away and they tried to tell me that this shoe is not made in black patent leather, despite me telling them that they are and that I had seen them on both Amazon and the Capezio website. They told me that they had the tan and they were the same price as the Capezio website. I considered going over there just to try the tan on for sizing, but who knows if they would have had medium and wide width and several sizes in stock. I would definitely purchase these shoes again. I love the Velcro strap as my daughter can easily put them on herself. If you have a dance store near to your home, I would take a trip over and try them on for size since it seems like the reviews are all over the board, unless you don't mind making returns. In our case, I could have purchased her current shoe size and they would have probably been a perfect fit, but with little growing room. I would recommend going up 1 size per our experience.

title: Birkenstock Women's, Zermatt Slipper

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Washed in my machine; cold, delicate, lingerie bags
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 9, 2021
reviews.text: I wish I would have taken a before ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è (I will next time). I know it says to ‚Äúspot clean‚Äù, but I‚Äôve always washed ALL my shoes/slippers in the washer (if they fall apart, I just don‚Äôt buy them again~ so user beware üòè). I put the main slipper parts (felt/rubbery bottom part) in my large lingerie bag and the insoles (the fleece/cork-rubbery sole) in my small lingerie bag (both zip completely and kind of lock- although my insoles were out of the bag at the end- no damage though)- washed on delicate/light load, cold. They look brand new! (I‚Äôm really hard on shoes and I don‚Äôt wear socks with these typically because they are so warm üòä‚ô•Ô∏è). No damage to the slippers- but it does recommend to spot clean- NOT IN THE WASHER! Like I said, I always do on delicate and in cold water- AT MY OWN RISK. Just putting this out there for anyone else contemplating washing. I bought my lingerie bags on Amazon awhile ago- but I use them for a LOT of things. After I‚Äôve worn headbands and/ or my ponytail holders a few times, I have a smallish lingerie bag in my bathroom and throw them in it- once I see my ponytail holders and/or headbands- cloth- are getting low, I throw them in the wash to get any oils from my hair off- good as new! Just an FYI for anyone that tends to throw the hair ties out after a few uses or never thought of washing them‚Ä¶ I was tired of buying them all the time, not expensive, but it adds up‚Ä¶ As far as the slippers go, I washed mine like I said above- it‚Äôs a buyer-beware kind of thing though, because it does say NOT to put them in the wash. Mine look brand new! I wouldn‚Äôt wash them without lingerie bags though as it keeps everything together and not jumbling around the washer, banging against the sides without a little protection. I AM IN LOVE WITH THESE HOUSE SLIPPERSüòä‚ô•Ô∏èüòä I‚Äôm probably going to order one, maybe two, more pairs because I know in a couple of years when I‚Äôll need a new pair they won‚Äôt be available ‚ô•Ô∏è

reviews.text: My feet are the happiest they've ever been at home with these amazing Birkenstock women's slippers!! I have plantar fasciitis and achilles tendonitis and was advised I could no longer walk barefoot, even at home. Boo hoo!! So imagine my utter delight when first stepping in to these very comfortable "furry" slippers! It's like walking on a cloud with arch support. I should probably get 5 more pairs in different colors but I'll stick with the one pair I have for now. If you need good arch support, these Birkenstock women's slippers are for you. There are also many colors from which to choose.

reviews.title: LIfe is too short to wear bad shoes. Get these.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 29, 2021
reviews.text: These slippers fit and feel exactly like every other 'real' Birkenstock since 1774. The Italian made wool may feel a bit scratchy or tight on the first wear however, it adjusts and conforms to the foot quickly. Wearing a thin sock can help cut that adjustment period. Being wool, it's water-repellant/water-proof (which also applies to coffee/tea for the half-awake in the kitchen type people who tend to spill their morning cup). The inner sole lining is REAL fur (from New Zealand) , not synthetic. It feels wonderful and nicely fills in any gaps not supported by the Birkie footbed - assuming that the wearer puts it on properly. It is not overly warm ( a plus for those with sweaty feet) yet does a great job at keeping cold feet comfortable. The latex sole is very supportive and flexible. It does not slip on smooth floors and is Lego-proof. The cork footbed provides solid support, not the pillow-like squish that goes flat in a couple of days. Yes, they can be worn outside (but shopping or long walks should be done in street shoes, not slippers). Another big plus is that they are not overly large, cushy, or otherwise oddly shaped so as to look like marshmallows on the feet, don't make walking difficult, don't prevent 'tucking a leg', don't get stuck under cabinets/furniture. Well cared for, like all other Birkie's, there's no reason to think these slippers will not last for many years. Pros: Everything above. Con: Red was Out of Stock in my size.

reviews.title: My perfect slipper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 10, 2021
reviews.text: I always wore soft-soled boiled wool slippers but developed arthritis in my feet which meant I needed more support. Since I work from home, I wear slippers A LOT so it's important to me that they meet my needs. I've tried other supportive slippers but they're so heavy and clunky that it just feels like wearing shoes. I've also gotten ones out of manmade fabrics that my feet sweat in (sorry for putting that picture in your head!). These ones are wool so they keep my feet at a comfortable temperature. They provide the support of Birkies with a much thinner and lighter sole. You could wear them outside but my guess is they wouldn't last long because of the thinner sole. These are really house slippers. If I had one suggestion, it would be to add a little more cushioning to the insole but really they're very comfortable and work well for me.

reviews.text: As a 6‚Äô tall female, I wear men‚Äôs socks. They do not fit in the tiny compartments in the square box. Tiny, thin socks might fit. ALSO, THEY NEVER MENTION THE HIDDEN ZIPPER (!) on the bottom of the organizer. This helps stabilize it.

reviews.title: Wish these were sold separately
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020
reviews.text: These bins are great for organizing clothes on closet shelves or in drawers. The fabric cells have enough give to them that you can get away with overstuffing some cells and understuffing others. My only complaint is that I can't buy the individual modules separately. For example, I want more of the 8- and 6-cell bins (they're great for storing T-shirts), but I don't need more of the 3-cell bins (I keep my bras on hangers and nothing else fits well in these). I ordered two sets. Here's how I ended up using them: 24-cell bins: I use these for underwear (1-2 pairs per cell) and socks (1-2 pairs per cell). 8-cell bins: I use these for T-shirts (fold and roll into a short tube, stick into the cell). 6-cell bins: I use these for storing T-shirts (fold into small rectangle) or shorts (fold once and stick inside). 3-cell bins: I don't have a good use for these. Right now one is empty and the other has some pajamas in it. The cells are just too big and floppy to be useful for much.

reviews.text: I bought these to help organize the extraordinary amount of baby clothes/items that my baby has been gifted, and the sizes work perfectly for various items. The smallest squares fit 2 onesies per square when rolled up. The larger squares fit 2 pairs of pants per square when rolled up. I use the larger rectangular bin for holding diapers (both disposable and prefolds fit like a champ when stood vertically - I fold the prefolds in half to get them to stand), and the smaller rectangles are perfect for little items like socks and mittens. It's simple to find what I'm looking for and the tiny clothes don't end up lost in a giant pile in the drawer! The quality is quite good for the price and I like that the inner pieces of fabric are flexible as this allows me to better fit the items.

The new pair are not the same size, the materials are cheap, and I don't think they're going to last more than a year or two. I recently bought a much cheaper pair of sandals on Amazon for under $20 and they are made of much higher quality materials than these. I tend to reach for those much more often than these junkie tevas. I also wear my beat up old ones because they just feel great. reviews.title: Great product
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021
reviews.text: The product works as it should. My son has Autism. He has always struggled with buttons, clasps, ties and buckles. He is 14 and will still avoid doing all of these if possible. He is so thin yet tall that most of his pants are too loose at the waste but we won‚Äôt wear a belt as it is too much to deal with every time he has to go to bathroom. If I put this on his pants at night, he puts his pants on like normal during day and only has his pant button to contend with. It works! I‚Äôve read other reviews and I think people confuse how it is intended to work. You don‚Äôt snap each end to each other in front. You thread through the loops and on the last loop you fold the end back over the loop and snap it to the snap next to it. The front part of your pant area, the button and zipper area should be clear and open, no belt covering it. It‚Äôs genius in it‚Äôs simplicity.

reviews.title: Great for slim feet. So good for knees!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 22, 2020
reviews.text: I did loads of research on the type of running shoe I needed to protect my knees and for high arches. I'm a size 7 but my feet are quite wide so the 7 was a bit tight, and not to be goldilocks about it but the 7.5 are a bit too long. So these are a bit narrow in style, but they do the job. Saying that, they are great on my knees and arches. I've been on plenty of road and trail runs and so far they do stand up to great value for money and really comfortable. They're not the best looking kids on the block but keep running and no-one will notice!! If they made a wider model I'd be sold on a running shoe for life.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 14, 2020
reviews.text: While this is really cute, the fabric is as pictured, and an overall good value, it has a slight issue with the cut. The neck is a little large, and the sleeves are these slots that you put your arm through, only they have these open slits from elbow to wrist, which makes it sort of ... weird. The sleeves are not true sleeves, but rather sewn to the body of the garment. They look ok, but the design is a bit strange. This works well as a casual cover up, or even for an overlay for work if you have the right kind of shirt underneath (camisoles look weird as the fabric is thin, but a short sleeved t-shirt looks ok). If the neck was cut better and the sleeves more like a true sleeve, it would easily be a 5 star item. Overall minus 1 star for sleeve issue.

reviews.title: 36DD: Large is tight! (Lots of pics)
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 30, 2017
reviews.text: It's a good piece for a type of shirt that I desperately need more of: something that can work for the office and around town. Something that can be by itself in summer or with a cardigan in winter. This is definitely that. Only complaint is the chest. I'm 6' 2", 205 lb, size 12-14 in tops. 36DD. I finally stopped ordering XL's when I was tired of my body being lost in all my clothes. I got this in a large and I had to wear my small-boobs bra to get it to fit. There is no stretch at all, but thankfully there's a button in the back because I did my make-up before I put the shirt on and it almost got gnarly. I don't love my arms, especially in some short-sleeved shirts. But I would probably wear this without a cardigan. For a shirt that's not supposed to be fitted, it flows pretty well with my movements. It hints at the fact that I might have curves, which I like. If you're even slightly more in-between sizes, you may need to order up or pass on this one. And if you're a 36DD or higher, you may need an XL.

reviews.title: The most comfortable shoes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2022
reviews.text: I have really wide feet and ordered the wide version of these thinking based on the reviews of Puma shoes, they may not even be wide enough for me. First time I put them on they were a little snug. I played a round with them and have to say, they stretch and adjust to your feet, are fully supported inside and are now one of my favs. They are like a golf glove for your feet! So comfortable and make every round I play in them that much more enjoyable. One recommendation... don't lace them tight... buy the right size and the laces won't have to do much as they fit on your foot like a sock. Try them and I have no doubt, you will be as big a fan as I am...Like walking on a supportive cloud... Thanks Puma... I am difficult to win over as a fan for golf shoes... but these are winners!

reviews.title: Sleek design and very comfortable.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2022
reviews.text: I really like the shoes, they have a very sleek and cool design. I've played twice on courses that are very soggy and muddy, but my feet managed to stay dry at the end of my rounds. In addition, they are very comfortable.

reviews.title: Surprising Performer - UPDATED AFTER 2 1/2 MONTHS
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2021
reviews.text: UPDATE: Unfortunately (and despite my early experience of staying dry), The last few rounds I played the mesh was no longer water proof and my socks were very wet about 3 holes into the round (especially in the toe area). This was not golf in the rain, the course was just wet from the night before. Too bad... I still wear these shoes around town as they are comfortable and I like the way they look. Other than the dryness issue, I like they way they perform on the course too. Oh well... you get what you pay for. -1 star from original of 4 stars. ORINGINAL REVIEW: I was going to wait a little while to review these shoes because of the previous questionable reviews. However, yesterday sealed the deal for me! Granted I only have about 10 rounds of golf on these so longevity is YTBD, but yesterday I played in the rain and mud with these shoes after a day when my area received 3.5" of rain the day before. The course was Muddy and WET and I was concerned that these shoes, being less expensive then some of the best reviewed, might not hold up. Not only were my socks and feet bone dry at the end of the round but my feet felt great! They shed water like a champ and even though they are spikeless, I felt no slippage on any shot (tee box or fairway). From other reviews, it looks like there is a tendency for the laces to rip through the leather eyelets. I have been weary of that so the first few rounds I was "careful" not to pull too hard but the last few rounds I've been testing them a little more for durability. So far, no problem. Anyway, I try to leave reviews that help other consumers so here are the pros and cons readers digest version. This is one mans opinion, YMMV. The golfer leaving the review: *Male - 6'2" - 185lbs - size 12 medium *Mid 50's *Golf 3-5 times a week (12 Handicap) * Has owned numerous golf shoes from FootJoy and other well known brands. Pros *Comfortable (like, super-wear-all-day-type-comfortable) *Good looking if you like the sneaker vibe *so far, appear to do well in wet weather (UPDATE: 2 months in they are leaking!) *nice and cool on hot days *flexible upper mesh (see cons for same feature) *spikeless sole has provided good stability *fits this golfer's narrow foot but feels like it could be comfortable for wider fits. Cons *Still concerned about eyelets ripping (will report here if so) *May not provide great side to side stability for some golfers (Mesh upper not the same as shoes with leather upper) *Spikeless sole not an aggressive tread - aggressive golfers with faster swing speeds than I, may have issues. For $90.00 (and if the eyelets don't break) this is a great value in a golf shoe. Took off one star only for the stability factor.

reviews.title: Perfect shoe IF you avoid the fatal flaw
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021
reviews.text: I‚Äôm on my third pair in a month and have FINALLY learned my lesson. Yes, there is a horrible design flaw with the eyelets for the laces. Thin rubber doesn‚Äôt hold up when pulling the laces tight and so many reviews including this one show the fatal flaw. BUT, it can be avoided! I didn‚Äôt want to give up since this shoe was more comfortable than the previous six I tried on. So, for my third pair, after ‚Äúthe rip‚Äù occurred twice, I decided to poke holes through the eyelets and through the shoe material to match the top eyelet which was designed this way. The problem was solved and takes less than 10 minutes. I used a very small Phillips head screwdriver to poke the holes all the way through the shoe material, and re-laced the shoe. Now I get to enjoy the comfort of this shoe without having to worry about ripping the rubber for a third time. Don‚Äôt give up on this shoe!

reviews.title: the lace loop broke on the second wear
reviews.date: Reviewed in Australia on May 15, 2022
reviews.text: These are possibly the best golf shoes ive ever worn, amazing fit, great support and no waterproof issues. However on the second time I put them on the rubber/plastic lace hole completely ripped through as I was lacing them up. Fair to say I dont lace my shoes up hard so i was really dissappointed as i thought i'd found the shoes I'd wear forever (was looking to buy a second pair last night). I'd be really appreciative if the seller or Amazon would help me out here as I presume this is a manufacturing issue. --Adding an edit While it was disappointing that the construction of the shoes relied upon the plastic eyelit for the shoelace a very simple fix was achieved by putting a hole in the material below it. As a regular user of Amazon they were highly supportive and helped me. Once again - these shoes are absolutely fantastic, I have long narrow feet and the reduction in pain even playing 2 rounds in a day were noticeable. I hope that my experience isnt shared. Kind regards

reviews.title: LOVE this adorable skirt!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
reviews.text: Oh my gosh, this skirt is ADORABLE, so comfortable, twirly, and much nicer quality than I was expecting! It is so cute and fun to wear - I felt like a little kid in a twirly tutu all day and wanted to dance around and spin in circles! I love the mid-calf length (I‚Äôm 5‚Äô4‚Äù, around 110 pounds, and ordered a small) and it could be shorter or longer by placing the extra-comfy elastic waistband higher or lower or even cutting the outside layer of tulle the same length as the skirt liner (which is maybe 2‚Äù shorter than the tulle). I wore this down low on my waist for a formal choral concert to have the longer length, but it was comfortable no matter where I put the waistband. I love that the waistband is wider and lays flat and smooth the whole time I was wearing the skirt. The only downside was it was a bit hard to get the wrinkles out of the skirt liner from shipping (warm iron - not hot or it could melt - and WET it with water before trying to iron! I bet a steamer would have worked perfectly if I had planned ahead!) and it was a bit staticky from the plastic shipping bag, but spraying it with Static Guard took care of it and the static never returned (worn twice so far). I really love this skirt and will get a lot of wear out of it, despite only ordering it with the plan to wear for one choir concert and not care if it fell apart. I‚Äôll hand-wash it to make it last because now I love it! I had so many compliments on this skirt! Nobody could believe how inexpensive it was or that I got it from Amazon! I sent all the old church ladies into a tizzy when I divulged the cost and ‚Äúboutique‚Äù from which it came! üòÅ

reviews.title: You can customize it!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
reviews.text: I've bought this skirt in multiple colors to wear with a nude sparkly top on different occasions. It is always perfect and comfortable. I get tons of compliments. I want you to know that you can totally customize this skirt. If you like a lot of poof then wear it as it comes. To take the poof down a notch cut out one layer of tulle. To almost totally de-poof you can cut/remove both middle layers of tulle. Its really easy to do this (just lift up the outer layer and cut away, no sewing experience needed). You can use this for Halloween, informal days, formal events, whatever. I have a big tummy and a decent sized tush, but I wear this skirt in a size small. Don't ask me how, I have no idea because I always wear an L or XL in most clothes. I suppose that waist is so stretchy it just doesn't matter. Don't hesitate on this skirt. It's a great value and the quality is admirable at the price. The packaging is decent as well as the skirt doesn't come totally wrinkled. Just use a steamer if you have one to release the few wrinkles or mist it with water and put it in the dryer it with a towel on a very very low setting. Enjoy your special look, I know you'll look darling!

title: Vanity Fair Women's Illumination String Bikini Panties, Silky Stretch & Satin Trim
description: From the manufacturer Read more Read more Illumination Bikini Bikinis are low-rise and sit on the hips, with thin sides and a higher cut leg. They help cover up while maintaining a modern style. Bikinis are super versatile and flatter all body types, making them a good option for most easy, breezy outfits. Illumination Hi Cut Hi-Cut panties are a mix between Bikinis and Briefs, providing more coverage than a Bikini at the tummy and back but not quite as much as a Brief. Hi-Cut panties also sit higher up on the thigh which makes your legs look longer. Hi-Cut panties are a perfect partner for high-waisted pants and skirts. Illumination Brief Briefs offer the most all-around coverage. Designed for comfort and fit above all else, they usually sit higher on the waist. They have a simple silhouette and typically come in soft fabrics like cotton, nylon, or microfiber. Briefs are a great no-show option to wear under clothing that skims and glides, like dresses and skirts. Illumination Hipster Hipsters are most like a Bikini, but they offer slightly more coverage with wider sides and lower cut legs. Hipsters also tend to have a low rise, sitting just below the waist which makes them a great option for low-rise jeans and pants. Read more

reviews.title: Well-constructed and soft, but run short
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 4, 2022
reviews.text: Purchased grey and blue pants in size small. I'm 5' 1" and weigh 137 pounds currently. Love, love the pants as they are well constructed, with good material and even stitching, and as they are soft inside, warm, but not hot, feel very comfortable, and look cute. They fit me well everywhere except for the length, which just barely hits just at or a tiny bit above my ankles when I am standing barefooted. I'll probably just wear them inside the house. These pants need to be 1" longer so that they would be a better fit even for the petite persons who would order them. I would rate these pants with 10 stars if their length was more appropriate. 12/23/22 update: Forget the 10 stars. I still like the comfort & warmth, but theses joggers "grow" on you. Good is that after having been worn twice they dropped a little and are now the perfect length for me. Not so good is that the joggers stretch with movements, and with no recovery to the material, become out of shape and remain loose. You'd need to be wearing a new pair if traveling or going somewhere special, as their well-fitted look morphs into a comfy but sloppy type of "wear at home" look. These joggers still earn my 4-star rating for home use due to their comfort & warmth. I have a 2nd pair which I am saving for Christmas day as temps will be below freezing. Hopefully they will look good for the length of the family get-together. I'd planned to purchase a 3rd pair, but instead might just wear leggings reversed (to prevent rubbing damage) under a pair of jeans for warmth when leaving the house on those exceptionally cold days.

reviews.title: Huge! Ginormous! Definitely Supersized!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 6, 2022
reviews.text: I bought two pairs of basic black sweats for hanging around the house this winter. I love the quality and price of these Amazon Essential sweats. They're definitely well-constructed, and they arrive quickly. . I've got a large hiney and am always aware of that when I buy pants - so I ordered a size 5x hoping they'd be roomy enough for casual lounging. I took them from their clear plastic packaging bags when they arrived and held one up. It seemed very large and, honestly, I thought that if *this* fit my butt, I'd better do more walking. . Trying one on I realized that it was, indeed, enormous. Almost comically so. (First time in a long while I put a pair of pants on and didn't have to wonder if they'd still be comfy in four hours.) I kept them on for a while, pulling the drawstrings tight while recognizing that the fabric - front and back - was all bunched up. I really wanted them to work. . But they did not. They were quite simply far too large to keep. Reopening Amazon I began the return process, and when asked if I wanted to replace these two, I chose 'yes' and clicked on size 3x sweatpants. Sadly, there are no size 3x sweats left. At least not in black. Oh, I could get burgundy, charcoal heather, or navy heather - but I want black. So we'll see, I guess. The takeaway: THESE ARE HUGE! Buy accordingly.

reviews.title: Does the job, but certainly not flattering!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 16, 2022
reviews.text: I will start by saying I will definitely buy these again. That‚Äôs not the issue. They are comfortable and warm. I could do without the drawstring. I am 5‚Äô1‚Äù and bought 1x. when I sit down, they almost come to the top of my socks so for a taller person this could be a problem. Because of the ribbing around the ankle and the tapering on the leg, possibly they were going for a boot cut? - Makes them very unflattering but I bought mine for gardening, so I‚Äôm fine with that. I will say it fit exactly to size, but I tend to like things a little sloppier when I‚Äôm just gonna wear them only at home or outside, so I might go a size up next time. Good quality well-made especially for the price, would buy them again, but not flattering for those who care. Perhaps on a taller thinner person, it would look different. But I like them!

reviews.title: Warm, soft and cozy, but very weird looking on.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 17, 2022
reviews.text: I'm 5'2 and wear a 20. I got these in 2xl. I'm fairly happy with my purchase, but they look weird on. It feels like there's a lot of extra fabric in the crotch/front of the thigh area, and some of the seams are oddly bulgy in places. The ankle cuffs hit me at a good place, but I'm also very short! If you were much taller it may be an issue. That said, they are VERY soft and VERY warm! They're comfortable to wear, and the waist fits nicely and sits at a good place. The fabric seems thick and substantial. I bought these to wear at home, and they work well for that. If you're prioritizing comfort over looks, these are good pants for you :P

reviews.title: Great quality but runs big
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 11, 2022
reviews.text: The quality on these are great and the pockets are nice but they definitely run on the larger side. For comparison I‚Äôm 5‚Äô5 and weigh around 155lbs and carry most of my weight in my mid section. I ordered size large. The length is okay, slightly on the longer side, but the main issue with sizing is in the waist. There‚Äôs a lot of extra fabric in the front and extra space in the waist even with the drawstring pulled tight. I‚Äôm not sure if they will shrink a bit in the wash. I purchased three pair and ended up returning two. I‚Äôll update if the pair I kept show any shrinkage after being washed and dried. Overall I recommend the product, just be mindful of the sizing.

reviews.title: Love, love these pants!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 11, 2022
reviews.text: I walk about 2 miles every a.m. and for many years now during the cold weather I have been wearing a pair of my son's sweatpants that he wore in middle school (he's now 50!) I decided it was time to buy a new pair and I'm so glad I ordered these. I couldn't decide if I should buy small or medium but finally opted for small and they fit perfectly. I am 5'0" and weight 133. They are very soft and comfortable and fit just right in the stride and sit at my waist. They are the perfect length for me and hit right at my ankle. I was really surprised at the quality and the feel of the fabric. They are not only good for walking/exercising but I will definitely be wearing these to run errands, visit friends, etc. I just hope they will last as long as the ones I've been wearing and that were worn by my son before me! I highly recommend these for the quality, the comfort, and the price.

reviews.title: Love these so much I‚Äôve just bought 4 more pairs but went down one size.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on November 28, 2022
reviews.text: Best purchase of 2022!! Do perhaps measure before buying. More detail about that in my review. I love these! I was frustrated with paying a fortune for ‚Äúwarm‚Äù PJ bottoms so decided I‚Äôd try these as an alternative. Winner! They are comfortable for bed, around the house, going to the gym, whatever! They are the ONLY bottoms that keep my legs warm in bed at night when no heating is on. More than a pair of leggings with PJ pants then on top! I am a size 18 in jeans/pants. I am 81kg (178 lbs) and 166cm (about 5‚Äù4). I don‚Äôt have very large thighs, bum or calves but do have a tummy on me. I got the XL and they are very loose on me around the waist even when I pull the drawstring tight. They are loose enough on my legs to be comfy but again a bit baggy on me. If you have quite large thighs and calves the XL would possibly be just right for you those areas. These are VERY roomy. But as you can try before you buy see what‚Äôs good for you. Being a bit tighter may suit you fine. They are very warm with the lovely fleece lining and did I say really comfortable? The fabric is really nice. I got the grey ones and I‚Äôve now just paid for them after trying out (love that option Amazon!). I‚Äôve now ordered 4 more pairs in different colours but I‚Äôve ordered the Large not the XL this time which I think will fit me better (I‚Äôll review those and let you know). I‚Äôve given my two XL pairs to my son (as look unisex) and he‚Äôs got really chunky legs, bum and a tummy and they fit him great with a close fit. He loves them (he is 100kg). Being on a budget some colours are cheaper than others so check that out if saving money too! These will do me great through winter as PJ bottoms and loungewear. A double win. Very impressed and better than a lot of Pajama bottoms which are extremely overpriced just now. 100% recommend these! Work great with a fleece lined top or hoodie. Just measure yourself if possible against the sizing as everybody is shaped differently.

This shirt is as good or better than some of the brand name ones out there, all for a lower price. Update 7/3/2021: I've have now bought about six of these shirts. I've worn them and washed them extensively. Still fits the same and looks the same awesome hoodies. I correct what I said before. They are BETTER than the name brand ones I've tried! Perfect fit (at least for my body type--I'm 5'7" and weigh 143 lbs). Material is not to thin or too thick. They are not too long so you don't look ridiculous wearing them untucked (most people don't wear their hoodies tucked into their pants). Going to buy some more since I basically live in these hoodies.

reviews.title: Read my review before you buy...
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on July 14, 2021
reviews.text: I was buying some sleeveless shirts for the summer and I saw this one on the list. I read the reviews and decide to give size large a try. I'm 6'5" and a slim 205 lbs. Here is my feedback on this product: Pros: - Quick delivery - Soft fabric - I like the hoodie aspect to this shirt - Washed and dried fine without shrinking (keep in mind I hung dry it but washed in warm). - Price is great Cons: - It's really "bunched" in the front neck part. They over lapped some of the fabric and it's not very practical looking for a sleeveless shirt... sweater yes... sleeveless shirt, no. - It has a pretty strong chemical smell right out of the packet. - There has been several loose threads - Arm holes are smaller than I'd like for a large. - The overall fit is "meh" Final Thoughts: Even though I like the feel of the fabric, I feel like this shirt is going to fall apart after 5 or 6 wears. I also wouldn't wear this in public to be honest simply because the neck/collar of the shirt is folded over itself to accommodate the hood. It doesn't look good. Would I buy again? No. It's worth it to pay a bit more for a better quality sleeveless shirt. I hope you found my feedback helpful. Thanks

reviews.title: Love this comfy hoodie!
reviews.date: Reviewed in Germany on May 11, 2021
reviews.text: Wanted to buy a sleeveless shirt to wear around and outside the house when it's hot. I came across this hoodie and saw all the recommendations so I had to order one (or four). The stretchy tech material is really comfortable and makes the hoodie look great. As for sizing... I'd say it's true to size. I usually wear L or 52/54 EU in sports clothing (height 185cm / chest 41.5 inches / build athetic to normal) and the hoodie fits me great (not skin-tight but not loose either). It is a bit long and it's a bit tight on the chest (not as tight as muscle fit clothes but tighter than normal fit) but for me that's a plus. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Comfortable, Stylish, Below average durability
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2021
reviews.text: My very active 8 year old daughter has gone through at least 5 pairs of women's tennis shoes in the last year, and 3 of them were different sizes of these ASICS (women's sizes 5.5, 6.5. and 7 respectively). The shoes run true-to-size. She says these are her favorite tennis shoes for both comfort and style. They don't last quite as long as the other pairs she's owned in the last year. Her most recent pair was delivered on March 8, 2021 and had a hole in them by April 6, 2021. I'm hoping she can get another few weeks out of them before they completely fall apart.

reviews.title: Beware - YOU WILL BE CHARGED TO RETURN THESE IF THEY DONT FIT!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2020
reviews.text: This shoe is real cute and fits true to size lengthwise and width wise . . . but it squeezed my foot across the top no matter how much I loosened the laces so had to send back. Very nice rose color but could not wait to get them off. I was then very surprised to see that there was no free return shipping! I lost $6 by trying these shoes . . . I am packaging up and taking to a UPS dropoff, thought I would get all of my money back. I usually don't get charged return shipping when I shop on Amazon.

reviews.title: And the winner is... Great shoes for walking, proper fit.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
reviews.text: I ordered several pairs of shoes and tried each on a walk, This shoe and a pair of New Balance were the contenders after Saucony and Nike, I decided to go with Asics because of several reasons. 1 confort-your foot stays securely in place, other shoes you feel a shift. 2 they were lighter, the NB were a bit clunky. Kind of like high heeled sneakers. 3 there was a god bit of price difference, I could not justify the extra $80. 4 while other shoes would allow my heels to hit harder on the pavement. This shoe cushioned my walk, maybe it's the gel. they put a little spring in my walk!

reviews.title: Hope against hope
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2020
reviews.text: When I read the reviews about the Gel Cumulus 21 I hoped against hope that I wouldn't be among those who were sorely disappointed. However, as soon as I stepped into these shoes I knew that I wouldn't be able to wear them. The design has been changed significantly - flyte foam has replaced the gel at the toe end, and the bottom of the shoe is flat. In itself those may not be deficiencies and perhaps there are some folks out there who prefer the new style. Not me. They were way to tight and constraining - my toe rubbed against the front of the shoe and although they were light my feet hurt just wearing them around the house. I have been running in Gel Cumulus shoes for many years - at least a decade - and I've always been able to make an easy transition from one model to the next .On the plus side - they are extremely attractive shoes - and they appear to be solidly made. But I ended up returning them, now looking for a different neutral shoe.

reviews.title: Wonderful shoes for people with tall arches
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2020
reviews.text: I tend to get a lot of discomfort from shoes that are too tight around the top of my foot. The wide option in these shoes makes that not an issue. I have worked 14 hour shifts on concrete in these shoes and thanked my lucky stars for wearing the right pair. No rubbing issues. Plenty of cushion. They are super cute. Comfortable for running in, and have helped with hip, ankle and knee pain from the wrong alignment. It will depend on the shape of your foot, but if you have taller arches, these are definitely worth considering. I usually wear a 7.5 without socks/8 with socks. The 7.5 in these are a perfect fit for me WITH sock on, so they run slightly bigger than expected.

reviews.title: THEY ARE REAL
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
reviews.text: I've seen several comments on here claiming that these are fake so when mine arrived I inspected them up and down and all around and they appear to be real - I've ran in them twice now and no problems - just like the ones that I replaced. I've read that people are complaining that their feet are sore after going for walks in them, standing at work in them - well that I believe - these are running shoes, not walking/standing shoes and there's a huge difference - totally different heel strike, totally different weight transfer, totally different support. So to sum up my review: they are real they are great running shoes

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2021
reviews.text: Long time ASICS purchaser. They fit my feet like a glove. I have a high arch and wide feet, but I don‚Äôt use a wide. I took off the shoelaces and low and behold, the tongue was attached and not loose like typical sneakers. So I tried them without the shoe laces and LOVE THEM!! They feel like a slip on sketcher. All you Sketcher lovers, consider trying this model of sketcher or check out the description and see if mentions a tongue type.

reviews.title: Great cushioning, very comfortable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
reviews.text: These are different to all the ASICS running shoes I‚Äôve owned before - but in a good way! The proportions make your feet look small and cute, they have really nice cushioning and are super comfortable for me. I like the laces, not over engineered but like a ‚Äònormal‚Äô oldschool lace that doesn‚Äôt undo itself all the time. The heel is nicely supported and locked into place, but soft enough to feel comfortable. I run on roads regularly and am looking forward to having more cushioning with these as opposed to the ASICS I had before. I tried the nimbus 21 simultaneously, and the cumulus was my winner. These felt like they just want to go running. Choose at least a half size larger with ASICS running shoes compared to your normal size.

reviews.title: Really comfy and helped my painful achilles
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 12, 2020
reviews.text: Out of the many Asics available I chose these having read two reviews saying how they help Achilles sufferers. I can confirm they do help. Prior to these I was coming home and suffering with Achilles pain, not so now. There is firm but substantial, comfortable padding around the ankle and it is really light on the foot. My foot used to roll slightly with less supportive shoes but these support all round and give a spring to my step. My only criticism is that the laces could be a little longer, but they do come with a spare set. Size wise I am usually a 4.5/5 but always know to buy a 5.5 in ASICS and it‚Äôs a comfy fit

reviews.title: Holy Misery - Death Shapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 19, 2021
reviews.text: Dear lord have mercy these are not for short folk. I thought surely my ribs would crack or I'd pass out from oxygen deprivation. Now before you say I must have purchased the wrong size, I purchased one of these in my size, another one size up because I don't trust anything I can't try on and my success at online shopping has been very hit or miss. The result was the same in either pair, so this is not about sizing. The first thing to know I am 5'4 and purchased these for a little shaping in the hips and stomach. I did not know I was also purchasing a torture device! As I rolled that first pair up over my thighs I thought, hmm firm, and up over the belly, really firm. I kept rolling, and rolling, and rolling. Where do these things end! Now I'm getting real close to some delicates that sit well enough above my stomach that they should not be impacted, special things I don't want flattened out. Wrong! So now I have two options I can cover my upper delicates and flatten those out too, hello 5'4 extra thick board! Or I can stop unrolling these things, fold them down a bit, because an extra bulky ridge anywhere is exactly what I was looking for......I chose to fold them down a bit because flat wide board wasn't the look I was going for. Let me tell you, I chose wrong. The fabric these are made from is strong and the waistband on these are very, very strong. Now that's three very strongs right there all rolled into one, directly under my ta-ta's, coiled around my body like a starved boa constrictor that just wanted me to die! Added to that, there's still all that really strong fabric I assume was intended to cover the stomach of a giantess crushing my ribcage.....I...could...not...breathe....world...spinning....lights dimming.....HEEEELP! Now before you say you should never fold them down; you are right and I know this. But these things are never ending. It's not trying to squeeze yourself into a pair of hosiery that's just too small, where you pull and stretch and suck it in the make them stretch up to your waist. Nooo, no no no, these things are not those things, these things are just designed for someone at least 7 ft tall with a stomach waist area the length of my entire upper body. Trust me I considered user error, rolled them off and back on again and just stopped that waistband right at my waist which was about as effective as well I don't even know because it was not effective at all, but it was bulky. Moving along to the next pair, I have no idea what I was thinking, because this pair was no better. I did everything in my power to not pull or stretch them in any way. Just thrust one chubby thigh in after the other and then pretended I was a weeble wobble. A little shake and shimmy, A wiggle, a weeble and a wobble and I'm in! I gently eased that fabric covered super strength boa constrictor waist into place just above my natural waist and definitely below my ladies on high. Now I'm still breathing but they felt very heavy in the stomach area, almost as if there was just too much fabric piled on my stomach and I could have pulled them much, much further up. I also immediately noticed my stomach was definitely being "shaped". It was a very weird feeling. I felt like I was sucking in my stomach but also had a pile of concrete blocks pushing my stomach further in well past any average "sucking in" . Suddenly I was standing very straight, like a soldier at attention. I could not relax my stance, I tried. As the web of murder continued to exert all the forces of the universe on my stomach, all the body mass had to go somewhere, and it went up! I am fairly certain one of my kidneys just popped right on up under my ribs. What was that pain pressing against my spine? Well, that was the rest of my internal organs all pressing back and up, against my spinal column and under my ribs. All this pressure and upward movement of body mass and organs was making it difficult to breathe; short breaths, short breaths......I couldn't stand at attention any longer, so as my organs continued to shift, I slowly sat down. Have you ever tried to sit while part of your body is wrapped in a body cast? Me neither until right then. Now I am sitting there, straight as a board, my stomach continuing to cave in, my refugee organs pressing further and further into the space previously occupied by my lungs making breathing more difficult by the second. This was not working out, I had to get out of this torture device, I needed to breathe! Seriously, I needed oxygen....to live. And so, with every intention of rolling the death shapers off my body, I stood up and that is all I remember. I woke up on the floor with my husband kneeling over me, scissors in hand, a fresh red welt clearly visible. Apparently, he was unable to work his stubby fingers under the boa constrictor waistband and did the next best thing; he cut that medieval death shaper from the thigh up. When the scissors finally chewed through the waistband, that angry snake band decided it was not going down without a fight, snapped back and gave the poor man a welt. Ladies, if you‚Äôre tall, into BDMS or torture, you might like these. If you want to test your pain tolerance or endurance, these are for you. If like me, you prefer the security of knowing all your internal organs are in their designated spaces, move along to the next product. If you are short, move along. Lastly if breathing is not relevant to you have at these, for the rest of you, if you like breathing as much as I do, just keep scrolling, these are not for you or me.

reviews.title: Ordering up in size is a MUST!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2022
reviews.text: While I was impressed at the cost for such an item, this item did come in VERY VERY snug. I am 5'9 (175.3cm) at 190lb so I opted for the XL size as it seemed to be the best option but was VERY snug in the *package* area and sitting was very difficult as it tend to ride up in places. Fast Forward several months later, I wrote a review that I was disappointed and the seller reached out to me to see if there was anything they could do. They did offer to send me a replacement in the XXL size. While this isn't a size I was Ever used to ordering, they did mention that it was definitely larger, that it would fit much better but that it had a button vs zipper style that the original one came it. I would have preferred the zipper but the difference really was negligible and really not noticeable. Convenience definitely lends itself to a zipper front but I am more impressed that the seller was willing to be so helpful months after the purchase and make it right. Kudos to Amazon Seller - SOGSILK, you did an outstanding job. 4 stars. (-1 because the supplier couldn't provide you a larger style with a zipper but that's not for a lack of effort on your part.)

reviews.title: Excellent trainers - very lightweight
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 14, 2016
reviews.text: Excellent trainers - very lightweight, they don't give as much support as other models but they feel nice and nimble. I'd vote 4.5 if I could, only because I find the material is a bit too lightweight for me (you could practically fold then shoe down like a piece of fabric if you wanted). This could be useful for some, - say you were going on holiday and packing light, wanted to keep a pair of shoes in a small bag etc. Also bear in mind they get dirty very easy and if it rains your feet get literally soaked they offer no protection from water (I got caught in the downpours last month). Saying that they're a great summer-wear, nice and airy.

reviews.title: Excellent Shirt Overall
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 23, 2020
reviews.text: I bought a L henley in the olive color and am very happy with it. I've bought a number of henley shirts in various brands over the years, and this is definitely one of the best. The material is soft and comfortable, the fabric a light to medium weight, and the fit is nice though a bit smaller than ideal for me, and the neck/collar area is very comfortable. I'm just under 5'10' and 150+ lbs, with proportionally longer arms. The body on this is less roomy than I like, and the arms are also fairly close fitting, but I really prefer more loose fitting henleys rather than snug to the body. The sleeve length after washing is great for my arms, and I find that with I like this loose cuff more than the tight elastic cuff that's more common on henleys. The shirt length is a few inches below my waist, not excessively long. I like the soft olive shade of the one I bought. I almost scored this one with five stars, but the couple of minor issues I mentioned are all that left me at the four star rating. Overall, I'm impressed with this shirt, and the price is excellent.

reviews.title: Great shirts. Tall sizes.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 3, 2019
reviews.text: OK. I just wanted a cotton long sleeve shirt. One that fit my long arms. If I didn‚Äôt care if sleeves were too short, or cotton/poly blend was used, five bucks would have done it. But as soon as you get tall sizes, prices double or triple. Henleys, designs, material, fit, all add to the price. But after wearing what are essentially undershirts, I broke down and bought this $20 shirt. The sleeves are nice and long. The fabric is soft and comfortable. The colors are not plain. Even the buttons match the color of the shirt. It‚Äôs worth it to find clothing that fits and looks good. Kind of a shame that Amazon, or anyone, chooses to charge a premium for something that costs no more to make than regular sizes.

reviews.title: Too short even for short, fat guys, cheap cuffs.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 29, 2020
reviews.text: I admit to being a short, fat guy and wear a 3X shirt. I've bought the Hanes Henley shirts for a bit less than these and was very satisfied but decided to give the Amazon brand a try. Unfortunately these Amazon shirts fall short, literally, of my expectations. The shirt is not long enough to stay tucked in. At 5'7", I usually don't need to buy the tall versions of a shirt. In this case, I would need the tall version to keep my shirt tucked in and my belly covered. My other gripe is the cheap cuff, they just folded the material over and sewed the cuff instead of making a separate cuff like the Hanes Henley shirts that I bought. I will go back to buying the Hanes shirts and, when I can justify the cost, the Carharts.

This does not have the usual cut at top of the arm and the separate piece from the the top of the arm to the shoulder. Instead this one has a cut from the armpit to neck giving you the roundish shoulder. If you are not used to this style, you might feel weird. The material is good and price to quality ratio is good as well. It is only how you look wearing this that makes it different. It did not make me happy. That's all. Thanks.

reviews.title: Quality Boots but Design Need Improvements
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2017
reviews.text: Great stylish alternative to suede UGG's with adjustable bottom buckle, easy to clean too, the bottom soles are made with thick quality rubber which provides good arch support and traction without adding extra weight. Keep legs / feet warm during freezing nyc weather and comfortable wear right out the box. However, would not recommend wearing if it's raining heavily or stepping into slush puddles :) Rating this boot - 3 1/2 star for the reasons listed... Now for a $600+ pair of boots one would expect quality and great fit. Which is not the case fit wise, the leather is supple (not rigid stiff like other frye boots) and fur inside is thick which is great. But the fit (upper part is a bit wide), length (NOT over the knee, needs one inch more) and zipper (half zipper) all 3 parts need to be redesign. As someone who is 5'6 with a slim calf, the top part is wide...kinda like a floppy pirate boots and only reaches middle of knee making it look clunky, Half zippers are annoying since it makes the boot to bunch up slightly midway and taking them off requires a bit of effort. Why not make the boot with full zipper so it's easy to slip on and off and to eliminate the bunching? Also maybe add a adjustable buckle to the top so the width can be adjusted. Packaging could be better, boot arrived stuff with tissue paper in a no frills Frye box and no cloth bags included. Although I don't own any designer shoes except this one... noticed other shoes that are several $$$ have cloth bags... In any event hope Frye will make these improvements to the Valerie OTK boots. Would I purchase these boots at full price? Absolutely Not. When Amazon had a nice sale decided to get em to wear in cold weather.

reviews.title: Another pair of Frye boots to love!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2014
reviews.text: Another pair of Frye boots to love! These are winter boots so they are not for everyday wear. Lined with angora wool so they are warm all the way up over-the-knee. Too warm for indoor use (fine outdoors, but likely a bit hot for an indoor mall). They are somewhat tighter through the calf than the other OTK boots due to the wool lining. The soles are good grippers for winter weather (although so far I have only had one occasion to wear them in the snow and ice). They are comfortable as the soles seem to have a cushioning layer both for insulation and walking comfort. These will finally replace my old pair ( Blondo OTK ) that have served for some 30 years. One minor caution is that metal zipper extends all the way down to the sole for easy entry and exit. But, as those of us that live in snowy country know, a zipper going to the bottom will collect wet snow and ice and freeze in real winter weather or sometimes leak in snow-puddles. So be careful where you step. Still, really fine boots that you will love for the snowy weather.

reviews.title: LOVE the Shear-ling Perfection!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2016
reviews.text: I'm a Frye boot loyalist because my Frye boots mean comfort, quality craftsmanship/materials & beauty! These boots are real shearling all the up, my calves fit perfectly (I have normal to bit defined calves & is not an issue--thats the soft shearling distressed leather portion of boot), true to fit (no breaking in), gripping soles that work w/o construction boot look, soft distressed leather (texture in black gives a hint of matte finish compared to its taut leathered perfectly shaped toe, seams & zippers are well placed, inner boot placed antiqued zippers are smooth-quality-good length! Shearling is soft & on the black boot appears more grayish (natural appearance, no spots) than "brownish". Love the fur & leather blending (for versatility) vs Contrasting colors: brown or winter white fur on black leather) & antigued/adjustable (3 holes) Frye side ankle buckle is proportional to the boot. The boots have a comfortable yet supportive feel, too. Arrived ahead of time in a well packed Frye box! These are my gorgeous classic, functional go to winter boots!

reviews.title: They do not look as nice and modern and unique as other Frye boots
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2018
reviews.text: In my opinion, these are not up to Frye quality and look. They do not look as nice and modern and unique as other Frye boots. Leather looks more like PU leather. Lining is thin comparing to Uggs (that I personally ware on bare feet in coldest days). This one I would need to ware with socks. They are also very tight at arch area even if you go 1/2 size or even size bigger. I got them in 7.5 (my regular Frye size), and I did not feel comfortable. My friend ordered in 6.5 and also had the same issue. She tried mine 7.5, and while she found that length of boots feet area was longer, it still was uncomfortable in arch area. But if you have narrow feet then you may fill comfortable. Conclusion is that even if we put that narrow arch part aside, it doesn't worth even discount price, in my opinion. Therefore three stars only. Sorry Frye, love you, but you could've done better with this one.

reviews.title: As advertised.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2014
reviews.text: Built like a tank (and almost as large), but looks good and works as advertised. I have this next to my bed (not two feet from my ears) and have yet to hear it moving. Its so silent, in fact, that I often have wondered if its working or not (it is). Not the cheapest winder you can find, but from the reviews you seem to very much get what you pay for in these devices.

reviews.title: Keeps a Rolex working
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2019
reviews.text: My wife purchased this for me for my birthday. I had purchased a watch winder for my Rolex prior to this one, but I didn't do any research. The winder I purchased did not keep the Rolex sufficiently wound, so in effect, it was useless. I did some research, and found this winder to be recommended by Rolex, so I sent my wife the link. The winder looks very nice, and works perfectly. It spins the watch once every eight or twelve minutes (for my watch, I use the default eight minute setting), and once it spins the around a single roatate, the watch will gyrate back and fortch, mimicing the motion a watch will actually get while being worn. The motor is silent, making no audible noise I can hear whatsoever. Also, the case keeps the watch itself covered, which I prefer. I don't care for open faced watch winders. I like my watch inside a protective case. The cushion you mount the watch on is easy to use, and will not damage the watch. Excellent product that does it's intended job perfectly.

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Fits Us Better Than Any Other Keens
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2015
reviews.text: First off Amazon asked if it provides good arch support. I answered no. Read the end of my review for an explanation of that. This review is based off finding a fit and buying two pairs of CNX Clearwater in two different sizes for two individuals: Pair 1: I am a male with a narrow fitting heel and an average or narrower forefoot (toes). My bone structure is slight and I am very thin and I have no ‚Äúmeat‚Äù on my feet or ankles (or anywhere for that matter). I have a difficult time finding clothes that fit my frame and finding shoes that are long enough for my foot without being loose and sloppy in the width especially the heel. I owned a pair of Keen Men‚Äôs Newport (original from the first model year not H2) size 10.5 and found them to be rugged for working outdoor and great for slip on ease and airport travel. When the Keen Company was just getting off the ground they focused on ruggedness and roominess. The Newports were just too heavy, roomy in the width and clunky for my slight foot and I could not stand to wear them for any great length of time. Also I had to cinch the heck out of the bungee fastener to get the shoe to stay on and not slip off my heel when I walked. The original Newport ran small in length and I had to go up one size or half size to get the proper length. Then years later Keen introduced the CNX line, a lightweight and fitted (narrower) series of shoe. I originally got the Men‚Äôs 10 CNX Clearwater and found them to have too much material over the top of my foot. This was because the shoes was just too roomy for my skinny foot. I had to cinch the heck out of the bungee fastener to make the shoes stay on and not slip off my heel when I walked. This had the effect of folding over excess fabric in the mono-sock collar design of the shoe and would dig into the top of my foot uncomfortably. I tried the Men‚Äôs CNX Clearwater size 9.5 and found they were just not long enough for my foot and my toe just slightly hit the toe cap of the shoe in an uncomfortable way. The 9.5 however was a much better fit in the ankle and did not have as much excess material around the mono-sock collar when the bungee was cinched. I found the Clearwater to be about true to size where the Newport ran small. In recent years I have found that women‚Äôs shoes are often narrower than men‚Äôs. They usually are more colorful too and that isn‚Äôt bad for someone like myself that likes colors other than black, red, brown and white. I tried the Women‚Äôs Clearwater size 11 and found the fit was spot on. I still have to cinch the heck out of the bungee but the fold over of the mono-sock collar is minimal and is not enough to dig into my foot. The width of the Women‚Äôs size 11 is still roomy but not excessively so. So far I have had great luck wearing this shoe all day with no issues. Pair 2: My wife was a huge Keen Whisper fan. She had previously tried the Keen Newport H2 and Venice and found them to be too roomy and slipped off the back of her heel. Her Keen Whisper size is 8. She does not like to or have time to shop and found the Whisper fit to be good enough and stuck with that. With my revelation that the Keen CNX Clearwater fit almost true to size I ordered her a 7.5, her usual dress flat size. It was in her favorite color and I knew she would give it a try because of that. It fits her perfectly, and she finds it very lightweight and comfortable and better fitting around the foot compared to the Keen Whisper. Her only point to note is that she likes the Whisper bungee cinch system better than the mono-sock collar of the Clearwater. She finds that to cinch the Clearwater tight enough to where there is no heel slip the material folds over and if not positioned just right, can dig into the top of her foot. Conclusion: In short this Keen Women‚Äôs CNX Clearwater fits us both better than any Keen shoe we have yet tried. Keen has made an attempt to welcome those with narrow or medium width feet into the Keen wearing flock. We would both say that the width fit for us is the as our regular athletic shoes fit. For length she fits into her regular dress shoe size with in this shoe. Of the Women‚Äôs shoes I do own this fits like some 11‚Äôs do and like some 12‚Äôs do (I do not own any 11.5). To compare the fit more universally, for me the Clearwater 11 fits like Men‚Äôs 9-9.5, Women‚Äôs 11-11.5 Converse Chuck Taylor and for her the Clearwater 7.5 fits like Men‚Äôs size 5 Women‚Äôs 7 Converse Chuck Taylor. Arch Support: Everyone thinks of arch support differently so I really don‚Äôt like the question. I have noticed most people confuse arch support with stability and motion control. Look up ‚Äúpronation shoes‚Äù on google for more information. Most people that want arch support really mean they want ‚Äúmotion control‚Äù or ‚Äústability‚Äù shoes. These shoes force the feet to roll outward when running, walking and standing. The majority of people have feet the roll inward naturally and feel only the insides of their feet are bearing the weight and pressure. This has nothing to do with arch support. I have been told by two doctors I have a high arch on my foot. I am a light runner and use minimalist or barefoot shoes for running. I suppose I have somewhat strong feet. I was told arch support comes from within the foot and is provided by muscles and tendons of the foot. I was told flat feet can be hereditary or come as a result of wearing stiff inflexible shoes over a period of time that cause atrophy of the muscles. I was told no amount of upward arch curve in a shoe will correct flat feet. Exercise and flexible shoes, barefoot shoes or actually being barefoot while doing exercise to strengthen foot muscles may help return an arch to the natural shape or keep an arch strong. The arch curve of this Clearwater shoe does not even come close to contacting the bottom of my foot in the arch area. In fact only once every few years will I ever find a shoe that the built in arch ‚Äúsupport‚Äù bump actually contacts the arch of my foot. When I do find that, it creates a great amount of artificial pressure on my tendon and is painful and torturous to walk or stand in. Again everyone is different.

reviews.title: Love them
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2022
reviews.text: These are my favorite shoes to wear to an amusement park. They are so comfortable and dry so fast! I had my first pair for around three years and wore them all the time, but my new corgi decided they looked tasty, so I had to buy a new pair. If it wasn‚Äôt for that, I‚Äôm sure they would have lasted even longer!

reviews.title: So Small, (Probably Comfortable), Seriously Unflattering
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2020
reviews.text: I take an 8-8.5. The JBU shoe I just bought in an 8 fit perfectly--even a bit loose. 8.5 in NB and Brooks running shoes. I'm not sure if this review will reflect that I purchased the 8 or the 8.5, but I ordered both at the same time. Both are extremely small. Both are well made and I can tell the footbed is lovely. The inside is smooth. But, if I were going to reorder, I don't think the 9 would be big enough. I think perhaps I'd order the 9.5. So, I'd say a solid 1.5 sizes (counting by 1/2 sizes) too small for my foot--just to fit. I have wide toes and narrow heels. If you have really narrow feet, perhaps a full size larger than your size would be enough? I'm not going to reorder. Although these look cute in the box and I'd would have liked to try on the correct size, they are ugly. I mean--really ugly--or, I should say, unflattering. I don't mind ugly. There has to be a better option in terms of appearance. My wide foot looked like a flat square box in these, despite the fact that they were squishing them. These made me look like Fred Flintstone, and I don't have ugly feet. So, there you go.

reviews.title: Great high toe box!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020
reviews.text: This is the best fit for a narrow foot that needs a high toe box. And they are excellent shoes too. Combing reviews of Keen shoes, I learned that this model fits narrow feet best, and that is true. But did not expect this fantastic toe box! I have what I call "curly toe" - my big toes curl up like an elf - and have real trouble with shoes. Most are simply not made to fit toes like this. I wear holes in canvas, and just can't wear most shoes. They cause great pain. This is the first time I've had a toe box that is actually high enough that I can WIGGLE my toes! These shoes are so comfortable I don't take them off in the evenings; I wear them until bedtime. I love the gummy soles; they give me bouncy energy. I love the adjustability of the bunjee cord. I was afraid I would find them uncomfortable around my ankle and difficult to put on and off because there is no velcro opening/closure around the ankle. But contraire! They are actually EASIER to put on/take off than all my other shoes! I love the blue/pattern color too. In short, these are likely the best shoes I've ever had. I hope this model shoe is not discontinued. If you have narrow feet and/or curled up toes, this shoe is for you.

reviews.title: Perfect!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 7, 2019
reviews.text: If you only buy one pair of walking sandals in your life, buy these! The fit is exact and all encompassing - like wearing a supportive sock with a firm, cushioned sole! The heel strap, unlike some walking sandals, fits snugly round the heel in exactly the right place without slipping or chafing and there's even a small catch for the excess elastic after you've tightened it. Toes are well protected by a rubber bumper but without the toe-stubbing that one sometimes gets from these type of shoes. Perfect! This particular pair are blue with a pattern but I also have a the grey and the fuchsia-pink version. The blue look particularly good with rolled up jeans or shorts and I tend to wear them at home rather than for walking holidays so they'll only get field and pavement walking whereas the other pairs get some real hammer when I go on walking holidays. They stay in place in the roughest of terrain and if you're hot, you can stand in the nearest stream to cool your feet without any harm to the shoes. If you wear them in the sea you will get salt-stains when they dry so I'd recommend rinsing them in cold water afterwards. The manufacturer says you can actually put them in the washing machine but I've never tried this - I tend to just fill the sink with some tepid water and hand-washing liquid and give them a gentle wash. To get right down to the bottom of the foot-bed, I use an old toothbrush. It gets right into the toe and keeps your shoes feeling and smelling fresh. Put them in a warm, sunny place, preferably with the heels downwards to let the water drain out and they'll be dry in a couple of hours. I've had my grey ones for three years now and worn them up hill and down dale with hardly any signs of wear so if you are dithering over whether or not to buy some (they are quite expensive) I'd definitely say 'go for it' - you won't regret it - it's money well spent!

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Keen to get these Keen sandals
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 17, 2020
reviews.text: My daughter has worn a pair of these Keen sandals for a couple of years and adores them. They are suitable for extensive travelling in tropical climes and through water. We have also washed her pair and they have come up like new. So it was high time to order a pair for myself and I am truly delighted. I love the light blue canvas colour and the fact that these shoes have built in arches to support my feet, especially with the huge amount of walking mileage that I do. Beware: little stones, dust and dirt can enter! The soles are rubberised and have grip. My first foray with these was a 6 km hike through woodland and farmland. I wore them on a humid day with no socks. These sandals were brilliant and I am pleased to report that I experienced no friction and no blisters. I have had to order a whole size larger as not only do feet swell in the summer, but these do come up quite narrow. I also have small bunions and these are successfully concealed and accommodated with no problems.

I returned them and managed to find another pair of Venice sandals instead, I will be keeping these well away from the dog.

reviews.title: Cute costume for the price.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2015
reviews.text: Cute costume. I purchased this as a gift for a 3 yr old and I'm sure she will love it. I bought a size 4/5 and I think it will be a little long on her. As far as quality, seems decently made for a costume. Stitching is tight, fabric is thin costume type material, so not sure how that will hold up...but it's cute. One issue I found with it was on the seam of the skirt there was a long piece of fabric that was sticking out l just cut it off and it's fine. I think for the price of $17.99 it is pretty cute and will be loved by the little girl who is getting this for Christmas. Details of costume: dress has stretchy velvet material at the top with glitter stamp design, satin type arms and skirt is satin type material with a organza type overlay on front with glitter design stamped on. The skirt on the dress also has a "slip type thing" sewn in on the inside. All of the gold piping on the dress is sewn on and the top part of the dress has a removable Anna pin (the pin is kind of generic looking - like a knock off copy). The back of the dress closes with several small squares of velcro on the top part of the dress. Cape looks just like picture, has velcro closure and a small jewel sewn on. Cape is also thin satin type material trimmes in gold piping that is sewn.

reviews.title: Adorable costume!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2018
reviews.text: So pretty on my little girl. I got the 4-5 and my daughter is currently 3 1/2. She usually wears 4T in tops, so the dress fit as expected. It wasn't big, and it hit right at the ground. She wore it to Disney on Ice to accompany her brother's Olaf costume Disguise Baby's Disney Frozen Olaf Deluxe Toddler Costume,White,Toddler S (2T) They were perfect together and so many people commented on how cute their costumes were. I only had two issues with the costume. First, the fabric is thin and delicate, so I didn't let my daughter wear it to play around the house in until after our event, because I was worried that it would tear very easily. Second, I steamed it beforehand so it would look nice, and it only took about 30 seconds after putting it on to have it entirely wrinkly again. These issues really didn't bother me because I got the costume for a low price. Overall, I'm really happy with this costume.

The top is a stretchy velvet material which makes it fit snug but I am hoping leaves room to grow. I bought this as a gift for my daughter's friend's 4th birthday. I had my daughter try it on (she just turned 4) and is at the 50% range for height and weight for her age. The size 4-5 appeared to fit perfectly except for length which was a little long. I'm hoping since the top is stretchy it will fit longer than it looks like it will. Knowing the fit of the costume I would probably have ordered a size up and just planned to hem it. Overall the quality and look of the costume appears good except for the anna pin on the front. The photo is distorted so I just took the pin off and it looks better without it anyway.
