reviews.title: Works great if you follow the instructions
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 4, 2022
reviews.text: I'm writing this review to help others get the tarnish off of heavily tarnished items. I had an eagle charm that was beautiful but stopped wearing it because I rotate my jewelry and I didn't keep it in a safe place. I tried another very popular solution, but it still didn't clean the charm to my satisfaction. I even used a toothbrush with the old solution but it still wasn't clean enough. I then used a jeweler's cloth to help to no avail. I had used this product before, but the solution leaked a lot because I didn't close it all of the way so I trashed it. I decided to give this one a try again, and it worked! A rinse with soap and water got rid of the smell. I wear gloves when cleaning my jewelry because the oils on your fingers could cause your piece to tarnish first. This solution will cause slight chemical burns, so I wear gloves for that reason. When you clean silver, the solution strips away a minute amount of silver so keep your silver pieces in a small bag to keep from air getting to it and causing it to tarnish again. Polishing silver can wear away a layer of silver, so using the instructions saying to use it UP TO 10 swishes to remove the tarnish is a must and I check the piece after three dunks, then another three to see if it worked. Use it too much, and it will ruin your jewelry. I found that my jewelry, even with the rinse, comes out a bit dull, but I use the buffing side of a jewelers cloth to not only shine the piece but to put a protective coating to keep it from tarnishing so quickly. You can use jewelry polish if you so desire. I read that wearing your jewelry can keep it from tarnishing so I wear the pieces or store them in jewelry bags to keep the oxidation off and creating more tarnish. I have one bracelet that has lasted 20 years that hasn't needed tarnishing in all of that time, so that may be the reason it didn't tarnish. I wear that piece 24/7. This solution did what other products didn't do as well. If the smell is too much to handle, I recommend using it in a well-ventilated area such as the porch or deck and the smell won't penetrate your home. These are corrosive chemicals, folks and should be treated with care. BTW, the solution smells the same as it did before, and the basket never came with a brush in either container. My guess is they make three other products where the basket does have a brush, so instead of creating a basket for just the silver solution without a brush is a way to save money. I hope this helps.

reviews.title: Ordered this to clean an antique ring and was very sceptical
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on September 24, 2022
reviews.text: Recently on a trip to Poland I purchased and old WW2 silver ring. The ring is in ok condition but the silver on it was dirty and mostly blackish. I wanted to try and get it clean. The first thing that I have tried is baking soda with aluminium foil and boiling water, that worked a little bit but not much. So I decided to order this fluid and give it a try. I was very sceptical at first because the ring has a little bit of red colour made of something that I do not know, I was worried the ring might get ruined but decided to risk it and try anyways. ?I submerged the ring for 10 seconds and then rinsed it under warm water with dish washing liquid, to my surprise, the ring came out looking silver again and without the black marks on it, the red part did not get ruined neither so I was very relieved. Very happy that I took the risk and that the ring looks clean now.

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Silver looks like new
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on July 9, 2022
reviews.text: Most of my silver has been sitting in the drawer since early 2020 and had become quite tarnished. I decided it was time to clean and retrieved my old silver cleaner from the back of the cupboard only to realise it was no longer usable. I looked at the reviews for this one and the price was good so ordered. Remember it is only 10 seconds that you dip for, less fot items not too tarnished and voil√† sparkling silver is achieved. I then dropped the items into a sink of warm slightly soapy water to wash off the chemical and then a quick buff with a towel. The picture of the earrings and Pandora necklace are the best examples as these were totally black before cleaning. It says 12 months lifespan but I had my last cleaner for years, reckon it will last a lot longer than that. Oh and wear some latex gloves as this stuff is strong. Only pain was removing the internal safety lid, I had to use scissors to remove it but I understand why it has to be so secure, you can't have a chemical like this leaking out in transit.

reviews.title: Best silver jewellery cleaner that I have ever used
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on July 7, 2022
reviews.text: This is the best silver jewellery cleaner that I have ever used. It works very quickly. A quick dip, rinse, then polish with a silver polish cloth is all that‚Äôs needed to return silver jewellery to its original colour and shine. My only problem was opening the seal on the jar. These is no tab with which to peel it back. I struggled on because I didn‚Äôt have a knife or scissors at hand. I tried to push the seal inwards with my thumbs. It burst the seal open but the force that I needed to use, resulted in me jolting the jar and spilling the contents over the work surface. I lost 1/3 of the contents, as a result. I would advise puncturing the seal with a sharp knife or scissor point, then cutting it open before peeling it off.

title: Q Timex Men's 38mm Watch
bullets: Silver-tone 18mm woven stainless steel bracelet fits up to 8-inch wrist circumference
White diver-inspired dial with full markers & luminous hands; day-date window at 3 o'clock
Silver-tone 38mm stainless steel case with domed acrylic crystal
Rotating blue & red aluminum top ring; ‚ÄòTrue to the Past‚Äô battery hatch on caseback
Water resistant to 50m (165 ft): In general, suitable for short periods of recreational swimming, but not diving or snorkeling
description: From the manufacturer Read more Q Timex Our Q Timex Reissue series brings back some of our most iconic designs from the 1970s, a time when the quartz crisis was turning the mechanical watch industry upside down. Rotating Bezel When you align the center mark of your rotating bezel with the current position of the minute hand, you can then read elapsed time on the bezel. Domed Crystal Found in many vintage watches, domed acrylic crystals are shatter resistant making them preferred for dive watches. You‚Äôll see slight dial distortion at extreme angles, an organic curve as the crystal arcs above the case, and a warmth not seen with glass. Old-School Battery Hatch The caseback hatch is a design relic from the 1970s, when watch batteries only lasted months. Some modern batteries last nearly ten years, but we remained true to our archival designs. And you may thank us after a decade of use. Read more Diver-Inspired Design With bold luminescent hands, oversized markers, and an elapsed-time bezel, we kept the integrity of the diver style without the expense of a deep sea helium relief valve. Woven Stainless Steel Bracelet Hundreds of woven stainless steel links give you a durable polished look with a flexible fit. Tested Under Pressure In the 1960s we tested the durability of our watches on boat motors, the wrist of cliff divers and even in dishwashers. And we did it all on live television. Today, nearly every Timex watch is tested for water resistance and accuracy for 24 hours before it leaves our hands. Read more

reviews.title: Yep, They‚Äôre Socks!! Lol!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2018
reviews.text: We have a houseful of boy‚Äôs, & 1 Dad that are all hard workers, and hard players. Socks, & shoes/boots are always the first victims of such activities. Needless to say we go through a lot of socks. I really like the Dickie‚Äôs, and then the Merino Wool socks in winter, but they can get pricey considering everyone inconveniently (for my budget) has 2 feet. So Fruit of The Loom is one place I save money, and can usually find someone who has them on sale for less than two dollars a pair. The other socks do last longer, but not long enough to validate the cost. I do still get everyone at least 1 pair of the wool socks (the ones who don‚Äôt like the feel wear them over regular socks) for winter just because they are real outdoors types who go nuts if they spend an entire day indoors. I like to pick up a few packs every time I find them at that price point, and so far it has kept everyone in socks. When I pitch in a new pack of socks I throw out, or make rags out of as many pairs that have seen better days. If all their socks still look pretty good I just toss them in my closet until needed, because honestly no matter what brand of socks you wear - if you like playing outside, or spend a good part of your day in shoes & on your feet - you will need, or enjoy a new pack of socks at least once a year. I check socks at different times of year because I don‚Äôt want my guys going to somebody‚Äôs house, take their shoes off, and have dingy, worn out socks. I check around birthdays, start of school, & Christmas. Everyone has about 4, maybe 5(the husband has 5) packs worth of socks, and at least 1 pack‚Äôs worth will be exchanged out during the year. I have found it to be a simple way to manage all the socks. About every other year - depending on who it is they will be down about a packs worth of socks ( I still have no idea where they go), so they end up with 2 packs that year, and then you have growing feet... All kinds of good reasons to keep an eye out for deals on socks. Lol! I figure I can let it drive me mad, or manage it routinely, and keep a stash if I can. Maybe you, and your family rarely wear out, or lose socks, & spending more is the way to go, but I honestly have not seen any difference between these, and other brands a couple weeks in (some are initially fluffier, but it doesn‚Äôt last). I prefer to spend good money on the footwear over the socks. That is one place we don‚Äôt skimp is on the shoes, boots etc. that is where you really want to buy the best. Anywho as socks go we DO recommend this brand, & Hope our review is helpful to you!

reviews.title: Great Costume
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2013
reviews.text: Just got this today, and I have to say it's one of the better quality halloween costumes I've ever purchased. The flight suit is almost identical to the coveralls that we used in the Marine Corps, except all of the patches would be velcro, not just the name tag. It comes with both Maverick and Goose name tags so you can choose your poison. It is quite warm, would be pretty good for an outdoor party. I read in another review that the included glasses are plastic, so I ordered another pair of glasses. However, in the package I received, the glasses are metal, and seem to be pretty good quality. As far as fit, I'm 5'7" 155 lbs athletic build, and the S/M fits almost perfectly. The legs are a little long, but it's barely noticeable in combat boots. My biggest concern was the shoulder width and the crotch, both of which are perfectly sized. The front zipper is a two way zipper, so hitting the head after a few adult beverages isn't a hassle, as you don't have to take the suit off. Zippers are high quality, and similar to those on actual flight suits. Now, the reasons I gave this costume 4 instead of 5 stars. As I previously stated, the legs are just a hair too long, like maybe an inch or two. If I were 5'8 or 5'9, I don't think it'd be an issue at all. Pocket placement is slightly disappointing. There are no hip pockets, which means I have to adjust for placement of my phone and keys. Also, there is no back pocket, but that speaks to authenticity. There are a total of 5 pockets in the suit, two chest, one thigh, and two lower leg. They're all pretty roomy, but the thigh pocket goes just a bit deep, as anything I put in it hits my knee. Not really an issue, just an observation. I also wish the velcro on the cuff of the sleeve extended just a bit further, as the sleeves are a little loose when all the way down. Overall, this is a great costume. I'm venturing through my city's bar district on Halloween in it, and I'm happy there is no restricted motion and I'm comfortable wearing it for hours. I would certainly recommend this to anyone.

reviews.title: A great find for traveling (and for schools that allow wheeled bags)
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2019
reviews.text: Overall decent quality typical school style backpack. I am concerned the screws that hold the handlebar to the wheeled base are so short as to eventually become unstable. They handlebar moves about in it‚Äôs housing too much because the one tiny screw holding it in place is not sufficient to keep it stable. ‚ÄúWalks‚Äù up stairs very smoothly with the 6 wheel base. Decent handle height for most average height kids even into teens. Adjustable height for shorter/younger children. Locks in bag to the base via sturdy plastic clip system. Backpack straps tuck away (you have to adjust out to longest length to do so). I especially appreciate the bag is completely removable from the wheeled base so it can be used more comfortably when wheeling is not necessary (the lightly padded back cover is decent but not something one wants to keep strapped on their back for more than a few minutes, especially as the top of the handlebar remains exposed to the upper back/neck of your child‚Äôs body.)

reviews.text: My son loves his new backpack! In the 2017 age of fidget spinner mania the wheels "which look just like fidget spinners and really spin" are quintessential coolness. You have a normal black backpack plus you have a detached 6-wheel (3 wheel per side) trolley / dolly. The backpack has a sleeve on the back where the dolly slides through and the backpack rests on the bottom of the dolly. If you had a different backpack with a sleeve (open at the top and bottom) it could also work in as a replacement. The backpack came from China. It is not a known American brand. However, so far we love it.

description: Product Description Item location: United States Features: 1. Material: Faux Leather(polyester+Spandex) 2. Boning: Spiral Steel Boned/Plastic Bones 3. Back Design: ajustable lacing 4. Package: 1 x corset, 1 x matching G-String 5. Perfect for bridal lingerie, steampunk wedding dresses, Halloween costumes, date nights, burlesque or any intimate setting. How to put on a corset by yourself? 1. Loosen the corset by undoing the centre loops and pulling the back of corset apart 6-7" but don't undo the laces at the bottom of the corset. 2. Carefully line up the two sides of your busk on the front of the corset. Line up the pins and the holes and clip the busk together. 3. Tighten the lacing. Starting from the top. Next, go to the bottom of the lacing and pull the laces tighter there. Then working the bottom half of the lacing tighter. 4. Tie off the loose lacing on the back of your corset. How to find your perfect size? Corset is in order to make a more slender body, please don't compare with the general clothes' size. reviews.text: I'm 5'2, 203 pounds, and a size 14ish. I was gifted a 3XL and it fits perfectly. I'm very pleased! On the skin it's a perfect fit, but over clothing (like a T-shirt or a blouse), it fits well. It definitely gives a great shape. reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Quite busty but not unfixable! Over all great corset.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2015
reviews.text: This corset came before the delivery date which is awesome. Its made pretty well and tightens up nicely. The only complaint I have is the bust area is pretty enormous. You would have to have DD size tits if you want to fill this thing out. The roominess isn't a real problem for me though, since I can sew, I was just going to take the middle bones on the front of the corset on either side and overlap them over the 1st bones closest to the zipper and secure in place with either a rivet or sew them in. that would take care of the extra space. Overall this is a great corset. If I do buy again from this seller I would suggest women who are less busty buy a size down. I usually wear a medium but What I really needed was a size small. As with all corsets this corset does feature laces and tightens nicely. The shape itself comes down in a slight V shape towards your crotch. I know it sounds iffy me telling people out there to buy a size smaller than what they are but listen. Corsets were invented to give you and hourglass figure and make you look smaller. Therefore women would buy smaller corsets. You want something that's going to hold you in and shape you. If you buy a corset that is already your measurements then you cant tighten it to mold to your body. If you buy slightly smaller you can do that because its not your exact measurements. I hope this review has been helpful to all of you guys out there.

reviews.title: Great construction, sleeves too long (Returned)
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on November 20, 2020
reviews.text: I had my eye on this jacket for a couple of months, and once went it went on sale, I was so excited. I am generally average size everything (5'6", 160). Previously HH midlayer crew jacket in large size fit well, I checked the size chart for this jacket and ordered the large so I could comfortably wear layers underneath. When I got the jacket, the sleeves were abnormally long - covering my hands except the very tips of my fingernails. I could push up the sleeves and tighten the cuffs so my hands were more free, but there was a lot of material bunching up my arms, which isn't comfortable or ideal long term. Because I loved this jacket design so much I ordered it in a medium, thinking it was a size issue with the large. Same problem! Though I could now see the first digits of my fingers, the fit was so off it was unusable. Never in the past have I had an issue with arm length on a jacket, so this surprised me. I compared both sizes and could see that something was off in the design/cut, it wasn't designed to fit women well, or perhaps the odd bunching around the armpits and overly long sleeves is to be expected for Helly Hansen's more technical jackets. Looking closer at the photos of the models wearing the jacket, on some you can see similar bunching of the sleeves indicating same problem, so this looks to be a flaw with this particular design, unfortunately. My old sailing jacket of similar type is from Gill and fits much better, so reluctantly due to fit issues decided to return both sizes of the Helly Hansen. Otherwise the jacket was great - loved the design, materials, and quality but the fit issues rendered it unwearable for me (3 stars)

reviews.title: The description telling you which size will fit you best is fairly accurate
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 24, 2015
reviews.text: This review of the Bavarian Boy costume, is for college students or young adults. It comes in different sizes, it has a unique quality and it is for those on a budget. The costume comes in three different types of sizes small, medium and large. How you determine which size to get is based on pants size. When trying on the outfit it may occur to you the socks slide down too much or the shirt is too big. The shirt is supposed to be a little loose, so it will be a little free in the arm when dancing. The socks do have the tendency to slide down often when, jumping, dancing or walking to fast. This costume is stylish and can make you look like a true Bavarian Boy. It is comfy and smooth. The shirt is almost like a silk feeling and the pants also have a thin silk feeling. However, if you plan on being outside on a cold day or night it will not keep be warm enough. I would recommend wearing something under the shirt and possibly warmer socks. If dancing is on the agenda or trying to be flexible you will want to be careful because the material may rip. I wore it two days in a row and by the end of the second day I had a hole on the side of the pants (easily sewed back up) and one of the straps ripped off (again easily sewn back on). Because of the low-price the material is not durable when doing more than standing, walking or sitting. For the people who are living on a budget it is an inexpensive costume that you do not have to make. It was very convenient and arrived on time before the weekend started. Other Bavarian Boy costumes may be too expensive because they are trying to be more authentic. Then there is a T-shirt that has straps printed on them, and that does not look good. If you want something that looks like a real Bavarian Boy, and paying for an authentic one is out of the price range. Then this is a great choice. In general this costume works. Easy to find the right size, and not going to hurt the wallet. Hopefully this review has helped in making your decision.

reviews.title: Great Value for a Costume!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 21, 2015
reviews.text: The costume overall served its purpose. My boyfriend and I went as a German couple for a Halloween party and he wore this. It looks exactly like the picture! Sizing: just as many other reviews have stated, the costume is very big and you will need to size down 1/2 or 1 whole size approximately. My boyfriend wears a Large in everything and a 33/32 in pants, is 6' 2" and 180 lbs and we ordered a Medium and it fit almost perfectly! The suspenders on the shorts are not adjustable and therefore we couldn't fix the shorts so that they weren't pulled up as high as they were...this left his, um, man parts almost inappropriate looking and slightly awkward/uncomfortable for him. The size of the shorts themselves was great! The material is a tad bit thin and in some lightly could almost be see-through but we were in a dark garage and it was fine. The material feels "costume-like" as you would expect but not uncomfortable. The hat is as everyone has said - wrinkled and a little bit awkward, but we pressed it with an iron as best as possible and he wore it and it looked good. The shirt is very thin and the material "costume-like" as you would expect but a tad bit more silky, and the ribbon on it is cheap but what do you expect for such a cheap costume? You can substitute it with a dress shirt with the sleeves rolled up to your elbows to get the same effect. The socks are a bit thin but he wore a pair underneath to keep his feet warm at the garage party we were at. They were also a lot shorter than it shows in the picture but it worked out either way. Overall definitely worth the $26.30 we paid for it! Great costume and went well with mine! :)

reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 15, 2017
reviews.text: Overall for 26 bucks this outfit is great. It will hold up to multiple wears and the was comfortable to wear in an XL at 6 ft and 245 lbs. I have very broad shoulders and the shirt fit well. Well worth it. You just need to expect to make a few simple modifications. My advice... The socks are worthless and the suspenders are short as well, both of these issues are mentioned in other reviews so was prepared. A quick trip to Walmart produced some short alligator clip extensions to the suspenders. I threw out the socks immediately because they are super thin and flimsy and too small to fit size 13 feet, and instead wore some off-white Smartwool hiking socks with hiking boots. If you want, do what I do and glue a big red feather to the hat. The hat is a little small but that only enhances the comedic value of the outfit. And it's not uncomfortable. So yes you may have to do a few things, but they take minutes and overall buying this was way easier and authentic looking than trying to create something from scratch. I am tempted to give it 5 stars based on value alone, but realize some people may expect a 5 star rating to mean perfect out of the box.

reviews.stars: 2.0 out of 5 stars 2.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: The proportions seem off
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 4, 2019
reviews.text: I've been buying Victoria Secret bras for the past 13 years due to a friend who took me there, and once I bought one I was hooked. I use to buy cheap bras at local stores till I was introduced to VS. But sadly lately I can not afford to cough out 40+ bucks per bra. So I typed in top bras for larger chests in 2019 and the 2nd listed was this one. So i bought it with the hopes I snagged a good deal and everything feeling like it was back in harmony since I only had one VS bra left. My last 3 bras, the metal band broke through. The issue I see is the strap which goes under the arms and clasps together on the back, is no where near as long as a bra that would be fit for someone with a large bust. I wear a 38 D and I compared bra to bra. I am comparing a non push up VS bra with this one and the cup from the VS seems to cover a bit more. It felt more like a circle but where this one is slightly cut off at an angle at the top. The part that wraps around and clasps at the back is missing a big amount. If you take the part that has all the sets of loops on it, and add that same amount on top of that, thats about how long the VS is just on that side. The other side with the hooks that goes into the loops, is missing even more. I wouldnt even go a size up, because i have a feeling the band would be the same. It feels like they put 38D cups on a regular A size band. So more of my sides are being pushed out and over the bra under my armpit. I made sure to adjust the shoulder straps and no matter what I did, it feels like the cup is still being forced against my breast. It doesnt feel like my bust is resting in the cup, it feels like the cup is trying to suffocate my breast. If i wear a big loose shirt, im sure it wont be as visible, but trying to wear a cute tight top with this will not work. 2 stars for the very soft feel of the material. It feels comfy against my skin. Its snug so im not sure how long I would be willing to wear it. Since I just got it in the mail I wanted to see how one would fit before washing. I tried the white one first and thought maybe it was just slightly tighter. I have bought clothing before where one color was tighter than the others. But no. The other two I bought, for a total of three, were all the same. The other two were the Back Heather color. Not sure why the black heather is called that since it looks all grey. Hardly looks black to me compared to the image. This bra will have to be worn with bulky big shirts or around the house. I will keep my last VS bra hidden away for special occasions until I have to painfully cough up money for a new one. Wont buy the Hanes bra again. I wish a better experience for those looking for a better price. I know not everyones body is the same so some people this might work and others not so much. Just fair warning if the VS strap that goes below your armpit and around your back works for you, this one may be too short. I had this one hooked on the very last one where as with the VS I could hook it on the 2nd one on the inside, out of the four rows of clasps. Best of luck. Hope this information helps others looking for a cheaper solution, and avoiding this one is they need a larger band that goes around the the back. **Image Provided** This is the comparison side by side. The black bra is my VS bra 38D and the white one is the Hanes 38D. You can see how much length is missing for the strap that wraps around to the back is not there on the Hanes bra.

They cradle your feet and the thong between your toes you don't even feel, I have given these to friends who dont like to wear this type of flip flop with the thong betweeen their toes and they have fallen in love too, they love the compfort and its like you dont even know you are wearing anything between your toes. I love these crocs and obviously cannot recommend enough. A great shoe!

reviews.text: Very good. Sizing is good, I have found if I measure the length of my feet and go by that as the size guide for the particular product, online footwear purchases have been working well. The size on the bottom of these reads M6 W8. I am a UK size 6 euro39. I like these because of the width fitting, they are wide, which is what I wanted but then they are unisex which may be why, love the colour and of course the crocs cushiony springy comfort, like walking on air. Also nice for British summer as they are waterproof. Birkenstocks tend to get soggy on the dewy and wet grass and I love my birkenstocks. Nice to ease me back into walking more as lockdown eases üòä aesthetically crocs are a bit marmite and well I love marmite too so there you go ‚ò∫Ô∏è I would say crocs are chunky but funky and incredibly lightweight.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on October 5, 2017
reviews.text: I have worn these Athens Crocs for years and I thought that they had been discontinued. I normally wear a size UK 8 Male and so, after looking at the size chart (which I did not really understand ) I ordered a pair of UK8 which is an M9. When I received them, I saw that the size was a 7M/9W. I measured them against my others and they were the same size. They fit really well and are soft without being too soft. I would recommend these sandals, but ,as everybody says, be careful with the sizing.

reviews.title: I like Sidi shoes but these are a favorite
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 11, 2022
reviews.text: I had an old model that had little ractchets that let you get the shoe tight but with no too tight spots. On every ride I would adjust one or more of the ratchets along the way. These give me the same ability. The material of the tops is really pliable and comfortable. They were comfortable the first ride I took with them and I felt like they transmitted more power to the pedals. Probably because the fit was so good but just my perception and not documented with a power meter. I have seen some posts where they say the pad at the back of the shoe wears too quick. I have not seen that on my other pair of sidi shoes that I used for two years with the pads showing wear but nothing serious. In any case I put some shoe goo on them and put them back on. when that wears through I will just apply more. Not sure how much those replacements are but I do not understand how the person who post I saw replaces several a year. These were worth the price as I tried to get away with some lower cost shoes even some that are a name brand shoe but none have the feel of these.

reviews.title: Beautifully designed and made
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 9, 2022
reviews.text: I‚Äôve had a pair of lesser Sidi shoes for 15 years, and while the glue on the Velcro straps eventually failed, I repaired them to keep as a backup pair. They refuse to die. The Genius is aptly named. So many thoughtful touches and ideas are incorporated into them. I cannot imagine ever needing another pair. Solid, comfortable, almost infinitely adjustable, stiff where they need to be and flexible everywhere else, the quality of the design and build is matched only by the high quality of the materials. The old adage that, ‚ÄúYou get what you pay for,‚Äù was surely meant for things like these.

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Comfort + Performance
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 8, 2020
reviews.text: Sidi is a great and storied brand and I have owned earlier versions of the Genius before. But this is by far the most comfortable performance biking shoe I have owned. I suspect that has a lot to do with fit. The 42.5 (8 1/2) fit me like a glove with some welcome wiggle room in the toe box. I was new to the Double Techno-3 Push cable lacing mechanism. It does take a little getting used to, but once you get the hang of it, there is no going back. The micro-adjusting is really nice. I use these shoes with Look Delta cleats on Look PP-396 pedals, which I swear by. The whole set up provides a very high level of performance and comfort. I buy new biking shoes roughly every 10 years. The Sidi Genius 10 are so worthy of the investment. I expect to get great use of them.

reviews.title: Simply the Best Sports Bra I Have Ever Worn
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2022
reviews.text: As a retired elite athlete, I have worn many different models, through so many training hours and races, and frankly, some of the models I have used have, well, pretty much stunk. Not enough support, too much support, too revealing, too much padding. If you are an active athlete, then you know what I am talking about. It seems as if so many sports bras are made for the gym, and not for the road. For those of us that swim-bike-run for 20 hours a week - or more - we need something that will give us enough support, but not feel as if we were being slowly strangled by a python. The name of this bra caught my eye, the fabric and designs looked well thought out, and the styles looked good. And more importantly, they seemed as if they would support me and not choke me. And I was right - the strapping system holds everything in place, but doesn't chafe me if I go out for a 3 hour run, or a 5 hour bike ride. When you hold it in your hands it has a very solid feel. The stitching is first rate, with no loose threads. The pads are a bit thicker than most, but are flatter, and don't make the bra look as if you are not wearing any pads at all. They are easy to remove and wash, and after repeated use, have not warped or worn out. The colors of the fabric have not run, either. And have held up to the hot Florida sun and humidity. I have bought two of these, and tried on several of the other styles, and they all fit me, true to size. The blue color criss-cross has easily seen 120 hours of use, and has lost none of it's stretch. I would recommend these highly for anyone that is an endurance athlete. My next race is a 30K in January, and I will be wearing a Running Girl Sports Bra when I line up at the starting line. I trust it that much!

reviews.title: Great lenses but....
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 17, 2019
reviews.text: When they are new, you can't beat the price, fit & finish of these lenses. They just seem to wear out fast. The coating on the lenses comes off way too easy. I have purchased a few of these and will most likely purchase more only because I love my Oakleys but am too cheap to pay Oakley prices for OEM lenses ($90 and up). My most recent Mryok lens didn't last a week before the coating started coming off. I don't expect them to be as good as OEM, but should last longer than a week. The pictures are from today, July 17. The lenses were purchased on May 22. In the close up, you can see how the coating transferred from the lens to the frames just from cleaning. Just as a little tip - I find the Oakley cleaning cloth is safer to clean these lenses than the one provided. The one provided feels nice but does remove the coating if not ULTRA careful. Also, don't take them in the pool or ocean as this will hasten the coating removal.

reviews.text: Amazing Myrok lenses! Way more lense than advertised!! Although sold as green lenses, they have a perfect blend of green purple and blue hue to them. Inside of lenses are amber. Perfect for out on the water! Viewing out of the bottom or top of the lenses gives more of an amber hue and made that lake water amazingly clear this morning. These Myrok lenses blow Oakley mariner lenses OUT OF THE WATER. I've already received several compliments and inquiries out at the lake. Great job Myrok!!

reviews.text: Pros: Price. Cleaning cloth included. Cons: Fitment The high star rating got me. Great price as compared to Oakley‚Äôs $80 MSRP which is why I give it 3 stars. Fit, well that‚Äôs another story. It is not perfect. These are slightly smaller than the stock Oakley lense. Once popped in they barely held on (they do hold - barely) and minimal pressure will pop them right back out. This is most noticable while wiping the lense clean with a cloth. The slight amount of pressure your fingers apply while cleaning them is enough to have them pop out. The old adage of ‚ÄúYou get what you pay for‚Äù applies perfectly here. If you‚Äôre ok with a 98% fit - for the price - these are for you.

The large temple full wrap design blocks side-light offering maximum coverage which makes this style perfect for driving and sports activities such as skiing, biking, running, boating, fishing, and golfing. Iditarod sunglasses feature a lightweight pliable Grilamid frame for extended comfort during long periods of use. KastKing frames are built to survive years of active use, they are ultra-lightweight, extremely flexible, resistant to heat, resistant to UV rays, and possess excellent memory to retain their original shape. KastKing polarized lenses are manufactured with high quality Japanese and German raw materials to produce a lens with excellent optical quality that is ultra-lightweight, tough, and scratch resistant. KastKing lenses pass a double decentering test to ensure they meet the highest standards of visual clarity with no optical distortion which can cause eye strain and headaches. Polarization helps to reduce glare caused by reflected light which helps to improve vision and reduce eye strain. All KastKing eyewear lenses block 100% of the harmful UVA and UVB rays. Available lens colors include smoke, brown, and copper. Smoke lenses are ideal for bright sunlight and produce the most realistic color reproduction, but also work well in medium light and partial shade. Brown lenses increase contrast and depth perception, ideal for partly cloudy to sunny conditions. Copper lenses provide excellent contrast and depth perception, best suited for moderate to low light. KastKing mirror finish lenses are protected with a tough saltwater resistant coating to protect the lenses from harsh saltwater conditions. Select from a variety of stylish mirror lens finishes and frame colors to suite your eyewear taste. Your sunglasses also includes a molded hard case and a microfiber pouch that can be used for cleaning as well as storage. Maximum Coverage The large temple full wrap design blocks side-light offering maximum coverage which makes this style perfect for driving and active sports. reviews.text: This is my second pair of KastKing sunglasses which I got in preparation for my double cataract surgery this past October. I don't really care the pair they have you walk out with; it looks prehistoric and heavy. I wanted style, comfort and clear vision - and that's exactly what I got with KastKing. You guys got sunglasses right!

reviews.title: Awesome sunglasses
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 29, 2022
reviews.text: I haven‚Äôt taken them off. I dislike wearing glasses but once I put these on they fit my face. Which is rare cause I have a big face/head. Hard to find sunglasses that don‚Äôt squeeze my face or pinch the top of my ears. The kastking glasses are affordable. I use them for fishing helps see the fish which helps with sight casting. I recommend them to anyone looking for a good pair of sunglasses. I‚Äôm gonna buy a few more just cause I love them so much!

reviews.title: So helpful for my traumatic brain injury!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 11, 2021
reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but this review may help someone else out there who‚Äôs going through similar issues... I‚Äôve been recovering from a severe traumatic brain injury (which turned into severe neuro issues) for many years. To help ease the ‚Äúpain‚Äù and effects of LED and fluorescent lights (and general light sensitivity), I have been wearing polarized sunglasses everywhere. The last pair I had, I bought from W-mart. They were ok - did the job, but very heavy and did not fit well at all. When the polarized glaze started to wear off, I looked online for a better brand of fishing glasses (typically the best source for polarized sunglasses). I found these and decided to give them a try. They are amazing! Although large for my very small head, it‚Äôs so worth wearing them! I am in the very small percentage of people who get physically sick the instant I put on ‚Äúblue blocking glasses‚Äù, but these did the opposite. They are blue on the outside of the lenses, but they are not ‚Äúblue block‚Äù glasses. My neurologist has had me try many different colored glasses to see what would help. These are the first in a long line that have helped my symptoms stay at bay (headaches, dizziness, wobbly/jerky walking, disconnectedness from right side limbs). I can even shop inside multiple stores in a day without needing to collapse into bed in the dark/quiet when I get home! I wear them as much as possible through the day - watch tv, clean, cook, drive (so awesome!), even put them over my reading glasses for the ipad (my head is very small, so I can do that - they probably won‚Äôt fit like that for most). I think part of the design in the Iditarod style that helps me is the light blocking from the sides (peripheral vision problems) - I can turn my head in all directions without getting dizzy. KastKing, thank you for helping me find more independence and relief. Your glasses may not have been designed for people like me, but they feel like a miracle!

reviews.title: This is a game changer!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 10, 2022
reviews.text: Y‚Äôall!!!! These literally just made the biggest difference I did not expect! Did a trial run of packing with and without these impressive compression cubes and let me tell you‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm blown away! Just experienced a travel nightmare back in June for a domestic flight from Dallas to Chicago and I‚Äôm not about to go through that again! Preparing for upcoming trip overseas to Greece and want to only have my carry-on and under seat bag for a week and a half worth of clothes, shoes, toiletries and cosmetics, straightener and extra stuff. Reviews really help me make up my mind so I‚Äôm going to be pretty specific in the list below of what I was able to get into my 20 inch carry-on. Largest cube: One pair of jeans, three leggings, to crop pants, three wide leg linen crop pants, to Capri leggings Medium size cube 1: three jersey cotton maxi dresses, OnE sleeveless chiffon maxi dress, One romper, One swimsuit cover (long), pajama sleep shirt Medium size cube 2: 4 sleeveless tunic tops, to under Armour V-neck athletic tees, 3 short sleeve tops, 1 3/4 Sleeve top, 1 Long sleeve eyelet cotton top, 1 Long sleeve chiffon wrap top Small size cube 1: 2 under armor athletic shorts, 2 bike shorts, pajama top and bottom set, 2 short sleeve T-shirt dress Small size cube 2: two sport bras, One wireless T-shirt bra, 4 no show sock pears, 4 Bikini briefs, 6 thongs, 1 Long sleeve cardigan, 1 3/4 sleeve cardigan Holy crap you guys! It all fit in my small carry-on! I did it a couple of ways until I figured out the best way to fold each item‚Ä¶ For me rolling seem to take up more space despite what other reviewer‚Äòs have mentioned. After placing each of the cubes I still had room for two pair of sandals and one pair of slip on espadrilles. So extremely impressed and yes as an over packer this is a huge game changer! I went back on and bought a three piece set to use for my under seat bag which will hold they set of clothes as well as cosmetics and toiletries and electronics etc.. An international trip without having to check a bag! Worth every penny! The material seems very sturdy and well-made. Zippers and stitching seem very sturdy and best of all it works! I will buy another set for my husband‚Ä¶ One thing to take note he is 6‚Äô2 220 lbs where I am only 5‚Äô3‚Äù so his clothes will likely take up more space as they are bigger and more material. Still totally worth it though for the true difference it makes!

reviews.title: These won't perform miracles but they are still pretty good compression packing cubes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 10, 2022
reviews.text: These were a must for a recent trip. Flying a budget airline and not wanting to pay for a carry on required stuffing a lot of clothes in a backpack. I tried another brand of compression packing cubes and they didn't work at all. The SuitedNomad ones did offer a fair amount of compression, plus the benefit of organization and the ability to remove the clothes easily to access other items in the backpack. Don't fill them too full or you won't be able to compress them. I think I got it just about right, having to wrestle just a little with them to fully close the compression zipper. And once closed, the zipper stayed closed and there were no signs of stressed seams. They do not compress flat; meaning they will be rather bulgy as the sides compress more than the middle (which is how they all are). The darker colors do help disguise the contents which is nice. I would give them 4.5 stars if that was an option but decided to round up to 5 because in my experience, they are superior to comparable products.

reviews.title: Looks like it gets the job done
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 9, 2022
reviews.text: I'm only hesitant to give it a perfect review because I'm unsure about its long term durability. The zippers aren't the most heavy duty and the design of the bags mean that the expand/collapse zipper is prone to catch the fabric, I already had this happen once while testing these out. It does achieve both stated purposes: 1.) Organize clothes within a suitcase, and 2.) Compress clothes to make it easier to stuff clothes for more days in a small space. After a little time trying these out, here's my tips and tricks: - When zipping up the expand/collapse zipper, I like to leave a good gap on the open/close zipper to make it easier to push out air. Also, make sure the fabric inside the expand/collapse zipper is fully out of the way while zipping up. As mentioned it's prone to getting caught. - These bags *do* have limits, and as long as enough space is being saved, not everything has to go in them. I personally just put gym shorts, shirts, socks, and boxer-briefs in them since those are the easiest to compress. - Most importantly, it takes more time and effort to use these bags than just straight throwing clothes into a suitcase. I got myself the 3-piece, Large-Large-Medium set and timed myself taking 38 seconds to zip up the medium bag and 48 seconds for the large bag, so the math comes out to over 2 minutes just to zip up the cubes. Also, it takes more time to roll up everything vs just folding it. This could be an issue in a rushed situation. Saving space needs to be weighed against convenience. The photos I posted show that I managed to shove 10 days into a 20 x 13 inch (50.8 x 33 cm) carry-on when normally 7 days is the limit, which is nice, but if I know that I can do laundry during the trip I would prefer just to pack 7 days or less normally.

title: Birkenstock Women's Gizeh Sandals
bullets: Product Dimensions  :  10 x 15 x 6 inches; 2 Pounds
Best Sellers Rank: #28,039 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry ( See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry ) #58 in Women's Flip-Flops
Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars 25,643 ratings

reviews.title: My third pair
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2022
reviews.text: I started having issues with my feet a few years ago and a friend recommended Birkenstocks and I have been wearing them ever since. I used to go barefoot all the time but as I have gotten older I have noticed various aches and pains in my feet and back. I have very high arches and my podiatrist told me I need better support for my feet. These are one of the better shoes to help support my arches. I have purchased a few pairs on Amazon and others on the Birkenstock website. I will now only purchase them on Amazon when Amazon is the seller as the ones I received from other sellers don't seem to last as long which makes me wonder about the authenticity.

reviews.title: These are great!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2022
reviews.text: I have been wearing Birkenstock Gizehs for 20 years. I don't wear any other brands or style of sandals because I love them. Yes, they are expensive but they last a really long time & can be repaired when they get really beat up. I have lost count of just how many pairs I own but I think I have at least 10 pairs. I had Plantar Fasciitis many years ago and I require good arch support to keep it from reoccurring. I have never had problem since I started wearing these. They do take some getting used to if you have not worn Birkenstocks before & they do require a little "break in" time but it is well worth the effort. I can't speak for other styles of Birkenstocks but I can say that the Gizeh runs really big so SIZE DOWN. I wear 7-1/2 or 8M in shoes but in these I wear 37 which they describe as size 6. I'm no size 6 but I can tell you that even though I'm usually 7-1/2 or 8, every pair of Birkenstocks Gizehs I have are size 37M and they fit me like they were custom made for me. FYI, Birkenstock has recently started making an EVA version of the Gizeh which is pretty much like rubber flip flops but they are practically as comfortable as the $100 ones, still have great arch support, can get as wet as you want and they cost a fraction of the price. You should be able to find them for around $40. Again, really expensive for flip flops but although I don't know how long they last, I think they are worth the price.

That‚Äôs when I realized that these brand of shoes may not be as expensive as I thought, a pair that lasts more than four years, is of good quality, and I appreciate that. I ordered one pair for mua, and another pair as a gift for my three decades old daughter, my first born, as a bday gift. reviews.title: Long break in period but worth the effort!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2022
reviews.text: At 71 years of age, my feet have issues‚Ä¶no arches, pronate badly, hammer toes and bunions. A year ago, I bought my first pair of Birks (Florida) and have worn them exclusively around the house ever since. They have been the answer to my prayers. This year, I wanted to try a different style and I chose this Gizeh sandal. They actually make my old feet look cute! The break in period was a bit painful due to the really stiff toe post that has no give. But I didn‚Äôt want to give up on them. So a week later, my feet have fully accepted the toe post and my floppy arches are in love with the arch supports built into Birkenstock footbeds! If you‚Äôre on the fence, I urge you to try the Gizeh!!!

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: I had concerns over price and size..
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 22, 2020
reviews.text: First of all, I have wanted a pair of these for years and could never justify the price tag from the original source. I was sceptical when I found these on amazon as they are very well reduced from the normal price and wondered if they were fake. I scoured the reviews and couldn't really find any evidence to suggest they are, so hey bonus! The second worry I had was the size. I am a 6.5 but normally have to size up to a 7 as hardly anywhere does half sizes, again after reading all the reviews I took the advice and ordered a 5.5, cursing myself as I did it, expecting them to arrive and have to be sent back straight away. Fast forward to today when they arrive, they are in proper birkenstock packaging, they look and feel very sturdy, the name on the side is nice and clear everything suggests that they are the real McCoy. Next test is trying them on.. and they fit!! Now they say they are a 39 so I guess you could say that they are a 6 rather than a 5.5 but either way, I certainly wouldn't be able to cram feet in to a 6. They feel secure and comfortable enough and as I've read they will get more comfortable over time. So it's a long winded 5 star review, am absolutely made up with my purchase.. well done Amazon

reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: PRETTY DARN MAGICAL üòç
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
reviews.text: ***Sorry in advance, Amazon jumbled up my photos for whatever reason üòÇ BACKSTORY: I usually wear a 34D (used to be a 34DD but apparently they shrank after having a kid üòÇ) and I needed a strapless bra for a bridesmaid dress so I researched them for DAYS. I basically loath wearing certain types of bras and I own numerous Victoria Secret bras including strapless and multiway bras, have a few backless strapless adhesive bras, cups that could be sewn into the dress and even silicone chicken cutlet looking inserts that have all proven to be mediocre, a waste of time, not supportive enough, horribly uncomfortable on hot days (yes, adhesive bras do hold in all your sweat and loose their grip not to mention they are DISGUSTING to take off) so yea, you can say I've pretty much tried everything on the market. I will say I was extremely hesitant purchasing this bra because of its expensive price tag but I can tell you in the end, it is worth it, and I could especially see this bra being magical for even bustier ladies out there! First I'll lay out some details about the bra and than the pros and cons, so if you're interested, enjoy the review! ABOUT THIS ITEM: (straight from the listing) - 91% Nylon, 9% Spandex - Imported - Hand wash and hang dry - Strapless bra with contoured cups featuring removable straps - Hook-and-eye closure at back - Cushioned lower bottom band for added comfort - Band and sides smooth and minimize bulge - Do not iron, Do not dry clean PROS: - Beautifully contours your breasts - Great coverage - Lower V point than expected so this bra works great with low cut dresses/shirts - Exceptional support - Insanely comfortable - Fit/Size was exactly as expected - Heavenly silicone lining and grippies all over the bra will ensure you can "shake it, shake it, like you're supposed to do" üéµ because this bra isn't going to budge! (Seriously people, August wedding, insanely hot summer, pre wedding game, photos, ceremony, reception, definitely a little tipsy, dance floor for hours and stayed in place without having to adjust it until I took it off that night!!) CONS: - Pretty darn pricey! I purchased mine for $68 before tax - Shipping sucked. My bra was shipped in a plastic bag in a generic Amazon envelope and was definitely squished, bent and dented upon receiving it - NOT a push up (not necessarily a con but I was under the impression it would be). CONCLUSION: The under wire in this bra is extremely supportive and for you ladies who can't have any push up because their own boobs may suffocate them, this bra is pretty amazing and you should definitely give it a try! My sister and my two besties all range from DDD-G-F and I literally want to buy this bra for each of them because of the exceptional support and silicone grippies that this bra has. It's a beautiful, almost full coverage that looks flawless under clothes & dresses without having any overhang where bras tend to pinch up top when they're too small. It also has a beautiful shape and is low enough to wear with pretty low cut v shirts/dresses. The bridesmaid dress I wore it with had a very triangular top with low cleavage dip and spaghetti straps and I was very impressed with how well it worked! For any ladies who want more oomf, you could always add in some cup inserts to give you that push up feel too. Overall, this bra was definitely pricey and the shipping sucked which is why I rated it a 4/5 but the pros of this bra definitely outweighed the cons. Honestly the bra itself deserves a 5/5 rating. I would definitely recommend trying this bra, especially for the heavily blessed ladies! This bra is pretty magical üòç.

reviews.title: The Best Slim Jogger Set On Amazon Hands Down!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2018
reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that I am 6'5, 255. I'm not ion the best shape of my life but I still have a worked out looking body. I've been searching for a while for a slim fit jogger set that actually fits me height and build correctly. And this set for the most part fit the bill. My reason for a 4-star rating is becuase of the lack of consistency amongst different colors. For ex, an XL in Blue may not fit the same as an XL in red. I ordeed a pair of joggers in Red, Green and White in XL and XXL. The XL was a little too tight. The XXL was perfect. At least I initially thought. That is until I got the Blue and Yellow pants in the XXL. Now these fit with perfection. They were slim, ankle taper was right. And they were everything I wanted in this type of style. So I order another set in another color in both XL and XXL. Now this time another type of fit. SMH. The XL fit like a tourniquet and the XXL, whjile a nice fit were not a well fit as my Blue and Yellow set. Yet both were different from my red set. There is NO consistency among sizes. Since Amazon allows free retunrs I would encourage those who are Prime customers take advantage of that priveledge and order two sizes to be on the safe side. Just return the one that doesn't fit. Other than that gripe fabric quality is good. The set is sewn very well (no loose or hanging threads). And I feel this is good quality for the price. Is it Nike/New Balance/Adidas quality? Naw. But it's still pretty good. I am happy. However I would have loved to have given this set 5 stars. But because of the inconsistency in sizing ,I am giving them 4-stars. In conclusion one thing for certain. Out of all the brands of Slim Fit Track set this brand most definitely fits the best. I plan on ordering a few more sets becuase not only are they comfortable but they are attention grabbers. If you have are in shape and have a nice lean muscular build you will turn heads.

reviews.text: This a very well made jacket at a great price. In fact, I am going to order a few more. The only issue I have with the jacket is that it does not run true to size. I typically wear a medium, but after reading some other reviews, I ordered a medium and a large, and sure enough, the medium was way too small, but the large fit perfectly. Consequently, I suggest ordering one size up from your usual size. Other than that - a very nice looking and well made garment.

reviews.title: Looks good but be careful with red. Wash alone and extensively.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2019
reviews.text: 2 purchased - Colors looked good and fit is fine for red black and white jacket. However mine arrived with some red bled into the white strips. Washing with a detergent with oxi clean and also added oxi clean, the first half dozen or so washes the water and white parts were heavily red saturated. Finally after repeated cycles and loads of detergent and oxi clean, the white parts returned to white. One of the edge seams on the chest panels slightly loosened during this time as well but was easily stitched. Beautiful but took some time to be wearable. Also purchased the green and red one. Color and sheen are very much true to the picture. The colors pretty much match the look of a great falls green VW GTI so props there!

reviews.title: Weird Sizing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 22, 2021
reviews.text: I bought this in a 2XL because of breast reduction surgery - I needed a band that wasn't tight. This is a very good bra: well-made, light, and molds to your breasts in terms of the cup. I still thought the 2XL was a little tight, so I ordered up to the 3XL. There's no difference in the band size! I compared the 2XL which I'd been wearing to the new, unworn 3XL and probably because I'd stretched it out wearing it, the smaller band size was actually longer. I'm hoping the 3XL at least stretches to the same length as as the 2XL. Pluses of this bra as compared to more expensive ones: 1. The straps are adjustable and thin (other bras of this type are a tank style with wide straps that don't adjust) 2. The band still rides up a bit (maybe it's just me and my menopausal bulges) but not nearly as much as others I've tried. 3. Really accomodates your shape, even though there appears to be little difference in the cup size from one size to the next. Minuses of this bra compared to others like it: 1. It's cut high under the arms to prevent bulges but chafes a bit there and shows if you wear a tank top with regular sized armholes. 2. The mark-up for pretty colors like blue and lavendar are extreme. This happens on a lot of sites, not just Amazon.

description: From the manufacturer Band sizes 30-58, cup sizes A-L. Glamorise since 1921 Making the best-fitting bras for curvy women is our thing. It has been since day one and it will be for generations to come. Glamorise MagicLift Original Support Bra Just the Right Balance of Shape and Comfort Our best-selling plus-size bra design takes support to new heights with a cushioned construction crisscrossing under and over the bust for wire-free lift and all-day comfort. MagicLift design lifts, shapes and supports without a wire. Contoured cups provide coverage and comfort. Wide, cushioned straps help ease pressure and relieve shoulder strain. Hook-and-eye closure with 3 columns & 3 rows increases with size. Read more Behind the Bra ‚Äì How MagicLift Does it Without a Wire Wide Padded Straps Protect Shoulders Inner-Bust Band Lifts without a wire Crisscrossed Design For secure support Read more MagicLift Original Support Bra MagicLift Cotton Support Bra MagicLift Minimizer Bra MagicLift Active Support Bra MagicLift Moisture Control Bra MagicLift Natural Shape Bra Magic Lift Design & Technology ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì Wide Cushioned Shoulder Straps ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì Front Close ‚Äï ‚Äï ‚Äï ‚Äï ‚Äï ‚úì Key Feature Wirefree Cotton Minimizer Wicking Wicking Wirefree The easiest way to find your bra size right from your bedroom. Put on an unpadded bra, grab your tape measure and let's find your bust and band sizes! Fit solutions for bra malfunctions Band Riding Up.If your brand doesn't sit just below your shoulder blades, try tightening the band or losening the straps. If that doesn't help, you need a smaller band. Band Digging In. If your band is digging into your ribs, chest or back, try loosening the band. If that doesn't fix it, you need to go up a band size or try a wider band. Straps Digging In. If your straps are digging in, try loosening them or switching to a bra with padded straps. If that doesn't help, your band ‚Äì which should be doing most of the support work ‚Äì is too big and it's time to downsize. Slipping Straps. If your straps are sliding around or off the shoulders, they might be stretched out (which happens over time). Or you might be in the wrong cup size causing the straps to sit too wide and slip more easily. Bulging Sides. If you're squeezing out the sides, your band is too small and confining your bust. Go up a band size or try a bra with more cup coverage. Overflowing Cups. If you're spilling out the side, top or bottom of your cups, it's time to trade up. Bigger cups will help keep your bust securely (and comfortably) contained. Gapping Cups. If your cups are gaping a lot or a little, try a smaller cup size so they sit flush with your skin. Dropping Bustline. If your bustline is pulling down, shorten your straps (but not so much they dig) and check your cups (there shouldn't be any gap if they're the right size). If you want even more lift, look to non-stretchy bras with firmer support and rigid straps. Poking Underwires. If your wire pokes, you might be in the wrong cup size. Too small can make the underwire too tight while too big can cause the wire to move around. Both lead to uncomfortable poking or prodding.

reviews.title: Disappointing and uncomfortable.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on May 31, 2020
reviews.text: I had high hopes for this bra. The pictures of it looked good. So when I tried it on, it was very disappointing indeed. More than a bit baggy in the cup size, but I can accept that, as I‚Äôm usually a FF and had to get a G in this bra as no FF. But also, the ‚Äòboob shape‚Äô when it‚Äôs on, is not great - a bit pointy at the seam line, and due to absence of underwire, not really very containing, or at least, not in a rounded way, more of a lateral shape, squeezed out at the sides, so not flattering at all. However, the main reasons for giving this bra such a low rating are firstly, the material is coarse, scratchy, itchy, in the cups, back and straps - not at all comfortable to the skin - I wanted to take it off again, about 10 seconds after putting it on. And secondly, in my opinion it‚Äôs very overpriced (bras often are expensive, not sure why). But I am happy to spend a reasonable amount of money on a bra that fits well, supports well, is comfortable, and (bonus) even looks nice - quite hard to tick all those boxes when you‚Äôre a FF, but the bottom line has to be comfort - we have to wear these things, against our skin, all day! I would most definitely not recommend this bra.

reviews.title: GILDAN IS GOLD IN THIS FAMILY!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 5, 2016
reviews.text: My husband is really picky about his underwear. We live in South Florida and he insists on wearing T-shirts under all his shirts. Personally as a woman, I would never choose to live my life in Florida wearing 2 layers of clothing daily on my upper body because it's way too hot here for that, but my husband claims with the right T-Shirt on underneath his shirt, he feels cooler. There seems to be 2 major brands in men's underwear from what I've seen advertised around on the Internet and in the brick and mortar stores. I'm sure you know which ones I'm talking about. My husband had a "been there, done that" attitude about his old t-shirts and I had to start looking beyond those two brands. I found him some other less well known names and he always was unhappy with the way they felt or fit. Then GILDAN entered our lives and everything changed! I found the T-Shirts listed on Amazon and decided to buy them for him and give them a try. They are well packaged, bright white and neat looking. They are long and in proportion to his body. You would think I bought my husband a hot sports car with the way he reacts to these! He absolutely loves GILDAN because of the way they feel! No more complaining about the arms or neck being tight or the shirt popping out of his pants. These t-shirts fit the same and look the same as when they were brand new. No more shrinkage and when they come out of the dryer, they are in the exact shape they were in when they were brand new! And best of all, they keep him cool! We've found ourselves a winner, folks! Thanks GILDAN! Now my husband wants me to check if they are available in colors! Going to check on that right now!!

reviews.title: Repeat Purchase With Differences
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2022
reviews.text: Amazon makes shopping so easy, simple and let's face it deliver to your place of preferred shipping makes shopping it really is a no brainer; especially with the price of gasoline these days. The only down side is when a vendor / supplier changes a product it, Amazon doesn't know. Clothes are almost impossible to buy on line with the exception of foundation items; (Socks, under garments and etc.) The original purchase has back in April of 2014...and they are still my go to pair of jeans for working around the house, the farm, wherever. Comfortable, nice medium denim weight and even with a few holes are sturdy enough to probably last another 3 -4 years. This is my third purchase of Wrangler Authentics Men's Classic 5-Pocket Cotton Relaxed Fit Jeans but will probably be my last. Like going to your favorite restaurant only to find they don't offer the "exact same" menu item, that is how I would describe this recent purchase of Wrangler jeans. Similar but not the same quality. These are made in Mexico, same product codes and etc. nothing has change but the jeans are definitely different. The first thing I noticed was how soft the denim was. It was like a bath towel. The fabric used to make the pockets are so thin, that you can almost see right through them.. The blue dye on the demin bled even after being set with my mothers patented reminder to always set clothes with salt water. Did I mention they were soft? I mean baby butt soft, you will look down just to make sure you have pants on. That is all well and good unless your wanting to purchase these to use besides lounging around the house. They are comfortable. While I am enjoying the fit, and feel of these jeans, I'm suspect they will are not going to last 8 years like their predecessors. In the past, these have been great inexpensive jeans very good value. Are they worth the purchase? if your looking for pair of jeans you can do some yard work and household chores and still hold up, I would say definitely consider other options. If your looking for a comfortable pair of Wranglers for casual wear, you might enjoy these. Just don't expect them to ever make as infamous as ZZ Top's Blue Jean Blues.

reviews.title: Real American jeans, just like you'd find in Target. Sizing hints here...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 11, 2019
reviews.text: I lived in the US for over twenty years. The last five or so, I started buying Wranglers over Levi's as they were good value for money and made just as well. There are Wranglers with a "traditional" W sewing on the back pockets - heavier duty and meant for cowboy folk riding horses and doing country line dancin' (i.e. looking the part an' probably wearin' a shirt with pearlized buttons). If you're looking for W pockets, these ain't them. Search for "Wrangler cowboy" instead. These jeans are often considered "business casual" attire and have either a line or no trim at all on the pockets. I've bought these "authentic" ones with different sewn on labels at the back, some have a red Wrangler tag on them too, while others don't. Some are made in Mexico while others are made in Nicaragua. None are made in America, but the cotton material is American. They all wear and last exactly the same way. In America, these are the jeans you'd find at stores such as Target (nearest local equivalent would be a large Tesco store), as opposed to the higher priced shopping mall fashion stores. The waist sizing is typical for American jeans - it is NOT usually accurate to your waist measurements. I wear 33" jeans - and my waist size is 37" - take that as a hint, it's typically off by 2" to 4". If you've never worn American jeans before, I'd suggest visiting a store that sells them such as a Levi's store, and trying on a few pairs to figure out what your American jeans size is. These are not "flex" material. Wrangler Flex jeans have more give at the waist. The inside length is usually reasonably accurate, with a tolerance of an inch., unless I'm shrinking. They're still best worn with boots or a decent pair of shoes. So to put anyone's mind to rest, these are actual Wranglers, meant for everyday comfortable work wear. They should last at least a few years - certainly more than double the time compared to any of the jeans I've bought from the UK stores - because the fabric is a noticeably higher quality. After finding these on Amazon, I bought two pairs and they fit like my old ones, and the price isn't much more than it costs to buy in the States (full disclosure, many states don't charge tax on clothes - I've bought these in Montana for nine bucks a pair, and fifteen bucks in Minnesota).

reviews.title: Great value. Assess carefully before ordering.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 7, 2021
reviews.text: Great fit in seat and thank goodness for jeans with a 'natural' waist. However, the legs were voluminous. Noticed, the same photo used for Wrangler 'Comfort' jeans and 'Loose' version? I guess it's alright if your legs are like giant redwood, but for me there was just too much material. Overall, I was pleased surprised at the quality of these jeans especially as they are direct US imports and the most important thing, the really competitive price! Whilst I put this down as a learning experience, and returning through a UPS Shop was a hassle, I am hanging in there and have reordered the same size Wrangler imports in a 'Regular' cut. Haven't received them yet, but fingers crossed they'll be okay? Would definitely recommend, but think about your body shape and what you want before ordering? 3* only because of the misleading photos, description and hassle returning. Quality 5*. Value 5*.

The price is an absolute bargain, you can't go wrong with them, if you like Jeans, you should by them because i doubt you could find anything as cheap as these for the quality you get.

reviews.title: Beautiful Pendant, Cheap Chain.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2022
reviews.text: I love this pendant. It's simple yet beautiful, and priced right at $20. The size (for me) is perfect. Some Pros: 1. Pendant. 2. Price. 3. Length of chain. Some Cons: 1. White Gold Plating - Pendant's reverse side plating will wear away quickly. 2. The Chain - Chain will turn your neck green. 3. Price of rechaining can be very expensive. I was able to get the pendant rechained for $20, bringing the total cost to $40+ tax. The new chain stayed on the pendant for 2 weeks of continuous use, before the chain came off. I was warned that may happen, but the alternative was to get the chain laser-welded, for $100+. Read the specifications, read the reviews. I am glad I ordered this item. It has been a good learning experience. I enjoy the pendant and .925 sterling silver replacement chain. The wearing-off of the reverse-side plating doesn't bother me, and the pendant is dainty and beautiful; simple. --I do wish the replacement chain was laser-welded for durability; but at that price, this would turn a $20/$40 gift into a $150 gift with an inexpensive, worn backside, pendant. I do wish the item came with a beautiful sterling silver chain, as advertised; even as an optional upgrade. If so, i would purchase this item again, for $35-45. As is, I would recommend to use your own discretion, and would generally advise staying away, and finding something with a real .925 silver chain, that doesn't turn your neck green. I have now had this item for 4 1/2 months.

reviews.title: Used by a motorcyclist instead of chaps or thermals
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 10, 2016
reviews.text: BLUF: They are warm as heck. Order a size or two up on the waist. Try them on at a store if you can. I‚Äôve just gotten back to riding my motorcycle again year-round again. I‚Äôve been adding layers and clothing along the way to ensure that I can ride throughout the winter, and this past week the temps and wind chill took the ‚Äòfeels-like‚Äô temperature down to 20 degrees. I really hate wearing thermals, so I decided to try coveralls at a friend‚Äôs urging. After having spent a morning looking over different styles on the internet, I determined that a quilt-lined pair of overalls is what I wanted to go with. I took a trip over to my local Tractor Supply Company who had this same brand priced at exactly $20 more. I would have bought a pair then, but they didn‚Äôt have the size that I wanted. They also didn‚Äôt have my size in their store-brand either. I assume that had something to do with going after the first major cold/freezing spell. So, the biggest benefit was actually trying them on. In reality I wear a 32‚Äù waist. When I tried on a 34‚Äù waist in the store, I thought it was a bit tight. I ended up ordering a 36‚Äù waist from Amazon, and so far, they are perfect. I don‚Äôt feel like it‚Äôs snug. I ordered roughly two sizes up and have been very happy with the result. The length is 30‚Äù, just like every other pair of pants I own. Notes on fit: -I wear them with a pair of combat boots. It‚Äôs easier getting them on than getting them off. -The zipper on the pant legs works fine. The buttons are a pain in the rear, but that might be because they are new -and very stiff. -There are so many pockets. Great for using them for their intended purpose ‚Äì overkill for riding -I don‚Äôt like the fasteners for the overall straps. They work fine, but buttons would have been easier here. This is more like a hook and loop style. -I had to take off the overalls to adjust the straps. I ordered my normal ant inseam, but had to tighten the straps quite a bit. Still would not have changed that decision. When the temps are well below 40, and half that with the wind chill, these work amazingly well. My mid-section and upper legs are toasty warm all the way down to 20 degrees real-feel, and going 60 mph. The only drawback that I found when using them for this purpose, it gets cold from about my shins down when the cold air gets up under the pant legs. This is due to them being loose at the bottom of the legs. Again ‚Äì I am not necessarily using them for their intended application, so it‚Äôs not surprising that they are loose and allow air to flow, but that‚Äôs the only drawback. Otherwise, these fit great and they keep me warm. If I only had a pair of gloves this warm.

I wear a 36√ó30 jeans so I bought a 40x30 and they are still pretty tight with any kind of pants on underneath. The only way these fit is if I only wear a pair of underwear or just a single layer of thermals underneath. I wish I would have gone like 6 sizes bigger instead of 4 sizes bigger like I did. I'm most likely going to be returning these depending on if they keep me warm enough with just a single pair of thermals under them. If I need any extra layers under these to stay warm they will be worthless to me. But they do have a pretty darn nice layer built in so we will see. I'll try to update once I get to use them for the first time out in the -6¬∞ weather I will be facing next week. reviews.title: Fits well, fairly warm but needs additional layers below 5c, finish is generally poor
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on February 18, 2021
reviews.text: Comfortably fits my average build 7 year old daughter (1m40 tall) with a little room for growth. It's kept her warm enough in the recent cold spell, but my son has an identical coat in a different colour and he needed additional layers. Finish is just ok, with lots of loose threads and the stitching came undone on the inside of the cuff on the second wear. I've patched it up as she loves the colour, but it's not a great start. The zip doesn't catch the liner unlike a lot of similar style coats. Buy slightly bigger than you need if intending to use in winter to allow for layering. Keep in mind it's not waterproof either, but a brief light shower won't seep through the seams. They pack down small if carrying in a rucksack, but no stuff sack provided. If we get a few months of wear out of it, I'd buy another. If this review was useful, I'd be grateful if you click 'Helpful'. Thank you
