reviews.title: Great little jacket...will buy again
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on February 20, 2020
reviews.text: Great little coat. My son refuses to wear big coats or rigid kind of coats. He had one like this of a different brand, except it wasn't waterproof or as good quality, he wouldn't take it off and it became far too small. So I let him pick the colour of this one and he hasn't stop wearing it since it arrived. We got caught in a huge downpour and I expected him to be soaked through when we got home....but he was completely dry under the jacket, I was actually impressed....I expected it to come through the stitched seams. The coat is smaller than I thought it would come up. I got a 3-4 as usually this is huge on my 3 year old but the coat fits perfect it's more on the size of age 3 not 4. However I'd buy again. It's a great little jacket. My son's been wearing with a jumper and t shirt underneath in the current cold weather and he says he's warm, even though I wonder as it's so thin, but he doesn't act or seem cold after long periods of time out in it. I might get him some more colour as he chose red, so hard to match alot of clothing, but it's a lovely post box red and he absolutely loves it which is great as I no longer have to fight him to put on a coat.

reviews.title: Cheap but Cute and worth the price I paid

reviews.text: The dress fits as I expected and is very flattering, but the material feels rough at first and the zipper sticks. I couldn‚Äôt zip it up when I had it on, so I had to zip it then pull it over my head to put on the dress. It looks much nicer than the actual quality. I‚Äôm hoping the material will soften after washing but it feels okay after I‚Äòve had it on for a while. The dress didn‚Äôt have many noticeable wrinkles out of the bag so I think it will make a good travel dress. I don‚Äôt have much faith in the durability, but it could surprise me. I think it is a good option for people who are trying to find a cheap dress that packs well and actually has a shape unlike a lot of the t-shirt dresses I see out there. I especially like how the bodice fits around my chest, and the pleats are very cute. I‚Äôm happy with the length, too. I‚Äôll probably buy another one! TLDR: There are flaws in the quality of the material and zipper, but it looks great! Very nice design.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2022
reviews.text: I now have two of these dresses and plan to get more. I have the Red- which is navy with bright red flowers all over, and the Beige- which is white with burgandy and dark pink flowers. I love them both. They fit well and are super flattering. They hug the waist but then fall from there so it hides any tummy bulge. I love the fit, the classy look, the weight and feel of the fabric, the pockets, the neckline, and the length. The chest and sleeves aren't tight and the dress falls just below my knee caps. For refrence I am about 5'9-5'10, 180 lbs. Small C cup. Small waist, big hips. I usually wear a 12-14 in dresses depending on the cut. I like dresses that I feel are classic and that I DO NOT need to wear shapewear with and these dresses fit the bill perfectly. I would highly recommend these dresses.

Read more Explore Pori Jewelers! Italian designed jewelry Our jewelry is carefully designed by the skilful hands of Italian artisans. Each chain is unique and special. Our jewelry is inspired by the latest fashion trends and designs, keeping us providing you with new and exciting high quality jewelry. Material Pure gold, which measures 24 karats, is too soft for use in jewelry. We alloy it with other metals--silver, copper, nickel, and zinc--to increase its strength and durability. We offer the finest 10k, 14k and 18k gold jewelry collection. Perfect gift Whether it‚Äôs a birthday, wedding, or special occasion jewelry is always the perfect gift. We have a wide range of collection, starting from stunning figaro chain to amazing mariner chain. We have it all! Read more Choose from a wide range of chains! Rope Rope chains are linked in a twisted pattern to resemble a genuine rope. Rope chains come in both delicate versions where they are a popular choice for pendant necklaces, and heavier versions where the chain itself is the main attraction. Cable Cable chain, also known as link chain, consists of a series of identical oval links that are interconnected to form a functional and beautiful chain. Rolo Rolo chains are composed of oval interlocking links with alternate links turned 180¬∞. This chain comes in different widths; smaller chains being more popular with females and larger, chunkier chains with males. Read more Figaro The figaro chain has flattened links which vary in size. It usually has 2 or 3 shorter links alternating with a longer link. Mariner Mariner chain connects a small, round link with a larger oval link. These links resemble the chain attached to an anchor on a boat. Curb The curb is a simple and classic design of flat, interlocking, identical links. Smaller curb chains work well with pendants and diamond cut or twisted curb chains tend to reflect the most light. I have long hair and I wear it in a ponytail to one side of my face. I find that this keeps my neck cooler. I am a 56 years old woman and need to protect myself from the sun. The hat goes great with a denim skirt, tee, and short kimono. It also looks great with jeans. I bought this hat for $13.99 and it was worth it. So, ladies (or gentlemen) buy this!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 16, 2022
reviews.text: I don't like to size up or down in shoes too often. If they don't fit, they don't fit a d I just look for anotherbbrand or style. It just seems that when I change sizes for length, other parts of the shoe are wrong then for me (like the width or vamp or something.) But I was really in need of a pair of ballet flats in leather. These are surprisingly hard to find. I don't want heels, I don't want embellishments, just simple, black, leather flats. I don't really like the ones with elastic as they often will pull and annoy my Achilles tendon in the back, or the toes will look curled up like an elf. But I got these. They aren't to curled up, but we're slightly short. I have a foot that fits well in pointy toe shoes, so these round ones bumped my second toe in my regular size. And the elastic didn't help. So, I went up from 9.5 to 10. I think I really would have needed a 9.75 as the 10 is just a touch too long and can slip on ff of my heel. But there is no discomfort so I kept them. If you are on the small side of a size or have a ballet dancer type toe alignment, you should be ok. If you are right on or bigger in your size, you may want to go up a half size. Look for "free returns" when you pick your size (not all third party sellers have free returns) or get them on prime wardrobe (that's what I did) to ensure you get the right size. They are really cute and I wear them very often!!!

reviews.title: A nice shoe, but not great for my feet
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 31, 2015
reviews.text: I've been putting off writing this review because I feel ambivalent about these shoes. I have two pairs of Lucky Brand Emmie ballet flats in size 6.5W, the black and the nude. Let me start with the good points of these shoes - the leather is really soft, and they have very nice, basic, uncomplicated styling, which I like. The nude were good for the summer, although they were a little darker in person than I expected. The insole has some padding, and I did not find them to be hot or sweat-inducing. I wore them barefoot or with liners in the summer - though the liners tended to show - and wear them with trouser socks or tights now. They fit fine either way. They are very light, so carrying them to change into during snow boot weather will be easy. I've worn the nude ones occasionally, and the black ones several times a week since July and the soles and heels seem to be wearing well. The soles are not slippery. I used waterproofing spray and they will tolerate light rain, though I probably would not wear them in a downpour. I had a hard time deciding what size to get. My regular size for dress shoes is 6.5M, 7 for athletic shoes and boots, and my foot is wider in the front with a narrow heel. I thought I might need the extra width in the front, so I went with 6.5W. The length is snug (i.e. without extra length, like you would wear an actual ballet shoe) but OK - I think the 7 would have been too long. I also think the M would have been too narrow in the front. However, there is a lot of extra leather around the heel. Because of the elasticized topline, the heel does not slide around or cause blisters, which often happens when I wear flats, it just doesn't look great. [Note that since writing this review, I had occasion to try on the 7M in a store, and it was too long and a bit narrow in the front, though the heel fit better. Because of the elasticized topline, the 7M actually turned up a bit in the front where there was extra room, whereas my shoes in the 6.5W do not. I believe that especially for this shoe, where the leather is soft and will stretch and the elastic will hold the shoe to your foot, a snugger fit, with less than the usual thumb's width gap in the front, is better.] The other issue is comfort. If you are the kind of person who can wear ballet flats comfortably, I expect you will find these very comfortable. Although they do not have any kind of arch support, the padding in the insole makes them better than many other ballet flats. However, I am not that kind of person. I have lowish arches and a tendency to plantar fasciitis and thus to heel pain. I knew I was asking for trouble with ballet flats, but I really like their versatility, so I started out prepared to make whatever adjustments were necessary. Initially, I wore them with the little silicone arch supports they make for flats, which I had from my last (even less comfortable) pair of flats, but I would have heel pain. I tried them with the silicone gel inserts they make for flats, and the heel pain was better, but I had arch pain. So I tried putting the arch supports on top of the inserts, and that's not bad - the extra width accommodates the combination, and while they make my feet look wider, I can now wear them all day, including light to moderate walking, without pain. Because I needed a solution right away, I went with drug-store available options, but there are probably better accessories out there, albeit for more money. I got these shoes for quite a good price, so I did not mind the additional cost of the inserts, but I'm not sure I would have wanted to pay for the shoes and better inserts, or for the shoes at full price, knowing I would need to pay for inserts also. In summary, these are nice looking and nicely made ballet flats. I did not size up in length, as many recommend, but you may want to if you want a roomier shoe and are not comfortable with a snug fit. You may want to get the wider width if your foot is wider in the front, but be aware that the heel is also wider. This is a typical ballet flat, which is not a terribly supportive shoe. If you have problem feet, these will not be comfortable for you without some kind of insert, but may be wearable with inserts. I can't say that I love the way the way these shoes feel or look on my feet (although I really wanted to), but I do wear them regularly and they do the job. If someone invents ballet flats that have great arch support and cushioning, simple lines, are made with real leather, don't cause blisters, and don't cost a fortune, I will buy them. Until then, my Lucky Brand Emmies will do.

reviews.title: Mom of two boys swears by Jungle Mocs
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2022
reviews.text: I am a Mom of two boys, 3.5 years apart. One is now 12 years old in a man‚Äôs size 10W and the youngest is 9 in a youth size 3W. I have purchased two pairs of these in brown and black since my oldest started school in 2014, starting at about size 1 youth. More often than not I am able to save the older son‚Äôs outgrown Jungle Mocs for my younger son. We have only had to replace a few pairs of the lighter tan colors, as they do tend to show stains more. The black are generally passed on to the youngest still looking brand new. I have even gotten away with hand washing them in the sink and air drying them with paper towels stuffed in them to ensure they keep their shape on the rare chance they can‚Äôt resist a mud puddle. I am amazed at some of the bad reviews these get, because these shoes hold up for multiple boys with some very basic care. First, always waterproof any suede footwear with 2-3 coats of Camp Dry spray before you let your young man wear them. Do that 2-3 times a year. A suede brush and a damp washcloth goes a long way at keeping daily dirt and grime off. Teach your little men to not drag their toes to stop while riding a scooter, bike, swinging on a swing, etc‚Ä¶point out how that habit destroys even the most sturdy shoes. Inspect their shoes often and snip or burn off any loose threads before your sweet boy can‚Äôt resist tugging on one while trying to sit still in class. Always purchase at least two pairs of shoes for your kiddos; it‚Äôs not healthy for their feet, or the longevity of their shoe, to wear the same pair everyday. Feet sweat a lot, and a shoe will last longer if you rotate between two pairs, and allow one to dry out for 24 hours. Always wear socks and a shot of Lysol weekly keeps them sanitary and stink free. Purchase a shoe sizer and make sure you are buying the right size and width; try to resist buying big for grow room. These Jungle Mocs have outlasted my two very active boys and been passed on to younger cousins with this basic care. These are truly bullet proof boys school shoes for us, and we haven‚Äôt had a P.E. teacher complain yet, that they aren‚Äôt supportive enough for running and exercising.

reviews.text: I ordered these shoes twice. Returned both and gave up. I then decided to use the cm measurement on the Size Chart provided by Merrell on Amazon. She measured 18cm precisely and fit Size 12. We bought. They arrived and were waaaay too large. I'm estimating she's likely size 10. But as this is too much work to actually find out, I'm giving up. They are very heavy too. reviews.title: Buyer beware: defective product and defective seller attitude means one should avoid Captain Dave!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020
reviews.text: I really like these retro-style military type sweaters, and I own three of them (an RAF and two Royal Marine sweaters). I have had them for months or years, without any problems. I purchased the sweater in the photo from Captain Dave just before Christmas. I got it in a large, the same as the other sweaters I wear. The first time I wore this sweater, it tore, as you can see in the photo. The hole on the right was immediately noticeable; the smaller tear I saw soon after. I asked about returning the sweater for a refund, but Captain Dave's return policy is that the buyer has to cover the cost of return shipping. Having been accustomed to, and spoiled by, Amazon's return policy, I was frustrated that Captain Dave would not cover the return cost. I am out almost $53 for a cheaply made sweater, and I have to pay to get a refund? How is that in any sense fair or just? It isn't. Sadly, in this case, the Amazon A-Z Marketplace refund policies does not apply; I had several emails with Amazon, as well as chats. I guess Captain Dave has its own alphabet, possibly spelled RIP-OFF or CHEAP, that is outside the A-Z of Amazon. If you choose to buy from Captain Dave, know that you take a risk. I have a sweater that I am too embarrassed to wear or even give away to a thrift store.

reviews.title: Love my Frogg Toggs
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2022
reviews.text: This is my second set of Frogg Toggs. The first set is about 7 years old and after numerous uses and washings had lost a fair amount of their ability to shed water. Still, they are light-weight, flexible, well ventilated, and easy to pack. I was disappointed when my new set did not arrive with a stuff bag. But that is my only complaint. These are good for light to moderate rain conditions and relatively short exposures (1- 2 hrs). It's hard to get better protection with light-weight materials. Still these are my favorite light-weight rain gear. Give them a try.

reviews.title: Great product love it, But make sure you dont get these from Froggtoggs main site
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2013
reviews.text: Make sure you order these on AMAZON or AMAZON prime in case you need a exchange. This set of rain gear I purchased through Amazon Prime and this dealer sent the correct set and size A+ please read below if in case your thinking of ordering from frogg toggs direct web site.. Warning : if you order these DO NOT get them through the original froggtoggs site their customer service is absolutely horrible!!! I been calling for days and no reply just to ask if I can exchange on a previous order the set I bought before this set of rain gear, they answer the phone, but the woman who does returns Never returns a email or phone call and I left over 14 calls to the place along with numerous emails just asking if I can exchange them, because they do not return your money under no circumstances at all that is listed on their site. So a word to the wise buy from Amazon PRIME at least you can return them or get them from a stone and mortar dealer that you can try on the stuff.. or you will be out 95 dollars and have rain gear to fit a giant. even if I was 6'4 the pants would have been too big!! Update: on 6/17/13 I finally got a live person to help since the person dealing with returns never answers the phone or returns calls or emails. Anyway I ended up getting a return number. I tracked the return and it was accepted by frogg toggs AKA Guntersville breathables and item was signed for. Today is 6/24/13 I called to get a status update and no luck with some one to help you there. The operator is nice, but it's too bad she can not connect me with a live person again customer service is horrible.. As for now Guntersville breathables DBA frogg toggs has my money and the product and no customer service what so ever.. I will call back and try again. I will update again when I hear something. UPDATE: on 6/24/13 I called Guntersville breathables DBA frogg toggs, and spoke with (Tina) the operator who then connected me to a Girl Named (Ashley) who told me their is a woman named (Judy) who was not available at the time or not there today.. Judy who does the returns in the order they are received and will take 3 weeks or more to process the return. also this Returns rep Judy is the only ONE that handles returns. I was informed there was nothing more I can do to make this go faster. So a warning to the people who order from the frogg toggs web site beware if you need a exchange... basically I will have no rain gear this summer for my weeks of traveling. Also if you try to email them you get a failure delivery repeatedly, I guess this is a small operation being only one person handling returns I see now this is going to be a long dragged out process.. so Like I said if you think you might need customer service I'd pay the extra at a brick and mortar store or AMAZON Prime because by the time you pay the return shipping your over what you would pay at the store, and the store will provide you with some level of customer service. bottom line order these from AMAZON PRIME they atleast will make things right if you have a problem. Update 7/19/2013 Had to call frogg toggs back said my jacket was on back order and Should be here at the end of August 2013 and the tek toad pants would be here in September sometime. Hopefully at this point a refund would have been better especially when frogg toggs never sent me notice of any back order. Just plain ole bad service and operations will not ever repeat business with them or their product again. Update: 7/29/13 I was contacted by a woman named Misty on 7/29/13 Misty was very pleasant to speak with and very professional. Misty offered to send out a upgraded rain suit on 7/30/13 for me to look at and see if I liked it. She also said she would email me with a tracking number and then I would have her contact information also. as of 8/2/13 still no email and yes I checked my email spam folder nothing there either, so I guess I'm back to square one at this point very frustrated. Update: after months of dealing with froggtoggs directly still no customer service at all.. no one returns calls.. they did end up sending me a totally different gear than I ordered, I guess I'm stuck with this unwanted gear(garage sale)trust me DO NOT buy directly from Froggtoggs.com if they don't have it in stock you will end up getting whatever they send you,and this is acceptable by the BBB because I got stuck with it, so make sure you read terms or description for returns. I never had problems using amazon prime. Amazon always has a good contact number or email that's not bogus, unlike frogg toggs.. Although I had a really bad experience with ordering from Frogg Toggs.com I hope to save someone else from being stuck with leftovers they want to send you and keep $$$. you should get what you order on that note I was scammed out of a little more than 90 US dollars.. Froggtoggs customer service did lie to the BBB about contacting me if she contacted me id have the emails and she never called or attempted to email me Misty William in customer service you lied..

reviews.title: Cheap and effective for motorcycle use
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2022
reviews.text: This is the third set of Frogg Toggs I've bought to go over motorcycle gear. The material is flimsy but then again its not being subject to abrasion or stress on a static rider. Best of all, unlike polyester/ nylon it does breathe a little so you don't get sweaty. This particular model also has a detachable hood which can be discarded.

reviews.title: These are actually Scottish weather proof
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 24, 2022
reviews.text: Rare you actually find that are actually waterproof. I have used many alleged waterproof clothing for motorcycles and every one of them claim 100% waterproof, but they are 100% not waterproof they are showerproof only as in a very quick shower (proof) however Frog Togs these are very waterproof, these are by far my best suit I have purchased, I ran my arm under the water/sink tap full flow for 30 seconds, nothing got through despite being very thin material nothing got through I absolutely love using these on my motorcycle as they are very wind proof as well, I do not get cold even in the -1¬∞ temperatures. A great buy A+++ I will definitely buy again.

reviews.title: Ignore the bad reviews. Frogg Toggs are great.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 18, 2022
reviews.text: If you're after a luxurious fashionable coat, this isn't it. If you wan't a cheap, well cut and sensibly designed shell to keep the rain off then I'd strongly recommend it. It will keep you dry and crucially it will work with anything from a T Shirt to thick down jacket underneath. You put this on when it rains and take it off when it stops. I'm not sure how breathable it really is but breathability in general is vastly overrated for rainwear. It does NOT have pockets but this is a shell. A refreshingly good product from a company thats not built on hype.

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Favorite out of 3 shirts purchased
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 16, 2018
reviews.text: My kid's little league team is the Miami Hurricanes this season, so I bought this NCAA Miami Hurricanes Women's Distressed School Arch Heathered Grand Slam Tee, Large, Charcoal HTR along with 2 other add-on items around the same price range ( each less than $10).: Alta Gracia NCAA Miami Hurricanes Women's Short Sleeve Spun Scoop Tee, Green, Large & NCAA Miami Hurricanes Women's Double Pattern Scroll Favorite Short sleeve T-Shirt, X-Large,Kelly I read several reviews before purchasing, and was well aware that this shirt runs small, so I ordered a large. I'm a 5ft tall, and 142lbs, nursing mom, and typically wear a size medium. The large fit well, and of the three shirts I purchased, this was by FAR my favorite. The V-shaped neckline was perfect, especially as a nursing mom. The fabric is a nice soft distressed cotton blend, which I found to be the coolest option. I also noticed that the distressed fabric is also slightly see through when you hold the shirt up to a lamp, but that was not an issue while wearing the shirt. This shirt also has the most comfortable stretch to it out of the three that I purchased. Of the other shirts ( all of which, also ran small): NCAA Miami Hurricanes Women's Double Pattern Scroll Favorite Short sleeve T-Shirt, X-Large,Kelly has a crew neck, and was a lighter/brighter green, but felt longer than the other shirts when it was on. I think it might have been ever so slightly longer (maybe 1") than the others. It was personally my least favorite because of the crew neck, but fine otherwise, and also a great option. :) Alta Gracia NCAA Miami Hurricanes Women's Short Sleeve Spun Scoop Tee, Green, Large ranked second place for me. The scoop neck stretched just enough to be able to nurse in it, and the material was typical stretchy t-shirt material, but I noticed the cut could have been better, as there was some minor bunching at the shoulders (as seen in that product image on the product page,) BUT I was able to find matching shirts for my two youngest kids with this toddler shirt NCAA Miami Hurricanes Toddler Short Sleeve Tee, 2 Toddler, Dark Green !! Again, this shirt took the cake for me. Looking forward to wearing this all season long! Go Canes!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 22, 2021
reviews.text: I purchased this cross for a different reason than most people probably do. I wanted something to remind me whenever I look into the mirror of who I am (Christian) and to remind me of not just my faith, but my actions. That being said, I purchased this Cross sometime in 2018. Since that time it has been on my neck 24 hours a day, seven days a week, 365 days a year. The longest it's been off of my neck is about 10 hours, and that being because I didn't want to look in the mirror and see it, I just wanted to be mad. The Cross is still as shiny as the day I purchased it. The chain is still strong. It is more that what I was expecting and what I paid for. I would recommend it to a friend.

reviews.title: Not Titanium - False Advertising!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 5, 2019
reviews.text: I got this cross today. It is remarkably heavy for a "titanium" cross, but beautiful and well made. I love the weight of it, actually, and the design. I ordered another cross, almost identical in size, but the description in the title for that one was Stainless Steel. They are virtually identical, except that the other one sold for a fraction of the price. I will say, however, that this one being heavier (titanium is extremely light) and more aesthetically pleasing, is hands-down my favorite of the two. Four Stars only because they use the word Titanium in the title description (and it is currently being touted as "Amazon's Choice for 'titanium cross'") when in fact every other description of this cross states - stainless steel. Wonderful cross! Bad advertising description.

title: Casio Protrek Tough-Solar PRW3500-1 Multi-Band 6 Triple Sens
description: Product Description Casio Protrek Tough-Solar PRW3500-1 Multi-Band 6 Triple Sensor Wristwatch Triple Sensor Version 3, advanced CASIO original technology that makes it possible to pack sensors 95% smaller than those of previous models into a totally new type of compact PRO TREK. Despite their smaller size, the new sensors in this model provides improved reading accuracy and energy efficiency. This new Triple Sensor Version 3 model delivers altitude, barometric pressure, and direction readings that are more accurate than previous models. A Barometric Pressure Tendency Alarm alerts the wearer to sudden changes in pressure readings, which can indicate upcoming weather events. This model is water resistant up to 200 meters and features Full Auto LED display illumination, which makes it a great choice for wet environments and nighttime operations. In terms of both functions and looks, this Triple Sensor Version 3 provides a choice of outdoor timekeeping gear that can't be beat. reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: This One's Special!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2016
reviews.text: Well now!!! This one's something special, isn't it? A little nicer than the rest. Of all the Casio's I own, this PRW-3500 is my favorite. NOTE: This watch's LCD display is MUCH clearer and brighter than the Amazon image(s) show! See other web images, it's very impressive. For comparison, I currently own: PRG-270-1 (black, some orange print) PRG-270D-7CR (titanium band) PRW-3000-2BCR (blue/purple) GW-9400-1CR Rangeman WV-300 Wave Ceptor (discontinued) And now, the PRW-3500-1CR All of the new Casio sensor v3.0 watches have come a long way in accuracy. Where I couldn't accurately calibrate the earlier Pathfinders, I can now calibrate everything and get very accurate readings with the new Pro Trek series. Here are some comments on the functions: COMPASS: Very accurate, works as good as my mechanical compasses. The movable bezel on this model is redundant, but still very useful and looks classy. Note: all magnetic compasses are negatively affected by magnetism, metal objects, etc. Best not to be used in the car, near electrical equipment or audio speakers which have powerful magnets. Best out in the field - and always calibrate right before using. BAROMETER: Accurate to within .05 inHg. More accurate than than my iPhone Weather Channel App, because it's real-time, whereas with the phone app you have to wait for periodic updates plus there may be a discrepancy due to the Weather Channels' sensor location(s). The barometer's Weather Alert mode works great on all of my Pro Trek's. Activate it when you know foul weather is coming over the next 24 hrs, and it will alert you when storms are approaching. Also good for camping & hiking - you can activate it to be alerted about any sudden storm approaching so that you have enough time to find cover. ALTIMETER: Affected by air pressure, so accuracy is more general, although the reading intervals have been improved. Best for hiking than car rides because snapshot intervals aren't suited for fast movement across terrain, they're suited for walking and cycling. Also, if you're hiking and a storm is approaching, your readings will not be accurate because changes to the barometric pressure will affect the altimeter readings. best use in stable weather. That said, it truly is the best technology available short of a GPS device. TEMPERATURE: Very accurate. I have all of my Pro Trek's calibrated using a small electronic temperature gauge, and all of them read exactly the same as my wall-mounted digital temperature gauge (when located at the same location as the watches). You have to take the watch off to get accurate readings, and this will probably never change due to the proximity of the sensor to your body. The sensors are very sensitive - simply picking up the watch will effect the reading. I recommend keeping it off for 30 minutes (not 10, 15 or even 20) to give the watch enough time to fully acclimate. If temperate is important to you, clip the watch to your backpack or tent. Do not leave it in the sun. BACKLIGHT: Works great. I love the brighter illumination of the new LED lights. In pitch dark you may be able to find items in your tent. I am very happy that Casio changed the afterglow limit from 1 second to 3 seconds. A one-second backlight limit (Pathfinder series) on any watch is an immediate deal breaker for me. I love the backlight's Auto-On feature: I wear one to bed and just flick my wrist to see the time whenever I wake in the middle of the night. I also love the location and knurled feel of the backight button - easy to feel in the dark. BATTERY: I've been using a couple of these models for a while now and have yet to see a fully charged battery reach Medium from normal use. I suppose you can run it down pretty quickly if you keep using the backlight too much. When they're new I'll leave them on a sunny window sill all day for the first couple of days for maximum charge. After that I regularly put them in a window sill once or twice a week for several hours just to keep them topped them off. ATOMIC TIMEKEEPING: Reception depends on your area and current weather conditions. This function only works at night, (usually 4am for me), even when wearing the watch. It doesn't work well for me on cloudy or bad weather nights, but you don't need to calibrate more often than once a week even if you're particular about accuracy. Don't expect to be able to calibrate 24 hrs a day unless you live very close to the radio transmission. I've got an Atomic Casio from 10 years ago and it has always synchronized, usually without me having to place it in a window. Keep it away from magnetic items like audio speakers. ALARMS: The 5 alarms are cool to have, but there's no way to label them to distinguish which alarm is for what purpose. I love the Snooze alarm - however, I do wish it had the ability to choose specific days of the week, such as only M-F (exclude weekends). So it's either all or nothing with the alarms - you'll have to remember to turn them off when you don't need them to be on. The alarms on the Pro Trek's are about as loud as they get with Casio watches. Just so you know, if these aren't loud enough for you, don't bother looking at other digital watches. I also have the Casio G-Shock Rangeman (much more expensive than the Pro Treks) and its alarms aren't even as loud as the Pro Treks (that's not to discredit the Rangemen, it's an incredible timepiece!). So in any case, if you're going to wear your digital watch covered by the sleeve of your Gor-Tex down-lined wilderness coat in 20 MPH winds - it's not likely you're going to hear the alarms. And I doubt you'll hear them in your nylon tent flapping in the winds at the top of that mountain peak either. It's just not gonna happen. In fairness, I know of no other digital watches that are louder. And for those who think a vibration feature is the answer, imagine the cost, size and need for more battery power being a major obstacle. SUNRISE/SUNSET: Once I properly calibrated for the LAT/LONG of my exact location, this feature is now in perfect sync with The Weather Channel app on my iPhone. (You'll have to find the lat/long website calculator for your area, Amazon won't allow me to post the link.) Other functions such as the stopwatch, countdown timer, world time, hourly chime, etc. are all standard features, and work as well as you would expect. v3.0 ProTrek watches are as accurate as the technology gets without GPS, but here's the best thing: they are the simplest effective gadgets to use! No batteries to change, no need to ever set the time and date again, and the user-interface is intuitive (after a quick read through the booklet). And the learning curve, if there even is one, is low and even fun. The instructions are great, and provide lots of important tips for best use. ONLY ONE CON: The band is very difficult to remove on my PRG-270-1, and this one is even more difficult due to the hole in the rubber strap retainer. It's very frustrating trying to get the strap to slide out from under that retainer. The best way I've found so far is you have to be able to use one hand to both pull the strap out while also squeezing the rubber retainer enough to get the strap's hump out from under it. This would make more sense if you own the watch and can see it visually. But this is by no means a deal breaker, as long as I can get the watch off without breaking it, I'm OK. Highly recommended!! I'm very excited to own this beautifully made electronic timepiece. Casio has come a long way. Don't hesitate to buy one!

reviews.title: Spectacular Watch With A Subpar Band
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2022
reviews.text: I've had several atomic solar Casio watches over the years and they have been tough as nails and have lasted forever. So when I wanted a new one with some extra features for outdoor activities, this is the watch I chose. Atomic time? Check. Solar charging? Check. Waterproof to 20bar? Yes. Compass? Yes. That's all of the boxes I needed checked. Watch does run on the larger side but is not heavy compared to others in this size range. Display is clear and backlight works well. (I had originally bought the PRW-3510Y-8CR which has the inverted display but I found that the inverted LCD to be difficult to read. The PRW-3500 is much easier to read in daylight.) My biggest gripe is the band. The resin bands that come with many Casio watches are stiff and this watch is no exception. Like I said, I had originally ordered the PRW-3510Y-8CR which is the same watch but with inverted display and a green band. The green band is made of rubber and is much more compliant and comfortable than the one that comes with this watch. I don't know why Casio would choose to put a rubber watch band on one model and not the others. Also, the band on this watch pulls arm hair like no other watch I have ever had. There are two "pads" by the watch bezel where the band is attached. They can move and trap hair under them which pulls every time the watch moves on your wrist. I was able to correct the problem by trimming the pads to provide a gap between the pad and the bezel. This stopped the hair pulling immediately. I can now love my Protrek 3500!

reviews.title: A very impressive, accurate, feature laden digital atomic wristwatch, complete with sunrise/sunset!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2022
reviews.text: Being a newer, more tech savvy Casio ProTrek digital men's wristwatch with a plethora of functions, this timepiece is by far the MOST capable, accurate, resilient, and feature packed wristwatch by Casio ProTek that I currently own, and love! Among its numerous attributes include atomic time keeping, 4 alarms plus snooze function, a compass display, barometric pressure reading, current temperature data, sunrise/sunset information, as well as an altimeter function that are in increments of 5 feet, which I find MOST useful for everyday use. Along with those amenities, this watch from Casio even has 48 world time readings (31 time zones), an intuitive stopwatch function with a countdown timer, and it can automatically adjust for daylight savings time. One minor caveat is for such an elaborate and amazing watch, the included resin band is rather basic and not as comfortable as my previous ProTek watch, which was the one that had moon phase and tide data capabilities. On the other hand, I especially appreciate the bold time display that appears on the sturdy bezel, since my last one had a rather small time reading on it. Overall, this ProTrek item is excellent, and I certainly recommend it highly to others!

reviews.title: Great watch for outdoor explorers
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on September 26, 2021
reviews.text: Let me start with this. There is one thing I would improve on this watch. Watch strap! It is nice and somewhat comfortable, my wrist is in the middle of two links where I can not find the perfect fit. It's either too loose or too tight. Aside from that, this watch is perfect. I already dropped it from 3 feet to ceramic tile. Not even a scratch on it. Unlike g shock, I don't see any shock resist material but it sure handled it like nothing happened. Tough solar only took half a day on the window ledge too become High from medium battery level. Time is atomic perfect accurate. Backlight is amazingly bright. Watch face is ready to read. I added tempered glass watch face protector. Even though unidirectional bezel would've been better, bidirectional bezel is solid and won't turn unless you wanted it to. I work in marine environment and water, mud, and sun are three primary daily conditioning I have to deal with. Although it's not g shock mudman/mudmaster, it is excellent in water and occasional mud condition. Simply dip it in the clean water and shake it in there for couple minutes and all is clean. Buttons are big and robust even though it's not made with metal. Hard plastic is sufficient enough to handle some bumps and rare hard hits. Sensor is exposed plastic and not rubber protected like g shock, but it hasn't been damaged nor broken off and works great. I could've gotten the negative display model with anodized black bezel but I decided to go with this model because positive watch face is much easier to read when in a boat or near water /marine environment. As per my very first complaint about the strap, the watch strap needs some improvement. However other than that one minor complaint, I wholeheartedly recommend this watch. This recommendation is coming from G shock affectionate (also eco drive drive watch owner).

reviews.title: Solid
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on August 25, 2017
reviews.text: Well I have had the watch for about a week now and I think I know it well enough to write my review...I bought this watch because it is a solid looking outdoor watch that I think can transition pretty easily for regular daily wear - it is classy enough looking yet rugged, but not overpowering. Outdoors I use it only for very simple activities...walking the dog, hiking, biking, kayaking, some camping but nothing super extreme. First impression is that it is a well built, nice looking , quality watch. One thing I do wish is that it had a pop of color...it is a bit plain albeit rugged looking. I think it would be better if the NSWE letters were painted something other than black. Mine came charged to "Medium" and only took about 36 hours or so in the windowsill/table to reach "high" charge. I put it on and it was comfortable but it does pull arm hair a little bit, though I found it stopped after a few minutes of wear and really this doesn't bother me at all anyways. I set my home city to Halifax and set my coordinates for Fton NB. The sunset/sunrise times are bang on any other estimate. The compass seems accurate to me although I haven't calibrated this. Altimeter and barometer seem consistent but not perfectly accurate, although again I haven't calibrated anything. The temperature does read high of course by maybe 10 degrees Celsius but it is pretty accurate when off the wrist for a while. The atomic syncing so far is hit and miss - of the 4 nights I placed it in my North facing bedroom window it has sync'ed once (likely due to good conditions) I am just under the maximum range from Colorado time station by something like 80 Kilometers (I think ) so if the watch can sync once or twice a month I would be more than happy. Stop watch is useful for day to day stuff (walking running hiking bbq'ing even). I would almost prefer if the bezel didn't move although it doesn't seem to move so easily that it moves without you wanting to move it. I did a fair amount of research and opted for this one over a Master of G Rangeman G Shock because I was more intrigued by the ProTrek line and it seemed to suit my style more. You can find a watch with all these features for less but you pay for ProTrek and the higher end materials they are made with. Overall am happy with my purchase would recommend to just about anyone. A really cool watch I'll wear for years.

reviews.title: ... me start out by saying this is a damn good watch. It's great for daily use or camping
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on February 4, 2017
reviews.text: Let me start out by saying this is a damn good watch. It's great for daily use or camping. This thing has a lot of features. PROS: -Nice long strap will fit around wrist of winter gloves -Temperature sensor can be recalibrated, accurate to 0.1 degrees -Can be set to metric or imperial -Several different display modes for date and time -Functions for long periods on a single day of sun exposure -Can be set to conserve power when not in use CONS: -When setting anything on the watch the lower button on the right side increases the value and the higher button decreases it. Very counter-intuitive -The barometer skips out regularly often missing stretches of several hours -The backlight can be set to come on for 3 seconds at most. My previous watch, a cheap timex, had a feature called afterglow where the backlight would stay on as long as you were pressing buttons. I'm hard pressed to think why my $300 watch should lack such a useful feature found on a $60 watch.

reviews.title: Perfect!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2022
reviews.text: These pants are crazy soft, not see through and have a great amount of stretch for comfort. True to size as well. I probably have about ten pairs of these because they just work. They also last a very long time- I have thick thighs and they have yet to rip in that area iykyk. Oh and the pockets are perfect for holding a large phone and a set of keys while working out.

reviews.title: Comfortable and Great Pockets
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2019
reviews.text: I love that this has good sized pockets! It seems to be quality material that is soft and comfortable. I am 5'3" 120lbs and the small fit great. They are not too tight (similar pants I have are tight on my calves) but are flattering. They are thick enough to easily pass the "squat test" and I do not worry about them being see-through during my workouts. The only drawback is that the lining is not as breathable as I'd like and I feel like it's a little warm for workouts - not bad enough to keep me from wearing them or ordering more though. Granted it's summer and a workout is hot anyway! These are definitely perfect for wear outside of a workout if you just want comfy pants. I ordered the Capri Pink and they are a lilac color that I really like.

reviews.title: My Favorite Leggings
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
reviews.text: So flattering and comfortable. The fabric is a bit thick so it's perfect for fall and winter. I'm sad to have to stop using them in warmer weather! Pockets are deep and hold my huge phone easily. There's also a hidden pocket in the waistband for money, ID, or credit cards. A bit long on me (I'm very short) but not so long I'd need to complain about it. Easy to pull on. I have big thighs and sometimes leggings don't feel like I can ever pull them up enough - constant fight between thicc thighs, big butt, and the fabric pulling down BUT not with these leggings. They stay put really well.

reviews.title: Comfort with Seams
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2019
reviews.text: I needed a sturdy pair of leggings for cold weather outings and these seemed to fit the bill. I also wanted to a pair that wouldn‚Äôt have see thru areas when stretched over my wider parts. These definitely held up their end of the bargain. The only thing that I wish was a bit different would be the many seams running thru these leggings to make them so sturdy. If there were solid, sturdy leggings without all of the seams, I would have rated it with 5-stars, but otherwise, these are functional and supportive outerwear for Winter!

reviews.title: Best yoga pants ever!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020
reviews.text: Best yoga pants ever! I‚Äôm 5‚Äô4 190lbs and ordered XL (my normal size, big booty) they fit great! I love the feel of these but most importantly I love that they don‚Äôt slide down. I don‚Äôt have to worry at the gym they stay up and they are not see through. I have 2 black pairs and a navy pair and will be buying more. The pockets are and amazing plus, my iPhone X fits perfectly with no worries of it falling out. There‚Äôs just the right amount of stretch and they are really soft and comfortable. Love the high waist, hides the mommy belly and has a great slimming effect. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.title: Awesome leggings!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020
reviews.text: I am in love with these leggings! I ordered a black pair first and went back to order the grey pair! I am an avid runner and never have to pull these up on a run. I also love lounging around the house in them because they are super soft and comfy. They are also very nice quality and not see through when squatting. I was worried about the quality with the price being so low, but I like these leggings even more than my one pair of lululemon leggings (that were way more expensive). I definitely recommend these and will probably order some more for myself in the future!

reviews.title: Highly recommend!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2020
reviews.text: These are amazing! Soft, move with you, comfortable and stay in place and keep you in place too! Wore them today for the first time and I love them! reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: The Great Hunt of 2018 for the ever elusive 'Black Pointy Ballet Flat'.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 4, 2018
reviews.text: As I'm starting a new job on Monday, I wanted to spruce up my wardrobe a bit. I searched high and low, granted there's a pretty small distance between those two as I live in a fairly small town, but nevertheless I was determined to find a pair in store. Belk, Kohls, TJMaxx, Rue 21, Wally World, Old Navy and then finally Payless. Payless was my last hope. I walked in, the women were rude, finally after browsing one came up, gave me the "special's spiel" and went on her merry way. I found a pair that I actually liked for $24 and found a pair of random shoes that were a $1 with "the sale". I also picked up a pair of buy one get one free no-show socks. I thought about it for a minute, and decided to search Amazon real quick....found this pair within a minute. So I decide to put my shoes back and order these; I did keep the socks though. I get up to the counter, and the stereotypical 'I'm angry that my parents are making me get a stupid job, so I'm going to be a giant a-hole to everyone' college girl say's "you put your shoes back...?" as if questioning my sanity as to why I would ever reject her special over priced black pointy flats and mulberry mini heels (the $1 shoe I picked). "Yea, I didn't particularly care for the $1 shoes, and one pair at $24 seemed a little high, so I hopped on Amazon real quick and found a pair....but I would like these socks, please." *Blank/annoyed stare as she rings up the socks.* "That'll be $6.87" "Ummm....they're supposed to be buy one get one free, and one pair is $3.99, so I'm not understanding the math there..." "They're buy one get one HALF OFF" "Oh, well that's not what the other lady said. *attempting to diffuse the situation* you know what, I'm sure I just misheard, my bad. *I know dang good and well I heard correctly. I'm 25 and I'm starting to get wrinkles....but my hearing is still fully intact*. "You know, $6.87 is a bit to rich for my blood for just two pairs. I'll have to pass on these as well, sorry to waste your time." "Yea." To wrap this story up, I'd like to note that two of the most adorable little old ladies were in the store and I'd overheard 'angry college girl' being super rude to them. You can be rude to me, but if you're rude to a white, permed, and short haired little 85 year old that's wearing a sweater which says 'I love my grandkids', you probably won't be forgiven at the pearly gates for that one...just sayin'. Now, onto THESE bad boys. The suede actually looks nice and well done. The fit is great, I ordered an 8.5 (my normal size) and their true to size. I will say, they're pretty narrow. I have narrow feet so they fit me nice and snug, but if you had wider feet, or bunions, you'd probably want to look elsewhere, or order a wide if they have them. Comfy to walk in, I don't expect blister, albeit I'm going to be sitting in a cubicle, not a lot of physical activity involved there. My only complaint (which is why I gave 4 stars), is that on the inside of the shoe, they didn't set the top layer down correctly, so there's a bump. That probably makes no sense, but I took a picture to show you. Overall great shoes and I'm overjoyed by the price. I will never shoe shop among actual humans again...only Amazon robot shopping from now on.

reviews.title: Soft Material = Quick Creasing :-(
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 21, 2019
reviews.text: Just got these a few days ago, wore them for the first tine today. I was pretty impressed with these when I put them on. Color's a true taupe the fit is SO comfortable. Ive got long fingers and toes and these covered my toes completely. The cushioned areas are well placed, walking is very comfortable without additional support though eventually I'd probably put in an insole anyway because.....flats. Size is a true fit, my foot is very comfortable including the toe box. Nothing feels cramped or too loose. The dealbreaker is I think the material which is a double edged sword. On one hand its great that its soft, because there's no breaking in period for wearing the shoes. Unfortunately that softness also enables creasing very easily. Ive walked maybe 1/2 - 3/4 of a mile in these today and and have a very noticable crease about a quarter inch down from the point of the toe box. I read in some other reviews about this but i thought it would take more time for the crease to happen and I could deal with that. This is bothering me alot more than I thought it would as it does ruin the visual appeal of the shoe. I was going to get the blacks of these too and interchange them daily for work ....but I may have to go with something thats made of firmer material and just try to break them in. I'm really not sure. Im not really docking a star for this but should mention that the right shoe also had some slight discoloration on the left side of the toe box. Edit: I've worn these shoes about 3 more times since initially posting this review, walknog the same total distance with long breaks in between. The crease doesn't seem to be getting any worse, so I'm guessing if you walk for only 15 or 20 mins at a time with long breaks in between the crease has time to kind of recover. I'll be getting the blacks ones.

title: Yaktrax Hiking and Walking Traction Cleats for Snow, Ice, and Rock
bullets: Lightweight and affordable slip-on traction cleats to reduce the risk of falls when walking on snow or ice to work, school, or even to the mailbox
Made of abrasion-resistant 1.2 mm steel coils with zinc coating to prevent rust; secured to shoes with durable Polyelastomer outer band
Provides 360 degrees of traction on cold surfaces for all-direction stability
Highly elastic outer band with heel tab slips easily slips on and off of shoes; perfect for pedestrians, professionals and the elderly
Available in four sizes: X-Small (W2.5-6/M1-4.5); Small (W6.5-10, M5-8.5); Medium (W10.5-12.5, M9-11); Large (W13-15, M11.5-13.5)
description: Product Description Yaktrax Walk Traction Cleats are lightweight, affordable, and easy to put on and take off, making them a simple solution for reducing the risk of falls when walking on snow and ice to work, school, or even to the mailbox. A highly elastic outer band and a tab on the heel help the cleats slip easily on and off of shoes, making Walk Traction Cleats perfect for pedestrians, professionals and the elderly. Traction is provided by abrasion-resistant 1.2 mm steel coils that are coated with zinc to help prevent rust. The shaped edge of the coils provide 360 degrees of traction on cold surfaces for all-direction stability. Yaktrax Walk Traction Cleats are tested safe from breakage in temperatures as low as -41 degrees F. reviews.title: A must have for winter walking to stay upright
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 26, 2022
reviews.text: I live in the Northeast US where we have can have snow as early as late October through early April. We get icy conditions as well and it‚Äôs important to remain upright when walking in those conditions, even in your driveway. Yaktrax are the perfect solution to winter weather outings. They go on easy, will fit most style shoes or boots with flat bottoms, and are very durable. Once you put them on you can walk confidently through the snow and many ice situations. Because of the coils on the bottom you‚Äôll want to be careful with surface changes when coming indoors. Ceramic tile can be very slippery so make sure you have a rug at the doorway to remove your shoes/boots prior to stepping on the tile. They don‚Äôt slip off while walking (unless you have the incorrect size). They‚Äôre easy to remove from your footwear. I have a pair of shoes with the Yaktrax already attached by my front door for easy on/off when I need to go outside. These are a great accessory for people with mobility issues that want to be safe walking outside in the winter.

reviews.title: Amazing!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 28, 2022
reviews.text: So, I never would have bought these because well quite frankly I thought they looked like a gimmick. However, I was telling my cousins how icy it is around our house and they said, you have to buy these Yaktrax, so on their recommendation, I bought a pair. However till they came in the mail, the ice was all melted. We live on a farm in central PA and the ice came back with a vengeance over Christmas of 2022. It was a mess and one of my kids remembered I had purchased these Yaktrax. So I put them on my barn shoes and I have not fallen once! Not even a slip! Love them!

reviews.title: Great...until you lose one.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 26, 2022
reviews.text: I ordered these to wear on my boots for walking my dog in the ice and snow. I've only had them for a month and they were working really well. No more landing unceremoniously on my bottom during walks with a crazy big puppy! Unfortunately, one fell off during our walk today without my notice. I have written to the company about buying a replacement. Hopefully that will be possible because I do otherwise really like the design of the product with the coils rather than spikes. If they will not offer this I will look for a different product next time, one with a securing strap across the top of my foot.

reviews.title: Don't let Winter Lock You Up - Get the YakTrax!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 23, 2022
reviews.text: My family laughed when I purchased these last January and the weather went warm on us. But today the streets and sidewalks of Seattle were covered with sheet ice. No one could drive. No busses running. No police. A guy did video of him skating down a city street. The only way you could get around if you have something like YakTrax. They are affordable and work like a charm. They aren't too big and bulky, so you can have a pair with you any time. My daughter was the only person in her department who showed up at work in her hospital today because she could walk a mile in the ice with the YakTrax. Great buy.

reviews.title: Great product, just a little unstable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on December 12, 2017
reviews.text: Overall - great product. Used them over trainers for dog walk and felt confident I wouldn't slip. Went over conpacted snow and these were amazing. Good on ice too - they find grip in any direction. I wore them over leather soles shoes (which are as good as ice skates normally) this morning and great improvement. They fitted better on the trainers but were fine on shoes. You can hardly see them on black shoes too, which is a bonus. They don't have spikes so I trust them to walk a few steps across my expensive hall flooring. My one gripe is stability. The bits you walk on cross over in the middle which means you feel unsteady, like your ankle may go over to the sides, if you're walking on tarmac or ice. Not a problem o snow though.

reviews.title: Perfect, if only the straps could be half a cm shorter.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2021
reviews.text: This bra lifts, separates, is extremely comfortable, and provides a good amount of support for stretching, walking, yoga, and weight lifting. It doesn't do much for bounce control for activities such as running, kick-boxing, circuit training, or cross-fit. I'm 4' 10" however, and there's a lot of space between the straps, and my body. I can slide my whole hand/wrist between, right above the pec, and still have space plenty of space. If the straps adjusted just half a cm more short this would be the perfect high impact sports bra. I'll reiterate that it is immensely comfortable regardless of my inability to use it for high impact sports despite the fact that my need for a good high impact sports bra was my only reason for giving this product a try. the Showoff is a better fit for my high impact needs, but it doesn't provide the same structured support this bra COULD if I had the shorter straps. I did find some errors in stitching. Some of the ends weren't knotted off. Luckily for me it was on the exterior, and so I used a hot knife to secure them. Contact between fused plastic, and skin can be quite abrasive. I've noticed that a lot of ppl struggle to get it off. I criss-cross my arms to grab the bra from beneath each arm-pit with a pincer grasp, and pull up until the breasts have been released from the underwire. Then pull it off like any other shirt after that. I am claustrophobic, and it's very unpleasant, but it's done in seconds, and the over-all design is one of a well structured support system to handle bounce on all sides.

It's very lightweight fabric which is great for summer, not so great if you want something heavier or better at hiding bulges, which heavier fabric is better for. I did not find this shirt to be see-though in any way though. I got the blue, not sure if it comes in other colors (maybe those are see through). The sleeves are a perfect length for me, almost to my elbow which is great to hide fat arms. I washed once with no shrinkage, probably due to the high poly count in the fabric. Overall I'm pleased with this purchase and the way the shirt fits, as it is slightly fitted through the waste making it less boxy than other shirts I own. Hopefully it lasts for at least a year without getting holes in it due to the thin fabric.

reviews.title: Super soft, & there IS a tail...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 29, 2022
reviews.text: I got the 24-30 month size for my relatively petite 2 year old. It is super soft. There's room for growth, without it being too bulky. I couldn't understand why there was a tail on other animals in this same line, but not the dog, but there IS one. It's visible in the very last photo, but my eyesight isn't the best, so I missed it and ended up buying a tail to add on from Party City. The tail is there, but the entire thing is sewn against the suit itself, so there's no fun/cute movement to it. I may use the tail I bought for Halloween and leave it off whenever she decides to wear it around, as toddlers do. She loves it and seems comfortable, so that's a win. It also has snaps between the legs, as well as down the front, if that's something you're wondering!

I have a narrow foot. Listen to the reviews to size up a half size. The only reason they got 4 stars is they are scuffed on the backs of the heels when I took them out of the box and on the front of one shoe, the zips are extremley stiff to pull or down and they are not as high on the foot or the wedge as my linqs pairs. However, when I printed the return label for the olive pair and rang DHL for collection I was refunded immediately from Amazon which was fantastic and enabled me to buy the grey pair before they sold out. There will be a breaking in period I feel which there wasn't with my other pairs, I can wear those all day but these are fab. I would buy another if they were available in 9.5. :)

reviews.title: Cute and comfy dress, but it is slightly loose
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 28, 2022
reviews.text: The dress is pretty cute. I purchased it as a backup to another dress that I also purchased at the same time for a "beach" wedding. The other dress I purchased fit exactly and that's the one I ended up wearing to the wedding. This dress would have looked better, if it had not been so loose on the top. I felt that perhaps a medium would have been a better fit for me, even though I had purchased large with the other dress (which was from a different company). I am a short woman, so I might have to hem this dress a bit, so it doesn't look quite as long, which makes me look frumpy. The armpits have gaps so I just wore a camisole underneath. I probably should have exchanged this dress for a medium, but it did not seem worth the time, effort, and was not environmentally friendly due to all the shipping back and forth. I am pretty flat chested, so that might have made a difference, too. All in all, it's worth the money and the dress is machine washable.

reviews.title: Thoughtful button placement
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 30, 2022
reviews.text: This was a nice surprise for the price. The buttons were color-matched to the fabric, and they were also placed thoughtfully. The buttons were spaced closer together at the top, to prevent gapping and and showing your bra, and spaced wider at the skirt part. A nice touch and means I won‚Äôt have to sew a snap in like I normally do for button downs! My only problem is that the armpits were gapping and showed my bra if I lifted my arms. This is a common problem with pattern drafting in larger sizes - the designer makes the pattern in size S and then just proportionally enlarges it up for the other sizes, but you need to adjust arm holes when you do that and many forget. But I liked it enough that I will see what I can do with some darts. I am about a size 12 with 32HH UK bra and I liked the fit of the XL. It‚Äôs also not crazy long for a short woman - 5‚Äô2‚Äù and it hit a couple of inches below the knee, didn‚Äôt look super frumpy.

reviews.title: It is beautiful and affordable! Better than diamond!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2021
reviews.text: I was never a fan of expensive rings that is why when my husband (boyfriend at the time) asked me what kind of ring , size , finish, etc. I wanted, I told him that I would rather use the money to buy a car and/or pay my student loans . So that‚Äôs what he did. I just could not imagine spending so much money for a diamond ring. What I never told him is that I actually wanted a solitaire ring with a big round brilliant beautiful stone. I still disagree with paying such price, especially now that I found out about Moissanites! It has more fire than diamonds, it is inexpensive, it is lasting, durable, and it is 2nd hardest gem. That is why I bought this ring for myself. If anyone ever asks me if it is real or fake diamond, I would proudly say that it is neither. I will proudly say that is is made of MOISSANITE , a beautiful gem . Not a fake diamond, because it is not. Cons: It runs a little large for me so I will be getting a ring enhancer to keep it in place and enhance it, and also the prongs holding the gem are a little sharp, so be careful. I scratched myself a few times because I forgot I was wearing it. Otherwise, I am very happy with my purchase. I am glad I bought the 3ct one. If thinking of using it as a diamond substitute, I recommend getting a 1 or 2 ct one to make it harder to distinguish between diamond and moissanite.

reviews.title: Lightweight & Fits Well

reviews.text: Being 5'1" & 108lbs, I was very skeptical this would fit (things online rarely do), but it fits me perfectly. Loose but not giant. Arm length is perfect. reviews.title: Great for higher waisted pants!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2022
reviews.text: I love this sweatshirt. The price is right, and the fit is right for the look I was going for. It‚Äôs very soft, not too heavy, and I was looking for a shorter and more boxy fit. I am 5‚Äô6‚Äù, about 120 pounds, and I have a long torso. I purchased a size small, and washed it on hot and put it in the dryer on hot for the first time I laundered it. I did not notice a lot of shrinking, although I have to admit I did not try it on before I washed and dried. I just eyeballed it. I have some higher waisted pants, but don‚Äôt want to wear a crop top. This sweatshirt fits the bill perfectly! I can do a French tuck into high waist pants and it‚Äôs not too bulky. Or I can just leave it untucked and it still looks good, but I can move freely without worrying about exposing my torso.üòÅ I have purchased some of the Hanes sweatpants, including the gray. I can tell you that the gray of the sweatshirt is a pretty close match to the grey sweatpants. I can see, however, from a couple of washing of the sweatpants at least, that pilling might become an issue if not washed properly. And more importantly not dried properly. I wouldn‚Äôt go high heat with these items again. One of the pictures is the sweatshirt just hanging freely, in the other picture I am pointing to where my belly button is.

reviews.title: Perfect vintage-style sweatshirt for the price.
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on October 14, 2019
reviews.text: 5‚Äô7, 160lbs, 36 C, long torso - ordered a Medium in black. I ordered this with trepidation. I wanted a slightly boxy yet slim fitting sweatshirt to wear with high waisted jeans, something not too bulky to layer under a jacket. I figured if this sweatshirt was a miss that was ok; it was so cheap I could wear it around the house or give it to my kids. I was very pleasantly surprised when this arrived - it fits just as I expected, just like on the model. It‚Äôs not too thick, it is soft and comfy, perfect for Vancouver weather. It hits at my hips (wouldn‚Äôt recommend to those who are over 5‚Äô9‚Äù unless you want a true crop). It is fitted yet comfortable through the shoulders, then straight from under the arm to the waist. The wrist hits just at my wrist. Has a cool vintage vibe, the black is a true black. My only concern is that it will shrink in the wash, in which case I would buy a Large next time. I will definitely purchase more though, looks great with my high rise Madewell‚Äôs and Levi‚Äôs and a pair of sneakers. Update: I washed it normally (Warm in the washing machine/threw it in the dryer) and it did not shrink, yay!

reviews.title: Poor quality sweatshirt material.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 14, 2019
reviews.text: I have now worn this sweatshirt for a couple of weeks and sadly it looks like I I've worn it for many months. The material has already got a lot of pills, (also known as bobbles or lint balls) showing both outside and inside. Had I known that the fabric was so poor and would change so fast to looking worn, I would certainly not have bought the sweatshirt in the first place and unluckily I bought 2, as they looked nice on the website photo.

reviews.title: Not Quite As Expected For the Hanes Brand
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 29, 2018
reviews.text: This is quite a nice sweatshirt overall, however it's a bit boxy, the sleeves could be a but longer and it's a bit undersized, I.e. the XXL should really fit a size 18 to 20, say, yet I doubt very much that it would comfortably fit someone in that size range and it'd be very tight at best. I'm a size 16 and it just fits me with a bit of room to spare. I see that another reviewer has said this is the best sweatshirt she's ever had - that's either overstating it or she's never had really well!-fitting, accurately sized sweatshirts before! This one in my opinion is just OK and, in fact, mine might now be relegated to being used as loungwear when, in fact, I'd bought it hoping to wear it outside!

reviews.title: LINTY
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on November 3, 2018
reviews.text: Extremely disappointed!! Hanes has totally gone downhill with this. Short waisted, can't keep my back warm. Poorly stitched, thin cotton material, the fleece is thin. Before washing & after washing LINT everywhere. It SHEDS from inside. It gets lint balls all along the sleeves & underarms. I have to CONSTANTLY lint shave them each time they're worn or washed & I've only worn then twice, washed twice. In 27 yrs of consumerism & wearing/washing garments I've never encountered anything so ridiculous for 'knubbing'. I'd give them away exept they're alright for lounging around my apt or wearing to the gym [don't get them contact with a t-shirt underneath or a cardigan_then they end up covered with lint!]

reviews.title: Review for short, round, old women.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2021
reviews.text: I have a belly. Among other things. I'm working on it. I ride horses. I do farm work. I eat actually pretty darn healthy. So if you make fun of my pictures, I will put ketchup on you and have you for lunch! Lol So hubs is totally ok with the way things are now, but he mentioned that sometimes he likes "a little packaging on the present", so I have attempted... to do so. I'm five ft tall, 225 lbs. He likes that 225 lbs. He married me like that. But let's be honest, at 48, gravity is a b. Among other things. So, for Christmas, since I already spun alpaca wool and knitted the man a stocking hat (Again. He loses them), I decided for Christmas that I would order this...whatever this is. Dental floss? Red ham netting from the butcher shop? No wait, that's the fishnet stockings. I got those too. And red suede "scre w me" heels. I have to walk veeeeeeery slow. Anyways I am a size 18 pants with short legs. The waist doesn't fall gracefully, my belly sticks out like I'm 8 months along. Nevertheless, I'll be wearing the heels (hopefully I won't break an ankle), this. .. thing....and the fishnet stockings on Christmas, bc it will probably make my freak husband very happy. Then after he has had his "happy", I can go out and play with my animals in my regular t shirt and jeans. I feel ridiculous. Lol. Size up. This was my size, a 2x, which is what I wear in both men's and women's t shirt and my belly still stuck out like crazy. Was hoping for just a bit more coverage. And yes, I'm wearing leggings and a sports bra in the pics, you freak. Did you think I was gonna pose au naturale`????? Yaright. Lol

reviews.title: Pretty decent shirt for the price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022
reviews.text: Fits well for slim fit individuals. Comparable to slim fit Nordstrom Men‚Äôs Shop shirts. If you can‚Äôt catch a sale at Nordstroms, these are a good alternative. Can‚Äôt say much for durability as I just got mine today, but will update later on.

reviews.title: Casual, Not Formal
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2022
reviews.text: This shirt is best worn with jeans or casual pants and a sport jacket/blazer. It should not be paired with a suit or tie. If it is worn with a suit, a tie should not be worn with it. It is the perfect shirt for the casual look with the top button opened. Another plus for this shirt is that it comes with slots for collar stays. The only time I would wear a tie with this shirt is if it was a part of a casual outfit, with the tie loose and the top button unbuttoned.

reviews.title: Good shirt, but not sure about sleeve sizing.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2021
reviews.text: This is a decent shirt. I love that they have these simple tattersall patterns - classic and versatile. The fabric is acceptable; a bit thin, but right on par or better than most dress shirts in this price range. Stitching is quite good! The shirt is also nice and long - which is excellent! There is nothing worse than a short dress shirt that comes untucked. 'Button-down' shirts should be tucked into your trousers and so should be an adequate length to stay tucked in. Well done here! Furthermore this is a really good slim fit cut! Nicely fitted in the torso, but plenty broad enough in the shoulders. My issues lie with sizing. I originally ordered a 16x32-33. My sleeve length generally falls between 33-34 in most shirts. I went on the lower end here, and it was a bit too short in the sleeve. My mistake, so I returned the shirt and was refunded (thank you Amazon for making this so easy). I then reordered one in 16x34-35. The 34-35 is a bit too long, definitely all of 35" instead of 34". I wish I could just order a 34" shirt, or at least a 33-34 range, as those are my size. These sizing ranges just seem too variable or inconsistent., it puts me in between Amazon's sizes. Also, the 16" neck is a bit too big... it's closer to 16 1/2", but I sure don't want to step down to their 15 1/2" size. I know this is picky, I'll still be able to wear it, but it won't be the perfect fit of dress shirt for me. I'm sure others can find a good size. Hopefully these details help improve the product, or help someone make an informed buy regarding sizing.

reviews.title: Stiff and relatively heavy material
