reviews.text: material to heavy and non elastic

reviews.title: Hands down the best dress shirt I‚Äôve ever owned
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2022
reviews.text: The quality of the shirt (especially for the price) is astounding. The material is thick yet breathable. The fit is truly slim and form fitting, but not too tight. The shirt also has quite a bit of stretch to it. Sleeve seemed a bit long but not terribly long. Build is 5‚Äô10‚Äù 175 lbs, muscular with a 12 inch drop in my suits (chest to waist) I bought one, wore it once, and immediately bought another. My only regret is that I didn‚Äôt buy 10. This shirt has been unavailable for some time now but once every week or two I will check back just to see if it‚Äôs available.

reviews.title: YES, this shirt is SLIM FIT
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2021
reviews.text: Go ahead and put me on team "Slim Fit". I wasn't certain whether to buy this shirt because some reviewers insisted that it wasn't slim fit and that's just a deal-breaker for me; I will not go out wearing enough cloth to outfit a clipper ship! Turns out those folks either got the wrong product or their definition of "slim fit" is more like "painted on". Knowing how things can go wrong with clothes sizing, order fulfillment and even flat-out incorrect labels, I'm liable to blame Amazon and their suppliers rather than other reviewers. Anyway, the shirt fit me as expected based on the sleeve and neck sizes -- and I love the fact they have half-inch neck sizes BTW; choose carefully and this can really make it look more tailored. They're 100% cotton and come out of the wash without too many wrinkles (wrinkle resistant is pretty accurate). A true dandy would still insist on having it pressed, but most of the time I can live it, especially if it's hidden under a suit. It _is_ quite sheer, as many people have noted, but as a dress shirt with an undershirt underneath it's perfectly adequate. I'm pretty impressed; it's a great value buy.

reviews.title: I Do Not Think That Word Means What You Think It Means
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
reviews.text: Pros: Quality- for $20, these are really nice dress shirts. Well made, and very nice looking. Wrinkle free (as noted). Colors- bought two different styles and satisfied with the colors of both. Fit- these fit okay; they are longer dress shirts so that they stay tucked in. Cons: Collar stays are not sewn into collars. I'll lose one or both soon and I'll let you know how the collar does without them. Fit- these do not fit like any other slim fit shirt that I own. Maybe a little slimmer than your typical regular fit shirt, but not by much. Other reviewers mentioned tenting because of the fit and I can't speak to this yet as I've only worn under a sweater, but it is a fear. Perhaps most wouldn't be bothered by a slim-ish fit; but I prefer a no doubt about it slim fit. UPDATE: When I wear these under a sport coat with a tie, they are awesome. So much so that I purchased 3 more and now have 5. I don't use the collar stays and thus far, have had no problems with the collars. I suppose this could change if I wore them regularly. They are a nicer fabric than say my JCP or Van Heusen dress shirts. And for this reason, I recommend. I'm staying at 4 stars because they could be more slim, but they are super nice shirts. Peace.

reviews.title: Great shirt shame about the delivery
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 9, 2022
reviews.text: Second purchase thrown onto front step didn't ring bell. NOT HANDED TO RESIDENT. Packaging on the front scuffed with holes. I was out but luckily found before it rained. Package looked like it had been opened not sealed. Is it new? to send back or not? ??? First arrived properly packaged. I bought this a a Christmas present for my husband fully expecting to send it back. Bought shirts from also from M&S and Next. So that something would be right!! Neck 17.5 This was the only one that fitted well (others too baggy) Sleeves perfect (others too long). Washed and ironed well, collar sits nicely, told its comfortable to wear. Bought again.

reviews.title: Could give better sizing information.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 10, 2022
reviews.text: I ordered this shirt for my partner for our wedding. The colour is beautiful and a good feel fabric so in that respect good value for money, however the sizing could be clearer. It is, as stated, slim fit however I had to return and reorder due to being too small. Return and replacement dealt with quickly and my now husband looked gorgeous in it, so buyer beware, double check sizing.

reviews.title: Lovely shirt
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 30, 2020
reviews.text: The sizing are totally weird and make no sense but I made a dive to buy something I was unsure about and very happy with it. The only thing I do not like is that it has amazon essentials on the inside of the shirt. Little weird and cannot be cut off which sucks. It‚Äôs nice and long considering I am 6ft 3 and a very nice looking for a smart shirt. Very happy with the shirt. Not sure what else to say but it fits and a good buy.

reviews.title: Excellent concept, poor execution
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 27, 2021
reviews.text: I am a fan of Amazon Essentials. I have previously had a great purchase of a vacuum cleaner which was half the price of a named brand and twice as good as my last electrolux - I gave this a 5 star rating as you would expect. Unfortunately for this purchase, the shirts are reasonable quality, but way too big. I'm a large and ordered a size to fit accordingly, however, the shirts that arrived would fit XXXl. I'm hoping Amazon can get their sizing right. In the mean time I'm off to the high street so I can try on the shirt ..... old school, but effective! It appears to be pot luck if you get the right size for you.

reviews.title: It is a nice cool watch
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2022
reviews.text: I like a red color watch and have my eyes on this watch for a while. When it‚Äôs on sale I bought it. I think I received a used watch because it has 2 links with the red paint peeled off, and when I brought it to a watch store to resize, the staff at the store told me that the links (with the paint peeled off) were removed and then put back in - but in a wrong way: backward. Besides, there was no protector film covering the face and the back of the watch (but I don‚Äôt know if all new watches will have these protector films) and the watch is already running. Well, I guess it explained why the price was dropped about 40%. However, I still love the watch because of its vivid color, its cool look, and it runs well (I got it a week ago). There‚Äôs no scratch on the face or the back of the watch, and the links with red paint peeled of were removed to fit my wrist. In a word, I‚Äôm happy with it!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 24, 2019
reviews.text: This is my third pair of Naot's Susan. I love this shoe. I have white, black and navy. it fits well and is extremely comfortable. However, in order to get my third pair, I had to return one pair that was made very poorly and did not fit at all. I have worn Naot for years, and have an extensive collection of colors and styles. In the last year or two, I have had to return a few pairs because of improper fit. I am told they are made by hand, so allowances need to be made. However, as much as I LOVE the brand, I write this hoping they will notice and improve their product. The black pair I just bought is perfect, but I had to return another pair as the upper leather straps were too loose and attached to the footbed at a different place as compared to the shoes I had. Keep the quality control is what I say to the maker. The styles are lovely and the shoes are great.

title: Darn Tough Hiker Micro Crew Midweight Sock with Cushion - Women's
bullets: Ó£Ω HIKER MICRO CREW CUSHION - This Micro Crew has earned a hallowed place in the hearts of many a through-hiker who demand more from a sock. Comfort, durability and fit that never rests.

Midweight with Cushion ‚Äî A warm and extremely comfortable choice when conditions demand it, this fine gauge knitted sock provides mid-level cushion density under your foot. True Seamless technology allows for an undetectable seam fusion for an Ultra-smooth, invisible feel.
Micro Crew Height - A shorter, more concise take on the traditional crew height. Peeks just above the top of a standard hiking boot.
Composition - Knit with 59% Merino Wool, 39% Nylon, 2% Lycra Spandex
Guaranteed for Life - Darn Tough's famous guarantee - if these socks wear, tear, or develop holes, Darn Tough will replace them no questions asked. No strings. No conditions.
Made in the USA - Every pair of socks is knit in Northfield, Vermont - the perfect testing ground for the finest premium all weather performance socks.
Product Dimensions  :  4 x 4 x 2 inches; 2 Ounces

description: Product Description THE ULTIMATE HIKING SOCK A sock that works as hard as you do. Our socks are the most comfortable and durable socks you'll ever own. Read more MICRO CREW HEIGHT Sitting near mid-calf , it‚Äôs the best sock height for everyday casual and dress. A shorter, more concise take on the traditional crew height. Peeks just above the top of a standard hiking boot. ULTIMATE COMFORT No slipping, no bunching, and no blisters. The ultimate fiber for breathability and comfort in all conditions, the All Weather Performance means cool in the summer, warm in the winter. CUSHION DENSITY Cushion in the Hike/Trek category features terry loops under the foot , and in the taller styles reaches above the ankle for comfort and protection. Mid-level cushion density under foot. TRUE SEAMLESS Undetectable seam fusion for an ultra smooth, invisible feel. Darn Tough uses high density knitting techniques, which means there are more stitches per inch. This leads to a more comfortable, durable, great fitting sock with no added bulk. Read more SUSTAINABILITY Darn Tough aims to improve the well-being of our community by locally designing and manufacturing the most comfortable, durable, best fitting socks while continuously reducing our environmental impacts. MATERIALS IN OUR SOCKS Every material we use in our socks has been carefully chosen and tested to meet our rigorous durability standards. We currently use natural and synthetic fibers, and only 3 types of fiber per sock. As you‚Äôd expect, we are actively investigating and testing new fibers and yarn blends that do not appear in our current products. We‚Äôve prioritized Merino wool throughout our product lines and our goal of producing the most responsibly made product is reflected in our commitment to the success of the Responsible Wool Standard. MERINO WOOL Merino wool is the most important and relied upon fiber in our products and accounted for 56% of our yarn consumption by weight last year. For many years we‚Äôve prioritized the use of Merino wool exclusively from sheep that have not been exposed to the practice of mulesing. In early 2019 we made a commitment to support the Responsible Wool Standard (RWS) and shift 100% of our wool supply to RWS-certified Merino wool. RWS is a voluntary standard with strict guidelines to protect animal welfare and adhere to progressive, sustainable farm and land management practices while maintaining traceability throughout the entire supply chain. Although the market share for RWS is only estimated at ~1% of global wool production, the number of certified sources has grown substantially over the last couple years. Today, 100% of the wool we procure is RWS-certified. RECYCLED NYLON We use REPREVE, a nylon 6 fiber made from pre-consumer industrial waste that would otherwise be landfilled or downcycled. Using REPREVE instead of virgin nylon allows us to offset the use of crude oil, benzene, cyclohexane, and other harmful hydrocarbons that are involved in the production of virgin fiber. In short, using recycled nylon conserves energy and water and reduces greenhouse gas emissions from manufacturing. While we aim to reduce our use of virgin nylon in our products, recycled nylon only accounted for 4% of our nylon consumption last year. We‚Äôre actively working with our suppliers to source more recycled nylon so we can incorporate it across our product lines. To date, nylons generated from pre-consumer waste material have held up well against our durability requirements, but we‚Äôd like to find an equally good source of post-consumer recycled nylon or yarns that blend both pre and post-consumer nylon. SPANDEX/ELASTANE We use Lycra to provide elasticity, strength, and form-fitting comfort. While spandex accounts for no more than 5% of the fiber used in our finished product, it represented 27% of the raw materials we procured last year. Like conventional nylon, spandex is derived from petroleum and has been important to the performance of our products. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs the most difficult material in our fiber mix to replace with a recycled alternative. When it comes to synthetics, we‚Äôre primarily focused on converting virgin nylon and polyester to recycled alternatives. However, we‚Äôre also looking for functional, recycled spandex alternatives. Sustainability Merino Wool Recycled Nylon Spandex/Elastane STYLE 1903 STYLE 1971 STYLE 1908 STYLE 1907 STYLE 1985 STYLE 1968 CUSHION Cushion Cushion Full Cushion Cushion Cushion Cushion HEIGHT Micro Crew Micro Crew Boot Sock Boot Sock Micro Crew Micro Crew COLOR OPTIONS 5+ Blue, Lavender, Willow, and Cranberry 5+ 5+ Aqua, Denim, and Plum Gray, Taupe, and Denim MADE IN THE USA ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì ‚úì COMPOSITION 59% Merino Wool, 39% Nylon, 2% Lycra Spandex 63% Merino Wool, 35% Nylon, 2% Lycra Spandex 69% Merino Wool, 27% Nylon, 4% Lycra Spandex 64% Merino Wool, 33% Nylon, 3% Lycra Spandex 55% Nylon 42% Merino Wool 3% Lycra Spandex 53% Nylon, 44% Merino Wool, 3% Lycra Spandex CUSHION IN THE LEG ‚úì ‚úì YARN WEIGHT Midweight Midweight Midweight Midweight Lightweight Lightweight SOCK CAPITAL OF THE WORLD We live and work in Northfield, Vermont. Our backyard is the perfect testing ground to make the finest Premium All Weather Performance Socks. We ski, snowboard, hike, bike and run in the most unforgiving climate in the lower 48. It is under these conditions that we design, test and manufacture our socks. STILL MADE IN VERMONT, USA After so many decades why do we still knit every pair of our socks here in Vermont? We don‚Äôt do it because it‚Äôs the easy thing to do‚Äîwe do it because it‚Äôs the right thing to do. We do it because for us, it‚Äôs the only way to do it. There are faster and cheaper alternatives but nobody ever outsourced anything for quality. ONE FAMILY - We are family owned. For 40 years we‚Äôve been knitting socks in the Green Mountains ONE MISSION - Darn Tough is a family-owned, American manufacturer of end-use-specific socks. ONE MILL - Every step of the knitting process happens right here, by us, locally, in Northfield, VT Read more

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Super Comfy Socks from A Great Company
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 24, 2022
reviews.text: When I first started buying Darn Tough brand socks, there was a short period of "sticker shock". I went from paying $20 for a package of 6+ socks to paying $20 per pair. And yeah, the price keeps going up. But here's the thing...these socks are super comfy. They come in all sorts of fun colors, the fabric is wool and will keep you warm in the winter but cool in the summer. I've worn these hiking in snow and at amusement parks in the summer heat. One might care about the color combinations, but have you seen typical kids "these days"? They're wearing mis-match socks anyways. I've gotten compliments on these socks. I have at least a dozen pairs. This pair is one of the newer-to-me designs. They're on the thicker side and I love the cushion. Perhaps I've become a sock snob, but there's a good reason. If these wear down, get a snag, etc...you contact customer service. Send them back to the company and they'll give you credit for a new pair. And, well, I know there are people out there who can buy just one pair, but that's not me. I check my socks a few times a year for "wear and tear" but I think it's been a good 2 years since I've sent them back. These are actually the socks I happen to be wearing today! So, after about 50 washes (cuz I love them and wear them all the time), this is what they still look like. I bought these just under a year ago. The "bunching up" at the bottom of one picture is because I just pulled off my shoe and did a point/flex pose for the 2 pictures. For those that haven't fallen for Darn Tough yet, another reason why I like them so much is that there is no seam at the toes, thus they don't rub against the shoes. My hubby was having an issue where the fabric "pilled" and the Internet said to wash them inside out. That seems to have done away with the problem. Enjoy!

Fashioned from top quality .925 Sterling Silver with handmade bright cut & polishing. Pair with the chain option of your choice. Read more Choose Your Necklace This pendant is offered in a variety of style necklace choices to meet your needs. Select the options at the top of the page to view the description of the necklace included in that option, as well as all details. Current options include: Pendant Only - Includes a jump ring so you can attach the chain of your own choice (up to 3.5mm thick) 24" 2.4mm Rhodium Plated Solid Brass Heavy Curb Chain with Clasp 24" 2.4mm Rhodium Plated Endless Solid Brass Heavy Curb Chain 24" 1.7mm Rhodium Plated .925 Sterling Silver Medium Curb Chain with Clasp 24" 2.2mm Rhodium Plated .925 Sterling Silver Heavy Curb Chain with Clasp Silhouette shows where a 24" chain falls on an average man Read more What is Sterling Silver? While pure silver can be combined with many different types of metals, Sterling Silver is created when combining pure silver with copper . Sterling Silver jewelry can be composed with different amounts of copper but is most often seen with the .925 stamp, meaning that the composition is of 92.5 percent silver and 7.5 percent copper. This has been found to be a good combination for maintaining the silver's durability without harming its sparkle. Beautiful Gift Box Included Your jewelry comes complete with a beautiful velvet box that is idea for gift giving. Contains a plush pad that the pendant rests on. The box is also the perfect storage to make sure your jewelry is in perfect condition when you are not wearing it. Storage in the box is also the perfect way to avoid scratches when not in use. Caring for Your Heartland Sterling Silver Double Sided Oval Saint Michael and Guardian Angel Pendant Silver, when exposed to the air will always naturally oxidize, i.e. tarnish. To prevent this your Sterling Silver pendant is protected by a clear coat, baked on, lacquer so it is not in direct contact with the air. To ensure the longevity of this protection you should never use silver cleaning products as they will damage coating. You should also make sure your pendant does not come into contact with harsh household chemicals such as bleach, ammonia, or chlorine. If you notice any dirt build up over time you can simply wash the jewelry in a mild dish soap, dry off (do not use anything abrasive) and then shine up with a microfiber cloth - like the ones you get with eyeglasses. As with all fine jewelry, it is highly recommended to not wear your jewelry while showering or swimming - harsh chemicals can damage your jewelry. reviews.title: Chubby got checked...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020
reviews.text: ...sort of. I'm on a weight loss excursion and buy more exercise leggings as a reward and motivation. Searched for weeks and found these. Criteria was simple: good reviews and not $30+. I'll start with the material of the black pants. It's soft and stretchy, but not the shiny type. Still poly/spandex, still some compression. They fit pretty well. The waist stays put! Well, for the most part. When I'm stretching, my gut pushes and they roll down. Legs are a bit weird in that when I do a Cize workout, I do occasionally pull them up. What I hate most is the camel toe requirement for them to fit properly. Good thing I work out at home and alone. I'm short with a larger butt. While you cannot see through these pants, you will end up with some sweaty butt and/or crotch that's visible. I had my husband look, in case I'm blind. Anyway, I washed them according to the instructions (cold, line dry, no softener). Wpre them once and the chib rub is a problem...there's pilling already. If you know anything about Cize, it's dancing. High intensity dancing. How there's any pilling is beyond me and a little disappointing. I don't wear these leggings except to walk down to the basement, work out, and back upstairs. I'll be washing them on the active wear cycle, which is hot or warm water (no softener, throwing in the dryer) and will update how they hold up. Lots of reviews state the material is different depending on color, which is cool for me. I intend to order more in different colors anyway. How could I not? They're comfortable, have compression, and I barely have to adjust them. I'm sold. I do wish the material was the same throughout, but I think I'll survive.

reviews.title: Good Quality for the Price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2022
reviews.text: Pants fit very well. I am a 64 year old cyclist and do not care for the tight lycra pant sort "look". LOL. These shorts provide the traditional cycle short padding where needed and look casual enough to get off your bike and walk into a store (not wearing tights). These pants would work great for touring (narrow) and and wider hybrid bike saddles. They wick well. I'll be buying me another pair for sure. Nice pockets also. These feel better on me than my expensive bibbers that I have worn on longer rides (centuries). Someone said in a review that the padding is too far forward. Must be a casual/hybrid cyclist that sits staight up all the time. I disagree because you need the forward padding for narrow saddles when you are bent forward on road bikes. P.S. The XXL fits my 42" waiste perfectly.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 17, 2020
reviews.text: Purchased the watch for my wife's Valentine. It was the only chronograph woman's watch we found that had "tachymeter" increment display that she wants on a watch, and the price was affordable. The tachymeter is somewhat visible on one side of the photo but not the other side. I took a chance and purchased it anyway. When the item arrived and examined at actual size‚Äînot the enlarged photo size‚Äî the tachymeter practically invisible. Even with a magnifying glass it was difficult to see. I also realized the dials were all bone white as opposed to the toned down grey shown on the photo. Additionally disturbing to the eye were the hour numbers 2, 5, 7, 9, 11, which are awkwardly chopped up appearing more like an accident of white paint fell in those spots. Unfortunately, I was forced to return the item without even removing it from its box.

reviews.title: Embarrassment as a gift; dead battery. WOOPS!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 11, 2013
reviews.text: The watch itself is a fine piece all you would expect from Victorinox. Very tastefully designed and practical enough for everyday wear. I can not say the same of the seller; who unfortunately did not check to see if the watch battery was any good. With all new victorinox watches(perhaps with all new watches for that matter) a small spacer will be between the time adjustment knob and the casing--unfortunately it was absent and the battery has thus been completely drained. Very foolish, indeed--walmart has better quality control. Such a shame that the seller had not assured satisfaction by simply making sure the watch would arrive fully functional and in 100% brand new packaged form. Tisk tisk tisk indeed. Luckily I offered it to my girlfriend as an early Christmas present and we'll have time to seek a replacement. I will be returning the watch for a refund and buying from a different seller. Perhaps an honest mistake on the seller's part but there is no excuse for selling a watch that won't keep time out of the box. 1 star for the retailer. 5 stars for victorinox design. Good luck and happy shopping.

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Compact and serious looking Swiss made women's chronograph
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on June 21, 2016
reviews.text: There are very few women's chronographs of both compact size and more technical aesthetic, for those ladies not attracted to the overtly bling designs that dominate. Being derived from a larger men's version, this model from Victorinox, at 34 mm, successfully blends a complex but clean design into a robust-looking piece that is still elegant. The colour of the dial on this particular variation can vary dramatically under different lighting - more so than any other watch I've seen. In most web pictures, even those without colour grading, the dial is almost grey, which I think looks great with the beige strap. See my photos for how different it can look. On the dial, there is a typical chronograph layout but with two different sub-dial sizes including a superimposed hybrid, creating more interest than all three being the same size. All sub-dials are concentric ring textured. The intersection of the chronograph hour and small seconds dial is continued, with some very artful and high precision truncation of the numerical hour markers. This way, a lot is crammed into the small space without it actually looking too crammed. These markers even have a vertically brushed finish that isn't visible in any of the standard product photos, it's another layer of sophistication for the wearer to appreciate. They are in a chunky font that, combined with the straight, bold hands, give more than a hint of aeronautic instrumentation. Finishing off, the tachymeter scale is on the inside wall of the case and there's a date window at 6 o'clock, balancing the Victorinox logo at 12 o'clock. The case back screws on, far better than the snap fit variety. One thing that surprised me was the date setting. Instead of changing with each turn-click of the crown, it changes with every 12 clicks, as the hour hand moves independently while the minute hand judders alarmingly while staying put. Upon further thought, the fact the hour hand jumps exactly one hour, and a YouTube video showing the date change on a partially constructed ETA 251.471 as used here, suggests this is in fact normal behaviour. It's Swiss so it's got to be right, and who reads manuals anyway? At ¬£139 this is a bargain.

reviews.title: So flattering
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 15, 2021
reviews.text: I bought a medium, I'm a 34C, and it fits nicely at the middle clasp. I'm not used to wearing bras that show so much breast? So I worried about spillage, but I guess it's fine because I've been wearing it for hours now and there's no issues of traveling or spilling or anything like that. Very cute, very flattering. The lace is a little itchy but I'm able to ignore it: the worst part is the TAG. I've come to ignore it for now but the tag is illogically long and in a really annoying place: under the left arm! Why they didn't put it near the clasp like every other bra, I will never know. Also, it's PADDED. Sewn in, perfect. It does show the line of the connection through some shirts, but I have sports bras that do that already so it doesn't bother me. One thing though: I thought it was a deep red, but it's actually plum colored. UPDATE: 3/31/21 When wearing this bra at work last week, one of the straps suddenly broke! The stitching came undone. Luckily I had a sewing kit at hand and was able to sew it back up, but if I hadn't, I'd have had to go home, which would have really screwed up my day. Now I'm paranoid about the other strap breaking on me, and haven't worn it since. Really disappointing. I shouldn't have to reinforce the strap stitching just to wear this thing.

reviews.title: Lightweight and Comfortable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
reviews.text: I bought these shoes to wear with a pair of tapered pants, but I didn't like the way they looked together. I thought that the wedge had a little more height. The first time I tried them on they squeaked when I moved. Because I liked them and not wanting to return them I thought maybe my feet are swollen. After trying them on, putting them back in the box a few times and it was too late to return them, it came to mind they are new shoes. One morning I got dressed and decided I would wear them and walk the squeak out. I fixed breakfast, moved around the house a little and the squeak was gone. After having them on a few hours there was a little pressure across my toes when I was just standing but I adjusted my foot and was good to go. Again, that might have been my foot experiencing some swelling and not a problem with the shoe. I liked how they looked with my flair cut jeans, slightly flare cut slacks and a casual T-shirt dress. I haven't tried them with anything else. I really do love that they are super light. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because they didn't (to me) pair well with the outfit I bought them for. I'm glad I kept trying them on and didn't send them back. I planned to wear them through the fall or until it gets too cold and I need socks.

She has a 20.25‚Äù circumference size head & I was able to adjust the Velcro back of the hat to fit her head. The Velcro has great grip & has not come undone once. Her head sweats a lot so I needed something breathable & lightweight. I love the dark underbill of the hat for glare protection for her eyes on the court. I also like that the top of the hat is not structured & boxy so that the relaxed shape of it molds to her head giving a better fit. We also had problems with other hats blowing off in very windy conditions & this hat stays put & has never blown off. This hat is perfect although I do wish it had some UV protection built into the fabric. I purchased it in white to reflect the sun the best & stay cooler than dark colors. I never thought I would find a hat that would work for my 4 year old until she got older & I‚Äôm thrilled that this one is so perfect in every way!

reviews.text: This fits me just right. I have what I consider an average-size head, and this hat is great! reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Worth the money for me!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2022
reviews.text: The media could not be loaded. I absolutely loved this costume! I got a lot of compliments. I normally like to wear my clothes a little snug but I hesitated on buying a small, which is what I normally wear. I had no issues with the medium and it fit well. Maybe the small would have not fit correctly over my bust? or may even have had a big problem trying to zip it back up when using the restroom and damaging the costume. I am a 38D, weigh 133 lbs. I read many complaints about the swords as well. That they are too small and that there is no way to carry them on your back or that they are plastic like and childish. It is a costume and for play so of course they will be plastic. They didn't look childish to me and looked great with my costume. Real swords would probably get you into trouble hahaa. I slid the swords under the costume on my back behind my neck and had no problems and did not have to carry them all night. They stood up well and they actually did look like the picture. But if you want to actually carry them in a backpack, you may want to invest in a childs backpack sword. I also wore a black bra under my costume just to avoid any slips with my bust lol. The material does move around as you are moving around but with my black bra on, I wasn't even worried about that area being moved around. The mask that it comes with is a little on the large side. But that's ok, I just wore my own black mask and it looked perfect! I had no problems with the arm sleeve. Yes, it is a bodysuit but I had no problems unzipping myself to use the restroom. Don't get this too tight because you will have a hard time trying to zip this back up yourself, and may risk ripping the material or breaking the zipper. Again, I had no problem unzipping and zipping back up myself to use the restroom. I guess if you are flexible with your arms then you won't have a problem :) Otherwise, do get help. All in all, this costume was one of my best I've worn!

reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Super Sexy BBW Ninja
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2019
reviews.text: OMG this costume is pretty awesome! I couldn't give it 5 starts because there were a couple hiccups, but nothing too serious. My only complaints are that the face mask and the neckline of the costume were a bit defective. The face mask was cut waaaaay too large for a normal face lol The holes that are meant to go over your ears to keep the mask in place on your face were extremely far apart so I just opted to pull the mask tight and knot it behind my head under my ponytail. My bf had to take in the neck of the costume because it fit kind of baggy in comparison to the rest of the costume. Other than those tiny flaws, this costume was perfect! I'm about 5'9 - 5'10 and weigh 199 lbs, so I got the XL. It was a great fit overall, even fitting comfortably over my full bosoms and lower belly pudge. I would have liked the netting to be maybe half a size more snug. The material is durable and doesn't have a cheap look or feel. I was able to comfortably walk around the strip and go dancing. The swords that come with it are plastic and looked a bit childish up close, so I opted to carry a decorative sword from my bf's collection. The arm sleeves are one of my favorite parts of the costume because they are a great fabric and look very good on. They are a bit snug so keep that in mind if you have chubbier forearms. But they don't slide down or get baggy as the night goes on.

reviews.title: So much nicer than expected.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2022
reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before ordering, wasn't really sure what size to get since some people said order larger, others said smaller. So I just ordered my normal size, XL, and it's perfect. I'm just under 5'5" and weigh about 200, a bit pear-shaped. This dress fits me like it was made to order for me. I decided to sew up the neckline a bit, shows just too much exposed cleavage for my taste. I sewed it together about half way up using a blind stitch so you can't even tell. I left the lower set of ties so they can still be used in a small bow or loose. And I may take the hem length up about an inch. But other than that, it's lovely. Extremely soft and flowy fabric. Even the sleeves are the perfect length for me. I did notice while I was sewing by hand, that if your needle isn't sharp the fabric could snag and you'd end up with a run in it, so be careful with that or with pins if you decide to pin the neckline instead of sewing. I am going to order some other colors/designs before the price goes up.

description: From the manufacturer Read more High Rise Skinny Ankle High Rise Sits at Natural Waist Premium Stretch Denim Skinny Leg Opening Inspired by Lee Heritage Denim Jacket Classic Fit Stretch Fabric for All Day Comfort Functional Style Mid Rise Straight Leg Regular Fit Sits Slightly Below the Natural Waist Straight Leg Opening Mid Rise Bootcut Regular Fit Sits Slightly Below the Natural Waist Bootcut Leg Opening Read more

reviews.title: A Good Basic Lined Jean
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
reviews.text: Fleece is soft. Size is true. I normally wear a size 6 and the 6s fit properly. Snug, but you don't want baggy butt wearing jeans! I have full athletic thighs AND I have a mature middle age figure (meaning I carry more weight around hips and thighs than a younger woman). For reference, I am 145 pounds and 5'9". The M length fits - hem below ankle, not enough to cuff. Fleece is a red and black 'lumberjack' plaid. The jeans are plain with no embellishment. Good, generic, basic lined jeans. Warm in 20 degree weather. A little spandex (1%) helps with comfort. No gap at waist. No riding down and exposing 'plumber's crack' when bending over. (If this DOES happen, it's because the jeans have slipped down and the knees are pulling the top of the waist down when bending.) Wear a belt if the waist is too big. This is why I recommend snug jeans without any 'ease' or excess fabric. I have a 30" natural waist and 40" hip, and if you go by the Lee size chart, 8s should fit me best but they are too big. I bought both 8s and 6s to compare. Remember, the rise (height of jeans from crotch seam to waist front) determines where the jeans will hit at the waist. The rise is mid-rise. The jeans' waist hits below the belly button. They WILL stretch out a little, over time, while wearing them. I have not washed them yet to comment on wash and wear.

reviews.title: Good, not fantastic
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021
reviews.text: This is a very warm and comfy Jean. But very stiff with no give. No elastic in the waistband so I can't wear without a belt. Uncomfortable to hike in as tbe stiffness is built in to the Jean. I sometimes need to wear leggings or thermals underneath for added warmth (Connecticut winters) but I can't with my normal size. I needed to go up a size for that as the denim shrunk in the wash. 4 stars because: No give, very stiff, no stretch and needed another pair in a bigger size for 2nd layer. But still works well as fleece lined pants.

The waist sits a little lower than I would prefer, but not bad, and the length is a little long, but not bad when worn with boots or tennis shoes. They could be cuffed, but I haven‚Äôt worn them that way. I have washed them and dried in the dryer on low heat without any weird shrinking of the inner layer.

I'd be a fool not to. IF your going where its cold these are worth every penny. the quality is off the hook! I looked at Carhartt and Eddie Bauer but I just couldn't see myself spending $60+ on a pair of jeans for a few days here and there. These are PERFECT. Do Yourself A Favor And Get A Pair!!

reviews.title: Very nice warm jeans
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on January 23, 2020
reviews.text: I bought these jeans in October '19, just before it got really cold. I have worn them several times and they have been washed a few times too. They wash well. i washed in cold water as recommended. I have had other lined jeans where the jeans had shrunk i wash but not the lining so that looked terrible, but these washed well,no shrinkage of either lining nor jeans. They can't be tumble dried so they do take some time to dry. Thy look nice on, not to bulky or anything, maybe the jeans material is not quite as nice as my other jeans, but it's not a problem for me. They do soften up a bit in use and wash so if you think they feel a bit stiff to begin with, they will soften up! Only problem I have with them, and the reason for 4 stars and not 5, is that the waistline is slightly to low. This is due to the fact that there is a little bit of stretch sideways, but none in the length. That makes it more difficult to get the jeans to fit nicely at the waist, this would have been easier if either there had been stretch in the length or if they waist had been a little higher. I just make sure to wear a long top. All in all, I am very happy with these jeans.

reviews.title: Stylish, comfortable and functional. Get them!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 8, 2019
reviews.text: I am IN LOVE with these glasses. They came in a very sturdy box, equipped with tools to fix your glasses, a case and a wipe! I wasn't sure if they would fit me well because I have a low nose bridge (+my head is on the smaller side), but they don't slip at all and look super cute. I got the tortoise brown frames, but now I'm considering getting them in other colors because I love them sooo much. There IS a glare from when someone else is looking at your glasses, but honestly they are so cute that I wouldn't mind just walking around town with these glasses on. As for the blue filter, it works! I'm not sure HOW it works, but I definitely feel like my eyes are straining less when I have these on while using my laptop.

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 6, 2020
reviews.text: These blue light glasses are AMAZING! I‚Äôve never worn glasses in my life and gave away my last pair of blue light glasses because they were uncomfortable. These are so lightweight but well made. They are the perfect size on my face and have majorly reduced the headaches I‚Äôve gotten since switching to working in teletherapy full time. They come with a nice case, a cleaning cloth, and a repair kit that I doubt I will ever have to use because they‚Äôre so well made. I got the tortoise print and it has a beautiful subtle purple hint to it but is still a classic style. I can‚Äôt recommend these glasses enough!

reviews.title: Worth your money!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 27, 2019
reviews.text: I read review after review to decide what glasses to purchase. Ended up going with these and I don‚Äôt regret it! I had a severe issue with corneal abrasion this past year and ever since, I am sensitive to being on electronic devices as they tend to dry my eyes out. I‚Äôve been using these glasses for about 2 and a half months now and they have been great! My eyes don‚Äôt get nearly as dry when I‚Äôm on my devices for extended periods of time. There is a yellow tint but hardly noticeable when you have them on. I will say that the frames were much smaller than I thought they would be. However, I like it as it doesn‚Äôt make them look like costume/fake eyeglasses. Came in great packaging with extra hardware in case you damage a nose piece. Definitely recommend!

reviews.title: Great glasses for high computer use!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 17, 2018
reviews.text: So far I've been using these for about a week. I work a desk job where I stare at a screen under fluorescent lights everyday. I have noticed that I have more energy at the end of the day and I am feeling less drained. It has took me a little while to get use to them and sometimes wearing them for 8 hours makes my eyes tired because it does make the world a little dimmer (that's the point!). I usually take them off for a few minutes and then once my eyes readjust I'm craving to put them on again. I really appreciate how they are saving my eyes and giving me more energy throughout the day. I love that they come with a case, and a cleaning cloth. They LOOK incredible.

reviews.title: These are the real deal
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 6, 2020
reviews.text: Blue light blocking glasses are important to me because I am susceptible to ocular migraines in my right eye from bright light entering my retina too quickly (think LED headlights, and you may be able to deduce how night driving etc can be a risk!) These glasses are the real deal and I can drive comfortably at night again. I recently ordered a pair of glasses from another company and the lenses were simply tinted yellow and it was literally useless. That being said, I am super grateful to have found this product and will be ordering another pair from this company to keep in my car at all times. 5 stars!

reviews.title: so cute just not exactly what I was looking for

reviews.text: I bought these glasses because my job is pretty much staring at a screen all day and need some relief from the blue light. I order the Purple Amber glasses and love love love the look of them but I'm not sure that I love the style of these glasses on my face. I figured I would try something new with round frames but these glasses sit weird on my face. I feel like they sit up too high on my nose and protrude from my face too much. Overall I really like these glasses but maybe just not the right ones for my face.

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 19, 2019
reviews.text: I have a desk job, and spending so much time looking at computer screens started to make me feel like my eyes were straining whenever I would look away, or into natural light. I tried these glasses, and sure enough, the tone of the computer screens looks warmer and not so blue and bright. I haven't been using them for too long, so I can't speak of long term results, but so far, it has been great and I can tell a big difference from days I use them to days I may forget to. The frames are also really cute and a subtle color. I got the Purple Amber frames and love them! They aren't super purple or bright, even from a certain distance they may look kind of brown. They aren't too big, but just right, and fit really comfortably.

reviews.title: Nice!

reviews.text: Great shoes. Large toe box. Very breathable. Comfortable. I wear 13 or 14 depending on brand of shoe. Debated on which size to order. Went with 14. Perfect fit. My foot is slightly on the wide side. These fit perfect in those regards. I'd say unless your foot is crazy wide, these should work for you. I'd also probably size up if unsure. Probably depends on sock thickness or wearing barefoot. Really like the breathability. I can see them being ideal for summer wear. I did wear them with a medium wool sock already this winter in single digit temps for a short period of time without issues. Not sure how they would work as water shoe, but for general everyday wear, they're great. Recommend.

reviews.title: BEST SHOES EVER
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 6, 2022
reviews.text: The last time I enjoyed a pair of shoes this much, is when I learned I didn‚Äôt have to be barefoot for the rest of my life.

reviews.title: Best multi-purpose shoes I've owned so far.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 16, 2019
reviews.text: I love, love, LOVE these shoes. This will be my second pair in something like 10 years. The first pair took me for over a month in Tahiti and have been everywhere in between since about 2017. I got them originally because I wanted something hikable that would dry quickly as our trip in Tahiti found us on a boat for 2 weeks. I also wanted them to double as water shoes that would do a little more than sandals to keep rocks and gravel out. After that trip they've been out numerous times camping, fishing, and vacationing in other places and have performed very faithful service as an everyday shoe because of their comfort. I Love these shoes. They're definitely a very good mixture of just the right amount of lots of things for me. For my lifestyle they're like a sport utility shoe. Does lots of things well but nothing perfect. Regardless the trade offs are all more than tolerable and beat the pants off of most shoes I've purchased in the past to do one or two things. -First, they perform as a workable water shoe. They will stay a little wet but I haven't had many problems getting them to dry after about a day in the sun. Even when wet they don't stay soaking or sopping wet for long. -I would very easily trust them for hiking and backpacking for long periods of time. Although, I haven't done much of that with them yet I imagine some waterproof socks and wicking socks would complete the ensemble to make these very comfortable thru trip gear. -The comments about them letting in sand is true. Sand yes, rocks NO! I can tolerate a little sand in my shoes but stepping on gravel or sharp shells can screw up your whole day. They kept the big stuff out and that's what I really cared about. -They're very comfortable and light. Nothing overly supportive or gangly and tough to screw up your natural stride. Going on dayhikes are a dream. -Resilliant. These have been in the washer more than a few times. I must have worn them for thousands of walked miles now and they're holding up well. No delaminated rubber or anything unusual considering the amount of wear. The ONLY reason I'm buying another pair, in fact, is so that I have a reliable/fresher pair to take on longer hikes where I don't want to worry about a failure. In all seriousness, these have outlasted a few pairs of Catepillar steel toe workboots and a number of other pieces of footwear I use less frequently. They've been covered in cement, used to kick or push rocks, walked in for god knows how many steps, survived my disgusting foot smell, been washed and dried more than once and they're still in good shape and look decent enough to wear into town on weekends... Just amazing.

reviews.title: Good, but
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on July 15, 2017
reviews.text: These shoes have been great. Fit is excellent, they grip well in all conditions and they are cool and comfortable. I still wear them frequently for everything from commuting to work through gardening to weekend walks. 4 Stars only because they have not worn as well as they should at this price. The sole and structure are fine but the lightweight mesh upper is badly scuffed and torn and has worn through on the outers just behind the toes. Am I going to buy another pair? ...... probably.

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Passed Ryanair carryon sizing reqs but also survived being checked through two connecting flights
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 1, 2022
reviews.text: I bought two of these in a rush as we needed them for a family trip, and this model was in stock vs. the spinner. While I wish the 4-wheel 21-inch model would have been available in time (that one is listed as: Case Dimensions: 21 inches x 14 inches x 9 inches; Overall Dim: 23 inches x 14.5 inches x 9 inches; Weight: 5.4 lbs, Vol: 46 liter) , this 20-inch model actually is closer to the Ryanair specs as of August 2022. (TravelPro does offer an "international" 19-inch spinner model on its own site, but that one has slightly less capacity at 39L and was not in stock within my timeframe. Specs: Overall Dimensions: H: 21.75 in. W: 15.75 in. D: 7.75 in. Case Dim: H: 19 in. W: 15 in. D: 7.75 in. Weight: 5.3 lbs. Vol: 39 L) I'm happy to report that this 20-inch two-wheel style met Ryanair's specifications with nary a second glance. Ironically I was forced to check it on a Delta/KLM codeshare, because the flight was very full. The Azure Blue looked pretty much good as new when it showed up on the carousel, despite being checked onto two connecting flights. Post-trip pic attached - any color variation in the full-length pic is due to shadows, not dirt. Azure Blue is actually a nice warm blue, first pic is just a little overexposed due to afternoon sun. See second photo for color comparison. (Actually the bag looked better than my also brand-new hardshell American Tourister (ABS) spinner which was checked on the same flights and emerged with several long scuffs. But they both did the job which was to protect my belongings and remain intact.) I appreciate that this TravelPro has some higher-end features: all the zippers, even the ones on the interior mesh divider, are two-way (i.e. not just a single one-way zipper); the telescoping handle has two height adjustments; the wheels run smoothly and in fact track so well that you can push the bag down an aisle instead of pulling it, allowing for more maneuverability; the grab handle on the bottom makes it easier to move when loading into an overhead compartment; it's stable and not tippy even when fully loaded and with extra bags resting on top. It does not have locking zippers though you can use a small padlock to secure the zips. My one caveat is that I wish the side grab handle was oriented vertically or diagonally when the bag is standing upright, instead of horizontally. That would make it easier to grab when it is lying on its side (e.g. on a carousel) or to carry when walking in close quarters, as if it were a briefcase. Last thing that I really like about this bag is that it is quite light (5.4 lbs, vs. other similar models from diff brands which can clock in at up to 8.2 lbs), which makes it far easier for me to hoist it over my head. I am >5 feet tall so when I put it into an overhead bin I need to stand on the seat or lift it in a full overhead press, so every ounce saved matters to me. Plus of course the lighter the bag, the more capacity I have for my belongings. Quite happy with this purchase!

reviews.title: Best Value for Money Carryon Luggage
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 21, 2022
reviews.text: I'm one of those who doesn't like to spend a lot on luggage because it takes one airline baggage handler to ruin your investment when that handler flings your luggage onto the conveyor belt without care or when he stacks up other bags on top of it. With that said, this carryon is an excellent balance between value and money: you don't spend a whole lot but you get excellent quality, durability, and functionality. I recently traveled with my TravelPro and found it to be excellent. It held up well to abuse, it rolled like clockwork, the wheels being top quality, and the zips worked without snags. The only design flaw is the side handle: I wish it has been aligned top-to-bottom instead of front-to-back, but both handles are strong and can lift a heavy carryon. If you get a good price for this carryon, you will not regret. One final thing: it has excellent volume and it fits carryon bins on both domestic and international flights as I found out during my travels last week.

reviews.title: You need this bag in your travel arsenal. Buy it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 4, 2018
reviews.text: If you like my review, please give it a thumbs-up. I only write reviews to help fellow Amazon shoppers. I am not compensated for any products, (I buy them with my own money, like many of you) and I write what I experience in order to make Amazon Reviews better for us all. This Travelpro Maxlite 5 22" is possibly the best carry-on out there for price/value. Yes this bag is slightly larger in overall dimensions (from top of bag to bottom of wheels, it's about 23" tall) that US Domestic restrictions for some airlines (United, for one) BUT this bag easily fits into overhead bins. I flew with this bag on 777's, 737-700's and A321s, all without issues. Gate agents didn't even look at this bag and I didn't stand out with it either. Other travellers who were trying to stuff rather large duffels were told at the gate they'd have to check their bags. Bag construction is of high quality nylon mesh and other high quality plastics. The wheels are perfectly round and feel durable. I pulled my bag across airports, roads, crosswalks and the uneven sidewalks in NYC. No issues and the bag remains stable and upright when being pulled. I elected to buy the two-wheeled version versus the spinner in order to gain more interior room in the bag. I was able to pack 3 suits and dress shirts (in a suit protector I also bought on Amazon) along with some golf shirts, shorts, jeans, socks and other small items. All this without making the bag bulge or look overstuffed like a Thanksgiving turkey. The bag is easy to pull down a jet's aisle(s) and with its built in padded side handle, making your way to your seat is a breeze. Being super light unpacked, this bag really makes great use of space all without making the bag heavy when packed. The zippers all have nice pulls and are easily accessible. The main compartment zippers have connecting loops so you can put a lock on your bag if you are forced to gate check. There's a front zippered pocket which serves you well for your phone and travel docs before going through TSA. This makes emptying your pants pockets easy so you can go unmolested through TSA checkpoints. While an occasional reach around from TSA could be nice, I prefer to avoid such personal interactions. The front expandable section of the bag allows for easy storage of a thin laptop or iPad and some cables. All making for easy access while on board a plane so you can get situated before flight with your devices. I can see packing for a 5 day trip in this bag and maybe adding a backpack for some extras to get to 7-8 days total. Overall, this bag is a great value, well made and I can see getting many good years out of it. And with bag fees going from $25-$30, buying and owning a bag like this is a no brainer now. If you use it 2-3 times, it will have paid for itself. You need this bag in your travel arsenal. Buy it. You can come back and thank me later.

reviews.title: The best brand
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 4, 2022
reviews.text: Love all of my TravelPro suitcases. The handle of one of my large cases bent and didn't slide in and out well (probably because of a very heavy back pack on the handle) and the company sent a replacement I was able to change myself. You can't go wrong with TravelPro. They are light, nice looking and have plenty of room. I also recommend sticking to the 2 wheel suitcases. The "swivelers" with 4 wheels are all the rage but 2 wheels are easier to pull over uneven ground, less likely to have wheels breaks and have more room (the 4 wheels on the bottom take away space).

reviews.title: Light and easy to use
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on May 27, 2019
reviews.text: I bought this after belatedly realising that airlines now allow larger in-cabin bags than the old TravelPro I bought around 20 years ago. I'd been shoe-horning everything into a smaller space than necessary or omitting stuff. More fool me! I'm not generally a brand loyalist but, after researching the alternatives, I plumped for another TravelPro not least because the old one is still in excellent condition, bar the knocks and bashes that some intense business travel has inflicted. They're tough. And in use, the MaxLite lives up to its name: despite being 25% bigger it's clearly lighter than my old TravelPro, the wheels have rubber tyres so it's quieter than the plastic ones, and they're enclosed, so less likely to get damaged. You can thump this over pavements and it'll still work. One or two more external pockets would have been nice but other than that, it's hard to fault.

reviews.text: This piece of luggage is described as light weight - but that‚Äôs about all I can say that I like about it. The suitcase is flimsy. I opened it up, and the lid flops open. It‚Äôs also described as having inline skate wheels. There‚Äôs no way you could use a wheel like this for skating - it‚Äôs false advertising, and the description needs to be changed. The wheel is a lightweight luggage wheel and flimsy - as is the entire piece of luggage. It has a pocket on the inside, but it‚Äôs has no room to give, so it won‚Äôt hold much, and the zippers are lightweight and a poor quality. I carry a CPAP machine with me that I attach to the handle, but the handle is flimsy, and I don‚Äôt think it will hold up to having the CPAP machine strapped to it. I‚Äôd rather have more weight, and luggage that will hold up to heavy use. My last piece lasted 15 years with constant use, and it was sturdy. I don‚Äôt expect this piece to hold up to all the miles I put on my luggage.

reviews.text: I purchased a set of Travelpro Maxlite based on luggage reviews, and I‚Äôm very dissatisfied with all pieces. Travelpro is described as being durable and having inline skate wheels. The wheels are NOT skate wheels - which is false advertising, and the pieces are ridiculously flimsy. The last set of luggage I bought had real skate wheels and lasted for 15 years of hard use. These wheels are flimsy suitcase wheels. The entire suitcase is extremely flimsy. The handle is not sturdy, and twists as you expand it. I carry a small suitcase on top, and I don‚Äôt think the handle can support it. The zipper is the quality and size of a dress zipper. My ski coat has a thicker and stronger zipper. The frame seems like it‚Äôs made of cardboard. The luggage is very lightweight but that‚Äôs because it has no strength and is a piece of junk. I don‚Äôt understand the good reviews? Did I get the same suitcase as everyone else?

reviews.title: A simply splendid carry-on suitcase.
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada üá®üá¶ on August 16, 2022
reviews.text: I ordered this Travelpro Maxlite 5 Softside suitcase on a Friday afternoon. It arrived the very next day - Saturday - just after 1:00 PM. Wow! Amazon Prime membership at its best. Another superlative Amazon shopping experience. The suitcase itself is a brilliant piece of luggage being beautifully designed, solidly constructed and expertly finished. There are no discernable flaws that I could find in any part of this bag. None at all. The interior is remarkably roomy for a carry on roller bag. Helpfully, there are two hold down straps to secure one's packed belongings. In addition, there are a couple of small pockets on the inside to place smaller individual items. On the front flap, there are a two additional zippered pockets. One of these is larger and expandable while the smaller one is suitable for documents and such like. The solidly constructed aluminium handle extends to make this a true roller bag. The black exterior fabric is cobbled, thick and feels very durable indeed. A distinct advantage to this model over the similar sized Travelpro carry on suitcase with four (4) roller wheels is that the slightly shorter dimensions of this model are likely to make it easier to store in an overhead bin. I say this because the two wheels of this model are tucked more closely into the base of the bag. There is also less risk of one of the more exposed free spinning wheels of the four wheeled model getting caught and torn off while placing or removing it in the bin. Otherwise, dimensionally, the two bags are identical. Lastly, there are two substantial rubber or plastic tips affixed to the base opposite the rear wheels to aid in keeping the bag upright when not in motion. Altogether, this seems to be a splendid pick from the range of available choices on the Amazon website. While a little more expensive perhaps than others, the price appears to be entirely justified by the quality of the suitcase. We'll see how it actually holds up on a flight (or many!), but all the signs point to the start of a long and happy relationship.

reviews.title: Over priced at best. Not impressed especially for $100 but I did not return them. YMMV.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 8, 2022
reviews.text: Needed something light to have on my feet. Especially around the house. Heard glowing reviews for these and bit. Disappointed. The whole stretch and velcro thing doesn't work for me and putting them on and taking off is way too much hassle trying to line up the velcro. I often don't bother undoing the velcro and take them off and then stick a hand inside to put them back on without having to deal with the velcro. They walk pretty well and are like not having shoes on. There is certainly no support whatsover. They basically give you some protection under your foot and not much else. Some talk of running in these. I can't imagine doing this. I don't even really like wearing them outside and I'm a barefoot kind of guy. At half the price I'd be pleased. For some the ability to take off and roll them up is important and this does work well but not a use case I'm interested in. At $100 these are overpriced. YMMV.

reviews.title: Excellent Footwear That Compliments My African Outfits.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 25, 2020
reviews.text: First, I bought these shoes because the Japanese style goes with a number of African outfits that I have. The shoes stretch out and all that so they are forgiving and great with different widths of people's shoes. I've had the shoes for 8 months now, so I've had a number of occasions to wear them. First, they are comfortable and lightweight. It feels almost like you don't have any shoes on and light as a feather like slippers. I was worried about the stretchy material and the bottom of the shoes, but so far after 8 months they are holding up very well with no tears, deforming of the shoes or anything. Now, with all that I've said above, the reason I give these shoes 4 stars and not 5 is because in order make these shoes all stretchy, flexible and lightweight, the manufacturer had to compromise the construction of these shoes by minimizing the insoles CONSIDERABLY! So, while the shoes are comfortable, they can be a potential grind on one's feet if you are planning to walk on urban streets for many hours at a time. Also, these shoes are not forgiving on rough dirt terrain (nature paths as an example) or rough asphalt surfaces with those little black pebbles. I could feel the peebles digging into the bottom of my feet some. So, the SOLUTION was to get a pair of "Dr. Scholl's Work Massaging Gel Insole Shoe Inserts". MAN! Those inserts fit right into these shoes (you can cut them to size if you wish) and created a cushiony feel for my feet and now they feel even more comfortable. Because these shoes are stretchy and flexible, it allows for these insoles without cramping my feet at all. With these insoles in place, it really mates well with these Vibram Men's Furoshiki Black Sneaker. So, now I can do longer urban street walking and better on rough terrain I have noticed. So in summary these shoes are HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! I also recommend pairing the shoes with the Dr. Scholl's Insole Shoe Inserts if you feel your feet might be a grind and fatigued on certain walking surfaces.

reviews.title: Try them.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 21, 2018
reviews.text: First time I'd seen these, wanted to love them. Waited forever to see the reviews. Finally tried these out.... I'm on the larger side, pretty active, but was looking for a shoe that wouldn't twist or come loose during aerobic and anaerobic workouts. Mainly elliptical for the aerobic and casual walking around the house without the worry of broken glass, wood splinters, basically anything you wouldn't want to step on with bare feet. Didn't want to deal with laces, this fit. Didn't want something that was going to retain heat, this fit. Wanted something super light weight, and possibly a good travel shoe, this fit. The first fit, these things wrapped around amazingly! The "straps" seemed loose at first when wrapping the foot and placing the velcroe pads on top of each other. Adjusted for a tighter fit, but this was to be undone back to the original, intended fit. Walking around for a few minutes made it apparent that these do not need to be pulled tight for a secure fit. They are just comfortable. Like socks, but with more protection. The rubber ridges on the outside of the foot caused no discomfort, really couldn't even tell they were there. First workout, kettle bells, various other anaerobic exercises, elliptical, and a cool down on the treadmill. These were everything I was hoping for for the anaerobics, no slipping, no foot movement inside, didn't do every workout out there, but they performed excellently. The elliptical took a little to get used to, foot didn't slip or move in the shoe, but I felt like I was and inch or two shorter than usual. There is no cushion in these things, so there is no rebound from the cushion you would expect from your running shoes. No soul to crush, no pun intended. These shoes are everything I wanted them to be. They are obviously a no-running shoe, unless you are a bare foot runner, then maybe... for everything else, yes. Not a formal shoe of course, these fit and looked much better than 85% of the pictures and videos I've seen of these shoes, where the toes looked like they were wrapped in a towel of some sort. I ordered in my exact shoe size range. Just got these things, so will probably update in a few months. Really hope these can last the better part of a year, if not more. Will definitely order again! Wish I wouldn't have waited so long!

reviews.title: Great Shoe With a Minor Niggle
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on May 17, 2019
reviews.text: Right, first off - I love theses shoes and wear them as often as I can as they give my feet unbelievable freedom of movement. The are comfy well made and (mostly) well designed. They are always commented on and I have sold the virtues of the Furoshiki to all that would listen. The weigh next to nothing and fold up small for travelling, which is superb. my one niggle I the small rubberated (definitely not a real word, but you'll get my drift) toe-cap, it needs to continue about 3-5mm further up the shoe. there have been several instances of my big toe popping up, out of the rubberated (real word now I've used it twice) pocket. Now I wouldn't be so bold as to say I've got normal feet, after all what is normal? I don't have freakishly long/short toes they're just average, so this must occur to other folk. Bottom line add that 3-5mm and you've got the perfect alternative to the repellent Sandal, a great gym shoe and a terrific all-rounder. I'm also going to say they make excellent slippers. So there you have it - well worth a purchase, but with a little niggle.

reviews.title: Great shoe.

reviews.text: First off I bought the original in 2016. After 4 years of wearing them, mostly inside, they gave up and I had to chuck them. Over 4 years service isn't bad though considering I wore them pretty much every day. This version seems hugely improved over the original. First off the Velcro doesn't make contact with the floor. The toe has more protection. The sizing is way better (Before it was XS, S, M, L and XL) and they just seem a bit more robust. I picked my size of Vibram Five Fingers, 9.5-10 (44) and the fit is perfect. Will I wear them outside and go on long walks, probably not, I have my other Vibrams for that. I wear them as sort of slippers but then can also go outside to the car/garage etc, which is a bonus. Highly recommended.

Eventually the size small was ordered and here are my findings: It is well made, the small was very roomy. Usually I wear belts around my waist or sitting loose below my waist over a long top - but I think this will fit as a pant belt as long as they aren't real low cut. For my purposes I probably could have gotten the XS. All in all - great find, sizing as stated and happy with the purchase.

reviews.title: Glad I sized up just incase!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 20, 2022
reviews.text: I normally wear a size 16 / XL (225 lbs, 5' 10"). But in light of the fact that I need them for Christmas Eve in 3 days, I had no room for trial and error so I went with the 2X just in case. Had I heeded all the reviews about how much stretch there was, and ordered my usual size, I would have been screwed. As another reviewer pointed out, the solids and the patterns are made from different material. These red & white stripes were made from a Polyester Spandex blend and had very little stretch to them, much less than most of my yoga pants and other brands of leggings. The fit comfortably, not loose, but not stretched at all either. I would have preferred the ankles to have been quite a bit smaller as they are oddly pretty wide. But I'll stuff 'em inside socks and boots and no one will know lol. These are thin and pretty basic, they will do in a pinch but are nothing to get execited over. I won't be buying more.

reviews.title: Order up about 2 Sizes Up
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 10, 2022
reviews.text: I normally refuse to pay more than around 12 bucks for a pair of leggings, and I usually wear a size 3X. However, I was seeking out leggings that are not thin and sheer, but not thick fabrics like nay you will find on other clothing sites that cater to more full-figured women. Thankfully, I ALWAYS check out the size chart, so I knew before ordering I should order up about 2 sizes larger. So, I ordered these in a 5X and they fit well. Not too loose sand not too tight at all around the waist. The fabric is not sheer or too thin and the overall quality of them seems to be pretty good. I have worn these 3 times since they arrived, and I have washed and dried 3 times. So far there is no shrinkage that I have noticed. Also, no rips, no washer or dryer damage (that happens with cheaply made leggings), and no separation of the seams. They may be a bit more costly than I like, but so far, they are an ideal legging. I strongly suggest getting one pair, testing them out and see if you feel the way I do. I will be ordering more of these in the future.

reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: SO soft & comfy!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 28, 2022
reviews.text: I have ordered 4 pairs of the solid color leggings so far and 1 pair of the pattern (red & black plaid) I WILL say that I LOVE the solid color leggings. They are extremely comfortable and definitely true to size. It's nice to finally find a pair of plus size leggings that aren't see through, comfortable and fit properly (in width & length) As far as the plaid, they weren't AS comfortable but then again I think I should have gone up a size. As you can see from my pictures, they are both 2X but two different materials. I think it's the polyester (and lack of stretch) that made them feel more snug. So I'd definitely recommend going up a size if you want to order the pattern leggings and stick to your regular size for the solid.

reviews.title: Almost perfect!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 15, 2022
reviews.text: I have been searching for the perfect stretchy, matte, COTTON spandex leggings forever. These are ALMOST perfect. They are a bit too long in the leg for me. I am 5'5", extra curvy/hippy hourglass to pear shape, ~260lbs, and the 2X fit great with room for plenty of movement. The elastic bands sits at my natural waist, which I prefer, as these are under dress/skirt leggings for me, and I like having the security of them not slipping down past my hips. They are definitely slightly too sheer and thin for not wearing something to cover yourself, but again, not what I intended them for. I'm just relieved these are legitimately leggings, and not shiny workout gear with weird visible seams. I can wear these to work! And, because they are cotton and not that "velvety" material we all know...the fabric isn't too slippery, I will be able to hem them nicely myself, and I don't slide right out of my leather office chair.

reviews.title: Not the top brand out there, but does suffice.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 16, 2022
reviews.text: As a wearer of pocket T-shirts for 30 plus years, I find this T-shirt comfortable and decent. I look for T-shirts with larger borders, such as the collar, the top of the pocket, the ends of the sleeves and the bottom hem of the T-shirt. The collar is about a 5/8" hem and does not wrinkle up after washing. The same can be said about the sleeve hems and the bottom of the T-shirt hem, which are a little smaller at about 1/2", and they too did not shrivel or wrinkle after the wash. The pocket, however, has a hem of about 3/8" and has wrinkled up after the wash, making the T-shirt appear cheap. Even the three other borders of the pocket have wrinkled around the border of the pocket and it looks cheap. I wouldn't pay more than $8 bucks for these shirts in the future

reviews.title: New Favorite T-Shirts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 12, 2022
reviews.text: I tried one of these pocket T's in the summer of 2022 and fell in love. I bought a few more and recently added a few long sleeves, for the cooler weather, to my collection. I think I own about a dozen of them now. I love the faded old t-shirt look and comfortable feel. They are well made, double stitched and the color selection is surprisingly large - nearly 50 i think. They are even comparably priced to what's available at the discount (so-called) stores. There's nothing about them I don't like except when I used a brush to scrub out a greasy stain. The dye faded in that area. That's over-dying for ya! I'll just have to be more careful from now on. And with Amazon Prime's return policy, ya can hardly go wrong!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 30, 2020
reviews.text: I probably would have lived out the rest of my life without purchasing bandanas, but COVID-19 changed that. Of course, there are no available face masks to be found (at time of writing), so after reading directions on how to make your own, I ordered this set. As a former healthcare professional, I'm not convinced that the use of these bandanas will be effective, as there's no way to fit them to individual facial contours, but I'm hoping they'll be better than no mask at all. The fabric is fairly thin, but these will be folded in a way to add more layers of protection, for filtering purposes I don't know much about different types of bandanas - I only chose these because of the price and the total number of items included. After machine washing for the first time, I did notice that the hems were coming unstitched, but I hope to not have to use these indefinitely. I was just glad to be able to find a product that shipped within a short time frame and again, wasn't exorbinately priced. To all fellow shoppers: take care and stay well...

reviews.title: They Fit Until I Sit Down
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 14, 2022
reviews.text: I normally take a medium tall because I have a long crotch. After reading the reviews, I ordered an extra-large. They fit until I sit down. This means they end up too short in the back and my underwear shows, and I don't wear high rise underwear. The pants dip down in the back at least 2 inches below my waist. and 4 inches when I sit down. They are 2 inches above my waist in the front. The problem is that the design is too short in the back crotch length. I have noticed that many imported pants are now including measurements that include the front and back crotch length, this is called the rise. Most Asian pants have a short rise. So, for you who believe the problem is that you are getting too big, it is not. You may have a long crotch length. The front crotch should be shorter than the back, except for someone who is pregnant. Still, they are comfortable, so I will wear them around the house, or with a tunic. I have studied clothing design and tailoring for years. Clothing is not designed as well as it sued to be. Stretch fabric does not make up for poor design.
