reviews.title: Very Comfy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 1, 2022
reviews.text: I adore these pants. I‚Äôve ordered 3 so far and plan to grab a few more to replace all of my old ones. 2 in black and 1 in striped Navy. I‚Äôve been trying to find replacement sleep pants for my beloved comfy yoga pants I‚Äôve worn for 10 years that are falling apart and these are the closest I‚Äôve come to it. These are lovely. They are thin and flowy but not too much, relaxed fit, and the waist has the right amount of spandex so they don‚Äôt sag. You can tighten if needed and it easily stretches for those bloated days without digging into your belly. They do run a little big. I got XL but could probably fit large with no problems but I like them loose. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô3 ish and while the length is a little long on me, it‚Äôs not bad enough that I‚Äôm stepping on them so I imagine if you‚Äôre taller than 5‚Äô7 they may be short on you. Overall, great value. Well made. I can see them lasting several years of frequent use. I believe the price has went up since I purchased my previous pairs but everything else has also gone up so it is what it is.

My party-parts are covered, but I don‚Äôt want to be in a situation where I really have to rely on the goodwill of my sister/fellow bipeds. The black is nice and dark but does fade after multiple washings. The fabric has maintained its integrity in my horrible textile-blender washer. As long as there‚Äôs no overwhelming reason to go out in public you‚Äôll be fine.

reviews.title: Nothing French nor terry about these poor quality excuses for clothing
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada üá®üá¶ on October 30, 2020
reviews.text: The pants fit to size. Thas's the best thing I can say about them. On the inside, the material looks more like flat lizard scales. There is no terry. They are 60% cotton, 40%polyester. Overly warm for a woman going through menopause, Or any woman who wants to wear sweat pants. The heat held in by the polyester is like wearing a garbage bag. The first time wore them & sat down in them as a party guest, & the seam opened at the knee, leaving my knee exposed with the material further separating and exposing more skin. Instead of returning them, I expertly hand sewed the faulty seam in question, and in a few months will donate this lame excuse for "French" style clothing to charity. Customers at Amazon deserve better. Avoid and save your money for quality items.

reviews.title: Perfect for my waist, too long for my legs.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2021
reviews.text: I like the material, the zip-off legs, the waist size, the color. Too bad the legs are so long, but I realize I'm a short, chunky guy. After I received one set, I liked it well enough to order a second. I requested my wife trim the legs to a better length for me, and then hem them. She did, and they look nice! The second set I left long, since there's a hidden draw-string inside the cuff of each pant leg. It's easy to pull it tight for hiking or biking, keeping it snug around the ankle, and probably helping keep wood ticks out. The draw string has a small, narrow pocket inside each pant leg cuff to hold it, and a spring-loaded tightening tab to hold the string tight when you snug it up, so you don't have to try to tie a knot in it. The excess string is easily contained inside the pant leg when the cuff is tied snug. I like these.

reviews.title: As expected but seams started coming apart fairly quickly.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
reviews.text: Shorts are comfortable and look okay (if you care what you look like in the water). I do a lot of free-diving with minimal equipment and grabbed these because I wanted something that provided less drag than my board shorts but more coverage than a regular speedo. I was pleased with the purchase for the most part. That said, I'm not sure if it's ocean use, corrosive sunscreen, or my bulging quads ;) but after only a few collective hours in the pool and roughly 18 collective hours in the ocean, the seams began to come undone. They're still useable, but I'd imagine they're going to get raggedy in not too long.

reviews.title: Drag suit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2013
reviews.text: I have seen some ridiculous comments about these suits. 100% guaranteed those comments are not from swimmers, by which I mean, at the very least, lap swimmers. These are supposed to fit you tight and the outer layer is supposed to be saggy to create drag as you are swimming your laps. Fits the way it is supposed to - I am a size 29 waist and ordered a size 30, size 32 would definitely be too big. 5'10", 148 lbs, swimmer's body type. The sag looks cool (if you get the right size that fits tight on your thighs), if you get it too big then I am sure the sag will look ridiculous. If you are self conscious about your body this will not work for you. Only reason this gets a 4 and not a 5 is because the orange color, which I also have, is the true 5... amazing color.

reviews.title: Great training suit!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2012
reviews.text: I've had a couple of these suits over the years, and I keep going back to it on the odd occasion that I need another. They last for a very long time! I think I bought my last about 5 years ago, which for the swimsuit world is an eternity. A few suggestions...this is a training suit, and shouldn't be worn when you're planning to swim fast. You should wear a normal suit under it (aka a speedo). And definitely order 1-2 sizes larger for this than your normal speedo-type suit (I wear a 28 or 30 in a speedo, but wear a 34 in this). It does take a little getting used to, and you'll feel a little more tired than normal when you first wear it. You may only make it through 1/3 of your normal workout, take it off. Try to go a little further the next time. The great thing about this suit is that when you go without you feel super fast!

reviews.title: A great suit, made well
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2013
reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement for the same suit I bought years ago. I'm in my 40s and not a competitive swimmer, but call it 2-3 times per week for 2-3 years, and that suit held up like a champ. This replacement seems similarly well-built (how many items today seem less solid than the identical models they replace?), and finally to the point -- it works. I use this suit for my workaday workouts, and on the rare occasion that I'm in a race, I use a non-drag suit. The difference is immense. This suit is also modest in all the ways that a men's suit should be, which is to say that you could wear it around non swimming types (in a pinch) and not be embarrassed. One item of note - it does run small. I'm a 33-34 waist, and the 36 inch waist for this suit is perfect. Anything smaller and I think I'd have trouble getting my legs into it.

reviews.title: They do what I bought them to do.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 4, 2020
reviews.text: Background: I lifted heavily through my teens and twenties. After a long hiatus, I‚Äôm back in a place where I‚Äôm able to train consistently again. As I‚Äôm only ever going to get older (and I no longer have a training partner), I‚Äôve been relying more heavily on video to form check myself. One issue I began to notice was that the soles of my boots squash down considerably on even moderately weighted squats, leading to instability in my feet that translated into an uneven concentric phase; my weight was shifting back and forth from hip to knee as my feet wobbled from heel to ball of the foot over the soft sole of my boot. Not wanting to jeopardize myself or my joints, I grabbed a pair of these. Fit: As most of the other reviews have indicated, this is a long, narrow fit. Those with wide feed may have trouble. Wanting it to be tight, I went half a size down from my usual (I wear a 12, I ordered an 11.5). This turned out to be a good call. They fit securely and well. I would not recommend doing anything but lifting in them as they‚Äôre stiff and heavy and tight. For the application this is a good thing. Function: They do exactly what I was hoping they would: my feet are no longer wobbling around on a soft, unstable surface, and my knees and back feel better coming out of my squat session than they have the last few times. My feet feel glued in place once I take my stance and I‚Äôm more easily able to distribute the load across the middle of my feet instead of rocking back onto my heels as I‚Äôm sometimes prone to do. There was no magical strength boost as some have asked about or reported (nor was I expecting one), but I‚Äôm now confident that I can continue to add weight to my squats without worrying about knee, hip, or back trouble creeping in. Solid product at a great price!

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Size down, buy now!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 9, 2021
reviews.text: As mentioned, order 1/2 to 1 full size down as these tend to run large and you need a snug fit on athletic shoes. Normally I wear a size 9 in street shoes, a size 8 1/2 in athletic shoes, but I ordered an 8 and they fit perfect. Immediate improvement in squat, definitely recommended if you find that you cannot ‚Äúsit back‚Äù far enough into the squat to be stable. Great for those with an unfavorable tibia-femur ratio, so the elevated heel helps accommodate for that. The tarsal strap provides additional stability and inspires confidence in the lift and can easily be loosened after each exercise. I mainly use them for squats, lunges, and clean and jerk. For durability, I have had them for about six months and they hold up great. I only use them on leg day and if I need to do cardio in the same session, I bring different shoes. I haven‚Äôt noticed any compression of the high-density foam heels. These are purpose-built shoes, so I don‚Äôt recommend using them for cardio or lifts that don‚Äôt need special shoes (bench, deadlift, machine work, etc.). Definitely do not walk to the gym in these, they are made for stability and not mileage. Take care of them and they will take care of you.

reviews.title: Great shoes, but they definitely run a half size big.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on March 23, 2017
reviews.text: I really like these shoes VS the Adidad Powerlift shoe, primarily for the style (I bought both, returned the Powerlift because they were HIDEOUS). They seem to be almost identical in quality in function, but I went with these because they don't embarrass me in the gym. However, as others have mentioned, order a half size down. Unfortunately the 10.5 (my usual size) was on sale for like 25 dollars off and I tried them, and found they were too large. But for the steep discount I decided to deal with the size, and I don't think it's a complete deal breaker. If I could do it again though, I'd probably just pony up the 25 extra bucks for the right size. Now for function, this is why I love these shoes: 1) While I didn't regularly fall backwards on my squats, there were absolutely times where I tried to envision sitting back in a chair and would sometimes lose balance rather quickly. With these shoes, that no longer happens. Or rather, it does, but I can catch myself thanks to the heel supporting me. I love that because it's safer and makes me feel more confident at higher weights. 2) Definitely allows me to push a little better out of the hole, and allows me to get in a deeper squat position more naturally. I feel like more form has improved along while my stability since I got them. Now that I'm getting into heavier weights, I very much value this. 3) I use them for everything, including deadlifts and pendlay rows. The lift in the heel is small enough that I don't have to change, I just use them for all barbell work. Deadlifts I do feel like they get my hamstrings and glutes a bit more involved, and rows I just feel like they give me a better stretch. For OHP I do feel like they give me some better stability and put me in a slightly more athletic stance. At 66 bucks, I can't say there's a reason to NOT them and I'm happy I bought them when I did. I'm two months into Stronglifts 5x5 and weights are starting to get heavy, and these shoes allow me to take those increases with confidence.

reviews.title: You should use boot trees!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2022

reviews.title: lightweight boot tree
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2014
reviews.text: Good lightweight boot tree. Helps leather boot shaft stay upright after wearing. (As others have stated, this will not stretch the boot shaft in any way; it merely serves as a support in place of the cardboard boot shaft 'stuffing' that most manufacturers place in the boot shaft for shipping.) These lightweight plastic boot trees are better than the cardboard--better support from molded plastic, light spring-loaded pressure, and easy trigger pull on/off. They are about 2" shorter than the top of my boots (~17"). I have only used these for a few days, so can't comment on durability. I would recommend these to anyone who seeks an easy to use, very lightweight boot form with light pressure. If you need a boot tree that can provide more pressure to the boot shaft, I'd recommend a cedar boot tree with curved shaft that follows the actual curve of the leg (calf) and extends taller than the top of the boot shaft. The boot shaft here has a slight curve/extension at the calf, but it goes straight up vertically from that point; not curved/contoured the entire shaft. Overall, 4 of 5 stars for a lightweight product, easy to use, keeps boot shaft upright. Shaft height is a little short for some boots (my boots measure 17" tall), and spring-loaded tension is very light--would prefer a little stronger spring for more firm pressure on the boot shaft. (That is a comment for Ariat, the manufacturer, not the online merchant.)

Much easier & cheaper alternative than either painting them or buying new boots that'd cost probably close to $1,000 to get custom-made boots with the same design. I really like the design that allows you to simply grip the handle, push down on it to minimize the width, put it in your boot - and let go.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 20, 2020
reviews.text: For the price, this is a fine winter jacket. It's very good as a car coat and knocking about in winter weather, keeping you warm without a lot of bulk. Pay close attention to sizing as you may want to go a size down. I normally wear a large, but I followed the chest measurement guide and ordered a medium. The medium fits well on my average build and range of motion is good. If you plan on adding under layers for being outdoors in cold conditions for extended periods of time, you may want to go a size up. My only complaint is that the hood is on the small side and does not extend out beyond my face for cold, rainy days. I don't plan on any rugged outdoor use so I'm fairly certain this parka will stand the test of time.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on May 14, 2021
reviews.text: This will be my third ring from this company. C'mon for the price you get a beautiful sparkler. Yes, a while ago one of the stones come out. Not a big deal. The seller replaced the ring. Thank you for the replacement. I like the ring it's believable, it's beautiful. The ring will last if you're NOT hard on your jewelry, which I'm not, but things happen and for the price it's NOT an expensive replacement. I still have the replacement from November and it still looks good. I'm buying another...For a just in case matter. My finger has NEVER turned green from any of the rings that I've purchased from the NY company. That's from the silver having a copper presence. Doesn't mean it's not real silver (925). Enjoy your üíç. Updating this review...I took both my engagement and this ring to my jewelers for a cleaning. I have the real deal engagement ring. However, I also was wearing this ring the day I took them to get cleaned. I was floored, the Goldsmith on duty wanted to check my rings and be sure the prongs were in good shape, from the request of his manager, this man spent 15 minutes inspecting both my rings... I was like OMG please DON'T test the eternity band... OMG I was like why is he taking so long. Now mind you, this jewelry store has an open area of where the Goldsmith sits and you could see him working. This man gave the NYC Sterling ring am overhaul on the prongs...I could see the difference. He even complimented the ring, how nice the "diamonds" are... This man was wearing loops... Go figure. He cleaned both rings and they sparkled like no bodies business. So NYC Sterling, your product is on point. Thank you. I'll continue to buy from you as well. I have no issues with your rings. No tarnishing, no green fingers, no stones coming out, well one time I did, you replaced the ring, again, thank you. So ladies, for the price... What do you have to fear... Absolutely NOTHING.

reviews.title: VERY IMPORTANT INFO *MUST READ*
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 27, 2022
reviews.text: I bought a pair of these pants last year, size 33x30. they are AMAZING. they are durable beyond belief. The problem was that 33 was a bit large on me, im usually somewhere between a 32-33. So i chose to get another pair, 32x30. I could barely even zip these pants up. Then I measured the "rise" of the pants, and i discovered that they took a whole inch away in the 32! So the 33 pants have a rise of 12.5". Plenty of room, and they're great if you like to wear your pants at your waist instead of your hips. The 32 pants have a rise of only 11.5". This is why i cant even pull them all the way up. the crotch is tiny. I have no clue what the rise would be if you bought a 34 or 36 or any other size really. but hope this will help someone

I normally wear a 32/34 and it's perfect at the waist and just slightly too short in the length. 32 and 33 waist sizes we're painfully tight so I ended up with a 34/34 which is loose in the waist and almost drags the ground. I wear suspenders, so the waist works for me. They're nice during winter, but they're so heavy that I don't think I could wear th in the summer.

reviews.title: Great Work and Trail Legwear
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 14, 2010
reviews.text: I was in the market for a good, strong, hiking and trail pant. Most of the options I came across were too heavy, not durable enough, or didn't have the right pockets. I research, but rarely purchase, clothing online, but these weren't on any shelves in my area so I took the risk and ordered a pair through Amazon, thanks to a "no-fee" return offer on them at the time. Though that guarantee turned out to be a bit of a hassle I was very pleased with the purchase and ended up with three pairs, one of each color. Here is my overall analysis: Pros: 1) The pants are lighter and more breathable than I expected. I have other double-knee pants; they are quite heavy. However, these are made of a durable but lightweight cotton weave that breathes very well. Considering all of the extra pockets and associated material (including Cordura-lined back pockets) I was shocked at how light the pants were. They represent the pants as being rip resistant ("Ripstop" as they say) and while I haven't seen them handle a rip, I am inclined to believe their claim. The particular weave of the cotton suggests that they would be hard to tear. 2) Good pockets and belt loops. The pockets are strong, well-stitched, and located in the right places. The front hip pockets are deep and made of very strong cotton. Not the thin white cotton found in jeans, these are almost canvas-like; very reliable. As I said above, the rear pockets have thick Cordura on the inside as the lining. I am confident that my shop pencil or combination square will not easily rip through as it has with my work jeans. The cargo pockets only have fullness on the rear seam, which is smart (the front seam lies flat, which prevents brush from catching easily while on the trail). They area large enough and close with durable snaps that can be opened one-handed, but don't pop open on their own. No buttons to fumble with or weak velcro patches. There is also a cell phone pocket (maybe a little small for some), an exterior "pliers" cargo pocket, and a hammer loop; all on the right side, so Southpaws beware. The "patented tape measure patch" is kind of a gimmick as it isn't very thick leather and doesn't actually run on the inside of the pocket at all, which is where my tape always grabs and pulls. It covers the outside and the fold at the top of the pocket, but that's it. It's not bad, just doesn't really solve the tape pinching "dilemma." The seven decent belt loops (including an extra wide center loop in the back) are well-spaced and provide good support and allow ample space for useful additions like binoculars, a flashlight, or a knife (yes, even a belt holster for those who are so inclined). 3) Serious stitching All of the major seams are triple stitched. All of the secondary ones are double and pretty serious. Most of the single-stitched are not high tension seams (just fullness and folds it seems) and look sturdy. Also the thread is of good quality. See "Cons" below for a side note. 4) Relatively Reasonable Price I paid [...] per pair (w/ free shipping and return shipping) on Amazon. Wrangler would sell direct at a little cheaper ($37 each I think) with free shipping on orders over $100. But of course, the return shipping would've been on me. So I went with Amazon. That's cheaper than Carhartts and these pants are lighter, have better pockets, and are better for hiking. However, I recently found these on a shelf at our local hardware mega-center (Menard's, for those who know it) at around $30 per pair. That's a screaming deal. So look for them. You might be able to find a local retailer by going to [...]. Cons: 1) Be aware - Waist measurements seem to be on the low side. I was thankful for the free return shipping deal, since the pants seem to run on the small side for their waist measurements. All of my other pants are 33s, but for these I needed a 34 to feel comfortable. And no, it wasn't merely wishful thinking on my part, the pants really do run tight in the waist. 2) Made in Mexico If you're a "Made in the USA" person, these won't fulfill that criteria. But judging by the quality, Wrangler made it clear they wanted good workmanship. If you're simply sick of substandard products from overseas, especially China, these aren't that. Not even close. 3) A couple of single-stitch runs might not hold up. Here and there, I have found a few stitching errors. Thread tails, needle burps, even one unfinished end. But all of them were in non-critical places. All in all, on three pairs I found 5 or 6 errors TOTAL. I don't know if you can do better than that for assembly-line clothing. 4) The free return shipping required a call to Amazon...twice. Despite the "automatic" nature of the free return shipping offer from Amazon, both of the pairs that I returned resulted in a return shipping charge on the return amount. This required a call to an Amazon Support rep both times to have return shipping refunded to me as well. The reps were friendly, quick to reverse it, and noted that the return should have been automatic. But since it wasn't twice, it was obviously not something they were going to fix. Realizing that this is not really relevant to the product itself, i did not figure in this factor when giving the four star rating. Nonetheless, you should know it for your own decision. Overall, very pleased with the purchase. Good, sturdy pants with nice features at a competitive price. They aren't Carhartts, but I didn't really want Carhartts or to pay Crahartt prices . I wish I had waited and bought it locally for the reduced price, but at the time this was as good a deal as I could find.

reviews.text: PROS: I buy these Wrangler Riggs Ranger pants all the time. I have insulated, non-insulated and shorts. I like the fact that my pockets are always in the same places all year round. reviews.title: QC lower than usual. Unsure of quality.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on June 30, 2022
reviews.text: I have 3 other colour variants of this pair of trousers. The other 3 are made in Nicaragua, while this pair is made in Bangladesh. The QC seems to be a lower standard on this pair, if I am to assume that they are genuine Wrangler's. Alignment of the 2 rear pockets is not the same as my other pairs, and actually not the same as each other. The Cordura rear pocket lining has a different stitching line and less material used for the wrap-around excess. The colour of the Cordura is also noticeably more brown than the more green/brown of the other pairs. Genuine Cordura? The side cargo pockets have less material used in the expansion layer and therefore won't expand as much when being filled as my other pairs. I paid significantly less for this pair, ¬£20 compared to around ¬£40-¬£50 for the others I have. It may be that there are other corners that have been cut in the manufacturing of this pair that I have not yet noticed. All of these points were identified in 10 minutes after opening the package, which I don't believe to necessarily be the original packaging, and it should also be noted that all the tags and store sale labels were already removed. In all, it does seem that there's a reason for this particular pair to be sold at such a discount compared to the Nicaraguan made pairs I have. I just hope that the bad QC doesn't extend to such things as thread quality and other things that are not so easily detected.

reviews.title: A nursing essential!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2022
reviews.text: These soft nursing tops are my favorite shirts to wear out in public and around the house. They are roomy enough that I wore them at the end of my pregnancy, when my other maternity shirts were getting too tight. They are flattering, but best of all very modest. When my baby is hungry I don't feel self conscious or feel the need for an additional cover while nursing around other people. They open up to where I can reveal just enough breast for baby to nurse, but don't expose my whole chest like many other nursing tops. They are also great for pumping. They open up wide when needed so I can easily attach my pump to both breasts. I have worn these the last 7 months. They have held up in the wash beautifully, no tearing or fading and they are still super soft. Don't forget them in the dryer or in a laundry basket, because they do tend to wrinkle a little. Even if they are wrinkled once I wear them for a while the wrinkles tend to go away. I like these so much I even wear them to work. My mom bought me more in different colors because they are flatering and functional. If you are breastfeeding or plan to, get these shirts!

When my husband ordered these for me, I couldn't believe the feel of them! They feel so soft and clean and actually make me feel good about myself again! There is only one downside to the sizing in that it fits right on the belly which isn't great postpartum, and it fits loose on the bust because of the way the part that under part is. Definitely order your regular size but be prepared for the top to be a bit loose and bottom a bit tighter at first. Love this product! These are the only nursing shirts I will now be buying!!! Thanks for making me feel good again!

reviews.text: I get my mom slippers every year because she wears them out and the "slide" or scuff slippers from Ugg would make her hips and knee hurt. She said her favorite pair were moccasins back in the day so we tried this style. She is THRILLED. She loves them. Easy to put on. Warm. Doesn't make her hips or knees ache. Absolutely thrilled mom is happy.

reviews.title: Comfy Ugg slippers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 9, 2021
reviews.text: These slippers felt stiff and tight when I first put them on. Also, wearing them with bare feet, the fur felt prickly which would have been the plant based silicate included within the sheep fur. After a day of wearing though, these have turned into the most comfortable slippers I have ever owned! The stiffness has gone and they feel snuggly rather than tight. The prickly feeling has gone and the fur is cosy and warm. Be assured, these are genuine Uggs and I would be happy to recommend them.

reviews.title: Good slipper - but sizing is quite small
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 30, 2020
reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife. She is UK size 4. Previous reviews had said fitting is tight - so go for one up in UK sizing. However, I couldn't find any stock in the UK in time for Christmas. Amazon have an international logistics centre which accommodates international purchases. So I bought US size 7 (the charts all say US sizes are equivalent to two lower in the UK). Delivery (from the US) was amazingly fast (three days?), and I held my breath on Christmas day at the unveiling, but according to my wife, the sizing works for her. Phew !

reviews.title: Levi Quality at a Fair Price, But Watch for Threads and Lint
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2022
reviews.text: FINAL VERDICT These jeans are the classic Levi‚Äôs that fit as expected and are very high quality; compared to any other place online, the price point (when there are price drops) of these jeans is outstanding. However, a couple loose threads at the bottom of the jeans make me worry about the longevity. DETAILED REVIEW: The Good: Shipment: The jeans arrived in a neat, undamaged box, with accurate shipping time. Fit: The jeans fit exactly as expected based on typical jeans sizing, for me. I got a 30x30 in the ‚ÄúBastion‚Äù color ‚Äì highly recommend the color for a classy casual look. Value: At this price point, this jeans are a steal. Watch out for intermittent price drops that make these jeans unbeatable. The Bad: Loose threads in the seam: After a couple uses, I noticed a couple loose threads in the seam of the jeans. I worry about the longevity but hope that a couple threads won‚Äôt cause an issue. Lint Attraction: A dog owner, this jeans do unfortunately catch a lot of dog hairs and lint. Not a total dealbreaker, but something to keep in mind.

reviews.title: Decent, not fantastic
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 15, 2022
reviews.text: The material seems to be the same as what they use for those disposable hazmat suits. In fact, I would say the product was designed to be used a few times and thrown away, not something that will last more than a year. The fit is kind of funky also, because it rides way up on the crotch though the legs are too long, and overall is ballonish and much bigger than anyone could ever need, unless you are severely overweight. The suspenders aren't anything too special, and the zippers are cheap and won't last long either, as far as I can tell. Compared to my Helly Hansens I was trying to replace, the difference in quality is noticeable, and though these may be a lot cheaper, I wouldn't trust them in the woods. They make noise so they really aren't good for hunting, but I suppose if someone's on a tight budget and doesn't need them for more than once or twice a year they would be OK. I'm sending them back and spending more to get better quality and fit. These are OK and might be useful for a certain kind of buyer, but I'm the kind of person who doesn't mind paying for quality outdoors equipment.

reviews.title: Listened to other reviews and got exactly what I hoped to get.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 17, 2015
reviews.text: I'm 5'6" and wear 30" inseam pants. I read the other reviews and decided to play it safe and just order a size small. I wanted to make sure that when I tried them on that I didn't end up swimming in them. Anyway, I Just unpacked them and tried them on over my clothes. First impressions. High crotch, length is perfect! I'm not stepping on the cuffs. Just loose enough for layering. The shoulder straps are elastic and adjustable. I make them as long as possible and the crotch issue is resolved. They float real nice on me. If you're taller than 5'6" you can't wear size small. You'd have to modify the shoulder strap length. Next is the flexibility test because I don't wanna rip out the crotch. I drop into a squat and they slide real nice over my clothes. They do stretch snug over the top of the thighs though, but loose everywhere else. The crotch seems pretty well constructed. Next I step one leg up on a chair and do a deep runner stretch with the other leg as far back as possible. No problems at all and crotch isn't stressed. I would like them to be just a "little" more baggy so they don't stretch snug over the top of the thighs while squatting, but I refuse to lose how well they fit everywhere else. Now the zippers. For me, the chest zipper goes low enough so I can use the head. Something I was expecting not to have, so that's a great bonus. The leg zippers are more than high enough for access but the adjustment straps pull from the side to the front. Shouldn't they pull from the side/front to the back? The result is this weird scoop ends up on the sides. Not very streamlined. No matter, I'll remove it myself and put it where I want it. They fit perfect enough to keep. If I somehow end up ripping the crotch out there's no way I would ever need to replace them with anything larger than a medium. In fact from what I gather from the other reviewers I would be swimming in them. I'm dinging one star for the lack of chest pockets (zippered ones would be perfect) and the lack of hand pockets as well (zippered ones would be good there as well). I'll update after I put them through their paces. I'm still waiting for my jacket to show up.

reviews.title: Not good on a motorcycle. Crotch seeps water.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 7, 2019
reviews.text: Performance: I bought these to see if I could use them with my motorcycle commutes when it got wet outside. I like the bib in combo with my motorcycle rain jacket. Unfortunately, even just in mist/fog type moisture, these pants will seep in the crotch. Everything else is fine. I'm sure it's just that the seems aren't meant to be tested while under the stress of sitting on a motorcycle. If I just stand up and let someone spray me with a water hose, everything repels water fine. Construction: The material is extremely lightweight and tougher than it appears. It's not that easy to rip this material. The seams don't have any visible defects that would allow them to leak which is why I'm sure they work perfectly when not under stress. Under extreme heat, like an exhaust pipe, they will melt fast. Keep them away from a strong heat source. Conclusion: I'm 5'10" 200 lbs and I bought them to go over a bunch of riding gear so I bought an XL, I could have easily gotten away with a L. These sizes are already set up to account for going over a layer of clothing. If you want to stay dry while walking around, these will work beautifully. If you want to stay dry while riding a motorcycle, they will get your crotch wet after about 20 mins; everything else will be dry.

reviews.title: I bought frog Toggs again for side by side rain gear!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 18, 2022
reviews.text: I have had frog Toggs Rain gear before. My pants finally wore out after three years and I am using this for trail riding in West Virginia, Kentucky and Tennessee. It keeps me dry and is very light weight. I decided to go with the bib pants this time. I bought large and they fit fine over jeans and my boots. The fact that I use my rain gear a maybe six to eight a times a year justifies the cost versus high-end gear. I will buy again when I need them.

reviews.title: Very comfortable but may run "small"
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on April 11, 2021
reviews.text: I have already worn these for two fifty-mile rides and they have proven to be comfortable and provide good support. Sole "stickiness" is just right; I had no trouble adjusting pedal foot position during rides. However, as a precaution, I ordered one-size bigger and I was proven right; they may run "small." That notwithstanding, my experience would lead me to conclude that they are very good value for the price.

reviews.title: One major gripe
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 16, 2020
reviews.text: I liked everything about this shoe from the start (the look, the comfort, functionality, price) but have one major concern. The grip on the bottom is too soft and quickly got torn up by my pedal pins. Now the bottom is a shredded mess and the grip is not great. I'm riding 2-3 times per week and the bottom was destroyed within just a few months. These are probably great for an occasional or very recreational rider but I will be upgrading to five ten freeriders.

reviews.text: I bought these to replace some shoes that were too small. The sole on these is not stiff. That's disappointing. I have Vans that are basically equivalent to these. These weren't cheap and don't work better than my skate board shoes. They are not comfortable as they run narrow for a regular size shoe. If you're looking at these Giro shoes for MTB /w platforms, go buy something else.

reviews.title: Love the Fit - Love the way they Feel - Love the way they make me LOOK!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 27, 2022
reviews.text: I have lost a fair amount of weight in the last year, and there is nothing like putting on a pair of jeans that fit perfectly and make me look good! Every other pair of jeans and trousers I have put on in the past 10 years have not fit, or have to be in a larger size and don't fit in the waist. I still cannot put on any other brand of jeans and have them fit me. The NYDJ Marilyn Straight - are about as perfect as a pair of jeans can get. can get. These are wonderful - they are a tiny smidge too big in the waist - but that is because I have always had an abnormally small waist to hip and breast ratio. And I've discovered that jeans button pins make the waist adjustable, so that takes care of the waist issue. I live in these!

reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Excellent time piece!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 23, 2022
reviews.text: First off, I am a huge fan of Citizen Eco-Drive watches. I bought my first one in 2010 and it's still running to this day. I stopped using that one daily after the band broke down on me and I haven't gotten around to replacing it. Fast forward to 2022 and I'm in need of another solid watch. I had been using an older Casio G-Shock after joining the military, but that started dying on me and the display only got more faint as time went on even after battery replacement. Then I got a cheaper Timex watch and the timing on it started to fall way behind after only about a month of use, up to an hour behind at times. I had enough, so I looked at getting a new Citizen Eco-Drive watch. One that matched my uniform which is what I wear most of the week. I needed a watch that was easy to read at a glance, reliable, rugged enough for work, and accurate. This watch hits all those marks. I haven't had a single problem with it since purchasing it and I've already taken it all over the place. The only 2 downsides I can think of are: 1. The band it comes with isn't the greatest. It's definitely TOUGH, but it's a bit too stiff and a bit too short if you have larger wrists. I wouldn't say I do and it was still not an easy fit. I replaced the band with a Supreme NATO strap from Crown & Buckle. 20mm band/strap fits the watch fine in my eyes regardless of what the specs say. 2. The hands don't glow as much as I'd like in the dark. Night shifts or later shifts can be rough when you're away from any lighting. Don't get me wrong, I can make out the time, but it takes longer than I'd like to because the hands aren't as bright. The only feature I miss from my G-Shock is the light up function. But overall, I'd trade that for not having to replace batteries ever again any day of the week. And I don't usually work nights or away from lighting, so it's something I can deal with. In the end, if these features seem to suit you and your needs, definitely recommend this watch!

reviews.title: Beautiful casual watch. Band comically short
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 25, 2022
reviews.text: I‚Äôve got two Citizen watches in my collection, both from the PCAT family. They are stunning, but also getting very expensive. I was looking for a more casual look, and more modest value. This thing is very nice looking and the solar charging system is as flawless as ever. But the band is just a fail. I‚Äôm a guy of, let‚Äôs say, larger carriage. My wrists are big but I‚Äôve never had an issue with a watch fitting. This one? Not even close to wearable. I spent a full minute struggling to get the last hole to buckle. When it did I couldn‚Äôt move my hand. Sucks getting a nice timeiece in this pedigree/price range and immediately have to come back to Amazon to find a useable band for it

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 16, 2022
reviews.text: I have a lot of watches - I really like this watch (quartz, so accurate - eco-Drive so no worry about battery). It looks great - but it is a bit heavy... I have several high end steel Omegas and this watch seems heavier at the end of the day. No, it's not a big deal - but just thought I'd mention in a review. Citizen makes a great watch - if you like the look (and I do), enjoy!

reviews.title: Get a replacement band right away.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 7, 2022
reviews.text: Like a lot of folks have said, order a 20mm replacement band right away. The factory one is stiff and way too small. I have small wrists, and I had it on the very last hole of the band. I‚Äôm not sure why Citizen would put that band on an otherwise great watch. The watch looks classic and classy. Other than the band, I highly recommend this watch.

reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Great looking, painful to wear
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 29, 2021
reviews.text: I love Citizen watches. They have given me good quality and consistency through a lot of hard wear and use outside. Bonus, I never have to change the battery. I've had my eye on this one for quite a few years. I dont recall when I first saw it, but it was around 2016. It arrived Saturday, the box was damaged. It had pretty clearly been opened before, the watch had a home once already. But it looked good and undamaged and started working immediately. The first negative I noticed is that the watch band is laughably narrow. It looks like they swapped bands with a woman's watch. Fine if thats your thing, but I really did not care for tge proportions. The next thing I noticed is how thick and stiff the band is. I dont know how many layers of Cordura they sewed together, but it is puffy in the middle, which is odd geometry to put on a watch band because you create pressure points on the wrist. The band sucks. It is ugly because it is so narrow, it is very difficult to manipulate because it is so stiff, and it is incredibly uncomfortable. Both my previous citizens also got low marks for band quality, so its not really a deal breaker for me, but boy is it ever irritating to spend $180 on a watch that you can't wear out of the box. For the price of a good looking replacement band, I could have just gotten a Timex. My solution was to make a crude frog that slips under the band. It takes the pressure off my skin, and it makes the band appear thicker. I'm not kidding when I say, if you buy this watch, buy a new band at the same time.

reviews.title: Good quality hat
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 7, 2022
reviews.text: I really like the quality of the hat. My only gripe is, when I measured my head, it was at 22.5", so I ordered the L-XL expecting it would fit without needing to stretch. However, there is a snug fit to the hat and I can feel it stretch when I put it on, which grows uncomfortable after a few hours of wearing it. I wore it for several days (pretty much all day) and it ended up producing a sore and scab on my forehead. I guess I just have a huge head. I plan to try the XL-XXL size to see if that's a better fit for all-day use. I plan to keep this hat though. The snug fit is exactly what I want for long-boarding, boating, etc when you don't want the thing blowing off your head.

reviews.title: i have about 25 pairs---what does that tell you???
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 18, 2022
reviews.text: i live in SoCal, where we never get too cold, so i wear the capris 9 months out of the year. I am large (5'7", 265 lbs) and the 3x-5x fit me very easily---not at all constricting, and a few are even a bit baggy. I wear predominantly black, navy, brown and even one pair of purple, so i can't speak to the see-through-ness of lighter colors, but the dark colors are not at all see-through. It is the same fabric content as LulaRoe leggings, and i've had zero fading or bleeding on any of them. I wash them on cold, on the delicate cycle, and hang to dry. The few times i've had to machine-dry them, they come out fine. I just hang them because i think it will add to the life of the fabric. with as many pairs of these i've bought, only ONE has gotten a small hole in the crotch. I've been buying them for at least five years, and seldom throw anything away, so that means i'm going on five years with some of these pants. Yes, i have a bunch so i don't have to wash a few loads for a couple weeks at a time (or longer), which also adds to the life, but i'm totally satisfied with the quality and durability of these capris/pants. as some have stated, the ankle-length pants do run long, so you might have a little scrunching-up at the ankles, but better than too short, IMO. I have recommended these to everyone i know (especially when you couldn't get solid leggings from LulaRoe very often, or for half the price). the leggings from Roaman's, et al, have a high cotton content, and start fading from the first wash, and they bag and sag after a few hours. These have not faded at all. i don't know what i'm gonna do when they stop making tunic tops long enough to cover my fat butt, and when this store stops making stretchy pants. I've gotten so spoiled by their comfort and elasticity.

reviews.text: These are fairly thin and I would never wear them in public without something covering my butt (I've got the kind of cellulite you can see through normal pants, so...) HOWEVER, I bought them to use as comfy pajama bottoms and they are perfect. I wear them inside out because I'm a stomach sleeper and the inner seam irritates me otherwise, but I don't think it would bother me if I wore them as actual clothing lol. I've had my current pair for two years and aside from a loose thread, it's still going good! Just bought two more as a subtle hint to never stop making these ‚ù§Ô∏è

reviews.title: They really are amazing leggings...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on October 22, 2022
reviews.text: These are by far the best leggings I've ever got. I've bought several pairs in black in both the 3x-5x and most recently the 1x-3x as I've lost weight. They are both great. They're true to size, they last, they're comfy, they're not see through at all, they stay pretty black even after washing (I'll get into that), they're amazing for us tall girls (I'm 5'11), which I thought would be the most helpful for any of my fellow tall girls. They are true ankle length and don't shrink to your calves when dried in the dryer. Love love love them. With all of that said though...The black ones NEED to be washed several times or your skin and everything you sit on WILL be dyed purple. I make what I call "new legging tea" in the sink. Hot hot water plus dish soap. Dish soap is important bc it draws the dye out best. I rinse and repeat this process three times then wash twice regularly. Yes it is a hassle. But if you're as sick and tired as I was of trying to find leggings as a tall, (former) big girl then it's worth it. I gave the leggings four stars because if the dye didn't leech they'd 100% deserve 5 stars. I hope this helps someone else to not have permanent purple butt prints on their white leather dining chairs and toilet seats.

Definitely recommend this brand for leggings and will be purchasing more colors!

reviews.title: Good basic workout shirt if you like long sleeves
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 1, 2018
reviews.text: This is a great lightweight shirt for sweaty people like me. I like to wear long sleeves in the gym both for modesty and to catch some of my sweat so I don‚Äôt leave it everywhere. I would call this a medium weight fabric ‚Äî not as light and stretchy as Nike‚Äôs ‚Äúdry miler‚Äù running shirts, but not made for warmth/outside running. The material is a little weird because it doesn‚Äôt really stretch, but it does expand to fit your shape. Weird, I know. When I first got it and went to put it on I was super disappointed because it felt like it was going to be too narrow in the chest/shoulders and didn‚Äôt seem to have any give. And I have generally found that Nike tops always run a little smaller than I expect them to, but maybe it‚Äôs just my weird shape not being compatible with their styling. But after having it on for a while it seemed like it had stretched over time. Still a little snug if I pull my arms and shoulders back but looks great and is still comfortable. Makes me look more badass and in shape than I actually am which is always a plus. One downside with the weird fabric ‚Äî because it doesn‚Äôt really stretch I couldn‚Äôt really roll up/push up the sleeves. Not really a huge deal except I‚Äôm used to doing it so I kept trying to do it out of habit and probably looked kind of stupid because it just didn‚Äôt work. Overall good for what I needed it for. I wouldn‚Äôt spend a ton of money for it but I personally plan to keep an eye out and will buy more in other colors if and when the prices randomly drop like they sometimes do on here :)

reviews.title: Perfect for Prince Eric
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2021
reviews.text: We decided to do Little Mermaid family costumes this year and I needed a prince costume for my husband. This fits the bill perfectly. He normally wears a large in shirts (6'0 and 150 pounds) but based on the size chart, I got him a medium. The medium fit great and not too tight or too baggy. The costume is well made for $30. You get the jacket, sash, and belt. The gloves and pants aren't included. I was amazed that the buttons are actual buttons, not velcroed like most costumes. For the sash, you need to lift the shoulder cap, put on the sash, then velcro the cap back down. The belt was kind of loose in the back, but we can pin it. Very happy with this costume!

reviews.title: Don't accidentally dry it.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2022
reviews.text: For the price, this really isn't a bad shirt. I believe the collar to be too large for a shirt of its size. While the shoulders, chest and arms fit comfortably the collar is gaping, and the lapels have a tendency to curl up substantially. I bought several of these in solid colors that hang in the closet of my home office. I essentially wear one most work days on Zoom rather than using nicer quality polos for work tasks. The problem I just identified was that the shirt was accidentally dried in a hot dryer with other colors such as boxer shorts and socks. It shrank quite a bit, and I would estimate it's actually closer to a slim fit now. Unfortunately the vertical shrinking was immense and now barely hangs below my belt line.

reviews.title: Great polos for the price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2022
reviews.text: I bought a couple of these polos because I was in need of more dark green polos in my wardrobe and they were on sale for 8 bucks. I am pleased to report that these are among the better polos I have owned. I'm 5'10", 120lbs, very skinny build, so it can be difficult to find shirts that are slim enough without being too short. These polos in a size small are a perfect fit. The small size is similar in length to a typical medium t-shirt. They might be a little long for shorter people. I have not experienced any shrinkage in the wash (either cold or medium) or after drying. The material feels as good as almost any polo, breathable but not too thin. The collar is wide enough to be worn buttoned all the way up for that nerdy look. I was happy enough with these shirts that I quickly ordered 3 more.

reviews.title: Amazon sizing looks fine to me
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 30, 2021
reviews.text: According to the size guide, my body measurements are in the middle of the Medium size range. However, I followed the advice of Amazon and other reviewers and ordered a size down but the Small was far too tight. Measured across the chest below the arms on one side, the garment was about 50cm (100cm all round), which is about right for a Small in my view. I should have ordered my normal size according to the Amazon size guide. I used to buy my polos from a large UK highstreet retailer but recently their shirts have become lower quality and are now made of a thinner fabric so I looked for an alternative. These Amazon shirts in comparison are slightly less expensive, better quality and made from thicker, heavier, slightly coarser fabric. If, like me, you're looking for simple, pure cotton polos without brand logos (and the associated cost) but better quality than those from budget retailers, these Amazon shirts might be for you. I just wish they'd restock and offer a wider range of colours. Amazon delivery and the handling of my return was prompt and hassle-free.

description: Product Description Edox has produced Watches Since 1884, leading-technology high-precision timepieces with passion, ingenuity and a meticulous attention to details. In 1883, Christian Ruefli-Flury, an exceptionally gifted watchmaker, gave his wife, Eva-Maria, a pocket watch he designed for her 25th birthday. She was so impressed with her husband's talents and the beauty of the watch that she persuaded him to found his own watchmaking company. Christian Ruefli-Flury launched his watchmaking enterprise in Biel-Bienne. He named the company "Edox," which means the hour in ancient Greek. The hourglass logo he put on his watches has adorned all Edox watches ever since. For a century and a quarter, the history of Edox has been studded with horologic successes and inventions of which many remain unrivaled to this day. EDOX LES B√âMONTS COLLECTION Les B√©monts is a pictoresque forest situated just a few meters from the EDOX factory. The timepiece collection features classical design, with pure and timeless lines and is equipped with a variety of high-quality Swiss-made movements, from the automatic chronograph to the Ultra Slim quartz movement. Read more Swiss-made Since 130 years, Edox imagines, produces and distributes Swiss-made and hand-assembled timepieces. The Les Genevez based company is operated with skilled Swiss watchmakers and modern equipment, respecting the tradition and the know-how of our elders. Excellent Movements We believe in proven movements from the most reputable specialists. Because we want to make absolutely sure that you can rely on your watch every single second of a day ‚Äì for years to come. In short: Proven calibres from leading movement suppliers Increased reliability and access to spare parts Excellent quality and longevity Swiss origin Handmade Masterpieces Every single part of an Edox watch is made to exact specifications with the lowest possible fabrication tolerances. Nevertheless: Assembly and regulation are still done by hand by skilled watchmakers. reviews.text: These became my ride or die sunglasses. Considering that I have two toddlers, most sunglasses just choose death. Not these bad boys. I got these sunglasses in June of 2021. Their polarizing effect is the only thing that works for my very light sensitive eyes. I need them especially for driving. They've been through the gauntlet, and almost look new. The lack of pins is probably my favorite feature, given that my children love trying to snap the arms off. I've lost the arms multiple times, and have always been able to pop them back on with no problems. These sunglasses have virtually no scratches or signs of wear despite being used many times a week in various harsh weather conditions. Just ordered another pair in a different color.

reviews.title: If you are buying for someone picky, these are the shoes. Trust me.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on December 12, 2022
reviews.text: I bought these for my husband about 4 years ago. I am now buying him a second pair because these are literally the only shoes he wears to work and his are stained and worn thin. My husband is the pickiest person to buy shoes for and it has caused a lot of stress over the years. He is also a physician and spends a lot of time on his feet, so they have to be the most comfortable shoes to ever exist for him to like them otherwise I will never hear the end of it. The first weekend he had these, he wore them to a conference and to all the social events afterwards, walking several miles between establishments in Miami. He said 13hrs was probably stretching the time his feet were comfortable for the first time wearing them, but fair. I did change out the laces for elastic shoelaces because he said it took ‚Äútoo long to tie them.‚Äù Coming from a man that has nothing but complaints about every single shoe ever, that‚Äôs an easy fix. He is usually an 11.5 and has these in an 11. He has a narrower foot, so the width has not been an issue.

bullets: SPINNAKER - OUR STORY: It is the sea and crafts that glide and dive into her waters that inspire so much of our design. 2 YEARS INTERNATIONAL WARRANTY: Your Spinnaker watch is warranted against any manufacturing defect for a period of twenty-four (24) months from the date of purchase.

reviews.text: These are nice looking and well made watches. No complaints about the watch itself but on recieving mine I was a little disappointed to find that the documentation was missing. Thinking this was a bit off I decided to return it but I have since learned this is standard procedure for spinnaker. I also discovered that by going direct to you can take advantage of sales and discount codes which typically bring the price of this down to ¬£180. I managed to get the bracelet version for just over ¬£200 which is nearer to what I would want to pay for one of these. See my full review of the watch under the black dial bracelet version.

reviews.title: Beware of the spring bars
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on December 20, 2022
reviews.text: The watch is decent but not remarkable. However, it's severely let down by the thin and poor-quality spring bars. Upon trying to change the strap, my spring bar tool snapped the end of one of the spring bars which means it's now impossible to fit a strap due to the tiny end piece being stuck in the hole. I should add, I've changed straps on watches using a spring bar tool hundreds of times and never experienced this. So, sadly, it's been consigned to a shoebox with the other watches I no longer wear.

reviews.title: D√ºnne Arme keine Chance
reviews.date: Reviewed in Germany üá©üá™ on October 5, 2019
reviews.text: Ich sammle gerne Uhren und habe schon eine kleine Sammlung. Somit kann ich die Uhr gut vergleichen. Dies ist meine erste Uhr jedoch von spinnaker. Nach unz√§hligen Videos auf YouTube habe ich mich gefreut die Uhr zu bestellen. Dank Prime ist sie nat√ºrlich schnell bei mir angekommen. Was erhalten wir f√ºr 300‚Ç¨: Saphirglas mit ir coating, NH 35 Uhrwerk, biderektionale L√ºnette welche unterm Glas sitzt, solides Armband, superluminova usw. Also eigentlich recht viel...aber nur eigentlich. Die Dicke der Uhr mit 1,5cm kommt auf den Bildern nicht gut r√ºber. F√ºr kleine Handgelenke ist die Uhr leider nicht geeignet...das Armband hilft der Uhr auch nicht um schmaler zu wirken. Trotz der tollen Verarbeitung und des wundersch√∂nen Zifferblattes, welches eine Struktur vorweist, habe ich die Uhr zur√ºckgeschickt. Der st√§rkste Konkurrent der Uhr ist die Seiko selbst. Ich spreche hier nicht von Design sondern von den Daten und dem Preis. Es wird schwer sein Seiko Fans von dieser Uhr zu begeistern wenn sie im selben Preissegment liegt. F√ºr breitere Arme ist die Uhr definitiv geeignet und kann ihre Sch√∂nheit entfalten. Kleinere Arme hingegen lassen die Uhr klobig aussehen. Wurde der Preis auf 250-270‚Ç¨ fallen dann w√§re spinnaker sicherlich eine interessante Alternative zu Seiko.

reviews.title: Cheap fabric, but a good fit.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 31, 2020
reviews.text: I didn't realize this had the left breast pocket. I don't usually don't buy those. This fabric is pretty thin and not super soft or stretchy. There's a little give but not much. The fit is loose anyway. This is a good "menswear vibe" ladies shirt. It hit to the end of my rear just past my hips. It's not super tight in the waist but seemed a little more snug in the chest. I'm 5 ft 0 and 157lbs with a long torso, chest is 36D waist 34 hips probably 42 or something (big hips). I bought a Large. I wouldn't say this shirt was too tight anywhere. The shoulders fit decently. I definitely want to wash before the first wear due to fold creases and the collar being a little stiff. This is not as good quality as my wrinkle-free broadcloth oxford from lands end, that's for sure. But it's a good casual stand-in. Definitely wouldn't consider it work wear unless you have a casual job. The cotton isn't super soft or smooth. The side seams aren't hidden. They're quite wide and stand out awkwardly. Overall this is a good budget buy for a SAHM like myself who just wants a casual , basic wardrobe staple.

reviews.title: The good‚Ä¶ The bad‚Ä¶ The value
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on July 13, 2019
reviews.text: The media could not be loaded. The fabric for the shirt is 100% cotton and good quality. I washed my white shirt in hot water and ran it through the dryer at medium. I found shrinkage to be minimal. The shirt is 100% cotton and definitely will have to be ironed. If you don‚Äôt like to iron, this shirt is not for you. Some have commented that it does not iron easily but I did not find that to be true. You simply need to have your iron on the hot/cotton setting and be sure to use steam. I am 5‚Äò1‚Äú and on the heavier side with a 41 inch bust. I had to size up to a large-I generally wear a medium- But this gets the job done for me though I will either safety pin or add a snap to prevent gapping when I move. For most however I think you will find it to be adequate around the bust line and generous to the waist and hips. The length works for me, and though the sleeves are too long I generally roll them up so that is not a problem for me. After washing and running through the dryer, the sleeve length as measured from the underarm to the edge of the cuff is approximately 18 inches. The center back, measured from the bottom of the collar to the bottom of the shirt is approximately 27 1/2 inches. For the money, this is a great classic piece which I believe I will get a lot of value for the money.

reviews.title: I'll only wear Vionics from now on!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
reviews.text: I've had problems with my feet for over three years. I've tried different shoes and insoles but none of them compare to Vionic. The only draw back I may have is that after about 4 weeks of wearing them, several times a week, the leather has relaxed. Now I need socks on instead of just tights because the boots have loosened up. Really it just made them comfortable with socks and in the area we live, if you wearing boots then socks are appreciated!

I've worn them to work for the first time today and they are very uncomfortable, all my toes rub, as do my ankles. I am hoping eventually to wear these in as the next size up costs ¬£100 more. Lesson learnt - never buy shoes online! These were just too uncomfortable for me so I gave them to charity.
