description: Product Description The Godfathers of the jam band world, Grateful Dead spread their one of kind musical style to millions of people around the globe over their 30-year career. The legendary band formed in 1965 in Palo Alto, California amid the rise of the counterculture of the 1960‚Äôs. Jerry Garcia on lead guitar/vocals, Bob Weir on rhythm guitar/vocals, Ron "Pigpen" McKernan on keyboards/harmonica/vocals, Phil Lesh on bass/vocals, and Bill Kreutzmann on the drums were the founders of Grateful Dead, later joined by drummer Mickey Hart. McKernan died in 1973 due to health issues, but the rest of the core played together for the entire history of the band. Influenced by rock, country, folk, bluegrass, and blues, their psychedelic musical style did not fit an established genre. Grateful Dead first performed in 1965 at one of Ken Kesey‚Äôs Acid Tests in San Jose, California. Their first major performance followed in 1967 at the Mantra-Rock Dance, a musical event at the Avalon Ballroom that included acts Big Brother and the Holding Company and Janis Joplin. Grateful Dead has sold 35 million albums worldwide, but it was always about the live performance. They constantly toured and their live improvisations differentiated them from other bands, who would rehearse specific setlists. Garcia stated in a 1966 interview: "We don't make up our sets beforehand. We'd rather work off the tops of our heads than off a piece of paper.‚Äù This created a unique experience every time they took the stage, for them and the audience. A world record, Grateful Dead played over 2,300 concerts and more free concerts than any other band in history. Initially, their live shows were primary in the San Francisco Bay Area, but they inevitably reached the rest of America as well as Canada, Europe, and even the Great Pyramid of Giza in Egypt. They promoted a sense of community among their fans, and many would follow the band from venue to venue, spawning the birth of Deadheads. They were one of the first bands to allow fans to record their shows and trade them freely amongst each other. Impromptu communal marketplaces, known as Shakedown Street, were created by Deadheads at concert venues, allowing fans to buy and sell anything from food to home-made T-shirts while following the band. On August 9th, 1995, Jerry Garcia died from a heart attack after struggles with several health issues. The remaining members decided to disband, but there have been numerous reunions. Weir, Lesh, Kreutzmann, and Hart reunited in 2015 for five concerts called "Fare Thee Well: Celebrating 50 Years of the Grateful Dead.‚Äù Trey Anastasio of Phish joined them and the shows sold out stadiums in Chicago and Santa Clara. Weir, Hart, and Kreutzmann have teamed up John Mayer to keep the spirit alive today as Dead & Company. Grateful Dead was inducted to Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1994. Maybe the best way to sum up their legacy is to use a quote from Hart: ‚ÄúThe transformative power of the Grateful Dead is really the essence of it; it's what it can do to your consciousness. We're more into transportation than we are into music, per se, I mean, the business of the Grateful Dead is transportation.‚Äù Lately, it occurs to me; What a long, strange trip it's been‚Ä¶ Bertha Skull and Roses have been featured in Grateful Dead artwork throughout their career. Inspired by a drawing by Edmund Joseph Sullivan from the 1913 edition of the Rubaiyat of Omar Khayyam , Alton Kelley and Stanley Mouse rendered the original draft, a skeleton with a crown of roses holding rose wreaths. The design first appeared on a poster in San Francisco for Dead shows at the Avalon Ballroom in 1966. It became famous when it was used as the cover for the untitled live album Grateful Dead (1971) . The album was published without a title after a dispute with the record company over the name, but became widely known as ‚ÄúSkull and Roses‚Äù because of the iconic cover art. The rose-wigged skeleton is often referred to as ‚ÄúBertha,‚Äù the first track on the album. Dancing Bears The Dancing Bears made their artistic debut in 1973 as part of the album art for History of the Grateful Dead, Volume One ‚Äì Bear's Choice. Drawn by Bob Thomas, the bears are a reference to Owsley ‚ÄúBear‚Äù Stanley, the soundman for Grateful Dead and producer of the album. The bears are often referred to as the ‚ÄúDancing‚Äù Bears, but they are actually marching. Bear himself has said: "The bears on the album cover are not really 'dancing'. I don't know why people think they are; their positions are quite obviously those of a high-stepping march.‚Äù Whether they are dancing or marching, Deadheads fell in love with the colorful bears. They seem to represent what the culture is all about: Music, dancing, laughing, and marching arm in arm together showing solidarity as well as individuality. Steal Your Face The Skull and Lightning bolt emblem, originally created for a practical use, grew into one of Grateful Dead‚Äôs most recognizable symbols. The concept started with Owsley ‚ÄúBear‚Äù Stanley when he was inspired by a freeway sign that stood out to him. He wanted to brand the group‚Äôs musical equipment so it could be easily identified during concerts with multiple bands. He shared the idea with artist Bob Thomas, and the first design was drafted in 1969. After some evolving, it contains a white skull (known as Stealie) and 13-point lightning bolt along with an alternating red and blue color scheme. Even though the symbol was used previously, it became known as the ‚ÄúSteal Your Face Skull‚Äù after it was featured on the cover of the album Steal Your Face . Dancing Terrapins Debuting in 1977, the Dancing Terrapins first appeared on the cover of Terrapin Station . Alton Kelley and Stanley Mouse collaborated again to develop the cover art. In the song, terrapin is referenced as a location: ‚ÄúSome rise; some fall; some climb; to get to terrapin.‚Äù The cover is more of a literal visualization of Terrapin Station, featuring two dancing terrapins playing banjo and tambourine next to railroad tracks. In many mythologies, turtles are associated with the cosmos and Earth, often depicted as supporting the world on his shell. The terrapins are a reminder of how lucky we are to be here and alive, showing that sometimes the best thing to do is to slow down, sing, dance, and enjoy the experience. Read more Woodstock '69 Woodstock is one of the most pivotal moments in rock and roll history. Attracting more than 400,000 music lovers, people from all over flooded to Bethel, New York in the summer of 1969 to celebrate peace and music over the 3-day party. The festival became a muddy mess with inadequate food, facilities and sanitation. Despite this, 32 acts performed including Jefferson Airplane, Jimi Hendrix, and Grateful Dead. The rain-soaked stage caused major problems for the band, as Grateful Dead members were being electrocuted by their instruments. Known as one of the best live bands of all time, this performance fell well short of expectations. Weir: ‚ÄúSome people made their careers at Woodstock, but we‚Äôve spent about 20 years making up for it [laughs]. It was probably the worst set we‚Äôve ever performed.‚Äù Festival Express '70 Originally called Trans Continental Pop Festival, the Festival Express left the station in the summer of 1970. The Canadian tour was headlined by Janis Joplin, The Band, and Grateful Dead playing in Toronto, Winnipeg, and Calgary. Instead of flying to each tour stop, the bands traveled by train leading to non-stop jam sessions and partying. They were met with protesters when arriving in Toronto due to high ticket prices, seen as promoter greed. Jerry Garcia quelled the crowd by arranging a free concert in nearby Coronation Park upon a flatbed truck. The tour was a financial failure, but it featured great performances. The tour was immortalized in the documentary Festival Express that premiered at the 2003 Toronto International Film Festival. Cornell '77 While there will always be debate, the performance at Cornell University‚Äôs Barton Hall in Ithaca, New York on May 8th, 1977 is widely considered one of Grateful Dead‚Äôs best shows. The setlist is legendary, including standouts Scarlet Begonias -> Fire on the Mountain , where Phil Lesh‚Äôs bass melted faces during the opening riff and St. Stephen -> Not Fade Away -> St. Stephen . Only to be followed by a 14-minute version of Morning Dew , in which Garcia masterfully performed. One of the reasons this performance became so revered was the great sound quality of the tapes, recorded by Betty Cantor-Jackson. Original ‚ÄúBetty Boards‚Äù finally surfaced after a storage unit auction which included the famous Cornell recording. At last, Cornell 5/8/77 the live album was officially released on the show‚Äôs 40-year anniversary. Egypt '78 In the shadow of the Sphinx and Great Pyramid, Grateful Dead performed three shows in Giza, Egypt in September of 1978. Bassist Phil Lesh took the lead in planning the event along with band manager Richard Loren. Lesh wanted to play at a place of power: ‚ÄúPower that's been preserved from the ancient world.‚Äù There was some trouble staging the show, from an equipment truck getting stuck in sand and having to be towed out by camels to recording issues during the first show, but the wonder of the event offset any negative vibes. During the final show, a total lunar eclipse took place, really encapsulating the whole experience. In 2008, the band released Rocking the Cradle: Egypt 1978 , a live album composed of songs from nights two and three for the 30th anniversary of the event. Workingman's Dead Workingman‚Äôs Dead is the fourth studio album by Grateful Dead. Released in June of 1970, it was recorded back to back with companion album American Beauty . The majority of the album was written by Jerry Garcia and Robert Hunter. They utilized an Americana, folk-band style that was different than the psychedelic, electrified tone of previous albums. According to drummer Bill Kreutzmann, the album was influenced by the Bakersfield sound, a genre of country music that was significantly influenced by rock and roll. Garcia had purchased a steel guitar while on tour the previous year and was keen on using it for this album. The album opens with the highly acclaimed Uncle John‚Äôs Band along with popular tracks Dire Wolf, Cumberland Blues, and Casey Jones. Rolling Stone readers voted it the best album of 1970. American Beauty American Beauty is the fifth Grateful Dead studio album. Released in November of 1970, it continued the bluegrass, folk-rock stylings of Workingman‚Äôs Dead that was released earlier in the year. Like Workingman‚Äôs Dead , most of the album was written by Jerry Garcia and Robert Hunter. While recording the album at Wally Heider Studios in San Francisco, they were around Crosby, Stills, Nash, and Young and other artists creating a ‚Äújammer heaven.‚Äù You can hear their influence on the band and album through folk melodies and vocal harmonization. The album title has a double meaning, referring to Americana style of music and the rose ‚ÄòAmerican Beauty‚Äô featured on its cover. Box of Rain opens side one, flowing right into Friend of the Devil , while side two starts with Ripple and finishes with Truckin‚Äô . Europe '72 Europe ‚Äò72 is a live triple album composed of songs recorded from Grateful Dead‚Äôs European tour in the spring of 1972 showcasing live favorites and new songs like Jack Straw and Brown Eyed Women . It was the last album to feature Ron ‚ÄúPigpen‚Äù McKernan, one of the founding members, who died after its release. Originally recorded to recoup the expensive costs of the tour, it received commercial and critical success. Starting in London, the band made stops in Denmark, Germany, France, Netherlands, and Luxembourg, concluding the tour back in London. Their crew grew to 43 members who became known as the ‚ÄúGrateful Dead Family.‚Äù While it features songs from previous albums like Truckin‚Äô and Sugar Magnolia , they are transformed into new performances with their improvisations. In the Dark After a 7-year hiatus from recording studio albums, Grateful Dead released their twelfth in July of 1987 with In the Dark . They had been playing the songs for several years prior to recording, allowing them to be matured and perfected. The band took a more comfortable approach when recording, playing in a darkened theatre with the same lighting they would use on tour, but with no audience. Reaching No. 6 on the Billboard 200 chart, it gained unexpected popularity and became the band‚Äôs only top ten album. It was led by the band‚Äôs only top 40 single, Touch of Grey , peaking at No. 9 as well as frequenting MTV with its music video. This mainstream success brought on a new set of fans referred to as ‚ÄúTouchheads.‚Äù This led to the ‚ÄúMega-Dead‚Äù period where they began to sell out stadiums, a mixed blessing for some hardcore fans. Read more Fire on the Mountain Fire on the Mountain was composed by drummer Mickey Hart. An instrumental version titled Happiness is Drumming appeared in 1976 on the album Diga by Hart‚Äôs other band, Diga Rhythm Band. With lyrics written by Robert Hunter added, the song evolved into Fire on the Mountain . The song‚Äôs catchy rhythm was a perfect complement to Jerry Garcia‚Äôs playful guitar style. It was released on Grateful Dead‚Äôs Shakedown Street in November of 1978, even though the band was performing it live the year prior. It is often improvised and coupled with Scarlet Begonias during live shows, the pair being referred to as Scarlet Fire . The eternal partnership was immortalized by the 25-minute version performed at the famous Cornell University show on May 8th, 1977. Ripple ‚ÄúRipple in still water; When there is no pebble tossed; Nor wind to blow.‚Äù Another successful collaboration between Robert Hunter and Jerry Garcia, Ripple was released on American Beauty in 1970. Garcia enlisted David Grisman to play mandolin on the track and Friend of the Devil from the same album. Fans have noted connections between the lyrics of Ripple and various religions and philosophies. Some lines are compared to Psalm 23 from the Bible, while the refrain has a Zen K≈çan feel to it. Even the chorus is written in a haiku-esk format. No matter the interpretation, it always has a profound effect on the listener. Maybe so profound that two fans even start their own T-shirt company and pay tribute to inspirational track with the company name. Dark Star Dark Star started as an unassuming single released in 1968 that failed to sell 500 copies but became one of Grateful Dead‚Äôs most revered and mythical songs. The single was under 3 minutes long, much different than their live performances that could see Dark Star played for 20 to 30 minutes. Dark Star is the opening track on Live/Dead , the band‚Äôs first live album and is regarded as the very definition of the band‚Äôs early improvisational music with its blending of psychedelia, jazz, and jam elements. After 1973, the track fell out of regular rotation at their concerts. Catching a show that had a Dark Star performance became the ‚ÄúHoly Grail‚Äù for Deadheads. It is one of The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame‚Äôs 500 Songs that Shaped Rock and Roll as well as No. 57 on Rolling Stone‚Äôs 100 Greatest Guitar Songs of All Time. Uncle John's Band The opening track of Workingman‚Äôs Dead , Uncle John‚Äôs Band is a bluegrass-folk arrangement with acoustic guitar and close harmony vocalization. Grateful Dead added the song to setlists in late 1969 and released it as a single prior to Workingman‚Äôs Dead . While the single did not garner huge success, it was the band‚Äôs first chart hit and attempt to reach mainstream audiences beyond their cult following. Though already an underground legend for their live shows, this was the first time many had heard the band. The identity of ‚ÄúUncle John‚Äù has spawned many theories, from blues musician Mississippi John Hurt to John Cohen from the New Lost City Ramblers. Regardless of the inspiration, Uncles John‚Äôs Band is one of their most well-known songs and included on the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame's 500 Songs that Shaped Rock and Roll.

reviews.title: Excellent quality at a very reasonable price.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 9, 2021
reviews.text: I've purchased multiple shirts in each of three different iterations of Amazon's 'Goodthreads' brand standard fit, band collar, long sleeve shirt - the oxford cloth, the denim and the chambray cloth versions - and all three versions have been very well made and were offered at an extremely reasonable price. I have paid twice as much when purchasing similar quality shirts from other retailers in the past. The version with chambray cloth seemed a little stiff and scratchy after just one wash, but the cloth used in the other two versions was soft from the get-go. My major complaint about the shirts is that Amazon cannot seem to keep all of the colors and sizes in stock. I would have purchased more of the shirts had they been available in my size in the color I preferred. It would also be nice if Amazon created a linen version of the shirt. In all of the versions, my experience is that you should order one size larger than your regular size.

reviews.text: I‚Äôm 6‚Äô3‚Äù and 240. 50 inch chest with a 39 waist. I ordered XXL Tall as reviews stated it runs small. Ordering a size up did the trick and it fits near perfect. A little roomy in the waist, but I expected as much in order to get a proper shoulder/chest/sleeve length. Very soft, sanded-cotton - reminds me of flour sack material; soft, thick. Construction is above average as seams, buttons and cloth are all solid. 4 stars as the sizing is off. This is a great value... wonder if all Amazon product is this good.

reviews.title: Run small
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 25, 2022
reviews.text: These are really cute. They do run small, unless mine were mis-marked. I ordered an 8 and that's what was on the packaging. However my heels are over the back and my toes are over in the front. They are also narrow. I wear a "narrow" in a shoe, not that I can find that any longer, but I have to really wiggle my feet to get them on.

reviews.title: From 1 Star to 4 after breaking them in
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on June 22, 2021
reviews.text: I bought these a month ago, to replace my old faithful pair that have seen much better days. Upon first opening the box and looking at them, they seemed cheap. Tried them on and didn't fit rigth either. The straps were kinda tight and the toe separater seemed misplaced for the size (making my heal stick off the end slighty). I was going to return them but I'm actually glad that I forgot to. I ended up wearing them out and about one day and they started to fit much better within minutes of walking in them. By the end of the day they were broken in and weren't tight across my foot anymore. Even my foot doesnt hang off!! (Somehow???) Lol also, they seem to be much better quality then I had initially thought too! I gave these 1 Star at first but have now changed them to 4 stars :) For refference: I'm a true 8 1/2 with average width. I bought a 9 and they JUST fit after breaking them in. Personally would like a LITTLE extra room at the heal part, (I like flip flops to be slightly bigger then my regular shoe size) and wish I would have bought a 9 1/2 now. Oh well though! They were cheap enough that I dont care that much that they aren't 100% perfect for me. BUUUUT, if they had slightly more room at the heal, I would have given 5 stars!

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 5, 2020
reviews.text: I love these, the patterns are great and people always comment on them. They are thinner than you usually get in the UK, but for us that works out well as we use then under a 2.5 tog sleeping bag in a 19deg room. They are slim fitting, but despite having a chunky baby they fit well. Admittedly she's 80th centile, 15lb 10oz at 4 months and wearing 6-9 with sleeves and legs rolled up once, but then she's mostly in 6-9 from tesco/next etc anyway. A couple of things I personally think could be done better: * A double ended zip, so you can just open the bottom half for nappy changes, rather than exposing baby's whole body, especially for night time changes! * Fabric covering the inside face of the zip. Admittedly my baby hasn't had any problems or skin irritation with the zip on her skin, but I'd have expected to see it covered nonetheless

Toddlers and stains go hand in hand. I love that it's a zip and the wee popper at the top. Don't think I would purchase them again though as they are very expensive for what you get. They are really nice to look at, however, can get similar cheaper.

reviews.text: Long review but worth it: I recently received my plastic kunai knife in the mail, I ordered this to go with my Naruto Anbu Black Ops cosplay. Packaging was clean, neat, and undamaged. Normally when searching for props such as this for my cosplays, I‚Äôm skeptical as to whether or not the product is legit and worth spending money on... this plastic kunai knife is definitely worth it. The only thing I changed with this plastic knife is the wrap around the grip area. I changed out the white ribbon it came with to white athletic sports wrap. Swapping out the ribbon for the white athletic sports wrap just makes the grip area feel better in my hand. I also practiced throwing the plastic kunai knife outside and it held up well, no damage to the knife (only to the poor grass I was throwing the knife at haha). Will definitely purchase again to add more to my ‚Äúninja‚Äù cosplay collection.

reviews.title: Adorable and comfy but *buyer beware*!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on August 3, 2021
reviews.text: Absolutely adorable and comfortable for my little guy to wear to his uncle's wedding in Colorado. However it needed a bit of work to be presentable. It definitely isn't ready- to- wear. First of all the tags were sewn on the outside of the outfit as you can see in the pictures... like... why? So I had to carefully cut those off without cutting the seam. Secondly, the buttons in the pant area don't allow for full closure and so you can see his diaper. Just poorly designed. Since I purchased this right before the wedding, I only had time to use velcro to keep that area closed which was annoying. I got size 6-9 month and the fit is just right not too big and not snug. He's on the overage size for 6 months but if you have a bigger baby it might be too small. The bow tie hangs off the top button and is easy to remove. It fell off a few times and could easily be removed. I wish I had stitched it on instead. The pros is the softness and stretch of the material and that its just one piece which was super comfy for my 6 month old. Easy access for diaper changes. The material used for the shirt is a bit thick which wasn't a problem in the cool weather of Colorado but could be too warm for baby is temps over 80F. Little man looked cute and comfy for the wedding but if you want a ready- to- wear you'll be in for a surprise as this outfit needed some fixes.

reviews.title: Sort-of an ok replacement for my KMart Basic Editions womens short jeans
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
reviews.text: I have been wearing KMart Basic Editions womens short (not petite) jeans forEVER. I liked that they were on the less thick/heavy side and had a stretch without becoming over-stretched. I especially liked that they sat just below the belly button in the front but sat high enough up in the back that they were almost at the waist and didn't slide down my butt when I knelt or bent over. I found that they wore fairly well and washed well (I've worn them to do yard work and gotten them really dirty). I have been every size from 18 down to 6 (and up and down again and again) and still have been able to get my size in SHORT length. I especially liked that I could get them at regular price for under $20, sometimes on sale from $10-13. Unfortunately, they seem to be going the way of the dinosaur and so I've been forced to search for a replacement. I have been having a really hard time because I want a thinner material, in SHORT, sitting just at the waist (not mid-rise), straight but not tight, with some stretch, and with good-sized pockets, and a price that is reasonable. I can't wear Gloria Vanderbilt (they're just too tightly cut in every size); I find Dickies too "industrial"-looking and the material too heavy; in many store brands the material is too heavy or not stretchy enough and most don't come in short in a cut I like. Add to all this that I've been trying to buy online because I need jeans and the pandemic has resulted in a lot of store closures. I read a lot of reviews for many brands and finally settled on trying Lee. I am currently a size 6 (at the large end of the size range), but depending on cut and stretch could be an 8; short (not petite) length (29 inch inseam). I am 5'2", 132 lbs (but this fluctuates upward) and carry weight a little bit more at my waist and hips. I was on the fence as to whether to give the Lee jeans 3 or 4 stars, but since I just ordered a second pair I think it's only fair to give 4 stars. With that said, they are the best replacement that I've found so far for my KMart jeans, but they are by no means comparable. Here's why: 1. The waist band is fairly thick and it bunches at the button when I sit down, sticking me in the belly button and giving me the dreaded sweaty waist. 2. The jeans material itself has some stretch (not so much in the waist) but the material is a heavier weight than the KMart jeans--perhaps more of a mid-weight material. For some this might be a plus but on a hot (80 degree), humid, sunny day, the Lee's are definitely hard to wear comfortably, whereas I had no issue with my old KMart jeans. 3. Some reviewers commented on the minniscule front pockets and they weren't kidding. If I still had my old flip phone I would have to turn it sideways to get it in; it won't fit an iPhone. The front pocket needs a reality check and a redesign. But given my limited jeans options, I put up with it. 4. Others would consider $23 or so reasonably priced, but for jeans that I am going to beat up (gardening, cleaning the house, getting bleach and stains on them, etc.) I really want to have a good chance of paying under $20 and I couldn't get there (I had to hunt around to find them for $23-ish). Now for the good points: 1. They do not ride down my butt in the back (the way mid-rise jeans with stretch do on me), but instead stay firmly at my waist. This is the first pair of jeans out of the ones bought in my replacement "quest" that stayed put. 2. They have a small amount of stretch but did not stretch out in the washer and dryer (hot and hot settings). 3. They come in SHORT (petite is the wrong cut for me). When the stores reopen I will give up the on-line search in favor of trying on jeans in the stores, but for now these Lees are as close as I can get to my old Basic Editions jeans--sort-of. I hope this review helps anyone else hunting for replacement jeans.

reviews.text: This might be one of my favorite purchases ever. I genuinely believe this can look beautiful in everyone. The hip flare adds a little curve but also covers a little curve. The belt is so slimming, even if you're less slim there than you'd like. I cannot recommend this enough. The sewn-in labels detached and the lining on the inner sole lifted at the toes almost immediately but, with the hassle of returning them and the weather getting colder, I didn't bother. They feel a bit like well-worn Uggs or Mahabis, OK for occasional use but not if you're looking for something that will give the support I'd expected from the memory foam usp. They feel an awful lot harder than I expected. Not squishy at all but not supportive either. Warm but not comfortable. However! As indoor to outdoor mules these are great! Obviously you can't remove the soles (as you can do with the older Mahabis) but they are perfect as footwear that bridges the gap between your soft and fluffy couch tattie baffies and your big clumpy outdoor boots.

reviews.title: Heaven on Earth for your painful feet (just check out the logo!)
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on December 29, 2017
reviews.text: These mules are like walking on air! I have extremely painful feet due to numerous medical conditions with them, and have struggled to find comfortable footwear. Even walking barefoot on carpet is painful...I need support for my feet. The logo of the heart between a pair of feet grabbed my attention immediately...these people love feet! My feet guided my fingers over the keyboard and the other day my new Keepsakes mules arrived...beautifully packaged I might say. Well, as soon as I put these on my feet I realised that they were like nothing else I'd ever put on my feet before. The comfort and relief is instant. Something about the design means that the soles are kind of sprung in some way and you bounce as you walk. They are completely moulded to your feet and the feeling of support is amazing.My feet are now in heaven and I would recommend these mules to anyone who finds normal shoes, even with insoles, not supportive enough for their painful feet. I wish there was a waterproof version so that I could live in them forever!

reviews.title: Soooooooooooo comfortable!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on September 11, 2019
reviews.text: Oh my goodness, these are so comfortable! They have a good stable sole, lovely snuggly lining, and are so comfortable to wear. I even feel safe enough in them to 'pop' into the garden with the dogs - and I am someone who tended to 'slip' out of mules in the past, but the low back is enough to keep your foot in place. I ordered my usual shoe size, and they fit well.

reviews.title: KILLER SLIPPERS!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom üá¨üáß on November 24, 2022
reviews.text: These are the MOST expensive slippers I've ever bought but I'm old & thought I deserved them. I'm not a conspiracy theorist but I'm wondering if my ex-husbands have got together and contacted you with a plan? Perhaps they've got a new insurance out on me? The slippers nearly killed me pootling about in my retirement home yesterday. I fell over due to the sole coming half way off and sticking me to the carpet but managed to avoid breaking a hip as I fell onto a very surprised neighbour who is still recovering (I'm a BIG woman!). I tried to glue gun them this morning which has resulted in dubious gunk on the sides but still not stuck the sole and slipper together. Then tried Super Glue which spurted out all over my hands. Hands that have arthritis AND contact dermatitis. I am left with very expensive slippers with a gaping sole and what looks like someone has jizzed on them. I've discovered that rubbing alcohol does NOT get superglue off of my already sore hands and neither does petroleum jelly. My glue gun is now stuck to a box, I have no skin on a patch of my thumb and the glue still stuck to me is now stinging. The other slipper that is in working order WAS very comfortable and didn't try to assassinate me but I'm scared to wear it as:- 1) It would make me limp. 2) The same thing may happen. 3) My ex-husbands could receive their payout.

reviews.title: My third pair
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2022
reviews.text: I started having issues with my feet a few years ago and a friend recommended Birkenstocks and I have been wearing them ever since. I used to go barefoot all the time but as I have gotten older I have noticed various aches and pains in my feet and back. I have very high arches and my podiatrist told me I need better support for my feet. These are one of the better shoes to help support my arches. I have purchased a few pairs on Amazon and others on the Birkenstock website. I will now only purchase them on Amazon when Amazon is the seller as the ones I received from other sellers don't seem to last as long which makes me wonder about the authenticity.

reviews.title: These are great!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2022
reviews.text: I have been wearing Birkenstock Gizehs for 20 years. I don't wear any other brands or style of sandals because I love them. Yes, they are expensive but they last a really long time & can be repaired when they get really beat up. I have lost count of just how many pairs I own but I think I have at least 10 pairs. I had Plantar Fasciitis many years ago and I require good arch support to keep it from reoccurring. I have never had problem since I started wearing these. They do take some getting used to if you have not worn Birkenstocks before & they do require a little "break in" time but it is well worth the effort. I can't speak for other styles of Birkenstocks but I can say that the Gizeh runs really big so SIZE DOWN. I wear 7-1/2 or 8M in shoes but in these I wear 37 which they describe as size 6. I'm no size 6 but I can tell you that even though I'm usually 7-1/2 or 8, every pair of Birkenstocks Gizehs I have are size 37M and they fit me like they were custom made for me. FYI, Birkenstock has recently started making an EVA version of the Gizeh which is pretty much like rubber flip flops but they are practically as comfortable as the $100 ones, still have great arch support, can get as wet as you want and they cost a fraction of the price. You should be able to find them for around $40. Again, really expensive for flip flops but although I don't know how long they last, I think they are worth the price.

reviews.text: It fit perfectly great price ! Delivered the next day !

reviews.title: Birkenstocks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2022
reviews.text: I love my Birkenstock! They fit perfectly! I‚Äôve been buying Birkenstock sandals for years and they last forever. In fact I‚Äôm still wearing my old pair around the house as slippers.

reviews.title: So glad I bought them!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2022
reviews.text: Bought the Gizeh‚Äôs as a gift for my Mom. She‚Äôs a size 10 wide in most shoes but these regular sized sandals fit her perfect. Unlike other reviews I read prior to buying them, the entire sandal fit her to perfection. I was concerned the strap would be loose, or that it would be a copy of the original but it wasn‚Äôt. These are original Birkenstock‚Äôs (I compared all the features with the Birkenstock website) and I‚Äôm even getting a pair myself. Mom was happy and so was I.

reviews.title: Comfortable!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2022
reviews.text: My favorite sandal I have ever owned!!! I had to wear them for an hour before I got used to the leather thong, but after that, amazing! I have plantar fasciitis and the arch support is fabulous! I walked all over Italy in these sandals, and my feet never hurt once! Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Cute
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2022
reviews.text: I purchased a pair of Birkenstock almost five years ago, and they still are in wearable shape. The dog had nine puppies, and the sandals survived even being a chew toy! That‚Äôs when I realized that these brand of shoes may not be as expensive as I thought, a pair that lasts more than four years, is of good quality, and I appreciate that. I ordered one pair for mua, and another pair as a gift for my three decades old daughter, my first born, as a bday gift. When it Comes to comfort I don‚Äôt think they‚Äôre that comfy though, but they‚Äôre cute.

reviews.title: Long break in period but worth the effort!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2022
reviews.text: At 71 years of age, my feet have issues‚Ä¶no arches, pronate badly, hammer toes and bunions. A year ago, I bought my first pair of Birks (Florida) and have worn them exclusively around the house ever since. They have been the answer to my prayers. This year, I wanted to try a different style and I chose this Gizeh sandal. They actually make my old feet look cute! The break in period was a bit painful due to the really stiff toe post that has no give. But I didn‚Äôt want to give up on them. So a week later, my feet have fully accepted the toe post and my floppy arches are in love with the arch supports built into Birkenstock footbeds! If you‚Äôre on the fence, I urge you to try the Gizeh!!!

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: I had concerns over price and size..
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 22, 2020
reviews.text: First of all, I have wanted a pair of these for years and could never justify the price tag from the original source. I was sceptical when I found these on amazon as they are very well reduced from the normal price and wondered if they were fake. I scoured the reviews and couldn't really find any evidence to suggest they are, so hey bonus! The second worry I had was the size. I am a 6.5 but normally have to size up to a 7 as hardly anywhere does half sizes, again after reading all the reviews I took the advice and ordered a 5.5, cursing myself as I did it, expecting them to arrive and have to be sent back straight away. Fast forward to today when they arrive, they are in proper birkenstock packaging, they look and feel very sturdy, the name on the side is nice and clear everything suggests that they are the real McCoy. Next test is trying them on.. and they fit!! Now they say they are a 39 so I guess you could say that they are a 6 rather than a 5.5 but either way, I certainly wouldn't be able to cram feet in to a 6. They feel secure and comfortable enough and as I've read they will get more comfortable over time. So it's a long winded 5 star review, am absolutely made up with my purchase.. well done Amazon

reviews.stars: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 26, 2019
reviews.text: Blinking love these. Love the colours, they will go with loads of things. I‚Äôm a uk 3 and bought a 2.5. Regular width and original footbed. Perfect fit. These are the second pair of Birks I‚Äôve bought in a month and I have my eye on another two pairs. Birkenstock convert. Wear them around the house for two weeks to break them in and to mould to your feet, quite lumpy and stiff to begin with.

reviews.title: Love the snake design top!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 17, 2017
reviews.text: Have worn gizeh sandals for years. Size 36 fits me perfectly, and I love the snakeskin design on the top. As with all new Birkenstocks, they need 'breaking in' as the sole needs to soften as it starts to mould to your own feet. My older pair are like gloves, so perservere with wearing a new pair indoors for an hour or so at a time, building up until they feel just right. I live in them, spring through to autumn, so highly recommend.

reviews.title: Order a size smaller....
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 24, 2017
reviews.text: I've had several pairs of these, so the fit was as I expected, but I do order the size 4 (37) when normally I take a size 5 (38) Would recommend ordering a size smaller. If you've not had Birkenstocks before, be aware the foot bed takes some getting used to as there are ridges under the toes. I'd say persevere to get used to it and you will have yourself some of the most comfortable shoes.

reviews.title: Best sandals ive ever owned

reviews.text: I've never really been a fan of sandals but these have converted me. they take a short time to 'break in' but when they do they are so comfy. as expected they are very well made and will definatly last a long time. worth noting as i was researching this brand they do come up big, I'm usually a size 8 so tried a 7.5 (41) and they seem about right with toe room to spare.

reviews.text: This held up well on Halloween. My daughter is 5 years old and she normally wears a size 5/6. This costume was a bit big on her, but once we put on the layering needed for cold Missouri trick or treating it worked out pretty well. I still pulled it back a little with a safety pin just to make sure the neck line stayed where it needed to. The skirt did have glitter and that was the only downfall. It did not last very long. Now they use the costume for dress up at home and still it's held up. No complaints here!

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2021
reviews.text: Nice sparkle. Exactly what i was looking for. I like that along with the regular backing...they added the rubber kind as well. Nice to have the option. I ordered the mid sized range (2.2) which are plenty big enough for me) & now im going to purchase the smaller (1.6) as i have real ones...but lost one. OUCH! Now that i see they look so great... i can wear one of these along with the real. Or....since i have three holes in one ear...i can mix & match & wear 3 triangle or wear my real round brilliant & add 1 triangle or whatever i want. Love to mix & match. Plus you cannot beat the price + quality!! I had some high end trillion cut "absolutes" from Suzanne Sommers from back in the day....while they were nice they were also pricey. These are just as nice but for much less the price. As always...best part is if you lose one....its no big deal!! I still feel the sting from losing that one real trillion! Grab a pair or two & look fabulous...no one will be the wiser! xoPam, still Kelli's mom

reviews.title: Overall great shorts with a couple minor problems THAT SEEM FIXED IN RECENT PRODUCT
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
reviews.text: I just bought a new pair, have had a previous pair (same exact model) for 3 years and have ridden at least 2000 miles in them. I love these shorts, and they are 1 of 2 (now 2 of 2) primary riding shorts, and have held up almost perfectly. No durability issues. Like some other reviewers, me in tight riding shorts is no longer in anyone's best interest, so I appreciate the "modesty" of these shorts. Some folks call these mountain biking shorts, but I use them for road biking and they work fine. Pad is on the big side, as noted by other reviewers, but doesn't bother me at all. Problems that prevented a 5-star rating: 1) Like others, I've had issues with the zipper on the old pair. I find that when the zipper pops open, I can fix it by pulling it all the way down and then back up, but I've had a couple rides with extra ventilation because I didn't catch the zipper malfunction. So it's not a deal breaker for me, but definitely not something that should happen on shorts at this price point. 2) My older pair are tan. I always use sunscreen when I ride, and the leg fabric quickly became permanently stained a grayish color for the bottom 2" or so -- I assume from the sunscreen and/or my sweat. Really hoping my new (gray camo) pair doesn't stain. A couple reviewers complained about the front pockets on these. Yeah, they're basically useless when riding because of shallowness, location and lack of zipper/velcro to seal them. BUT you get a zippered pocket on side of each thigh, another one on back of right thigh, and a zippered wallet pocket. Between these and the fact that all my riding shirts/jackets have multiple pockets, I don't miss the front pockets at all. Overall, I LOVE these shorts. UPDATE: My recently (2020) purchased version of these shorts have no zipper issues, and the fabric has not been stained by my sunscreen. I consider these 2 issues resolved.

reviews.stars: 4.0 out of 5 stars 4.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: Waist is about 32 1/2 inches unstretched - and the bunched up pleats at the back feel rather like plastic
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2015
reviews.text: For me with about a 34 waist give or take, the fit was a little too snug. The open pockets were well positioned and they wear well as shorts, but depending upon the liner I use when riding they can be tight and constricting. I find that the Revelry (also in L) because they are larger even though L, have no contraction whatsoever when I ride in them. I am going to try XL in these, but I fear it will be too large... What was annoying about these (a combination of the design and the fabric) was that the back has a huge amount of bunched up fabric where the elastic is - which feels like plastic and is scratchy and annoying. The Revelry does not have this, nor does the Ether LT for me (which is in size L not the same size as this regular Ether in size L). The big problem with the Zoic shorts are that the sizes for mens L are NOT anywhere near the same from one style to another. I purchased in size mens L: Black Market Ether Ether LT Revelry See photo. NONE of them are the same size waist even though ALL of them are mens size L. All of them have elastic bands in them of one size or another, but it does not work out to fix the problem as the largest L (Revelry) get bunched up when pulled tight enough for me, while at the other end of the spectrum the Black Markets are so tight that they are not possible to tolerate. Every short in mens L: 36 inch waist - Revelry 34 inch waist - Ether LT 32.5 inch waist Ether 30 inch waist Black Market The waist size for size L Revelry is 36 inches, Black Market size L is 30 inches! This is absolutely absurd! Please see the attached photo. The left edges are lines up, they are all flat with no stretching. Specifically for Black Market what makes it even worse is that the waist is 30 inches but it comes with an integrated belt that is nearly 40 inches long! A 30 inch waist and a 40 inch integrated belt! The other shorts have nice design and quality, without this 'feature' of the Black Market. I also found that for Black Market shorts the non-zipper pockets puff open and are not at a good angle. The non-zipper pockets on the Ether and Ether LT are perfect position. In the zipper only Revelry, all the pockets were fine. The zippers appeared good. I can't say what the actual waist measurements are for other sizes than L. Who knows!

reviews.title: Really great shorts at least two times better than the next ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2016
reviews.text: Really great shorts at least two times better than the next best pair I ordered out of 4 or 5 pairs...the button that holds the padded inside garment in place broke the first time I tried to snap it but I only plan to use the outer shell (the street/mtb shorts) anyways so not necessarily a problem for me. Also Id like two back pockets instead of just the one right hand back pocket. Also the zipper enclosure of the one back pocket could be slightly wider as I can barely get my hand in there to extract my money and any other things I put there. I also would like to see them add belt loops to the shorts for days when I want to carry extra weight in my pockets, as a pound or two of weight tends to cause the shorts to keep sliding down. If you tighten the waist too much with them built in belt you risk popping the waistband button open as its a snap button rather than a button or fastener that locks better or a combination, although the present velcro reinforcement near the snap button certainly helps.

reviews.title: Not made for men with buns and thighs larger than "flat" and "stick" respectively.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2015
reviews.text: As is typical with shorts, these are too small. They still fit, but they're tight. For some reason, shorts (and especially swim trunks which are made much like these are) come from some alternate universe where men have board flat butts and tiny wastes. Unfortunately, that's not the same universe we live in. I wear a 42-44 waste pant and have athletic legs. I bought the 3XL since everyone else said these run small. And what to you know, they are tight. It's not just these, I have the same problem with shorts in general. Beyond that, they're still comfortable and breathe nicely. I haven't tried the padded liner yet, but even without the liner they worked good on my bike in just regular undies. So, 4 stars because they still do the job they were designed to do, but I'm docking a star until whatever universe shorts (in general) are made in aligns with ours finally.

reviews.title: Short, tight and stiff
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2019
reviews.text: Gorgeous slippers, I wish they felt as cozy as they look. I ordered a 9 for myself and a 10 for my sister (usual sizes) after believing the top-rated comments ("they feel tight at first but just wait...) Well, we both could barely get or normal size on our feet. I tried the 10 on (I have never had to buy a 10 shoe in my life) and it still feels barely long enough and way too tight for a comfy lounging/going out for the mail slipper. I don't want to take the risk of trying to break them in and then not being able to send them back if they still feel tight after a week. The rubber soles are much narrower than my previous moccasin-style slippers (LL Bean and UGG) and they makes my feet feel "perched" on the soles. There is no arch support, which I think the narrowness of the sole makes worse - no room for your foot to spread out. I love the idea of my ankles wrapped in that lovely wool, but I didn't expect the upper to feel so hard-molded. Great look but not the feel I was expecting. Both slippers are going back and will probably re-order a different slipper altogether.

reviews.title: Not the best choice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
reviews.text: So I've never owned a pair of Uggs, thought they were overrated. However, I decided to get these as I thought they would fit my fat arch lol and were different and cute. Size wise I can be a 7.5 or 7, they run narrow in the toe, so I would be normally a 7wide for a narrow running shoes. Sizing said to get 7 which is what I purchased, they are very very snug at 1st for length and width. I've only had them for 6days. They've stretched a bit but now the sole is coming apart like the glue didnt stick (picture I only took a bit of it out because some of it is still glued). I've only been wearing them in the house and wearing them when I can not alot since I work lol but I was hoping they would stretch and fit if I bared through it, which again they have (not a lot, but a bit, still snug). I would say not worth the money, unless you have it to spare. Also, no arch support, which is okay I wouldn't wear them out the house or for a long period of time. I have been wearing them with no sock (which I'm not a huge fan of) or a thin pair socks because of the rubbing on my big toe. All in all will not purchase again.

reviews.title: Not up to Uggs quality.. design flaw
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2016
reviews.text: I will say I have been wearing Uggs since the seventies long before Pamela Anderson was seen in the nineties keeping her feet warm in Hollywood ! I could not wait to love these and never take them off. Not in Hollywood, but Up in the North Country. But..as WONDERFULLY SILKY-SMOOTH that the wool felt against my foot, the best woll there is was missing at the top/tip of one's toes? -sadly these mocs have a gap in the plushest fur where the top stitched seam meets the side of the mocassin? A BARE SPOT AT THE TIP OF MY TOES ! THIS IS WHERE THE RUBBER MEETS THE ROAD. Where the feet freeze first and its the last to get warm.MOST OF US LIVING IN actual COLD climates.. do need serious lining and Uggs used to be reliably thick up front. And coming fresh off a cold UPS TRUCK ON A WINDY DAY..MADE THE FUR SO WELCOME. AND a long, BLAZINGLY COLD ZONE, felt immediately- is purely disappointing. BAD BATCH? Quality control? Not a big deal these days? Again, some maybe wont mind and others will find it insulting at full price, nearly the top UGGs SLIPPER PRICE. We have a probem. Sizing:was small on my medium width size 7 foot. The 8 was way to tight on the length. It hurt. So they needed 2 sizes up. My foot loked awful long already! In a 9 I dont think they get daintier on a five foot tall woman.The toes curled up too. Elfie. Uggs has missed the reason many of us eventualy replace very well worn Uggs with an upgrade. We loved our od pair, why did we haveto make do with hight costs, and less quality?

reviews.title: NOT SHEEPSKIN !! And painfully tight.
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on February 12, 2018
reviews.text: This slipper fits VERY tight in the forefoot (as others here have noted) - and I mean so much that it actually hurts, feels like a hard/plastic vise around my forefoot. But my biggest issue with these is that they are NOT SHEEPSKIN. I love love love UGGs and own at least twelve pairs of boots and slippers and I love the full shearling/sheepskin lining. This slipper is made of some new jazz they're using now called "UGG purewool" - which is just wool FLUFF that's woven into a fabric backing. It says so on the little information card inside the box. (But not on all the descriptions on the amazon listing, and not very noticeabley either so I didn't realize it until I got the delivery.) I expect shearling when I buy UGGs - that's what they are known for, especially in slippers! This "purewool" lining feels MUCH less soft and luxurious than the shearling and I'm not sure it would breath/wick in the same way either (although any kind of wool lining will have wicking and warming qualities.) This must be UGG's way of boosting their profit margin ---> cutting corners, using a cheap wool lining instead of pricey shearling - but still charging an arm and a leg. Not cool.

reviews.title: Perfect Hat for Amusement Parks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
reviews.text: After lots of hat research, I got this hat just in time for our vacation. It was a bit tight on me at first (I have an average size head). If you have a large head this hat isn't for you. I hand washed it in cool water and put it on my head several times while it was drying to stretch it out a bit. Since it's 100% cotton it did stretch to fit my head perfectly. I'm not used to wearing hats, but since we were spending a day at an amusement park while on vacation, I thought this would be perfect. It's exactly as described and you don't have to adjust it to see things since it has a shorter bill. I thought a big floppy hat would just annoy me since I'm not a hat person normally. So this was great for me. It does come with a removable strap, but I didn't use it since the hat was snug to begin with. I could see the strap being handy if it's really windy outside though. This hat was great for a day at the park and not getting sunburned on my head, ears, forehead, neck! Yay for that!

reviews.title: Disappointed & not worth the price
reviews.date: Reviewed in Canada on January 27, 2021
reviews.text: I sized up in this because I was wanting a looser fit for over top of tight dresses. I got exactly what I was figuring I would but in the future I may just go with my usual size (M) since this item had a lot of good stretch to it. Normally I highly recommend the Grace Karen brand because they have some of the best quality fabric for clothing I‚Äôve ordered online..but this cardigan was a definite exception. The fabric is okay at best, it‚Äôs a lighter sweater but would work well for most weather. But it has a very flimsy & thin feeling to it around the edges, such as the sleeve ends that makes me concerned that this sweater will be very quick to pill & fray in the next few washes. I will update if it does fray quickly..but I‚Äôve got my fingers crossed for it. My biggest disappointment was how cheaply done the buttons are for the price of this item. I don‚Äôt mind having to resew a bottom occasionally on a sweater like this..but they look like they were barely hanging on to begin with when it arrived new. Also the button holes themselves, rather then have any protective sewing along it‚Äôs edges in the hole so that they will be resistant to wear, it‚Äôs like they were made with a machine cut & just left at that. This will cause the button holes to fray considerably in short time from regular use & I‚Äôm quite disappointed with that..all of the edges of this sweater are made in this fashion & I had the sleeves/opening/button holes already begin to look worn out after the first wash in gentle (hung to dry). Just not very impressed with that detail since this is one of the pricier cardigans I‚Äôve bought & had a higher standard from how well other Grace Karen clothes were normally made. I wouldn‚Äôt suggest this cardigan for more than costume wear or one of use. It‚Äôs just not built to last & I‚Äôm sure a cheaper priced alternative could be found for something of this lower quality. Size: L Bust:40‚Äù Waist:32‚Äù Hips:42‚Äù

reviews.title: Same size different fit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2022
reviews.text: Omg‚Ä¶ this dress made me nuts lol I was looking for a dress for maternity photo shoot. I really like the look and fit on me compare to another dresses that I order. However! I had to order this dress three times‚Ä¶ and I almost gave up with this dress lol 1st order) I saw embroidery on the chest area was coming off but I thought I could fix it otherwise I thought it was perfect and I was going to hand wash it few days before the photoshoot and I noticed that the end of the dress on the back was ripped and patched at the factory. It had a hole too. It‚Äôs end of the skirt so you can‚Äôt really tell unless you get close but it‚Äôs not $10 dress, I thought it‚Äôs better to exchange. 2nd order) why?! Same size but 1-2inch smaller on the under chest area and dress was shorter than the 1st one that I order‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs definitely tighter than the 1st one‚Ä¶ not sure if factory mistakenly put Medium label on Large size on the 1st one??? Shoulder and everything else was same fit so I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs the case‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs just a quality of this dress/company‚Ä¶ also the embroidery on the top area was also coming off on this but I could fix it so didn‚Äôt care. Side of the dress was a bit wrinkled (didn‚Äôt lined evenly so it get wrinkled up a bit) It didn‚Äôt look smooth so I was like f this. I‚Äôll order another one to see which dress is perfect!!! 3rd order) omg‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs tighter than the second one by a bit lol üòÇ length of the dress is same as the second one. I saw two holes on the lace in the front which were tiny but bothered me‚Ä¶. Also the sleeve length on each side is different‚Ä¶ üò© one sleeve was longer than the other‚Ä¶ it didn‚Äôt look good so I decided to return this one. I was gonna keep the first one since it feels comfy even though it‚Äôs messed up on the back but my husband said it‚Äôs too long (dragging on the floor) and he said I look better on the second one so I keep the second order and returned two of them. Maybe I‚Äôm being picky but quality of the dress is not that great. I won‚Äôt complain if it was $19 dress‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs just for photoshoot so I keep one and stick with it.

reviews.text: Reviewed after a year of wearing: A true reproduction of a lightweight, breathable classic. These are fantastic especially for the price. They are a Japanese shoe and may run the tiniest bit snug, but not so much that you should change your size just enough that it's choice for narrow feet. These shoes add a pinch of height, as the tread comes out a bit. Speaking of which the tread is interesting... Doesn't do much to add grip but it's nice that rocks won't get stuck in them. The downsides of this shoe are what makes it nice. The upper is such a soft synthetic that your feet aren't really being kept in place at all. The sole being a bit narrow, especially coming in on the inside of your foot means that if you stand funny, the insides of your feet can just almost hang over the shoe. The strangest thing about these shoes however is that the extra laces came already laced meaning they had a white and a black set of laces already laced up... Double laced how odd is that? These make great beaters and the thick tread means they'll last me at least another year. I'm pleased.

reviews.title: Amazon has a cool little do-dad where you tell them the make and ...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on February 22, 2016
reviews.text: I have been previously wearing the women's version of this shoe, (as I am a woman) but, since the all black with the hint of red trim around the ankle was not available in women's, I opted to just convert the size into the men's sneaker. Amazon has a cool little do-dad where you tell them the make and model of the well fitting shoe you currently own, and they tell you what size you should order in the new shoe, with an image to predict how the shoe will fit all over in comparison to the old shoe. I would have guessed to buy 2 sizes down, but I went ahead with the recommendation of a size and a half down, and it was correct. In general, it's a very good fit, the only difference being that the toe box is slightly narrower in the men's shoe than it is in the women's shoe. I took the insoles out and replaced them with my orthotic insoles by Arch Rival. (also purchased on Amazon) They fit perfectly, and work well in these sneakers. I have been sticking with Saucony for the last 4 pairs of shoes I have purchased because, since wearing them, the severe plantar fasciaitis I had been suffering with for about 3 years, has diminished to nearly nothing. I was on the brink of surgery for gastronemic recession, and now I only need to ice now and then, and/or take an NSAID occasionally to manage it. No surgery so far!

reviews.title: Love Sauconys, don‚Äôt love the changes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on September 1, 2020
reviews.text: I am a loyal fan to the Saucony Jazz original and low pro shoes. I have been wearing and purchasing for many years. This year was very difficult for me to find a pair I wanted. The colors and color combos are a bit out of my spectrum. The ones I do like of course aren‚Äôt available in my size. What‚Äôs that tell you Saucony?! My second complaint would be that the tongue apparently has become too expensive to be padded. Now they are nothing more than thin Strips of fabric. What‚Äôs up with that? With this new change I can no longer slip my shoes on without having to bend over and hold onto the tongue so it doesn‚Äôt go into to shoe with my foot. Tisk, Tisk. Other than that I did find this pair that match my beloved Buckeye colors. And they do fit as they should and wear comfortably for hours and hours. Just wish the tongue had more than seven cents worth of fabric.

reviews.title: Great winter sneaker, comfort, warmth & style
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 26, 2021
reviews.text: I have a pair of sauconys I really like to wear, was looking for something warmer for cold weather walks. These sneakers look great, are so comfortable, my feet and legs feel so well supported. And, they are warmer than my first pair, as these are designed for cold weather hikes. I don't feel any cold or wind through them at all, like I do in my old pair of saucony jazz. I waited too long to decide on which sneakers to order from the brand's website, they were sold out in my size. Was thrilled to find Amazon had them in stock. As usual, I am happy I ordered a 1/2 size bigger in these, as I usually do for my sneakers. 6.5 men's/8 women's. Normally wear a 7.5 shoe.

reviews.title: Thick & plush Sherpa lining - very cozy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 14, 2022
reviews.text: This is a very cozy sherpa lined cable knit sweater. The lining is super thick & plush and extents thru the arms too. It is very cozy warm like a sweatshirt but looks like a nice cable knit sweater. I love the toggle loop closures and they are just tight enough to close the jacket completely. It comes with little plastic snaps to close it securely but they are very cheap, hard to snap together and you have to be very careful when opening them as they will pull at the knit of the sweater. I am handy with a sewing machine so I took them off and sewed on a zipper which worked great for me. Again, the toggles are plenty to keep the jacket closed I just wanted it to seal up snug as I'll be wearing it out in snowy & windy conditions. The hood it deep and wide - really cozy but not restricting which I appreciate. The yarn is a cotton blend that is soft and the weave is tight -no loose strands or pilling. The sleeves are a good length for me - able to cover my hand and most of my fingers. The pockets are an OK size - my iPhone 13 mini fits in horizontal and feels fairly secure, a bigger phone would not fit well. I will be washing it in the washer but laying flat to dry. Overall I am very happy with it and excited to have a nice looking sweater that is super warm & cozy this winter.

reviews.title: LOVE!!!!!! üíúüíú
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on November 27, 2022
reviews.text: I am in HEAVEN with this sweater! So why 4 stars? Plastic buttons that I have to sew back on, and one of the button loops already fell off! If I could remake, I would put zipper behind loops not the plastic snaps spread so far apart. I have put in washer, hung to dry. If I could live in it I would. It is SO TOASTY! If the prices didn't jump up with each falling degree it is outside I would order more. I purchased in summer when it was $15 cheaper. Wish I had purchased more then!! It is true to size- slightly large, but better to snuggle in. The "sherpa" is only in the body, not the arms, BUT arms are lines with thick warm cotton lining. Def not to wear when the winds are from Canada, as it IS a sweater, and breeze goes through, but put it under a wind breaker or winter jacket, and you will be snug as a bug! Hope this helps!!

reviews.title: If they fit, great shoes. If they don't, ouch.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 18, 2021
reviews.text: Well, I've owned these trainers for 18 months, and they've lasted for 1000 miles (yeah, I like to properly test my shoes lol). So my thoughts after this distance are: they're not bad. I still get blisters from them, right on my instep. It's like the shoe is too narrow, but just at the edge of the top of my instep, and it rubs, and I get horrid blisters. I thought they'd wear in and get comfy, but they just didn't. How do they look after 1000 miles? Pretty good actually. The mesh part of the upper is coming away, but the sole of the shoe still has flex. For 1k miles, I've had more expensive shoes that lasted less. Which leads me to value for money - if it wasn't for the blisters, I'd say amazing. But the fit isn't right, and they haven't worn in, so it's not great from me. Overall, I've spent more for worse running trainers, but ultimately these don't make the top 15 trainers I've had in this price range.

reviews.stars: 1.0 out of 5 stars 1.0 out of 5 stars
reviews.title: DON'T BUY for running!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 11, 2020
reviews.text: DO NOT BUY these for road running!! Whilst they were very comfortable, the heels on both soles were completely worn out after 205km. (Previous running shoes I have bought at same price lasted 500km+). See photos showing top of shoes still in great condition, but heels completely worn. So for ¬£50 I have had just over 2 months usage - Not good! I complained directly to Under Armour and they weren't interested.... they said complain to retailer (even though UA have obviously designed an inferior product). I have now asked the retailer for a refund. I will update this review with their response.....the retailer was great. Had to send shoes back for inspection, but then fully refunded. So, use this shop with confidence, but don't buy these particular shoes for running!

reviews.title: Hard wearing and true to size
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 18, 2020
reviews.text: Great buy, well constructed and true to size training shoes. Bought to replace UA shoes that were almost 3 years old. Hopefully these will last as long too! Used for both the gym and on road running. They are lightweight and easy to clean. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Comfortable fashionable trainers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 29, 2019
reviews.text: Suffering from feet problems most of my life a friend recommended these trainers. I must admit they are extremely comfortable. Well worth the money.
